Name: ASUC South Asian Ad Hoc Committee
Description: The South Asian Caucus Ad Hoc Committee is committed to uplifting the vibrant and diverse South Asian community at UC Berkeley by addressing the institutional gaps in representation, access, and support. Our mission is to create a more interconnected and empowered South Asian student experience through meaningful cultural programming, tangible resources, and cross-cultural collaboration.
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: ASUC South Asian Office

Name: *New Callink Feature: Blue Heart Initiative üíô
Description: Joining Student Organizations using the Blue Heart Initiative The Blue Heart Initiative is a feature on CalLink identifying registered student organizations that are classified as ‚Äòopen membership.‚Äô These organizations may require a form to record demonstrated interest, but there is no formal application to be accepted into the organization. A blue heart [üíô] placed next to the organization‚Äôs name on CalLink indicates they meet this requirement and opted-in to this feature. Look for this blue heart as you explore organizations to join. The Blue Heart Initiative is brought to you by the Associated Students of the University of California (ASUC) and Organization Advising and Student Involvement Services (OASIS). Frequently Asked Questions: 1) Is my RSO eligible to participate? Any Registered Student Organization (RSO) that indicates they 'accept all' interested members during the yearly registration process are eligible. These organizations may require a form to record demonstrated interest, but there should be no formal application to be accepted into the organization. 2) How can my Registered Student Organization (RSO) sign-up and get a blue heart added to our name? Eligible RSOs will have the opportunity to opt-in to this initiative during the yearly RSO registration process. 3) When will the Blue Heart be added to our RSO's Name on CalLink? Blue Hearts will be added to RSO's Names on CalLink on a rolling basis as registration forms are processed. 4) Does it matter if my RSO is a Graduate RSO? No, Graduate and Undergraduate RSOs are eligible to participate in this program. 5) Does my RSO have to participate in this initiative if we are eligible? No, you are not required to participate in this initiative. Your RSO must consent to participating via the registration process. 6) How does my RSO opt-out if we are no longer open membership? Please have an RSO representative (ideally the same person who opted into the BHI) complete the Blue Heart Initiative Opt-Out Form. 7) What's the difference between an 'Application' and an 'Interest Form'? An RSO may use an 'Interest Form' to record contact and other information for internal purposes, but they will not use this information to evaluate whether you can be a member of their RSO or not. An 'Application' is a tool used to screen potential members for interviews and, ultimately, membership.
Summary: BHI is a new feature identifying student organizations that don‚Äôt require an application and are classified as ‚Äòopen membership.‚Äô A blue heart [üíô] next to the group means they meet this requirement and opted-in to the feature. Click here to learn more.

Name: 180 Degrees Consulting at Berkeley
Description: 180 Degrees Consulting is the world's largest student consultancy for the social sector, with 200+ branches around the world. At Berkeley, our branch keeps social impact at the forefront of our work, engaging with non-profits, social enterprises, and the corporate social responsibility divisions of for-profit enterprises. We aim to build a more compassionate, equitable world--one project at a time. Check out our website at https://www.180dcberkeley.com
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: 180 Degrees Consulting provides consulting for nonprofits and social enterprises. We work with organizations to develop innovative, practical, and sustainable solutions to strategic, operational, and financial challenges they are facing.

Name: 1G at Haas (First-Generation and/or Low-Income Club) üíô
Description: The Mission of the 1G @ Haas is to promote, retain, and empower first generation students across Berkeley Haas‚Äôs ecosystem to elevate community and experiences that will power our first generation students to have a sense of belonging. This group 1G Club @ Haas was formerly named Haas General Management & Leadership Club - [3/6/24] [LL]
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of the 1G Club @ Haas is to promote inclusivity across all cultures and nationalities that makes up the past, present, and future of first generation students at Haas. We are here to promote pipelines to our future leaders.

Name: 2024-2025 RSO Training Demonstration Group üíô
Description: This group is intended to be used to demonstrate tools and modules of the CalLink org management system for registered student organizations who are ASUC-sponsored at UC Berkeley for the 2024-2025 academic year.
Categories: Service Student Organizations
Summary: test - 2024-2025 RSO Training Demonstration Group.

Name: 3D Modeling and Animation at Berkeley üíô
Description: We are a student organization dedicated to education, research, and creation in fields encompassing, and related to, the production of 3D animation. We provide a group for students who are interested in working in the 3D animation or related industries, researching in relevant fields, or simply for students who are interested in learning about the topic. To facilitate a healthy ecosystem of support, we run a DeCal class called UCBUGG: 3D Modeling & Animation (http://www.ucbugg.com). We also host guest lectures related to the topic of 3D Modeling & Animation, to help students pursue their career and self-learning goals. To join, just hop on our Discord (https://discord.gg/ZUFgDry) and follow us on social media. That's it. No apps, dues, etc.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are a student organization dedicated to education, research, and creation in fields encompassing, and related to, the production of 3D animation. We also run a DeCal class called UCBUGG: 3D Modeling and Animation (ucbugg.com).

Name: AAAA - Furries at Berkeley üíô
Description: The furry fandom is a subculture interested in anthropomorphic animals. Its origins date back to at least the 1980s in science fiction and comic conventions. Due to the diversity within the fandom, as well as fictional portrayals of the fandom based heavily on stereotypes, a certain amount of stigma and controversy is unfortunately associated with the fandom. The Anthropomorphic Animal Appreciation Association hopes to serve and portray the furry population on campus positively, as well as foster community collaboration between furries at Berkeley with other interest-based or academic groups.Follow Us :3 Bluesky | Twitter | Instagram | TikTok | Mailing List
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Furries at Berkeley, a chapter of the Anthropomorphic Animal Appreciation Association, aims to serve the interests of fans of anthropomorphic animals through education on topics related to and community building centered around the furry fandom.

Name: ABA
Description: Founded in 1975, Berkeley ABA is a business organization with 5 teams: Business Development, Finance, Marketing, Non-Profit Organization, and Strategy. Our founders set out to provide a bridge between the professional world and the students of the UC Berkeley campus. Over the course of 45+ years of history, ABA has expanded its mission and now represents many diverse majors and cultures: ABA‚Äôs mission as a business organization is to develop well-rounded business leaders who put our skills to work and never compromise our humility, integrity, or passion for each other and the work that we do. As such, we provide our members with opportunities to gain hands on professional experience through various industry-focused projects. ABA has become a well-respected organization on the campus, in the business community, and in the business world. With over 500 Alumni, it is the undergraduate business organization on campus with the largest alumni network.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Founded in 1975, Berkeley ABA is a consulting organization with 5 teams: Business Development, Finance, Marketing, Non-Profit Organization, and Strategy. Visit http://www.berkeley-aba.com/ for more information.

Name: Abba Modern
Description: We are a Christ-centered dance group that aims to spread Christian thought and ideals to the Berkeley community through the art of dance and testimony.
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We are a Christ-centered dance group that aims to spread Christian thought and ideals to the Berkeley community through the art of dance and testimony.

Name: ABC Sketches
Description: While other groups occasionally make sketch comedy videos, none are fully dedicated to this activity. Furthermore, many of the comedy groups on campus are exclusive and/or require an audition process. ABC Sketches is about providing an opportunity to any and all creative and comedic minds to bring their sketch ideas to fruition. We want to meet frequently, film carefully, and produce our videos to perfection. After producing our videos, we hope to post them online to provide any viewers with a laugh. We also hope to submit our videos to appropriate competitions and festivals.
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: ABC Sketches is about providing an opportunity to any and all creative and comedic minds to bring their sketch ideas to fruition. We want to meet frequently, film carefully, and produce our videos to perfection.

Name: Acacia
Description: Acacia Fraternity was founded in 1904 at University of Michigan, Ann Arbor on May 12th. The California chapter was founded 1905, having the distinction of being one of the oldest operating chapters in the National organization. However, "an organization is not necessarily good because it is old, but old because it is good." There are a lot of great fraternities out there, and only you can decide which one is right for you. Here are a few reasons why Acacia Fraternity should be on your short list. Acacia Emphasizes Academic Achievement Academic achievement should be the first and foremost priority of all university students. It is also central to the mission of Acacia Fraternity, whose chapters stress academics above all else. Moreover, the Acacia Fraternity Foundation assists deserving Acacians with cash scholarships ‚Äî over $250,000 in scholarships and educational grants were awarded by the foundation during the 2007-2008 academic year alone. Acacia Develops Leaders Acacia Fraternity is dedicated to building leaders by providing a wealth of leadership opportunities for our members. From social issues to academic, business to philanthropy, the Acacians of today are the leaders of tomorrow. Click here to view a list of prominent Acacians. Acacians Help Better the Communities in Which We Reside Our motto is "Human Service," and we take it very seriously. As member of Acacia Fraternity you will have ongoing opportunities, through structured community service programs, to make a difference in the lives of those in need. Acacians Value Fitness Members of Acacia are encouraged to participate in intramural sports, a system in which athletes of all caliber find camaraderie and physical challenge. Whatever the sport, and whatever your skill level, as a member of Acacia you will always have a place on the team. Acacians Know How to Have Fun Forget the "Animal House" stereotype of reckless partying and irresponsible behavior. Acacia's policy is that each chapter maintains a fun yet responsible social policy that promotes responsible choices and the dignity of every individual as well as zero tolerance for illegal activities.
Categories: CalGreeks Interfraternity Council (IFC) Fraternities
Summary: "An organization is not necessarily good because it is old, but old because it is good."

Name: Academic Cultural Enrichment Coaches üíô
Description: ACE Coaches teaches weekly Saturday classes to 3rd grade to 5th grade students at the San Francisco Chinatown YMCA. We not only provide academic support but also create a space in which our young students can maintain a connection to their Chinese heritage. Our club was founded especially to provide academic support to students residing in SF Chinatown's SROs*, or single room occupancy hotels. Coaches help to prepare and lead lessons that engage our students' creativity and critical thinking in the subjects of English, math, science, and cultural enrichment! We also host many fun socials for team bonding. *SF Chinatown's SROs are often only 8'x10' in size, and many of our students reside in a single unit with their entire families. Many of the inhabitants of San Francisco Chinatown's SROs also live below the federal poverty line. The ACE Coaches program provides critical academic support to these students, who might not otherwise have a dedicated space for studying in their life.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: ACE Coaches aims to provide academic and cultural enrichment to underserved students living in the Single Resident Occupancy in San Francisco Chinatown, and through this process, establish more community involvement in the SF Chinatown community.

Name: ACEing Autism at Berkeley
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Volunteers helping Bay Area children with Autism Spectrum Disorder thrive through tennis. Our mission is to foster growth, social connections, and fitness for children with autism through tailored tennis programs, addressing a national need.

Name: acts2fellowship üíô
Description: What is acts2fellowship? Acts 2 is a passage in the Bible describing people devoted to studying the Bible, to prayer, and to one another. ‚ÄúFellowship‚Äù is simply another word for friendship‚Äîfriendships that develop through discovering life together from God‚Äôs perspective with its many challenges. Many of us attend the Acts College Church and welcome all types of people to do life with us. Whether you‚Äôre a Christian eager to grow in your faith with like-minded friends or someone who‚Äôs curious to learn more about Christianity, we welcome you!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: acts2fellowship (a2f) is a Christian fellowship at Cal. We meet every week to study the Bible, do college together, attend church services, grow in our faith, and build lasting friendships!

Name: Adventist Christian Fellowship üíô
Description: WELCOME to Adventist Christian Fellowship! ACF fosters a community of both college level students and young professionals in the Bay Area looking for a spiritual family to be apart of. We welcome people from all walks and different backgrounds into a relationship with Christ and the community. Together, we study the word and try to understand the greater roles we have as modern-day Christians, and how to best practice living the Kingdom of Heaven. ACF is proud of the support system it has created, as well as the open dialogue that it has started between members of our community. We invite you to join us, visit us, talk to us, or simply, come eat with us! Instagram: @acf_berkeleyVisit our page at www.berkeleyacf.com/
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: ACF fosters a community of both college level students and young professionals in the Bay Area looking for a spiritual family to be apart of. We welcome people from all walks and different backgrounds into a relationship with Christ and the community.

Name: Aerial Arts at Berkeley (Formerly known as Aerial and Pole Club at Berkeley) üíô
Description: This group [Aerial Arts at Berkeley] was formerly named [Aerial and Pole Club at Berkeley]
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our mission is to bring circus to Berkeley and provide a safe, inclusive community for students to learn and practice aerial arts while fostering a culture of acceptance, belonging, and empowerment. We train aerial silks, hoop, trapeze, and more!

Name: Aerospace SAE üíô
Description: We spend each year designing, manufacturing, testing, and flying aircraft in preparation for the SAE International Aero Design West competition each Spring. We teach our team the necessary analysis, design, and manufacturing skills necessary for not only the construction of an aircraft, but for the foundations of a career in the broader field of engineering.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are a student competition team that designs and manufactures fully functional, remote-controlled aircraft to compete in the SAE International Aero Design Competition.

Name: Afghan Student Association
Description: Our mission is to preserve, promote, and embrace the cultural heritage of Afghanistan through social events, education, mentorship, advocacy, and fundraising. We are partnered with other Afghan student organizations across the state in a collaborative effort to bring awareness to the rich culture and tradition that Afghanistan has to offer. We invite those of all cultural backgrounds to learn about Afghan culture/history and contribute to our advocacy efforts.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our mission is to preserve, promote, and embrace the cultural heritage of Afghanistan through social events, education, mentorship, advocacy, and fundraising.

Name: African American Male Education Network and Development
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: A2MEND empowers Black men in higher education through mentorship and advocacy. It bridges community colleges and universities while nurturing leaders who promote Black excellence.

Name: African American Student Leadership Team
Description: The purpose of the African American Student Leadership Team is to unite the black student leaders on campus. It is a space for official and unofficial leaders of different organizations/offices can come together and collaborate. These collaborative relationships will help streamline events and resources for black students. This will be an official organization to help unite different black groups and sync communication.
Categories: Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, Black/African American Student Community

Name: African Inclusivity and Solidarity Association (formerly Organization of African Students) üíô
Description: The African Inclusivity an Solidarity Association formally known as Organization of African Students at UC Berkeley is a space to learn, share and engage on the opportunities and challenges of African continent and its diaspora. We are committed to: Strengthening relationships among students of African descent and facilitating their academic and professional excellence Maintaining a platform of pertinent discussions about the pressing issues of the African continent, and brainstorming on innovative solutions to address them Supporting students of African descent planning to attend the University of California, Berkeley Challenging the stereotypes about Africa and celebrating the richness and cultural diversity of the African continent on the Berkeley campus We are ASUC Sponsored per SB 121 since 10-31-12. This group African Inclusivity and Solidarity Association was formerly named Organization of African Students at Berkeley - [10/27/23] [LL]
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: We are the African Inclusivity & Solidarity Association or AISA, formerly known as The Organization of African Students at UC Berkeley.

Name: African Maghreb Student Union
Description: The organization would be a center to host cultural events, serve as a safe space for students of this minority Maghreb background on campus, and foster academically-relevant conversations between these students.
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: African Maghreb Student Union connects students with other Maghrebi-identifying students (the Maghreb countries include Algeria, Tunisia, Libya, Morocco, and Mauritania) culturally, socially, and academically.

Name: AFX Dance üíô
Description: AFX Dance is a dance group founded by Ping Quach, Geoffrey Chen, and Rosemary Hua in Fall 2011 to give dancers an opportunity to learn about and participate in dance culture, continuously build our community, and positively impact those around us through that process. Our name AFX reflects our three pillars‚ÄîAspirations, Family, Experience‚Äîand our philosophy of creating a family environment for dancers to build up the confidence and support to reach new heights. With a dance ‚ÄúCompany‚Äù (competitive/advanced) and ‚ÄúGeneral‚Äù (introductory/intermediate) membership, we strive to provide our dancers and leaders with new, fulfilling experiences that will empower them to dive deeper into dance culture; pass it on to the greater community along with our philosophies and values of growth, community, and support; and hold each other accountable in uplifting and amplifying the voices, lives, and experiences of those who have made all of these art forms and experiences possible in the first place.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: AFX Dance is a dance group founded in Fall 2011 at UC Berkeley. AFX Dance is divided into Company (competitive/advanced) and General (introductory/intermediate). AFX Dance also has a technology team focused on improving the operations of AFX Dance.

Name: Aglet Noise Collective üíô
Description: Nothing is original. Steal from anywhere that moves you. Take what resonates with you, what fuels your imagination, and make something real. Promise to steal in a way that is true to yourself. Collaborate, find new people, put yourself in a room with them. Aglet Noise is a collective for music, art, and experimental collaboration. We organize live events and projects that mix media and defy categories‚Äîlive sets, performance art, interpretive dance, film, theater, whatever you can think up. We are a space for ideas that don‚Äôt fit into neat boxes. If it feels like no one else would put it on, that‚Äôs the point. You don‚Äôt need to be a professional. You don‚Äôt need to set up a coffee chat. You just need an idea, or the desire to help make someone else‚Äôs real.
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: At Aglet Noise Collective, we aim to develop and promote musicians part of the UC Berkeley music community and the nearby area, by hosting events, promoting artists‚Äô releases and helping artists record and release their songs, along with video content.

Name: Ahlul Bayt Student Association of Berkeley üíô
Description: The Ahlul Bayt Student Association (ABSA) of Berkeley is a chapter of the ABSA Network. We provide an enriching and supportive environment for UC Berkeley Shi'a students on campus by spreading knowledge and love of the Qur'an and the Ahlul Bayt (AS). Though our organization is catered towards Shi'a students, our events are open to anyone regardless of religious affiliation. ABSA Berkeley is dedicated to nurturing the spiritual and communal lives of Shi'a youth through regular programs, educational events, and service opportunities. Check out our Instagram to stay up-to-date with future events @absaberkeley and check out our new website where we are currently fundraising absaberkeley.org
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: ABSA

Name: Air Bears - Skydiving Club at Berkeley üíô
Description: ANYONE can skydive! Come hang, come chat, come experience. Skydiving is safe, fun, and a one of a kind experience. You wont regret it!!!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: To foster a diverse and welcoming group of people and to expose UC Berkeley community members' to the incredible, surreal, live-changing, fear-conquering experience of skydiving.

Name: Alexander Hamilton Society at Berkeley (Formerly known as Alexander Hamilton Society, The)
Description: Hamiltonians, a renowned group of students, faculty, national policy leaders, and captains of finance and industry, share a conviction, rooted in the history of the last century, that the world is a better, safer, and more prosperous place when the United States is willing and able to lead. We foster constructive debates on college campuses, critical to the intellectual and professional development of a new generation of American leaders. This group [Alexander Hamilton Society at Berkeley] was formerly named [Alexander Hamilton Society, The] - [3/12/25] [AP]
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Alexander Hamilton Society (AHS) is a non-partisan, not-for-profit, national organization that inspires and educates students in the importance of American leadership in the world and launches them into careers in the private and public sectors.

Name: Allergy Living, Education and Resource Team
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Allergy Living, Education & Resource Team (ALERT) is dedicated to fostering a safe and welcoming environment at Berkeley for those with food allergies.

Name: Alpha Chi Omega
Description: Alpha Chi Omega - Pi Chapter at UC Berkeley Real. Strong. Women. Alpha Chi Omega was founded on October 15, 1885 by seven amazing women at DePauw University in Greencastle, Indiana. Anna Allen, Olive Burnett, Bertha Denison, Amy DuBois, Nellie Gamble, Bessie Grooms, and Estelle Leonard founded Alpha Chi. It was the first, and most likely last, musical fraternity. The group was thus named Alpha, meaning first, and Omega, meaning last, using Chi as a link. The purpose of Alpha Chi Omega was to provide the advancement of the intellectual, social, and moral culture of its members. The Berkeley AXO Pi Chapter was founded on May 7, 1909. Visit us on social media! Website Facebook Instagram Tumblr National Website
Categories: CalGreeks Panhellenic Council (PHC) Sororities
Summary: Alpha Chi Omega : Pi Chapter at UC Berkeley

Name: Alpha Chi Sigma Professional Chemistry Fraternity
Description: Alpha Chi Sigma is a co-ed professional fraternity on campus that focuses on various fields of chemistry and engineering. We are a close knit community that develops our members professionally and academically. With events such as tutoring sessions, career panels, and outreach with local schools, AXS is for anyone who enjoys chemistry adjacent sciences.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Alpha Chi Sigma is a co-ed professional chemistry fraternity offering opportunities for both social bonding and professional development.

Name: Alpha Delta Phi
Description: ====Who We Are====The Alpha Delta Phi California Chapter has been a mainstay of the University of California ever since we first received our charter in 1908. In addition to the immense social gratification Aqua Delt‚Äôs privileged brotherhood provides, there are many academic and character building advantages unique to becoming a part of the Alpha Delta Phi. Our novelty and selective chapter size offer the opportunity to cultivate immediate leadership experience and contribute to a fresh and emerging legacy. ====Notable Alumni====-Walter Haas Jr: President and CEO of Levi Strauss & Co.-Allan Sproul: President of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, namesake of Sproul Hall.-David M. Solomon: Current CEO of Goldman Sachs-Dr. Frederick Allen: Pioneer of Diabetes Research.-2 U.S. Presidents: Franklin D. Roosevelt & Theodore Roosevelt-Francis Julius Bellamy: original author of the Pledge of Allegiance -7 Supreme Court Justices ====Our Mission====We seek to develop potential new members through our national founder, Samuel Eells‚Äô original vision statement: "a true philosophical spirit looking to the entire man, so as to develop his whole being - moral, social and intellectual."
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, CalGreeks Interfraternity Council (IFC) Fraternities
Summary: We are the California Chapter of the Alpha Delta Phi, one of the oldest fraternities in the country, founded in 1832. We strive to develop our whole being, moral, social, and intellectual. This mindset has created iconic social leaders-see notable alumni

Name: Alpha Delta Pi
Description: Keep up with Alpha Delta Pi on our social media pages! Find us on: Instagram @caladpi TikTok @caladpiFacebook @ UC Berkeley Alpha Delta Pi Alpha Delta Pi was founded by Eugenia Tucker in 1851 at the Wesleyan Female College in Macon Georgia. It holds the distinction of being the first secret society for women, and therefore the foundation of the entire sorority system, hence our motto- First, Finest, Forever. Psi Chapter of ADPi was founded in Berkeley in 1913- the 23rd national chapter to be established. In 1931, the chapter purchased our current home, 2400 Piedmont Ave. The house was formerly the summer home of notable Bay Area heiress Phoebe Hearst, and was recognized immediately as the showplace of the campus.Since then, the mansion has had several modern conveniences added on, but it still retains its original character. It serves as a charming home to almost sixty girls. With its location on Channing circle, Psi chapter of Alpha Delta Pi lies at the very heart of the present-day Greek community.
Categories: CalGreeks Panhellenic Council (PHC) Sororities
Summary: Alpha Delta Pi was founded by Eugenia Tucker in 1851 at the Wesleyan Female College in Macon Georgia. It holds the distinction of being the first secret society for women, and therefore the foundation of the entire sorority system.

Name: Alpha Epsilon Omega
Description: Alpha Epsilon Omega, established at the University of California Berkeley in August 2022, holds a mission centered around uniting students dedicated to fostering cultural stimulation on campus. This dedication aims to kindle interest in the Armenian language, history, and culture, all while upholding rigorous standards of academic excellence. The fraternity's objective revolves around nurturing a community where brothers wholeheartedly embrace their culture and heritage through philanthropic, cultural, and professional events. AEŒ© has established and will continue fostering a supportive network for its members, contributing significantly to academic and social success.
