Name: Association of Korean Artists
Description: AKA: Association of Korean Artists
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: AKA, officially known as Association of Korean Artists, is the one and only platform for networking and communication between Korean musical artists at UC Berkeley.

Name: Association of Latino Professionals for America at Berkeley (ALPFA)
Description: The mission of the Association of Latino Professionals for America (ALPFA) is to empower the Latine community at UC Berkeley by offering extensive leadership training, essential career advancement resources, and valuable networking opportunities.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups
Summary: The mission of the Association of Latino Professionals for America (ALPFA) is to empower the Latine community at UC Berkeley by offering extensive leadership training, essential career advancement resources, and valuable networking opportunities.

Name: Association of Women in EECS üíô
Description: AWE is a student-run organization at UC Berkeley that seeks to connect, inspire, and empower female and non-binary undergraduate students in electrical engineering, computer science, and adjacent disciplines. AWE hosts a variety of academic, industry, and social events throughout the year to support and connect our members. All AWE members are welcome to the events we host throughout the year, including technical workshops, company events, socials, field trips, and much more. Members stay in touch through our club-wide Slack, and receive opportunities through our weekly newsletter and resume book. We also encourage members to join our mentorship program to give back and get involved! Our office is also open as a study space and a social space for members during AWEffice hours. Being a part of AWE means joining a community of inspiring and supportive women in EE&CS here at Berkeley. Learn more about membership on our website!
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: AWE is a student-run organization at UC Berkeley that seeks to empower female and non-binary undergraduate students pursuing Computer Science and/or Electrical Engineering disciplines.

Name: Astrophotography at Berkeley üíô
Description: Astrophotography at Berkeley provides opportunities for budding astrophotographers to socialize and learn from others interested in admiring the night sky through photography. All familiarity levels are welcome. Digitally explore the universe with us!
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: AaB fosters a judgment-free environment for students of all familiarities interested in astronomy and telescopic observation! Club activities include trips to areas of low light pollution, group socials, and astrophotography tutorials. Come explore!

Name: ASUC - Berkeley Student Media
Description: Berkeley Student Media is a student-staffed unit in the Student Union‚Äôs Creative Lab (MLK 155) at UC Berkeley. It receives funding for equipment and programs from the ASUC Publications and Media Board and CACSSF for student staff compensation. BSM‚Äôs mission is to develop and connect students from the UC Berkeley campus to the media community. BSM does this by offering a variety of resources such as equipment rentals, space reservations, print services, and social media circulation for student media organizations. BSM is committed to helping students grow and develop their interests as artists and creators of media. BSM offers free programs to registered members of Cal‚Äôs 100+ student publications and media groups. These programs include free Equipment Checkouts, Graphic Design Services, Space Reservations, Marketing, Distribution, and Storage. Visit www.studentunion.berkeley.edu/student-media-center for more information. For questions, email: studentmedia@berkeley.edu. Follow us on Instagram @berkeleystduentmedia! Berkeley Student Media is a chartered program of the Associated Students of the University of California, an independent 501(c)(3) non-profit association.
Categories: ASUC Chartered Program
Summary: BSM provides a community forum for UC Berkeley Students to connect to the media community by offering resources like equipment rentals, space reservations, print services, and media circulation. BSM focuses on supporting student development in media.

Name: ASUC - CalTV
Description: CalTV is online, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week on YouTube, Instagram, TikTok, and Facebook. Since its founding in 2005, CalTV has grown into one of the largest student-run television organizations on the West Coast. If you're interested, or just curious about the on-camera and behind-the-scenes workings of broadcasting and digital media, check us out at caltv.berkeley.edu! Spring 2025 Application: Opens September 5th, 2025 Recruitment Events ‚Ä¢ In-Person Info-Sessions: Tuesday, September 2nd & Thursday, September 4th LOCATION: Social Sciences Building 175 (for both, Zoom option available for the 4th)TIME: 8 - 9 PM PST (for both) We are tabling on Sproul! ‚Ä¢ Monday 09/2 to Friday 09/5 from 9 AM - 3 PM. ‚Ä¢ Drop by and chat with our directors! Fall 2025 Application closes Friday, September 5th at 11:59 PM. Follow our Instagram @caltv for recruitment updates!
Categories: Media & Film Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, ABSA - Budgeted over $7500 Organizations, ASUC Chartered Program
Summary: Since our founding in 2005, CalTV has become the premier student-run media and entertainment organization at UC Berkeley. Our departments include Studios, Entertainment, News, and Marketing to help students explore all aspects of content creation.

Name: ASUC - Democratic Education at Cal
Description: The DeCal Program (or just DeCal) is a student-run democratic education program at the University of California, Berkeley - here, students create and facilitate their own classes on a variety of subjects. Each semester we support over 150 courses facilitated by students, for students. These are accredited Pass / No Pass courses on our campus. To facilitate a course, a student must find a faculty sponsor. Around 3000-4000 UC Berkeley students take DeCals each semester. What the DeCal Board does: Manage the online course listing / this website. Help facilitators get funding from the ASUC, get publicity, make copies for their course, or simply help them fill out the paperwork. Put on pedagogical workshops, connect people to UCFTR resources, foster an academic dialogue on education. You can contact anyone on the Board via email: decalprogram@gmail.com
Categories: Undergraduate Organizations, ASUC Chartered Program
Summary: The DeCal Program (or just DeCal) is a student-run democratic education program at the University of California, Berkeley - here, students create and facilitate their own classes on a variety of (often unorthodox) subjects.

Name: ASUC - Grant & Scholarship Foundation
Description: The official grantmaking and philanthropic unit of the Associated Students of the University of California (ASUC). Below is a summary of each of the grants available this Fall. Any questions can be directed to the Executive Director of the Foundation, Stephen Chase, at grants-asuc@berkeley.edu. Trustee applications are now closed. You can learn more about each of our grants being offered this Fall HERE. The grants are nowopen from the 3rd of October and will be open until the 10th of October at 11:59PM. The list of grants we are offering are: Academic Opportunity Fund Arts & Service initiatives for the University & Community (A.S.U.C.) Grant DeCal Grant Student Organization Travel Grant Student Technology Grant ASUC Undergraduate Professional Development Fund *Please note graduate students are no longer eligible for the Academic Opportunity Fund. *Please note the Grace Rualo Asuncion Leadership Grant will be offered during the Spring Cycle.
Categories: ASUC Chartered Program
Summary: ASUC - Grant & Scholarship Foundation

Name: ASUC - Innovative Design
Description: Innovative Design is a family of designers, photographers, web developers, and videographers at the University of California, Berkeley. We are creative individuals who are continuously evolving by collaborating, inspiring, and educating one another. It is through our different artistic tools and talents that we are able to create novel photography and designs for our peers and professional clients. We provide pro-bono creative services and teach popular DeCals to the Cal community. Website: https://www.innovativedesign.club/ Creative ServicesInnovative Design has three disciplines: Graphic Design, Photography, and Web Design. Throughout the semester, we also host several educational and industry events. Graphic Design: There are three graphic design tiers, Beginner, Gold, and Blue Tier. Blue tier is a group of intermediate to advanced designers that offers more professional design services while Gold tier offers graphic design education and experience for beginner to intermediate designers as they service on-campus groups and professional clients. Beginner tier is composed of beginner designers who has little to no experience in graphic design. Photography: There are three photography tiers, Beginner, Gold, and Blue Tier. Photography disciplines provide members hands-on experience as they provide photography services such as shooting professional headshots, event photography, stock photos, and more. Web: There are two web design tiers, Beginner and Gold. Web Gold members work for clients that are in need of technical help in designing their websites. Gold members learn new skills and put existing knowledge to use through hands-on experience.Beginner tier is composed of beginner designers who has little to no experience in web design. DeCals Innovative Design teaches 3 DeCals: Introduction to Photoshop and IllustratorThis introductory course teaches graphic design through the use of Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop. This class is built for students who do not have any prior experience or knowledge of these programs. We work with students in developing a thorough understanding of these programs with weekly lessons and hands-on tutorials. In addition, students complete relevant homework exercises which aim to give students the opportunity to practice tools, develop original designs, and channel their creativity. Lastly, we explore graphic design trends, principles, and applications. Graphic Design PrinciplesThis is a technical course in which students are taught extensive knowledge of Adobe programs (such as Illustrator and/or Photoshop). The class also covers conceptual and theoretical aspects of design such as color theory, branding, and user interface design. At the end of the course, students have a portfolio of work showcasing extensive knowledge on several design topics and an understanding of various elements of design. Photography PrinciplesThis DeCal is for students interested in learning photography. We start off with the basics (camera manipulations and shooting in RAW) and quickly move onto composition rules and tricks to get better, more thought out photos, and from there move onto how to be a professional photographer, photo ethics, and integrating art into photography. By the end, students will feel strong in their photographic abilities, be able to critique their own work, and see the world through an artistic eye, so they can further grow as a photographer. It is intended to be for beginners with little to no knowledge of how to use a dSLR or other camera with manual capabilities. Throughout the year, Innovative Design hosts a variety of events, from our annual designathon CMYK: Come Make Your MarK, speaker and workshop series RGB: Reach / Grow / Build, and an educational weekend series of creative workshops HEX: Hone and EXplore. Check out our Instagram or website for our most up-to-date announcements!
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage, ASUC Chartered Program
Summary: Innovative Design is a team of graphic designers and photographers that provides services to campus organizations and local businesses.

Name: ASUC - Open Computing Facility
Description: We don't use CalLink! See the links below for how to join. The Open Computing Facility is a student volunteer-run organization dedicated to free and open source computing. We run a computer lab at 171 MLK Student Union and provide free services for the Berkeley community such as website and email hosting, shell accounts, and high-performance computing. If you‚Äôre interested in joining the OCF, no application is needed! Join our Slack or Discord and introduce yourself as a first step. Also, check out ocf.io/getinvolved to learn more about how to get involved.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated MLK Space, ABSA - Budgeted over $7500 Organizations, ASUC Chartered Program
Summary: The Open Computing Facility (OCF) is a student volunteer-run organization dedicated to free and open source computing. We offer free web hosting, file storage, Unix shell accounts, high performance computing, and printing.

Name: ASUC - Student Legal Clinic
Description: The ASUC Student Legal Clinic is a student-run legal resource center that helps students and community members make informed decisions about legal problems. We provide free legal assistance and tax filing for Cal students and the Berkeley community. The Clinic has proudly served the Berkeley community for over 30 years, providing free and confidential legal research catered to the particular issues our clients are facing. Clients can walk-in or schedule an appointment to discuss their legal questions, and our trained caseworkers will provide clientele with fully researched case reports, outlining possible legal options and pertinent information about their rights. In the spring, the Clinic also participates in the Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) program to provide eligible students and community members free tax-filing services. All of our caseworkers are IRS-certified tax preparers. The Clinic aims to foster a nurturing environment where caseworkers can interact with peers who share similar interests and hear from a wide range of guest speakers, including Berkeley Law admissions officers, local attorneys, and Cal alumni. Office: Eshleman Hall, 312F Email: legalclinic@asuc.org Website: https://www.asucslcberkeley.org/
Categories: Undergraduate Organizations, ASUC Chartered Program
Summary: The ASUC Student Legal Clinic is a student-run legal resource center that helps students and community members make informed decisions about legal problems. We provide free legal assistance and tax filing for Cal students and the Berkeley community.

Name: ASUC - Student Union Program Entertainment & Recreation Board (SUPERB)
Description: SUPERB the Student Union Program- Entertainment - and Recreation Board is a student-run branch of the Associated Students of the University of California (ASUC) at the University of California - Berkeley dedicated to providing entertainment for the entire campus and community. Our events can include but are not limited to film screenings, concerts, comedy sets, interactive games, and giveaways all completely free for any Berkeley students! Check us out at http://superb.berkeley.edu.
Categories: ABSA-Allocated MLK Space, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, ASUC Chartered Program
Summary: Student Union Program, Entertainment, and Recreation Board (SUPERB)

Name: ASUC Administrative Office
Description: The Administrative Office is comprised of a General Manager, 2 Assistant Managers, and typically 6-7 Administrative Assistants. We advise the student government offices and handle general office tasks on the fourth floor of Eshleman. You will often see us staffing the front desk when you visit the ASUC office. We have many responsibilities, some of which include: advising student government, managing student government budget and reimbursements, reserving rooms, renting equipments, managing important ASUC documentation, and handling general campus and public questions.
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: The Administrative Office is comprised of a General Manager and typically 8-9 Administrative Assistants. We advise the student government offices and handle general office tasks on the fourth floor of Eshleman.

Name: ASUC Cultural Diversity Affairs Commission
Description: The Diversity Affairs Commission empowers and mobilizes underrepresented groups and organizations to promote diversity, inclusion, and equity. In doing so, the commission builds bridges for cross-cultural understanding and uplifts the voices of underrepresented communities to create a united student body.
Categories: ASUC Coalition / Commission

Name: ASUC Disabled Students Commission
Description: The Disabled Student Commission is an autonomous ASUC entity that addresses campus-wide disability issues. In addition to having advocacy campaigns, they also have fun socials and other events for Disabled students to find community. ASUC Disabled Students Commission advocates for students with disabilities on the UC Berkeley Campus and participates in disability justice projects impacting UC Berkeley campus, UC Wide, and in general. DSC also work on projects and initiatives supporting the disabled community at UC Berkeley. If you are interested in joining the commission, please fill out the form that is linked above! They are always welcoming new members!
Categories: ASUC Coalition / Commission
Summary: ASUC Disabled Students Commission

Name: ASUC Elections Council
Description: Each year the ASUC holds a regular election to choose its five Executive Officers and twenty-one members of the Senate. All members of the Association, that is all undergraduate and graduate students at UC Berkeley, can vote. Regular elections are held the second week following the Spring Break in early April. Students vote using the Ranked Choice System which guarantees diverse and proportional elections results. Furthermore, students can vote on referendum propositions. Referendum propositions can be placed on the ballot by the ASUC Senate, Graduate Assembly, or a petition of the student body. Lastly, special elections can occur to recall officials or in some other limited circumstances.
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: The ASUC Elections Council administers the ASUC Elections.

Name: ASUC Grant & Scholarship Foundation | Purchase Request Page
Description: You can review the slideshow training on how to submit a GSF purchase request HERE. Remember to always click "POPULATE FROM BUDGET" at the top righthand corner of your purchase request and then to type in the name of your RSO (or your name if you are an individual recipient) to select your grant award. Then select the line item for the item you are submitting a purchase request for. If you are uncertain about general logistics regarding submitting purchase requests, please see this training HERE. Remember that submitting PRs with errors can lead to delays in processing your request! Always feel free to email grants-asuc@berkeley.edu for support.
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: Page dedicated to the administration of purchase requests and funding for GSF awards

Name: ASUC Health Advocacy Commission
Description: Mission The mission of the Health Advocacy Commission shall be to act as a body for campus organizations to advocate for progressive, equitable, and accessible health policies and programs at the campus, local, state, and national level in order to promote individual and community health on the UC Berkeley campus and the greater community. We work to support the advocacy missions of student organizations and wellness of individuals through advocacy work, campaigns, and lobbying events. If you have a passion for health, law, policy, or advocacy in general, we'd love to have you! ________________________________________ Student Organizations Represented on this Commission: Fall 2022 ‚óè American Medical Student Association ‚óè American Medical Women's Association ‚óè Bhagat Puran Singh Health Initiative (BPSHI) ‚óè Blood Pressure Project ‚óè California Health Professional Student Alliance ‚óè Nutrigenomx ‚óè Phi Chi ‚óè Students vs Pandemics at Berkeley ‚óè Student Nutrition Advocacy Club ‚óè Undergraduate Street Medicine Outreach ‚óè United for Health ‚óè Volunteer Health Interpreter Organization ________________ Executive Board: Fall 2022 ‚óè Lee Dason Lam, Co Chair ‚óè Ammar Bhaiji, Co Chair ‚óè Kaitlyn Chiok, Secretary ‚óè Sai Chelluri, Program Coordinator ‚óè Mahathi Kandimalla, ASUC Senator ‚óè Hannah Marchick, EAVP Representative ________________ Notes for Contacting As of Fall 2022, we regularly check our emails and Instagram DMs. We try our best to respond within 1-3 business days. Thank you for your patience and please follow us on Instagram at @asuchealthadvocacy to keep updated about future events, campaigns, and application cycles.
Categories: ASUC Coalition / Commission
Summary: Health Advocacy Commission acts as a body for campus organizations to advocate for progressive, equitable, and accessible health policies and programs at the campus, local, state, and national level

Name: ASUC Housing Commission
Description: We exist to educate, coordinate, and advocate on issues relating to housing policy both on the local level and for housing owned and operated by UC Berkeley.
Categories: ASUC Government Offices, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage
Summary: The Housing Commission works to address UC Berkeley‚Äôs student housing crisis, a problem that affects both the student body and the surrounding community of the East Bay.

Name: ASUC Judicial Council
Description: The Judicial Council consists of 9 students vested with the judicial authority of the Association. The council's authority extends to all judicial cases arising under the Constitution, the ASUC By-Laws, official actions of ASUC executive officers, employees, the Senate, and any matters delegated to the council by the ASUC Senate or the Constitution. In exercising the primary judicial powers of the Association, the Council only grants such judicial relief as defined by the Constitution and the By-Laws of the Association. All decisions of the Judicial Council shall be final unless reversed by subsequent council action.
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: The Judicial Council consists of 9 students vested with the judicial authority of the ASUC. The Council's authority extends to all judicial cases that arise under the Constitution and the ASUC By-Laws.

Name: ASUC Menstrual Equity Commission
Description: We work in collaboration with campus and local organizations to consistently house Cal menstrual equity efforts without the risk of discontinuation due to lack of leadership. Our efforts are grounded in intersectionality, equity, and community.
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: ASUC Menstrual Equity Commission Info here -

Name: ASUC Mental Health Commission
Description: As the Mental Health Commission, we serve as the representative undergraduate voice on mental health‚Äì‚Äìacting as the central liaison between mental health stakeholders, addressing the intersectionalities of mental health including, but not limited to, race, gender, ability, diverse identities, basic needs, etc., and creating an overall campus culture of wellness by upholding the Mental Health Action Plan, educating and engaging with the undergraduate student body, and holding administration accountable through policy and programming
Categories: ASUC Coalition / Commission
Summary: As the Mental Health Commission, we serve as the representative undergraduate voice on mental health.

Name: ASUC Office of Academic Affairs
Description: About AAVP: The Office of Academic Affairs is the advocacy arm for the UC Berkeley undergraduate student body on matters relating to academic and campus affairs. The responsibilities of the office include: Advocacy and policy work in front of the Berkeley Academic Senate and central campus administration; Leadership and oversight of campus budget priorities and the student fee ecosystem; Facilitating conversations on long-term campus planning, including new campus developments, new academic programs, and changes to academic policy; Internal ASUC leadership and reform efforts to increase the accessibility and transparency of Berkeley‚Äôs student government; and Events and initiatives related to student mental health and wellbeing. AAVP Mission Statement: The ASUC Office of the Academic Affairs Vice President works to cultivate an inclusive and enriching learning environment at UC Berkeley that supports students' academic endeavors, celebrates intellectual curiosity, and encourages critical thought. Grounded in the values of community and collaboration, we are committed to building student co-goverance in academic and administrative decision-making. Departments: Policy Communications Events and Programs College-Level Advocacy Applications for select positions due on 9/9/2025; see the application link below for more information.
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: AAVP focuses on enhancing students‚Äô academic experience by identifying barriers to academic success and creating proactive solutions through innovative programming, supportive services, and policy initiatives.

Name: ASUC Office of External Affairs
Description: ASUC External Affairs Vice President 2025-26: Calvin Yang The Office of the External Affairs Vice President seeks to represent the student body at the local, state, national, international levels, as well as corporate partners. Students in the Office of the External Affairs Vice President will be working on a variety of different projects and initiatives that seek to improve UC Berkeley's relationship with the city as well as state and federal elected officials. Responsibilities may include advocacy through arranging lobbying visits, speaker forums to engage students with legislators and internal policy setters, city initiatives, as well as administrative and programming tasks. The EAVP Office channels Berkeley's history of advocacy, community organizing, and student activism.
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: The ASUC Office of the External Affairs Vice President represents the student body of the University of California, Berkeley and empower students to create change at the local, state, and national levels, as well as corporate partners.

Name: ASUC Office of Senator Anamaria Abnusy
Description: Our office is dedicated to uplifting immigrant, first-generation, and underrepresented students at UC Berkeley by expanding access to scholarships, grants, and critical legal and financial resources. We are also committed to fostering community and visibility for Armenian and Iranian students, creating spaces for cultural understanding and ensuring meaningful representation in student government. At the same time, our office works to support professional development within STEM, connecting students to opportunities, mentorship, and career preparation. Through advocacy, collaboration, and programming, we strive to build a campus where every student feels empowered to thrive.

Name: ASUC Office of Senator Bella Santos
Description: Bella Santos is the thirteenth consecutive ASUC senator to have been elected on all environmental platforms, commonly referred to as the ‚ÄòEco Senator‚Äô. This office will work to represent the interests of the environmental community in the ASUC Senate and create positive community change. Our goals for this office are to center environmental justice on campus and in the environmental community through education, engagement, and advocacy. Environmentalism is intricately and explicitly linked to social, racial, political, and economic justice, and we will ensure that the office‚Äôs work centers around this intersectionality. We strive to uplift and empower student-driven community action to counter the many injustices UC Berkeley continues to perpetuate. Our Instagram @ASUCEcoOffice has the latest updates on the Eco Office!
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: ASUC Office of Senator Bella Santos - Eco Office

Description: The mission of our office is to advocate for students within the ASUC, UC Berkeley, UC Student Association, and at the State and National levels. We are currently accepting applications for the following departments:Policy & Legislative DevelopmentUniversity Affairs Before applying: Please review the department and position descriptions, which can be found here. Name: ASUC Office of Senator Jada Yang
Description: The Office of ASUC Senator Yang exists to represent and uplift the disabled and Asian-American communities at UC Berkeley. Our work is for the community, by the community. If you are passionate about disability rights, Asian American advocacy, health justice, or public service, our office is the place for you! We are looking for changemakers ready to ensure our voices are not just heard, but integrated into our campus culture. As the first disabled community-centered office since 2022, we are proud to represent the experiences of the over 12% of our student community who report having a disability, especially the 35% of DSP-enrolled students who come from underrepresented minority groups. Our vision is a Berkeley where all students, especially those at the margins, can thrive without having to navigate systems that were not built for them. We believe that true representation requires us to learn from lived experiences, and we are proud to have you join us in our mission.
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: ASUC Office of Senator Jada Yang

Description: Joining the Office of Senator Kianna B. Rodarte means stepping into an environment that values collaboration, creativity, and impact. Students in our office get the opportunity to work directly with the ASUC, engage in student affairs, and develop skills in project management, advocacy, and community building ‚Äî all while connecting with motivated peers who are equally committed to making a difference at UC Berkeley. Mission Our mission is to create sustainable, student-centered initiatives that address academic, professional, cultural, and wellness needs while building bridges between communities on campus and beyond for the development of student's post-graduate career. Core Platforms Viva Comunidad: Latin√© RSO Support ‚Äì Supporting Latin√© student organizations through resource development, programming, and advocacy. Academic & Pre-Professional Opportunities for First-Gen Students ‚Äì Expanding workshops, mentorship, and pipelines for academic and career success. Student Safety, Success & Wellness ‚Äì Prioritizing student well-being through basic needs access, safety initiatives, and holistic wellness programming. Campus Compassion & Community Service ‚Äì Promoting volunteerism, collaboration, and service that connects Berkeley students to the greater community. Join Our Team Our office is currently recruiting Executive Directors, Associates, and Interns for each of our departments. This is an opportunity to gain hands-on experience in advocacy, project management, event planning, and student leadership while making a tangible impact on the Berkeley community. Contact üì© Email: krodarte@asuc.org Chief(s) of Staff: Esbeidy Campos, esbeidycampos@berkeley.edu; Gabriel Arzate, g.arzate23@berkeley.edu üì± Instagram: @asucsenrodarte Applications are OPEN on a rolling basis until Sept. 13th, 2025. Check out our role descriptions and office aplication here! Whether you‚Äôre interested in joining our team, collaborating on a project, or learning more about our initiatives, we welcome you to connect with us!

Name: ASUC Office of Senator Sara Teran
Description: This is the office of Senator Ter√°n. Sara Teran is the QT+ endorsed senator this school year and has emphasized her commitment to advocate and protect undocumented, immigrant, and international students and their families. My advocacy comes from personal experiences. Growing up in Mexico and immigrating to the United States at a young age, I‚Äôve faced many challenges and barriers. As an avid civil rights advocate and someone who has been involved in the ASUC since I joined Cal, I wish to continue my work in uplifting and representing the voices that consistently aren‚Äôt offered a seat at the table. As my community continues to struggle to move forward and succeed, filled with fear and a sense of uncertainty, I decided this -more than ever- is the time to stand up for my community and what I believe in. Joining the office to support our efforts to make tangible, possible change and advocate for students here at Cal.

Name: ASUC Office of Senator Sydney Scott
Description: Originally from Long Beach, Sydney is entering her third year studying Political Science and Educational Sciences with minors in Public Policy and History. She is committed to turning institutional knowledge into institutional change. Her office is built on the principles of health, safety, sustainability, and inclusion, with a core belief that student well-being should drive every decision on campus. Her office is working on a variety of projects this year. From expanding access to sexual health resources, tackling mental health challenges, environmental justice, and student safety, her office is focused on meeting students where they are and pushing Berkeley to be the best campus for all. Sydney‚Äôs leadership in the ASUC is shaped by her involvement in campus life and knowledge of Berkeley‚Äôs networks, especially its robust Greek system, where she has learned how to advocate effectively and foster a positive culture within these communities. When she‚Äôs serving students through the ASUC, you can find Sydney in the front row of the student section at football games, eating a California burrito at La Burrita, at a CorePower yoga sculpt class, walking around Piedmont Ave, or in the Environmental Design Library (Wurster)! If you are interested in joining the office, please follow us on Instagram at @asucsenatorscott for updates. If you have any questions at all, feel free to reach out via Instagram DM or by email sydneyscott@berkeley.edu and cc Chiefs of Staff fore.mikaylee@berkeley.edu & jane.grumann@berkeley.edu Fiat Lux, and GO BEARS üíõüíôüß∏

Name: ASUC Office of the Executive Vice President
Description: The Associated Students of the University of California (ASUC) is UC Berkeley's official student government, The Executive Vice President (EVP) manages all internal affairs of student government, leads the ASUC Senate, ensures transparent and effective student government operations, oversees ASUC commercial activities, and serves as a vital representative for all students‚Äô needs to the university administration and external organizations. The Office of the Executive Vice President supports student organizing in all spheres. The office is a supportive partner and ally to the ASUC Senate, facilitating the success of the Senate‚Äôs collective vision while assisting with its outreach and visibility. Offering financial and networking resources, leadership development, and empowerment opportunities, we strive to provide students with an environment that allows them to create positive change in their areas of their interest. We work to build a more vibrant and inclusive campus community through collaborative events, coalition building, providing access to space and funding resources, and engaging as many students as possible in major campus decisions. Our hope to is to move towards a better UC Berkeley founded on values of inclusivity and thriving student life. This year, EVP Isha Chander was elected to the role to lead projects to support transfer & nontraditional students, environmental justice initiatives, students‚Äô rights, and basic needs availability; improve access to spaces, funding, and services on campus that improve the well-being of students and the success of student clubs; process and Approve contracts between the ASUC and the University/ external organizations (such as the Wall Street Journal and New York Times subscriptions; focus on connecting frequently with clubs and community caucuses; and continue all of her advocacy from her term as an ASUC Senator. If you're interested in getting involved in student government, come work with us! You‚Äôll be able to gain experience in student government alongside a team that‚Äôs passionate, committed to service, and student centric. To review the office structure chart and available positions, please visit: tinyurl.com/OEVPPositions To learn more about EVP Chander and our office, please visit @ucbvicepresident on Instagram. To apply to the office, please visit: tinyurl.com/OEVPPositions APPLICATION DEADLINES:Phase 1 (priority deadline): July 27 at 11:59pmPhase 2: September 5th at 11:59pm Questions about applying? Reach out to the Chiefs of Staff at evpchief@asuc.org or DM us on Instagram! We hope to see your application.
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: The Office of the ASUC Executive Vice President is committed to developing quality student life and a stronger culture of community on the UC Berkeley campus.

Name: ASUC Office of the President
Description: Applications are now open for the 148th ASUC Office of the President at UC Berkeley. This year‚Äôs Office was formed with intention, care, and a deep commitment to advocacy that serves all corners of our campus community. We would be grateful for your support in sharing this opportunity with the students you work with. Students from all majors and backgrounds are encouraged to apply. Our Office is composed of 12 departments, ranging from campus organizing and basic needs to policy, advocacy, and communications. It‚Äôs a space for students to lead real change and gain hands-on experience in student government. We‚Äôre looking forward to bringing on a team of passionate changemakers. For any questions, students can contact us at opchief@asuc.org or reach out on Instagram @ucbpresident. The role of the ASUC President is to uplift, unify and empower our campus community by acting as the bridge between students and campus administration. Abigail Verino is a fourth-year student pursuing a double major in Ethnic Studies & Legal Studies. Her administration‚Äôs mission is to center communities to advance the progress of the Associated Students of the University of California. She built her campaign upon student activism, and centered principles of intention, equity, and excellence. As she leads the university with love, these values will remain at the forefront of her work.
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: Departments: Projects/Programs, Outreach/Internal Affairs, Policy Initiatives, Partnerships (Resources, Alumni, Financial), Commercial Development

Name: ASUC Office of the Transfer Student Representative - Joshua De Miguel
Summary: ASUC Office of the Transfer Representative

Name: ASUC Senate
Description: The 21-member ASUC Senate is the legislative branch of the student government. They control the ASUC's $12 million budget, update the governing documents, and represent the voice of UC Berkeley students. Senators work on a wide variety of issues such as campus safety, healthcare, affordability of education, and improving academic services. To stay updated on upcoming ASUC Senate meetings and other meetings sign up for the public notice listserv here. ASUC Funding to student programs is allocated by the ASUC Senate. See www.asuc.org Funding page for a complete description of the different ways students can apply for support from the ASUC. The ASUC Senate Finance Committee reviews spending decisions of the ASUC Senate and Student Groups according the ASUC By-Laws Title III. Groups seeking permission to use funds for a normally restricted use (see By-Laws) should initiate the appropriate waiver request available through the form links further down this page. Please direct all questions regarding ASUC Contingency Funding and other ASUC finance questions to finance@asuc.org.
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: The 20-member ASUC Senate is the legislative branch of the student government. They control the ASUC's $1.7 million budget, update the governing documents, and represent the voice of UC Berkeley students.

Name: ASUC Sexual Violence Commission
Description: The Sexual Violence Commission (SVC) is a survivor centered organization comprised of individuals who are committed to holding the university accountable. We aim to transform university sexual assault policies; improve, expand, and publicize services and resources for survivors; improve educational awareness and consciousness-raising among students; and foster a culture of consent across campus and throughout the community to ensure student safety and to create a more inclusive campus climate. As a team, our departments and leadership develop and implement a variety of events, projects, and programs across campus and collaborate with ASUC Officials, RSOs, and other organizations to educate our campus community. The SVC provides a cross-campus lens to ensure all such efforts are intersectional, welcoming, and considerate to all who have been impacted by sexual violence and harassment. *Link to SVSH Resources*
Categories: ASUC Coalition / Commission
Summary: The Sexual Violence Commission is committed to transforming SVSH policy and holding the university accountable so every student can thrive. Our team is comprised of students committed to social justice, advocating for change to keep our community safe.

Name: ASUC Student Advocate's Office
Description: The Student Advocate‚Äôs Office (SAO) is an executive, non-partisan office of the ASUC. We offer free, confidential casework services and resources to any student(s) navigating issues with the University, including conduct violations, grade disputes, enrollment issues, financial aid problems, establishment of residency, discrimination, and harassment. All support is centered around students and aims for an equity-based approach. Divisions: Academic, Financial Aid, Conduct, Grievance OUR SPRING 2025 APPLICATION OPENS ON JANUARY 13, 2025. Please fill out our interest form for recruitment updates! INSTAGRAM: @berkeleysao WEBSITE: advocate.berkeley.edu Any questions about recruitment? Email us at recruit@sao.asuc.org Tags: advocacy, student rights, casework service
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: Departments: Academic, Financial Aid, Conduct, Grievance The Student Advocate's Office provides free and confidential casework services for any student or student group involved in a dispute with the University.

Name: ASUC Student Union Board
Description: The Board is composed of UC Berkeley students, staff, and faculty. The Board establishes policy and provides oversight for all Student Union commercial activities in a manner consistent with University policies. The ASUC Student Union reports to both Student Affairs and the Student Union Board of Directors. The Chancellor and the ASUC give the Board the authority necessary for it to carry out its functions. This Callink Page is for the two undergraduate representatives appointed by the ASUC and their support staff.
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: The Board is composed of students, staff, and faculty. The Board establishes policy and provides oversight for all Student Union commercial activities. The Student Union reports to both Student Affairs and the Student Union Board of Directors.

Name: ASUC Sustainability Commission
Description: The Sustainability Team is a commission of the ASUC, and one of the oldest commissions in the ASUC. We create and implement a variety of projects that help establish sustainable practices and promote environmental awareness on campus. Project committees within STeam work as a tight unit to accomplish their goals, and leadership capacity is shared equally. We meet all together once a week to update each other on the progress of our projects and brainstorm strategies for successful implementation. The team also spends time outside of meetings through our STeam Socials a few times per semester. Interested? Here are some of our current projects: Ethical Eats centers around giving students access to sustainable restaurants. Our website grants sustainability ratings to local Berkeley eateries. This semester we are working toward creating a website to increase student awareness regarding restaurant sustainability, as well as to help restaurants work to become more sustainable. Another program STeam began is Environmental Justice and Education (EJ&E), where we teach a 5-week long curriculum that we create to elementary aged students in the area. Last semester we launched our Green Event Fund project, where we created and implemented criteria through which we can fund other RSOs as they demonstrate how they are working to be more sustainable. This program funds events, projects, printing, and anything else an RSO may need money in order to do more sustainably. Finally, STeam organizes Sunstock, a solar-powered music festival held on campus annually. STeam works hard year-round to prepare a venue, local lineup, sponsors, merchandise, and cuisine. Sunstock aims to unite students through music in an environmentally conscious way that brings light to improvements the music industry can make to be more sustainable. Our wide range of project niches displays how sustainability can be brought into all aspects of life and even combined with personal passions! We are always open to new ideas. The next project we work on could be yours! So come check us out at our meetings and initiate your own ideas. Follow our instagram, @asuc.steam for meeting time updates and come to any meeting, no application necessary.
Categories: Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, ASUC Coalition / Commission, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage
Summary: The ASUC Sustainability Team (STeam) is a commission established in Fall 2005. As a team, we create and implement a variety of projects that help establish sustainable practices & promote environmental awareness on campus. There is no application to join

Name: ASUC Vote Coalition
Description: Vote Co. is the official, nonpartisan ASUC department dedicated to voter registration and civic engagement at UC Berkeley ‚Äî under the Office of the External Affairs Vice President.
Categories: ASUC Government Offices
Summary: made inactive 2.19.2016 RJ per ASUC CLO request Reactivated for use by ASUC Vote Co as part of EAVPs office per Megan Fox 9/9/20

Name: Atlas Strategy Group
Description: Atlas Strategy Group is a non-profit consulting firm dedicated to tackling the unique problems our clients face with novel, strategy-backed solutions. Founded in 2020, our projects focus on streamlining innovation in biotechnology, healthcare, finance, corporate and R&D strategy. Our analysts and consultants have strong scientific and business backgrounds and bring diverse work experiences across research areas, scales, and industries to help our clients excel.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Atlas Strategy Group is a non-profit consulting firm consisting of analysts from the Robinson Life Sciences, Business, and Entrepreneurship Program (LSBE) dedicated to tackling the unique problems our clients face with novel, strategy-backed solutions.

Name: Atrium
Description: Mitochondria are the powerhouse of the cell, mass can neither be created nor destroyed, and one of our editors called 9-1-1 for the first time after her dad fainted from low blood pressure. In undergraduate education, the sciences and humanities are treated as disparate fields, and we are led to focus on the former aspects of science far more than the latter. In reality, scientists, engineers, and researchers all work towards improving human lives and often need to tap into the vast resources of human creativity and empathy to do so. Art and creative writing allow us to consider these implications with an expressive freedom not afforded by lectures and laboratories. We believe that exploration of this intersection of sciences and humanities is just as crucial to scientific knowledge as concrete theories and research. We intend for Atrium to be a space that humanizes the sciences through the sharing of creative student reflections on these subjects. As such, if you‚Äôre a STEM student, we warmly welcome you to submit work that reflects on the human aspects of your career aspirations and extracurricular experience. On the other hand, our magazine is open to all students with a story to share, regardless of major and career plans.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Publication Groups, Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Atrium is a magazine dedicated to creative student exploration of the intersection between the sciences and human experience.

Name: Aurum Cosmetics üíô
Description: Interested in cosmetics, chemistry, product development, beauty tech, or marketing? AURUM is the first and only club at UC Berkeley that comprehensively follows the beauty industry. We take a holistic approach, looking at everything from the science and formulations, to marketing and networking. The beauty industry will only keep growing, and we strive to be a resource to our peers and share our passion. Come join the AURUM movement!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: AURUM is the first and only club at UC Berkeley that comprehensively follows the beauty industry. We take a holistic approach, looking at everything from the science and formulations, to marketing and networking.

Name: Azaad
Description: Auditions for this coming season will be held in early September. Please follow our Instagram @ucbazaad for updates on recruiting events and everything else we're up to!
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Azaad, UC Berkeley's co-ed collegiate competitive Bollywood/Fusion dance team, creates productions that entertain audiences and motivate them to connect with the Hindi-Film/Bollywood culture.

Name: Azerbaijanis at Berkeley üíô
Description: Hello world! We are Azerbaijanis at Berkeley (AZB) - an officially registered student-run independent organization at the University of California, Berkeley. Founded in Fall 2022 by a team of 6 students from Azerbaijan, our organization has been a part of the UC Berkeley‚Äôs vibrant cultural community. Our RSO is serving two main missions: To promote, and embrace the cultural heritage of Azerbaijan. To foster a community for Azerbaijani students and those who are interested in Azerbaijani culture, and to bond through academic, professional, and social events. </aside> Our organization is open membership for all UC Berkeley students, faculty, and alumni. Additionally, all our events are following an open attendance policy of our club - meaning anyone interested (regardless of affiliation) is welcome to attend! Check out our Official Website
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our goal is to promote, and embrace the cultural heritage of Azerbaijan. We would like to create an environment where Azerbaijani students, and those who are interested in our culture can bond through academic, professional, and social events.

Name: Azure
Description: Azure‚Äîthe first premier organization at UC Berkeley that intersects business, consulting, fashion, and beauty! We believe that every student should have the opportunity to succeed and work with exciting brands in these rapidly changing industries. Whether you're interested in streetwear, skincare, or anything in between, we provide a platform for students to find business-related roles and work on consulting engagements with important brands in these industries. Our goal is to equalize the business community playing field at Berkeley and add new, fresh perspectives by providing professional resources and opportunities for everyone, regardless of what you're studying or your background. AZURE is not just an organization, but a movement towards a more equitable and diverse business community at UC Berkeley. Our group's beliefs center around the idea that business is a space for all, regardless of interests or background. Besides students, we are thrift shop advocates, sneaker collectors, skincare enthusiasts, and more. At AZURE, there is a space for all. Join us and be a part of the future of business in fashion and beauty at UC Berkeley!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Azure is UC Berkeley's first premier business organization which intersects business, fashion, and beauty. We provide a platform for students to work on consulting engagements with important industry-leading brands in these spaces.

Name: B PsychEd üíô
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The primary mission of B PsychEd is to create a space that brings together students from diverse backgrounds who share a keen interest in psychology. A place where intellectual curiosity, academic exploration, and a sense of community converge.

Name: B-Side, The
Description: Love going to concerts and talking about music? Passionate about social justice and equity? Join Berkeley B-Side! As a member of Berkeley B-Side, you can participate as a journalist, photojournalist, web designer, graphic designer, event manager, producer, marketer, or public relations member to satisfy your creative drive. Our members are both passionate about music journalism and social culture and work to create content combining the two. We regularly update our website, and once a semester, we collaborate on a print magazine to show off our most interesting pieces, photos, and designs within a thematically centralized magazine. You can check us out at @berkelybside on Instagram or berkeleybside.com !!!
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: A music magazine working to uplift marginalized groups in both music and general media. Passionate articles, evocative short films, and community events are just a taste of what to expect at Berkeley B-Side!

Name: BACC Campus üíô
Description: BACC stands for the Bay Area Christian Church. We are a non-denominational church that builds convictions solely off the Bible and Jesus' teachings. We are made up of different counties across the Bay Area, as well as international churches such as the BACC in Russia and India. The campus organziation related to the BACC provides an opportunity for students to discuss and question God's purpose for their lives. It's a great way to meet people and connect with other Bay Area college students.
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: A place where people can discuss their ambitions and move forward during their college career in developing a relationship with God. This organization teaches the basics of who God is, what it means to follow him, and how to discover your destiny.

Name: Badminton Club at Berkeley
Description: Cal Badminton is a student-run Cal Sport Club that allows for players of all skill levels to participate. We have players who only play recreational badminton as well as players who do both recreational and competitive. For more info, you can visit: https://badminton.berkeley.edu/ https://recsports.berkeley.edu/programs-events/sport-clubs/badminton-club/ You can also contact us through email at calbadminton@gmail.com. *NOTE: Our roster is not processed through CalLink. Please DO NOT send us roster requests through this website. Send a request to our Slack to join our community! https://join.slack.com/t/cal-badminton/shared_invite/zt-3c9q92llw-ZSjEp1FOxAuaUjYoBEDhOA Or follow us on our social media below!Instagram: @cal_badminton
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: Badminton Club at Berkeley offers players of all skill levels a chance to compete on both a recreational and intercollegiate level.

Name: Ballet & Books at Berkeley
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We forward Ballet & Books‚Äô nationwide mission of bridging the literacy gap for children aged 3-9. The organization utilizes a hybrid program of reading/writing instruction and creative dance movement to inspire and educate youth.

Name: Ballet Company at Berkeley
Description: The Ballet Company at Berkeley (BC@B) is UC Berkeley‚Äôs first ballet company, committed to providing a welcoming and accessible environment that allows individuals‚Äô passion for ballet and dance to flourish in a way that leads to artistic freedom and personal growth. As a student-run company, we strive to expand the aesthetic horizon of dancers and nourish a professional environment in which dancers can share the joys and innovations of the art of ballet with the UC Berkeley community. Our directors for Fall 2025 are Lily Eros, Ella Edelstein, and Frances Jing. Please don't hesitate to contact us at ballet.berkeley@gmail.com! Fall 2025 Plans: The Fall 2025 season will consist of weekly classes, rehearsals, and two end of semester showcases. Auditions to join the performing company will be held at the beginning of each semester. The end of semester showcase will be only offered to performing members. Fall 2025 Auditions: Day/Time/Location: September 2nd, 4th, and 5th, 6:00 pm-7:30 pm, Hearst Gym 230. Please arrive 30 minutes early for audition check-ins. Auditions will consist of a comprehensive ballet class including barre and center. All dancers interested in joining the performing company must audition, even if they are returning members. Virtual auditions will be available upon request- please email: ballet.berkeley@gmail.com for questions and inquiries. Fall 2025 Classes and Rehearsals: Classes: Mon/Thur 6-7PM in Hearst Gym 230 Classes are open for the ‚Äúdrop-in membership‚Äù for UC Berkeley dancers not in the performing company. Rehearsals: Mon/Thurs 7-8PM in Hearst Gym 230 Showcases: December 5th and December 7th in Hearst Gym 230 If you have any questions, please email ballet.berkeley@gmail.com. Updates and announcements will be posted on our instagram: @balletcompanyatberkeley We look forward to dancing with you all soon!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated MLK Space, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: The Ballet Company at Berkeley (BC@B) is UC Berkeley‚Äôs first ballet company, committed to excellence in ballet and the enrichment of the arts community on campus, as well as expanding the aesthetic horizons of both dancers and audiences.

Name: Ballet Folklorico Reflejos del Sol üíô
Description: Ballet Folklorico Reflejos del Sol, referred to as ‚ÄúReflejos‚Äù, is a Mexican folklorico dance group that promotes cultural diversity at UC Berkeley and in the greater San Francisco/Bay area. Our hope is to educate the university and the community about the Mexican culture through music, art, and dance. We are one of only a handful of Latinx/Chicanx performing groups on campus. We require no experience, so anyone interested is free to join us for practices Monday 6 to 7:30 for the beginners group and Tuesdays 6 to 7:30 for the intermediate/advanced group. Please feel free to e-mail us at reflejosdemexico.cal@gmail.com for any questions! Or follow us on Instagram @reflejosdeucb.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Ballet Folklorico Reflejos del Sol, referred to as ‚ÄúReflejos‚Äù, is a Mexican folklorico dance group that promotes cultural diversity in the SF Bay Area.

Name: Bamboo Abroad at Berkeley
Description: WE SUPPORT A NEW GENERATION OF LEADERS AND ENTREPRENEURS TO LEAD SOCIAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL REGENERATION OF OUR BIO-REGIONS AND COMMUNITIES. Through education work and demonstration, our mission is to support farmers, builders, entrepreneurs and designers to conduct socially and ecologically regenerative work. Join Regeneration Field Institute: a network of students, researchers, scientists, and leaders. Together we can take action for the regeneration of our world.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our mission is to provide the opportunity for students of all backgrounds to learn about sustainable bamboo architecture and agriculture, and eco friendly cultivation of many other crops in Manabi, Ecuador

Name: Bangali Student Association at Berkeley üíô
Description: The Bangali Student Association at Berkeley's primary goal is to provide a space for those affiliated with or interested in the Bangali culture and culture to meet other members of the community and celebrate our language, customs and history. The BSA stands on the principles of diversity and inclusiveness for all community members, including both Bangladeshi and West Bengali/Indian students of all heritages, backgrounds, and religious affiliations. Aside from fostering a social and educational community for Bangali students, we strive to promote awareness and appreciation of Bangladesh and Bangali people in the general UC Berkeley community through the celebration of various social and cultural activities. We also seek to improve the quality of life of the Bangali people through contributions to nonprofit organizations and relief efforts that support education, health, climate resilience and economic development in Bangladesh. tags: Bangladesh, Bengali, Banglai, West Bengal, Bengal, Bangladeshi, Students
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: ...The Bangali Student Association at Berkeley's primary goal is to provide a space for those affiliated with or interested in the Bangali nation and culture to meet other members of the community and celebrate our language, customs and history.

Name: Bangladeshi Students and Scholars at Berkeley (BSSB)
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Bangladeshi Students and Scholars at Berkeley aims to celebrate cultural heritage, supports new students, and fosters an inclusive, safe community while preserving our identity.

Name: Barbell at Berkeley
Description: Join Barbell at Berkeley, a diverse and inclusive community where everyone passionate about lifting, from Olympic lifting and powerlifting to bodybuilding and strength training, finds a supportive space. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, regardless of race, gender, sex, or sexual orientation. Why Join Us? Inclusive Training Community: Our weekly group sessions, Big/Little system, and other events cater to lifters of all levels, offering a nurturing environment for growth and success. Holistic Development: We go beyond lifting, providing specialized content on nutrition, meal planning, and injury prevention, along with beginner-friendly workshops and speaker events that enrich your fitness journey. Community, Empowerment, and Merchandise: Join us for mixers and weekly lifting sessions where we build a community that changes the broader weightlifting culture. Celebrate this spirit with our upcoming Barbell at Berkeley merchandise line, symbolizing our unity in fitness. Barbell at Berkeley is more than a club; it's a collective where strength is celebrated by all. Join our community and be part of an inclusive strength journey, lifting and growing together.Interested? Check out our Linktree to join: https://linktr.ee/barbellatberkeley
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our student-led organization celebrates every aspect of lifting, from bodybuilding to powerlifting, Olympic lifting, and beyond. We're dedicated to creating an inclusive space where all students can thrive regardless of their fitness journey.

Name: BARE Magazine
Description: BARE Magazine, UC Berkeley‚Äôs premier arts and creative publication, is a foundational organization within the UC Berkeley community. Our mission is to foster an inclusive and self-expressed community on the UC Berkeley campus, effectively offer students valuable work experience, and encourage and acknowledge the creative power of UC Berkeley students in fashion, arts, and lifestyle. Producing a biannual print magazine and regular online content, as well as multiple in-staff and student body-oriented events throughout the academic year are means to this end. We have 8 committees taking applications this semester: creative, editorial, operations, web, marketing, finance, design, and artist fund. If you are interested, join us for our info session to learn more! 9/4: Online Info-session Join Zoom Meetinghttps://berkeley.zoom.us/j/93580980394 9/8: Meet the department directors - in person networking event (7-8pm Haas Courtyard) For further details on joining us: linktr.ee/baremagazine For coffee chats refer to our Website: https://baremagazine.org/ Application Link Applications close 9/9 11:59pm Instagram: baremagazine
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Publication Groups, Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated BNorth Space
Summary: BARE Magazine is UC Berkeley's premier arts and creative publication.

Name: BareStage Productions
Description: BareStage Productions is a CalLink organization. BareStage Productions is the oldest and largest student-run theatre company at the University of California, Berkeley. BareStage offers student actors, directors, writers, musicians, and designers unique experience to practice and hone their craft outside the classroom. We pride ourselves on the pre-professional quality of our work, diversity of available opportunities, and supportive, inclusive environment. In addition, BareTroupe, BareStage's musical theatre group, and BarePage, BareStage's new writing and directing group, provides students with opportunities to perform regularly throughout the school year. ...................................................................................................................................................................... https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JI9fZXi6ZNQ BareStage Productions was formerly named Friends of the Theatre.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: BareStage Productions (Formerly Friends of the Theatre) is a CalLink organization. BareStage Productions is a student-run theatre company that produces two fully-staged plays and musicals every semester.

Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Social club for graduate students to celebrate and experience Taiwanese cultural events

Name: Bay Area Environmentally Aware Consulting Network
Description: Join BEACN ‚Äì UC Berkeley's Premier Sustainability and Social Impact Consulting Organization! ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Recruiting for Fall 2025 | More Information (Coming Soon) at: www.beacn.org/join ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- About BEACN: BEACN is UC Berkeley's premier business consulting organization focused on sustainability and social impact. Founded in 2006, we've worked with 119 unique clients, including leading Fortune 500 firms, non-profits, government agencies, and startups. Our diverse community spans all 7 academic colleges at UC Berkeley, representing 10+ countries, 20+ U.S. states, and various backgrounds‚Äîall united by a shared mission to drive sustainability and innovation, and to make the world a better place. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- What We Do: Every semester, BEACN partners with five organizations on high-impact, real-world projects. As a member, you'll join one of five dynamic project teams as a consultant alongside 4-5 other consultants, led by two project managers, and advised by a graduate student mentor and BEACN's executive board. Our projects are diverse in scope and vary based on member interest each semester, but can include things like: Engineering Research: Determining the energy efficiency of different battery types and proposing an electrification plan for client's vehicle fleet Geospatial Data Analysis: Evaluating the impacts of racial disparities in public transit access, and proposing revised transit routes for client to maximize access, minimize pollution, and optimize traffic flow Sustainable Policy Development: Delivering policy memos for legislative officials Marketing Strategies: Formulating go-to-market plans for innovative greentech products Financial Modeling: Assessing the financial viability of client's planned solar energy expansion efforts Learn more about our past projects at www.beacn.org/services. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Professional and Personal Growth: Beyond project work, you'll become part of BEACN's vibrant community, making lifelong friends and enjoying: Destination retreats Big-little pairings and mentorship Professional development workshops End-of-semester banquets Frequent socials, from arts and crafts on the glade to Halloween parties and team dinners‚Äîall at no cost to you! Additionally, as one of UC Berkeley's oldest professional groups, BEACN boasts a powerful alumni network with over 300 graduates working in leading organizations across consulting, tech, finance, public agencies, startups, and nonprofits. Our alumni have also continued their education at prestigious institutions such as Harvard, Oxford, MIT, and Cambridge. Joining BEACN connects you to this extensive, close-knit network, opening doors to incredible professional opportunities across a multitude of industries. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Why Join? No prior consulting or business experience is needed‚Äîwe provide comprehensive training to ensure your success in project work. BEACN also offers need-based stipends to support students facing financial hardships. We strongly encourage students of all backgrounds, experiences, and skill sets to apply! ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Contact Us: For any questions, reach out at info@beacn.berkeley.edu. Connect with BEACN: beacn.org | instagram.com/cal.beacn
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: BEACN is a student-run sustainability and business strategy consulting organization. Focused on sustainability & social impact, BEACN has worked with 119 unique clients, including leading Fortune 500 firms, non-profits, government agencies, and startups.

Name: Bay Area Scientists in Schools at Berkeley üíô
Description: Bay Area Scientists Inspiring Students (BASIS) volunteers foster scientific curiosity by connecting with kids and teachers through hands-on classroom experiences. BASIS is a science role model volunteer program that connects UC Berkeley graduate students, postdoctoral scholars, and undergraduates with students in public elementary schools within the East Bay. There is a huge demand from teachers and students in our community to bring hands-on science and engineering lessons into the classroom! "Tremendous! More, please!" is the top comment from teachers who've had a BASIS visit. Program Goals The goals of BASIS are to (1) connect a diverse range of scientist volunteers to elementary school students and teachers, (2) inspire students with examples of real-world science careers and issues, (3) engage with students in hands-on, inquiry based learning experiences, and (4) create effective teaching links between scientists and public elementary schools in the East Bay. Program Mechanics UC Berkeley science and engineering students interested in becoming a BASIS volunteer must first sign up for a one-hour on-campus orientation (held on campus). Sign up for an orientation online (http://www.crscience.org/volunteers/signup). BASIS volunteers then form a teaching team (or join a pre-existing team) comprised of friends and colleagues in their field of study. Volunteers choose dates and times that they are available to visit classrooms and present a one-hour hands-on, inquiry-based lesson with their team. BASIS ensures that these lessons are age-appropriate and aligned with the Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS). Teams generally present in one classroom per month over the course of a school year (~10 lessons/year) though there is a high degree of flexibility to accommodate your schedule. BASIS teams begin by teaching one of the lessons from our database of kid-tested, teacher-approved lessons. Experienced volunteers may also take advantage of training opportunities to develop their own lesson.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Bay Area Scientists Inspiring Students (BASIS) volunteers foster scientific curiosity by connecting with kids and teachers through hands-on classroom experiences.

Name: Bay Area Vision Research Day
Description: BAVRD is an annual meeting hosted and organized by Vision Science graduate students at UC Berkeley. It is dedicated to facilitating collaboration and discussion among vision researchers in the San Francisco Bay Area across many fields ‚Äì including neuroscience, computer science, psychology, immunology, molecular biology, bioengineering, optics, optometry, and ophthalmology.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: BAVRD is an annual meeting hosted and organized by Vision Science graduate students at UC Berkeley.

Name: BCS Organizing Committee
Description: BCS Organizing Committee aims to organize the event Berkeley China Summit each October. Berkeley China Summit is a full-day on-campus conference organized by UC Berkeley alumni and students. By building a platform where great minds from US and China collide, BCS aims to connect China‚Äôs businesses and investors with the technology, engineering, and business innovation expertise on UC Berkeley campus and across the Bay Area. The Theme of past years focused on state-of-art technologies and innovations that have seen a rapid growth in recent years, of which US, especially the Bay Area, and China will continue to be the main contributors and beneficiaries. Potential topics of discussion include Blockchain, Deep Learning, Fintech, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligent, Business, and Entrepreneurship, etc.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Berkeley China Summit is a full-day on-campus conference. By building a platform where great minds from US and China collide, BCS aims to connect China‚Äôs businesses and investors in the bay area.

Name: Beach Volleyball Club
Description: The Beach Volleyball Club‚Äôs mission is to create an environment that fosters strength of character, laughter, and collaboration through a supportive and welcoming beach volleyball community. Logistically our competition team seeks to compete in CBVA tournaments and train for skill development--while our larger body of members will learn the sport and develop a community in line with club values.
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Beach Volleyball Club‚Äôs mission is to create an environment that fosters strength of character, friendship, laughter, and collaboration through a supportive and welcoming beach volleyball community.

Name: Bear Power Fund üíô
Description: We are an organization dedicated to the support of Air Force ROTC through fundraising and community service.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are an organization dedicated to the support of Air Force ROTC through fundraising and community service.

Name: Bearettes Drill Team at Berkeley
Description: Since our founding in 2015, the Bearettes' mission has been to serve underrepresented communities and the greater Cal community as a group of students who demonstrate diversity, inclusion, and empowerment through performance and discipline. We strive to create a space where students from different backgrounds, communities, and cultures can come together to portray Berkeley through a different lens. The Bearettes aspire to bring spirit to people of color and provide a space for people of color to feel proud showcasing their talents on Berkeley's campus‚Äîdoing so by honoring and recognizing the history of dance and majorette dance to minority communities.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, OASIS Sponsored Organization, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Bearettes serves as an essential component of the Cal spirit teams that showcases diversity, inclusion, and empowerment through performance and discipline.

Name: Bears for Birds - Audubon at Berkeley üíô
Description: TLDR: Beginners welcome (we even lend out binoculars), and no club dues. Every week: Weekly indoor meetings, Bird Garden Gardening, Pigeon Destringing Every month: Bay Area birding daytrip Every semester: Overnight field trip, Inter-college 24-hour Birdathon (Beat Stanford!) See FAQs and signup for our mailing list and Discord at: tinyurl.com/b4b2024 See our past events on Instagram at @bearsforbirds Birdwatching is a unique form of citizen science that has dozens of intersections with ecology, culture, conservation, and education. Most members join us with near-zero experience; a curiosity for birds is all you need. (updated Aug 2025, admin J)
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Bears for Birds aims to educate students about local bird species and engage them in regional ecology through citizen science.

Name: Bears for Israel
Description: Bears for Israel aims to be an inclusive, pro-active, and pro-Israel voice that promotes open dialogue on the UC Berkeley campus. We advocate for the existence of the Jewish and democratic state. We work to build relationships with various student groups and on and off campus partners in order to form a more educated and informed pro-Israel student body.
