We are a mix of students politically, religiously, and ethnically who are interested in learning more about Israel and exploring it from political, cultural, and social perspectives. The best way to stay connected is to Like us on Facebook and subscribe to our newsletter (also through Facebook)!
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Bears for Israel aims to be an inclusive, pro-active, and pro-Israel voice that promotes open dialogue on the UC Berkeley campus.

Name: Bears for Palestine
Description: "Bears for Palestine is a student organization designated to enlighten, educate and raise awareness about Palestinian culture, values and history; with an overall goal to share the Palestinian story with the campus community through activism."
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Bears for Palestine is a student organization designated to enlighten, educate and raise awareness about Palestinian culture, values and history; with an overall goal to share the Palestinian story with the campus community.

Name: Beauty and Luxury Consumer Products Club of Berkeley üíô
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our mission is to create a space to explore the intersection of beauty, luxury CPG, & sustainability: We hope to generate experiences through conversations and initiatives to learn about beauty, luxury CPG, and sustainability to grow professionally.

Name: Behavioral Economics Association at Berkeley
Description: BEA is a vibrant and diverse community of students passionate about exploring and applying behavioral economics. We offer opportunities to engage in research, work on real-world projects with clients across various industries, and dive into the world of product management. Our networking events feature workshops and talks from industry leaders, including Nobel Prize winners and chief scientists, ensuring our members grow both professionally and personally. Plus, we host socials and retreats to keep our community connected!
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Serve as a common meeting ground for extraordinary minds interested in Behavioral Economics, research, or experiment design.

Name: Bengal Gazette üíô
Description: The original Bengal Gazette was started by James Augustus Hicky in 1780 in Calcutta, the then-capital of British India. Hicky‚Äôs Bengal Gazette was the first newspaper to be printed in Asia and prided itself on producing provocative, independent journalism. While Hicky‚Äôs Bengal Gazette only ran for two years, its spirit lives on in contemporary journalism about the subcontinent, including this very publication. [1] Today‚Äôs Bengal Gazette is a student-run publication based out of Berkeley dedicated to all topics related to Bengal, uniting the voices of Undergraduates, Graduates, Faculty and Alumni here at Cal. From our history, politics, culture, tradition, art, and literature, to our food, the Bengal Gazette strives to be a timeless platform to write and learn about Bengal. We are both a print magazine and a mobile platform, hoping to make a presence not just at Cal but throughout the Bangali Diaspora. Hope you read us!
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Publication devoted to covering all Bengali related events and topics, such as culture, politics and history

Name: BERC Undergraduate üíô
Description: BERCU is a community for undergraduates to plug into all the opportunities that the Berkeley Energy and Resources Collaborative (BERC) has to offer, addressing global and local energy & resources issues with respect to emerging energy technologies, environmental management, and policies. BERCU helps undergrads find their passion within energy and resources by offering educational events, industrial panels, graduate student mentorship programs, career fairs, and info-sessions, professional networking opportunities, as well as social events to find like-minded people.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: BERC Undergraduate supports students in finding their passion within energy and resources and to provide a network which supports them to take action.

Name: BERKE1337 Cyber Security Team üíô
Description: We are BERKE1337 (berk-leet), UC Berkeley's only undergraduate cybersecurity club. We compete in CTFs, live attacker/defender competitions like CCDC and CPTC, and maintain a steadily growing lab network. Interested? No application or experience needed, just take a look at the website and come to a meeting!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: BERKE1337 provides a space for students interested in learning about cybersecurity through talks, competitions, workshops, and industry interactions.

Name: Berkeley Art Museum Pacific Film Archive Student Committee
Description: The BAMPFA Student Committee aims to connect students to the Berkeley Art Museum and Pacific Film Archive (BAMPFA) through outreach and events. Each semester, we organize activities, small film screenings, and multimedia parties for students. The Committee also has an important role in advocating for students‚Äô interests within the museum operations and on the Board of Trustees. The Student Committee takes applications for new members at the start of every fall and spring semester.
Categories: Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The BAMPFA Student Committee works to connect students and the BAMPFA through outreach and events aimed at all members of the student community. Each semester, we organize activities, small film screenings, and multimedia parties for students.

Name: Berkeley Bahai Club
Description: The Berkeley Bah√°‚Äô√≠ Club is a student organisation devoted to the practical implementation of the teachings of Bah√°'u'll√°h, founder of the Bah√°‚Äô√≠ Faith, on unity, justice, and selfless service. Bah√°‚Äô√≠s believe social change starts with spirituality ‚Äî individuals increasing their capacity for service and working for the betterment of neighborhoods and communities. In line with the teachings of the Bah√°‚Äô√≠ Faith, the Berkeley Bah√°‚Äô√≠ Club works to promote the essential oneness of humanity; to foster a spirit of fellowship and love among all peoples; to break down the racial, religious and other prejudices that are the greatest barriers to peace and unity in the world today; and to bring about the betterment of the world through good deeds and service. Since a necessary element in effecting such a change is the individual, the Bah√°‚Äô√≠ Club tries to nurture individual spiritual growth through the development of moral values, an upright character and increased capacity for service. To these ends, the Berkeley Bah√°‚Äô√≠ Club organises divers activities and events, including: ‚ñ† study circles for the systematic study of Bah√°‚Äô√≠ Writings and thoughtful discussion of spiritual, philosophical and sociological topics; ‚ñ† devotional gatherings for sharing prayers and inspirational readings from all religious traditions in a peaceful setting; ‚ñ† talks & lectures from guest speakers on relevant topics; ‚ñ† service projects as a venue for transforming words into action; ‚ñ† inter-faith collaborations to promote the basic unity of all religions; ‚ñ† social events aimed at creating fellowship. Membership is open to all. All who have an interest in the Bah√°‚Äô√≠ Faith's community building activities, irrespective of religious affiliation, are more than welcome to attend meetings and events. ‚ÄúAnd the honor and distinction of the individual consist in this, that he among all the world‚Äôs multitudes should become a source of social good. Is any larger bounty conceivable than this, that an individual, looking within himself, should find that by the confirming grace of God he has become the cause of peace and well-being, of happiness and advantage to his fellow men? No, by the one true God, there is no greater bliss, no more complete delight.‚Äù ‚Äî ‚ÄòAbdu‚Äôl-Baha
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Berkeley Baha'i Club is a student organization devoted to the practical implementation of the teachings of Baha'u'llah on unity, justice, and selfless service.

Name: Berkeley Ballroom Dancers üíô
Description: Berkeley Ballroom is a student-run organization that has been providing classes and ballroom events for dancers in Berkeley and the East Bay for the past 50 years! We cater to the needs of all dancers, whether experienced or not. Our social dance lessons are taught at the beginner level, but everyone is welcome to attend our dance lessons and events. For all of our events, no partner or experience is required, but if you have one or the other or both we would be happy to see you as well! We also provide dance lessons for engaged couples preparing for their big day, customized to suit their dance levels and personal preferences. Check out our instagram, @calballroom, and our website! Please contact us for any questions about joining.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Berkeley Ballroom is a student-run organization that has been providing ballroom classes and events for dancers in Berkeley and the East Bay for the past 50 years!

Name: Berkeley Business Society
Description: Berkeley Business Society is a tight-knit community of diverse individuals who tackle real-world business problems for leading industry clients. Our consultants choose from one of five consulting projects, each encompassing a different concentration of business. Tailoring the club experience to every individual is our highest priority. We seek to build lasting relationships, as well as provide an unparalleled network of mentors and archive of professional resources. It is our hope that in BBS you will find an area of business that interests you, meaningful professional experience, and a lifelong community. Our 5 Consulting Concentrations Media: Work with a large-scale, industry-leading media corporation to solve real-world business problems while honing your research and analytical skills Finance: Develop quantitative strategy for a corporation or financial services firm by identifying and modeling novel opportunities for growth via investment Marketing: Design innovative solutions for a company to advance its branding and customer relations by developing campaigns and strategies that combine performance with creativity Social Impact: Deliver actionable recommendations for a nonprofit organization to solve its business problems through the employment of strategic analysis to create sustainable social impact Technology: Create high-impact solutions while gaining a deep understanding of the unique problems faced by a technology-based company through hands-on experience alongside entrepreneurs Visit our website for more information: berkeleybusinesssociety.com
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Berkeley Business Society is a tight-knit community of diverse individuals who tackle real-world business problems for leading industry clients through one of five consulting projects, each encompassing a different concentration of business.

Name: Berkeley Carillon Guild
Description: If you are interested in playing the carillon or play the carillon and want to become associated with the Sather Tower Carillon here at Berkeley, please contact us at(calbells@gmail.com) For more information about the Campanile, please see http://bells.berkeley.edu
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Berkeley Carillon Guild fosters relationships among students, alumni, and staff of the Sather Tower Carillon, addresses the problems of carillon students on campus, and provides awareness regarding the carillon program to the campus and community

Name: Berkeley Chinese Students and Scholars Association
Description: Berkeley Chinese Students and Scholars Association (BCSSA) is a student organization registered at ASUC (Associated Students of the University of California) on Berkeley campus. We are a non-profit and non-political organization dedicated to social, intellectual and cultural activities for Chinese students and scholars at UC Berkeley as well as other interested members in the Berkeley community. We have nearly 5000 registered members and is still in rapid growth.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Berkeley Chinese Students and Scholars Association is a non-profit organization dedicated to promote social, intellectual and cultural activities for UC Berkeley Chinese students.

Name: Berkeley Christian Fellowship
Description: We are a student Christian fellowship brought together by faith and biblical truth. This semester, our theme will be "Youth in the Bible". We will be reflecting on the lives of different youth in the Bible, applying teachings from their lives, and thinking about how we can live as young Christians. If you are interested in joining or attending our meetings, please contact us via our Instagram page www.instagram.com/berkeleychristianfellowship or to find our more about our beliefs, you can visit www.tjc.org.
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We are a student Christian fellowship brought together by faith and biblical truth. If you are interested in learning more, please contact us via our Instagram page www.instagram.com/berkeleychristianfellowship

Name: Berkeley College Republicans
Description: The Berkeley College Republicans is one of the largest and most active student run organizations at UC Berkeley and is the largest College Republican organization in the state of California. BCR offers Berkeley students the opportunity to have truly civil, open discussion of the issues of the day.
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Berkeley College Republicans is one of the largest and most active student run organizations at UC Berkeley and is the largest College Republican organization in the state of California.

Name: Berkeley Consulting
Description: As Berkeley‚Äôs first established consulting organization, BC has the privilege of providing its services across a broad spectrum of organizations. We work on semester-long engagements to provide valuable research insights and actionable recommendations to our clients. We are devoted to delivering high-impact solutions and pride ourselves on our ability to catalyze meaningful change within the organizations we work with as well as our close-knit culture. Check out our website at bc.berkeley.edu for more information
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Berkeley Consulting (BC) is an student-run nonprofit management consulting organization that provides innovative solutions to core business problems faced by its clients. Founded in 1996, BC is the first established consulting organization at UC Berkeley.

Name: Berkeley Economic Review
Description: The Berkeley Economic Review (BER) is the University of California at Berkeley‚Äôs premier peer-reviewed undergraduate economics journal, publishing undergraduate research papers, honors theses, and original content in economics and economics-related fields. As a member of Berkeley Economic Review, you will experience the inner workings of one of the most prestigious undergraduate economics journals on the planet. BER members work firsthand with professors and have access to networking and other career opportunities with professionals in this field. They get in-depth experience with the process of economic research and learn about today‚Äôs most crucial economic topics. Most importantly, being a part of BER connects you with a friendly community of fellow students who are passionate about this subject, providing each other with invaluable academic and career advice. For more information, please visit our website at http://econreview.berkeley.edu/.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Publication Groups, Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Berkeley Economic Review (BER) is the University of California, Berkeley‚Äôs premier peer-reviewed undergraduate economics journal, publishing undergraduate research papers, honors theses, and original content in economics and economics-related fields.

Name: Berkeley Energy and Resources Collaborative (Graduate group) üíô
Description: The Berkeley Energy & Resources Collaborative (BERC) is a multidisciplinary network of UC Berkeley students, alumni, faculty, industry professionals, and advisors who seek to turn world-leading research into world-changing solutions by tackling tough and timely energy and environmental challenges. More specifically, BERC‚Äôs mission is to connect, educate, and engage its members in order to foster innovation and action. To that end, BERC: Connects nearly 3,000 members as a part of a broad, cross-disciplinary network of students, faculty and professionals in the fields of energy and resources; Educates students about cutting edge work in energy and resources through organizing events, lectures, and treks; and Engages members by providing opportunities to address global energy and resources issues and collaborate on real-world projects. Please signup at http://berc.berkeley.edu by clicking the 'join' button in the top right corner. Find our full events calendar at http://berc.berkeley.edu/events
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: BERC is a multidisciplinary network of UC Berkeley students, alumni, faculty, industry professionals, and advisors who seek to turn world-leading research into world-changing solutions by tackling tough and timely energy and environmental challenges.

Name: Berkeley Environmental Economics and Policy Students üíô
Description: BEEPS builds an academic, professional development, and social community for all students interested in Environmental Economics and Policy. They cultivate a hub of resources and support that connects students with peers, professors, alumni, and industry professionals through networking events, a mentorship program, and speaker events. Most importantly, BEEPS fosters a community of connected students interested in EEP by hosting social events. https://linktr.ee/calbeeps https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=79ZMK-LcIlI
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: BEEPS connects current and prospective Environmental Economics and Policy students with their peers, professors, alumni, and relevant industry professionals.

Name: Berkeley Fiction Review üíô
Description: The Berkeley Fiction Review is a UC Berkeley undergraduate, student-run publication and is one of several descendants of UC Berkeley‚Äôs Occident literary journal, which was published from 1881 to the 1960s. Established in 1981 by Julia Littleton, Jenne Mowry, Joe Sciallo, and Paul Wedderien, BFR is now UC Berkeley‚Äôs oldest prose journal. In 2012, the Berkeley Fiction Review was named ‚ÄúBest Literary Publication‚Äù on campus by the Associated Students of the University of California. We look for innovative and reflective short fiction from new and emerging writers from around the world across all genres that play with form and content, as well as traditionally constructed stories with fresh voices and original ideas that say something new or bring nuance and perspective to an ongoing cultural conversation. We invite submissions of previously unpublished short stories year-round and publish annually. We nominate to O. Henry, Best American Short Stories, and Pushcart prizes. Our DeCal class takes place during both semesters of the school year. Members of the class read submissions for the journal and vote on them in class. The goal of the class is to teach foundational skills within the publishing and media industries as well as give students experience in publishing quality short fiction.Over the course of the semester, we will determine qualities of a good story, as well as learn about the publishing process. The class is graded pass/not pass, and can be taken for 1-2 units. No experience is necessary; all Berkeley students are welcome. We also welcome auditors. Enrollment form now closed. Berkeley students who have filled out our enrollment form must also attend a mandatory info session on 9/4 from 6 - 8:30pm in Social Sciences 56.
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Berkeley Fiction Review is UC Berkeley's premier prose journal. We publish a print anthology that includes artwork and 12-15 short stories from around the world as well as an online magazine focused on book reviews, culture, and personal essays.

Name: Berkeley Indonesian Student Association
Description: The Berkeley Indonesian Student Association (BISA) was established in 1985. BISA's main purpose is to create stronger friendships between Indonesian students at UC Berkeley and help create greater awareness of Indonesian culture. BISA strongly believes in the essentiality of this action because there is something uniquely diverse and fascinating about being able to speak your own language with a close group of people, in a setting so foreign and far away from home. Indonesia is a rapidly developing country. It is one of the fastest growing economies in the world and is home to a multitude of great historical monuments and young intellectual minds. Through connecting students with keynote characters, alumni, and each other, BISA aims to be a platform of learning for its members where they can also inspire, and more importantly, be inspired. BISA was created by the students and for the students. Through continuously building a larger and closer community, we aim to support each other as the people we are now and the people we will soon become.
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Berkeley Indonesian Student Association (BISA) was established in 1985. BISA hopes to foster a strong sense of community among Indonesian students and create greater awareness of Indonesian culture at UC Berkeley.

Name: Berkeley Innovation
Description: Berkeley Innovation is a human-centered design group at UC Berkeley. Founded in 2003, our members come from a wide range of disciplines, but share a common love for design thinking and innovation. Each semester, we work on design projects that give members hands-on experience with the entire design process, from conducting user research to building and marketing prototypes. We exist as a community for students who are interested in design to develop their design thinking skills and experience. We also run the Human-Centered Design DeCal‚Äîan introductory, project-based course teaching the fundamentals of design (learn more at hcd-decal.org). Engage with us! Follow our Instagram @berkeleyinnovation and learn more about our process and work at berkeleyinnovation.org *Name approved by OMBO 3/17/09
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Berkeley Innovation is a human-centered design group at UC Berkeley. Founded in 2003, our members come from a wide range of disciplines, but share a common love for design thinking and innovation.

Name: Berkeley Investment Group
Description: We run a student-raised investment fund, giving the Berkeley Community the opportunity to participate and gain experience in the world of investing. We bring in numerous financial speakers, run specialized educational programs and mock trading competitions, and organize professional workshops.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Semester long Analyst Internship; Lectures on Investment Strategies; Open-Forum Discussions; Hands-On Analysis of Companies/Industries; Real and Virtual Investing; Guest Speakers on Special Topics; Professional Workshops; Career Leads for Finance Jobs

Name: Berkeley Journal of Criminal Law üíô
Description: The Berkeley Journal of Criminal Law provides a forum for the discussion of regional, national, and international criminal law issues. Since its inception in 2000, the journal has published cutting-edge scholarship by professors, judges, research fellows, clerks, and law students from across the country. In addition to our publication, we host regular events to engage students, faculty and the larger community in discussions about important contemporary topics in criminal law and social justice. We seek submissions from scholars, students, and practitioners in both the private and public sectors. In addition to traditional scholarly articles, BJCL will consider book reviews, practice-oriented pieces, and student notes. While the journal publishes work covering a broad range of traditional topics in both substantive and procedural criminal law, we are also interested in articles that discuss issues unique to California and other western states. BJCL publishes on an ongoing basis and is completely digital (though authors can get hard-copy prints). We publish our Fall Edition in January and our Spring Edition in June.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Berkeley Journal of Criminal Law provides a forum for the discussion of regional, national, and international criminal law issues. The journal regularly publishes cutting-edge scholarship from professors, judges, research fellows, and law students.

Name: Berkeley Journal of Employment and Labor Law
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Berkeley Journal of Employment and Labor Law (formerly Industrial Labor Relations Law Journal) presents current developments in the labor and employment law field to scholars, practitioners, and students.

Name: Berkeley Journal of Entertainment and Sports Law üíô
Description: The Berkeley Journal of Entertainment & Sports Law (BJESL) is a student-run publication and scholarly community dedicated to fostering high-level, timely discussion of legal issues that contemporaneously impact the entertainment and sports world, both domestically and internationally. As an interactive and completely-online law journal, BJESL presents a unique platform for rich, diverse legal analysis that will serve scholars, practitioners, and students in these fields. Issues will contain approximately four articles by professors, practitioners, or students on current topics relating to sports and entertainment law.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Berkeley Journal of Entertainment & Sports Law (BJESL) is a student-run publication and scholarly community dedicated to fostering high-level, timely discussion of legal issues that contemporaneously impact the entertainment and sports world.

Name: Berkeley Journal of Gender, Law & Justice üíô
Description: BGLJ‚Äôs primary activity during the school year is to publish one annual volume of intersectional feminist legal scholarship. This process includes selection of scholarship through a consensus-inspired process of voting by our membership, and through the multi-phase editorial process. Members meet on a bi-weekly basis to discuss the merits of proposed academic articles. In addition to the publication of our journal, we sponsor and co-sponsor events relating to the editorial mandate of our journal such as our own annual symposium and other co-sponsored symposia, lectures, and discussions. This year we also plan to host more social events related to gender‚Äôs intersection with other axes of subordination such as race, class, sexual orientation, disability, and colonialism. Since we also act as a source of community and belonging for members, we also provide a number of supportive programs and services particularly for our members, such as an outline bank, a library of study aids, office resources, membership mentoring, and alumni networking.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our mandate is to publish feminist legal scholarship that critically examines the intersection of gender with one or more other axes of subordination, including, but not limited to, race, class, sexual orientation, and disability.

Name: Berkeley Journal of International Law
Description: Please see https://www.law.berkeley.edu/library/ir/bjil/ for further information.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: BJIL is a student-run journal at Berkeley Law publishing on a broad range of scholarship in public international, private international, and comparative law.

Name: Berkeley Journal of Sociology
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: A graduate student journal that publishes essays, photo essays, commentary and interviews on contemporary social and societal issues, online and in print.

Name: Berkeley Medical Reserve Corps
Description: The Berkeley Medical Reserve Corps (BMRC) is a deployable unit of healthcare volunteers that can be called on to serve in times of local, state, or federal emergencies. We are composed mostly of EMTs, and provide opportunities for members to use their licenses, refresh their skills, and serve the Berkeley community in a number of efforts. We work closely with the Office of Emergency Management and University Health Services in preparing campus for emergency scenarios. We currently provide medical support for Cal Athletics events such as Cal football and basketball games, participate in several large-scale emergency drills in the Bay Area, regularly teach CPR classes for community members, and partner with other local healthcare organizations to provide a diversity of experiences for our volunteers. To join, look out for our First General Meeting at the start of every semester! Follow us on Instagram (@mrcberkeley) in order to receive that information and more!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: To unite student EMTs (emergency medical technicians) and those interested in being EMTs on campus, providing opportunities to use their licenses, refreshish their skills, and offerish a forum to discuss EMS as it relates to Berkeley and beyond.

Name: Berkeley Model United Nations Conference (Formerly known as Berkeley Model United Nations)
Description: A little about us: Berkeley Model United Nations is a student-run organization on the UC Berkeley campus dedicated to planning and hosting the biggest Model United Nations conference on the West Coast. Every March, over 2,000 high school students from all over the world come to Berkeley to participate in Berkeley Model United Nations. Entering its 72st session, BMUN‚Äôs mission is to spread awareness of international issues and the spirit of diplomacy through UN simulations. We also aim to create an educational experience for high school students, to help them realize their potential in public speaking as well as policy debate. We do this by serving as head chairs on a diverse group of committees in which we help to facilitate delegate education through substantive diplomatic debate.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: We are an International Relations Non-profit that works to provide educational opportunities for students in the Bay Area. We host a 2000+ person conference in the spring of each year to raise money for our chosen philanthropic cause each year.

Name: Berkeley New Music Project üíô
Description: The Berkeley New Music Project (BNMP) is a collective of UC Berkeley's graduate-level composers and composition faculty within the UC Berkeley Department of Music whose aim is to promote contemporary music and art. As a result of our efforts, we have been able to organize public concerts of our music in collaboration with esteemed local and international artists.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: BNMP helps to produce new music works by UC Berkeley Graduate and Faculty composers, as well as those artists affiliated with the university.

Name: Berkeley Organization for Animal Advocacy üíô
Description: Berkeley Organization for Animal Advocacy (BOAA) is Cal's home for animal rights activism and plant-based community! Join us if you're an animal lover, life-long vegan, or anywhere in between. We are completely inclusive and love any students who want to change the world, undergraduate or graduate! Our vision is of a world where all individuals are safe, happy, and free. We host events like cooking socials and retreats, educate students about animal issues, and push UC Berkeley's administration and student government to reject factory farming. Recently, we've helped pass an ASUC resolution to make all of their catered events plant-based, marched for Measure DD to make Berkeley the first city in the US to ban factory farms, and hosted the 2025 AI for Animals conference! In addition to taking action for animals, we host solidarity events with labor groups, environmental groups, and food justice organizations on-campus. Factory farming and animal oppression affects the non-human world, but also low-income communities, people of color, and the health and culture of our society. We stand in firm solidarity with other social justice groups and are dedicated to total liberation for humans and animals alike. Join us in Fall 2025! Whether you're here for the hikes and game nights, volunteer opportunities at animal sanctuaries, or activism committees, we're excited to meet you! Sign up here: https://forms.gle/j5XCkBYh3kHjkHox6 Follow us for updates on Instagram: @boaa_ucb
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: BOAA is Cal's home for animal rights activism and plant-based community!

Name: Berkeley Poetry Review
Description: The Berkeley Poetry Review has been published at the University of California, Berkeley, since 1974. It is widely regarded as one of the premier student-run journals in the country. We‚Äôve featured the work of both new and established poets and writers, including Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Pablo Neruda, Brenda Hillman, Czes≈Çaw Mi≈Çosz, Cole Swensen, Robert Hass, Ishmael Reed, Thom Gunn, and many others from the Bay Area poetry community. We seek language-based and/or experimental writing, translations, art, and (less frequently) essays and interviews. We are particularly interested in work that complicates prevailing conceptions of poetic form and narrative voice.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Publication Groups, Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Berkeley Poetry Review (BPR) is the University of California, Berkeley's longest-running poetry journal, published annually since 1974. It is widely regarded as one of the premier student-run journals in the country.

Name: Berkeley Political Review, The
Description: The Berkeley Political Review was founded in the aftermath of the September 11, 2001 attacks by UC Berkeley students who wanted to offer a source of impartial analysis on the issues that most affect students and the world we live in. Since then, BPR has covered five presidential elections, the war in Iraq, the expansion and subsequent erosion of the European Union, immigration raids, drone strikes, the Great Recession, 20 years of Berkeley protest movements, the politics of ethanol, the approval of new medications, divestment from fossil fuels, the COVID-19 pandemic, and everything in between. We strive to provide cutting, original journalism on both the topics that dominate global headlines and those that slip beneath the radar of major press outlets. We have always been and remain entirely run by undergraduate students, from our newest staff writers to our most veteran editors and from our financial management to our coverage of Indian politics. If you would like to support our mission of producing a free and high-quality campus publication and cultivating the next generation of truth-seeking journalists, please donate here using our name.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Publication Groups, Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, ABSA - Budgeted over $7500 Organizations
Summary: UC Berkeley's only non-partisan political magazine. Read the Review and learn more at bpr.berkeley.edu!

Name: Berkeley Public Policy Journal
Description: The Berkeley Public Policy Journal is a student-led publication of the Goldman School of Public Policy at the University of California, Berkeley. The Journal engages readers in a public dialogue on current policy issues, reflecting the diverse views of our students, faculty, and alumni. We publish articles that critique, analyze, and provide recommendations on critical issues with the goal of influencing policy leaders.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: As the student-run journal of the Goldman School of Public Policy at the University of California, Berkeley, we are dedicated to providing a forum for policy-related articles that span a wide range of topics.

Name: Berkeley Science Review
Description: The Berkeley Science Review is a magazine run by graduate students that educates the campus community about groundbreaking research at UC Berkeley and fosters discussion of current science policy issues facing the Berkeley community. We also train scientists and nonscientists to communicate scientific research to the public in a manner that is engaging and accessible to nonspecialist readers.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The Berkeley Science Review is a graduate-student-run magazine that communicates the impact of scientific research conducted at UC Berkeley to a nonspecialist audience and explores the relationship of science with our broader community.

Name: Berkeley Scientific Journal
Description: BSJ is the premier undergraduate research journal of the University of California, Berkeley. Every semester, our undergraduate staff publishes independent research done by undergraduates at UC Berkeley, interviews with faculty members, and features articles on current issues in science. All research papers and features articles are reviewed by faculty members. The initial purpose of the journal was to provide an official forum in which Berkeley undergraduates could publish their independent research. But since its inception in 1996, the purpose of the journal has expanded to give the Berkeley scientific community a better understanding of how events here at Berkeley impact global concerns. The focus of the journal is broad, spanning scientific disciplines ranging from ecology to engineering, from astronomy to biochemistry. Our intended audience includes, but is not limited to, UC Berkeley students, faculty, and the surrounding community. A new issue of BSJ is published twice a year in print and on our website. See our website, bsj.studentorg.berkeley.edu, for more information on the journal, and decal.berkeley.edu for a link to our application. You must submit an application to our DeCal for consideration as part of our journal; we do not accept membership requests through CalLink.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Publication Groups, Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: BSJ is a biannually published, student-run journal featuring interviews with faculty members from various fields, undergraduate research projects spanning a broad range of scientific disciplines, and features articles revolving around a central theme.

Name: Berkeley Student Leadership Academy
Description: The Berkeley Student Leadership Academy is a series of engaging workshops and customized experiences that help undergraduate students develop leadership competencies. The workshops relate to leadership, engagement, and diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB) on campus. Registered participants will receive information about Berkeley Student Leadership Academy workshop series, specialized content, and access to mentorship and networking opportunities. Visit the Berkeley Student Leadership Academy website for more information.
Categories: Campus Departments
Summary: The Berkeley Student Leadership Academy is a series of engaging workshops and customized experiences that help undergraduate students develop leadership competencies.

Name: Berkeley Technology Law Journal
Description: The Berkeley Technology Law Journal is a student-run publication of University of California, Berkeley School of Law. We started in March 1985, published our first issue in Spring 1986, and have since covered emerging issues of law in the areas of intellectual property, high-technology and biotechnology. BTLJ strives to keep judges, policymakers, practitioners, and the academic community abreast of this dynamic field. The Journal‚Äôs membership, typically over 100 students, publishes four issues of scholarly work each year, including the Annual Review of Law and Technology. The Annual Review is a distinctive issue of the Journal published in collaboration with the Berkeley Center for Law and Technology and is dedicated to student-written case notes and comments discussing the most important recent developments in IP, antitrust, cyberlaw, telecom, biotech and business law. In addition, the Journal co-sponsors an annual symposium on an emerging area of technology law.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The Berkeley Technology Law Journal is a student-run publication of University of California, Berkeley School of Law covering emerging issues of law in the areas of intellectual property, high-technology, and biotechnology.

Name: Berkeley Tennis Association üíô
Description: Since its establishment in 2003, Berkeley Tennis Association (formerly Tennis at Cal) has expanded into the largest tennis club on campus with over 150 members in 2023 and growing. BTA provides its members with experiences, lessons, and memories that will last a lifetime! Our purpose is to provide opportunities for the UC Berkeley community to compete and socialize with other members of the tennis community. BTA is a social and casual club that encourages members of all levels to not only better their tennis game but to connect with others who share the same passion for tennis. We hold optional practices, social events, and tournaments throughout the semester. It's a great way to meet other tennis players, learn, or improve your game. All skill levels are welcome! In order to become a member of BTA, you must fill out our membership form and pay dues. Our Facebook group is our primary method of communication. Check out our promo video for 2020-21 on YouTube. [Formerly known as Tennis at Cal - mmc]
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our purpose is to provide opportunities for the UC Berkeley community to compete and socialize with other members of the community who share an interest in tennis at the Berkeley campus.

Name: Berkeley Undergraduate Journal üíô
Description: Established in 1987, The Berkeley Undergraduate Journal is the oldest undergraduate research journal at UC Berkeley. We publish exemplary, original undergraduate research papers in the social sciences and humanities. Submission applications are open for Spring 2025. See our website for details.
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Established in 1987, The Berkeley Undergraduate Journal is the oldest undergraduate research journal at UC Berkeley. We publish exemplary, original undergraduate research papers in the social sciences and humanities.

Name: Berkeley Urban Studies Student Association üíô
Description: BUSSA is a community of Urban Studies majors, City Planning minors, and other students interested in urban and regional planning. BUSSA hosts events‚Äîincluding urban walks, firm visits, and speaker events‚Äîfor students to network and experience the Bay Area‚Äôs urban environment. In Fall 2024, we will meet every Wednesday 5-6 PM in Wurster 314B. For more information, message us on Instagram or shoot us an email!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: BUSSA (Berkeley Urban Studies Student Association) is a community of Urban Studies majors, City Planning minors, and any other UC Berkeley student interested in urban and regional planning.

Name: Berkeley Women in Business
Description: Berkeley Women in Business (BWIB) was founded in 2005 by a group of dedicated and enthusiastic female Berkeley students hoping to pursue professional careers in business. The current purpose of Berkeley Women in Business is to foster professional development, provide career-networking opportunities, and educate our members about the contemporary issues that continue to dominate the world of business today. We strive to develop our members into well-rounded individuals with the skills necessary for future employment in professional industries. Our workshops are aimed at increasing our members' understanding of areas such as finance, consulting, and technology.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Women Interest Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: The mission of Berkeley Women in Business (BWIB) is to empower the business leaders of tomorrow through leadership development and discourse about gender equity in the workforce.

Name: Best Buddies at Berkeley üíô
Description: Best Buddies is the world‚Äôs largest organization dedicated to ending the social, physical, and economic isolation of the 200 million people with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD). Our program is dedicated to establishing a global volunteer movement to empower the special abilities of people with IDD by creating opportunities for one-to-one friendships, integrated employment, leadership development, and inclusive living. Founded in 1989 by Anthony K. Shriver, Best Buddies is a vibrant organization that has grown from one original chapter to nearly 3,000 chapters worldwide, positively impacting the lives of over 1.3 million people with and without IDD. Best Buddies engages participants in each of the 50 states and in 50 countries around the world. By joining Best Buddies at UC Berkeley, you will form meaningful one-to-one friendships with those with IDD, which will help them secure successful jobs, live independently, improve public speaking, self-advocacy and communication skills, and feel valued by society. https://www.bestbuddies.org/
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Best Buddies is a nonprofit organization dedicated to establishing a global volunteer movement, creating opportunities for one-to-one friendships, integrated employment, and leadership development for people with intellectual & developmental disabilities

Name: Best Laid Plans
Description: Best Laid Plans aims to provide an open space for people to be creative and have fun, through improvisational theater, comedy, and performance. BLP members will work hard to hone improv skills, learn, entertain others, and enjoy the experience.
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Best Laid Plans aims to provide an open space for people to be creative and have fun, through improvisational theater, comedy, and performance. BLP members will work hard to hone improv skills, learn, entertain others, and have an enjoyable experience

Name: Beta Alpha Psi
Description: As the premier national honors business fraternity since 1919, BAŒ® is internationally recognized and resonates with outstanding scholarship and professionalism. The Lambda Chapter was established in 1925 on the UC Berkeley campus. We excel in many career professions such as investment banking, consulting, accounting, marketing, software engineering, quant, and more by providing professional development and social networking opportunities for our members.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: As the premier national honors business fraternity since 1919, BAŒ® is internationally recognized and resonates with outstanding scholarship and professionalism. The Lambda Chapter was established in 1925 on the UC Berkeley campus.

Name: Beta at Berkeley (formerly known as Techfounders)
Description: BETA (Berkeley Emerging Tech Association) is an innovative student community at UC Berkeley focusing on technology and venture capital. It is dedicated to connecting students, entrepreneurs, and investors to foster an open and dynamic entrepreneurial ecosystem. Through initiatives such as venture conferences, guest speaker events, Demo Day, and its self-developed venture platform InnoSpark, BETA actively promotes resource sharing and interdisciplinary collaboration. BETA has co-hosted the BTT Venture Competition with Stanford, USC, and UCLA, supporting the launch and funding of early-stage projects. Past guest speakers have included industry leaders such as the Co-Founder of the North America AI career platform JobRight and the Social Media Director of the Silicon Valley Founders Club, providing members with cutting-edge entrepreneurial insights and hands-on opportunities. [Beta at Berkeley was formerly known as Techfounders at Berkeley - Name change from Techfounders to Beta at Berkeley still under consideration by OASIS - Millicent Morris Chaney 9-24-25]
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups
Summary: Our mission is to provide comprehensive support and assistance to students at UC Berkeley who are interested in technology and entrepreneurship.

Name: Beta Corporate Solutions
Description: At Beta Corporate Solutions, we provide our consultants with invaluable experiences by developing their teamwork, communication, and analytical skill sets in real-world consulting projects for our corporate clients. Our mission is to establish a relationship of mutual benefits between students and businesses by providing innovative research and viable solutions. Each year, our student consultants pursue successful careers in management consulting, finance, and technology, at firms like McKinsey, Bain, BCG, Deloitte, Goldman Sachs, JP Morgan, Morgan Stanley, Apple, Facebook, etc. To learn more about how to get involved, please contact Leon Jia at leonjia@berkeley.edu.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our mission is to establish a relationship of mutual benefits between students and businesses. We strive to improve a business' potential by providing innovative research and viable solutions to external clients.

Name: Beta Sigma Kappa
Description: Beta Sigma Kappa (BSK) is an International Optometric Honor Society, which serves more than 2,300 active members worldwide. The mission of BSK is to stimulate scientific achievement, academic excellence, and the ethical practice of optometry; and to promote and provide financial support for worthy research projects relating to vision care and the eyes. Membership in BSK is yearly, and eligibility is based on academic grade point averages. The goal of the Berkeley chapter of Beta Sigma Kappa is to help optometry students achieve academic and clinical success through our tutoring service. In order to provide enough tutors, BSK requires its second-year and third-year active members to complete 2 hours of tutoring to underclassmen per semester. These hours can be fulfilled by tutoring for didactic courses and clinical skills, participating in BSK-sponsored events, or contributing to BSK-sponsored academic resources for students.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Beta Sigma Kappa is an optometric honor society. The goal of the Berkeley chapter is to help optometry students achieve academic and clinical success through our tutoring service.

Name: Beta Theta Pi
Description: The newest fraternity at UC Berkeley, Beta Theta Pi is dedicated to developing men of principle for a principled life. Our brotherhood aids the individual, builds the Fraternity and strengthens the host academic institution through lifelong devotion to intellectual excellence, high standards of moral conduct and responsible citizenship. The Fraternity, founded in 1839 at Miami University (Ohio), has more than 130,000 living members including some 8,000 collegians on 122 campuses in the United States and Canada. Since 1997, Beta Theta Pi has been undergoing a revolutionary transformation ‚Äî back to where it began. With the Men of Principle initiative, Beta gives a new voice to the enduring values of our Fraternity. The Initiative is more than a program; it is a deep inner philosophy that demands integrity of action from every chapter and all members of the Fraternity. Our Mission ‚Äì To develop men of principle for a principled life Our Vision ‚Äì Every member will live Beta Theta Pi‚Äôs values Core Values ‚Äì To build lasting bonds of friendship and brotherhood, Beta calls for: Mutual Assistance ‚Äì Betas believe that men are mutually obligated to help others in the honorable labors and aspirations of life. Intellectual Growth ‚Äì Betas are devoted to continually cultivating their minds, including high standards of academic achievement. Trust - Betas develop absolute faith and confidence in one another by being true to themselves and others. Responsible Conduct - Betas choose to act responsibly, weighing the consequences of their actions on themselves and those around them. Integrity - Betas preserve their character by doing what is morally right and demanding the same from their brothers. Follow Us! Instagram: Betathetapi_Cal Twitter: BetaThetaPi_Cal
Categories: CalGreeks Interfraternity Council (IFC) Fraternities
Summary: Beta Theta Pi is dedicated to developing men of principle for a principled life. We aid the individual and strengthens the University through lifelong devotion to intellectual excellence, high standards of moral conduct and responsible citizenship.

Name: Beyond Academia üíô
Description: Beyond Academia is a grassroots student organization that helps PhD students and postdocs find careers outside of the tenure-track. We offer free seminars, workshops, and annual conferences to help our fellow graduate students learn about rewarding careers where their skills are needed and appreciated. We help to bridge the gap between the between graduate students and postdocs and the career opportunities that exist for them in various fields. Want to join us? If you're a Berkeley graduate student or postdoc, please get in touch: info@beyondacademia.org. We'd love to chat more. Want to attend an event? Sign up for our mailing list at https://beyondacademia.org/
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Beyond Academia is a career education group that exposes UC Berkeley PhD students and postdocs to career options outside of academia. Panels, workshops, and networking events give attendees the opportunity to interact with successful professionals.

Name: Bhagat Puran Singh Health Initiative at Berkeley üíô
Description: Bhagat Puran Singh Health Initiative is a group of wellness advocates devoted to eliminating health and social disparities within underserved and underprivileged immigrant populations by creating spaces of community engagement and providing access to health education for the betterment of the mind, body, and spirit. We work to provide opportunities to engage with each other, volunteer at our free clinics, pursue research and data collection, and work with nurses and doctors. Fill out the general member app below to get involved in BPSHI!! We hope everyone has an equal experience and a platform to voice their opinions. Everyone is welcome to join and apply! General Member Apps: BPSHI General Member 2025-2026 Ig: @ucberkeleybpshi To join our newsletter for frequent updates, please sign up here bit.ly/bpshinewsletter
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Bhagat Puran Singh Health Initiative is devoted to eliminating health and social disparities within underserved and underprivileged populations by creating spaces of community engagement through clinics and providing access to health education.

Name: BIA at Berkeley
Description: BIA at Berkeley is on a mission to co-create benefits with all students at Berkeley. We provide free services and campus information to all incoming students, with a special focus on international students. Our open, free membership welcomes everyone to enjoy discounts at more than 25 local businesses around Berkeley, as well as regular free movies, arts and crafts, culture festival events, and recreational activities.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: BIA at Berkeley is on a mission to co-create benefits with all students at Berkeley. We provide free services and campus information to incoming students. Our free, open membership welcomes everyone to enjoy discounts & to attend recreational activities.

Name: BicyCal üíô
Description: We seek to provide a space where members of this community can learn how to maintain, operate and love their bicycles in an inclusive and friendly space. We offer free access to a variety of bike-specific tools and maintenance education in a positive environment. Sponsored by the ASUC
Categories: Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: BicyCAL is a cooperatively run and student founded organization at UC Berkeley that aims to empower UCB students, faculty and staff to successfully integrate the bicycle into their daily lives.

Name: Big Data at Berkeley
Description: Big Data at Berkeley (BDAB), established in 2019, is one of the largest data science student organizations at UC Berkeley, comprising approximately 50 members across four departments: Bootcamp, Online Course, Projects, and Marketing. These four departments drive forward BDAB's dual initiative of making data science accessible through educational and consulting services. Within the club are also the Internal and External committees, responsible for organizing BDAB's social and professional events. Our Bootcamp department offers a seven-week in-person data science course called Big Data Bootcamp for high school students at UC Berkeley twice a year, during the Fall and Spring semesters. To date, we have taught over a thousand students across the span of 12+ bootcamps. In Spring 2023, our Online Course department launched a free, self-paced data science online course called Data Science Demystified for high school students, making data science more accessible to everyone. The course features 120+ minutes of video tutorials, 12 lesson and assignment notebooks, and 8 modules. It covers an Introduction to Data Science, Python, NumPy, Pandas, Data Visualizations, the Data Science Life Cycle, an Introduction to Machine Learning, Statistics in Data Science, and SQL. Our course is accessible to all via our website at https://bd.berkeley.edu/online_course/intro/. Our Projects department provides data science consulting services to 3-4 paying clients each semester. To date, we have consulted for over 25 companies ranging from startups to Fortune 500 companies across diverse industries. Our previous clients include American Eagle, Ulta Beauty, Tripadvisor, Intuitive Surgical, Applied Materials, Novo Nordisk, Annapurna Labs, Palo Alto Networks, and more! Of course, our educational and consulting data science services would not be truly accessible without our Marketing department. Through strategic advertising, social media, graphic design, and videography, they ensure that the public and our target clients are aware of all BDAB has to offer. In addition, they also host a professional photoshoot and design a variety of club merchandise every semester, exclusive to our members! Furthermore, our External committee provides exclusive professional development opportunities for all club members, from resume and interview workshops to large-scale events such as career fairs, Datathons, alumni career panels, and guest speaker panels directly from the data science industry. There are also many major data science events open to all members of the UC Berkeley community, such as Breaking into Data Science Research, where we invite professionals involved in cutting-edge data science research to talk about their work and offer advice to aspiring data practitioners. Lastly, BDAB is home to a vibrant and social community of members. This is made possible by our Internal committee that organizes fun social events exclusively for our members, such as a weekend retreat, an end-of-semester banquet, cross-club social mixers, and more!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Big Data at Berkeley (BDAB), established in 2019, has a dual purpose to make data science more accessible through educational and consulting services.

Name: Bike Builders of Berkeley
Description: Bike Builders of Berkeley is a club dedicated to all forms of bike engineering. The main focus is the design, fabrication, and testing of bike frames. However, we also welcome research into other bike components such as rims, shifters, pedals, etc. We are a student run organization and we bring our nicest bike to the Sea Otter Bike Festival every year. We also started a collegiate bike building competition at Sea Otter and will continue to compete each year for the forseeable future.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: To build a bike from the ground up as a team. Throughout this process we will explore bike design, fabrication, and assembly.

Name: Bio-Business Initiative
Description: At BBI, we aim to bridge the gap between the fields of biology and business, inspire the next minds of our generation by supporting high school students in the Bay Area through workshops and mentorship, and provide professional and academic support to our members through Haas and LSBE program application support, biotech symposium, resume/LinkedIn workshops, and more! Join one of our committees: finance, operations, or outreach. BBI is looking to recruit eager and dedicated UC Berkeley students who can embody our values: boldness, balance, and integrity.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We are an interdisciplinary, service-oriented organization motivated to link underprivileged high school students in the Bay Area with UC Berkeley students to promote careers in the fields of biology and business.

Name: BioEngineering Association of Students
Description: The BioEngineering Association of STudents. Every UC Berkeley-UCSF Bioengineering PhD student is automatically a member of BEAST. Its purpose is to facilitate student involvement and leadership in areas ranging from social activities to prospective student visit weekends, from running the annual retreat to organizing BESTs (BioEngineering Student Talks). There are several elected positions, but the structure is informal and anyone wishing to volunteer with any activity is welcome.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The Bioengineering Association of Students (BEAST) is the official student organization for the UC Berkeley - UCSF Graduate Program in Bioengineering, facilitating student involvement in the program and leadership opportunities in a variety of positions.

Name: Bioengineering Honor Society
Description: The Bioengineering Honor Society (BioEHS) aims to advance bioengineering within the University of California, Berkeley, and beyond. BioEHS honors and encourages academic achievement among undergraduate bioengineering students at UC Berkeley. It does so through study groups, professional development workshops, community service events, socials, and outreach projects.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Bioengineering Honor Society honors Bioengineering students who have demonstrated exceptional academic talent and abilities in their field, encouraging the advancement and quality of Bioengineering education through professional and academic support.

Name: BioethiCAL
Description: Are you pre-med, pre-health, or pre-biotechnology? Apply to BioethiCAL! Studying ethics allows future doctors, engineers, businesspeople, and researchers to develop a unique critical skill set that will aid them in their future high-stakes professions! About Us: We are UC Berkeley‚Äôs Undergraduate Bioethics and Medical Humanities Society. The discipline of bioethics explores the intersection of biological advancements and their moral implications. We enjoy grappling with tricky ethical questions in our two central committees: Debate and Journal. The interdisciplinary field of bioethics is concerned with the ethics and moral implications of biological and medical procedures, businesses, technologies, and treatments (from genetic engineering to patient accessibility of treatments, and more). We aim to expose students to this critical and often overlooked scientific division through targeted discourse, case studies, debates, and events. Linktree (Spring 2025 Application Found Here): https://linktr.ee/bioethi.cal
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: UC Berkeley‚Äôs Undergraduate Bioethics and Medical Humanities Society. We bring bioethical events, programs, competitions, speakers, case studies, and research to the undergraduate student population.

Name: Biofuels Technology Club
Description: Interested in sustainable fuels? Find your place in BTC! Research team conducts bench top experiments in a lab in the College of Chemistry. Using waste cooking oil from Crossroads Dinning Hall, we determine optimal reaction conditions, test catalysts, pretreatment and purification processes. Design your own experiments, work with a close team, and present biofuel literature to peers! Scale up team's runs a 50 gallon batch reactor in Richmond! We go to this facility most weekends during the semester implementing our engineering designs and creating usable fuel! After fueling in a car for the first time in Spring 2022, we are excited for regular production, improving quality, and getting our fuel into campus vehicles! Plus we have fun on the trips! Outreach and Logistics teams work with campus and local leaders in sustainability to host seminars open to all of campus. The liaise with campus, dinning halls, and various companies working to keep our processes running smooth. This year we are expanding this team to lobby for campus to move to sustainable options in their diesel vehicles. If you are interested in gaining the communication skills that keep organizations running this is the team to join. Finance team raises and maintains our funds. We use our sponsorship package to secure industry sponsors, apply for both campus and industry grants, and host fundraisers such as selling donuts in SF! We are always looking for new ideas for funding our club and welcome anyone interested in finance to this team! In addition to working with your team, BTC hosts many socials! Look forward to a retreat, studying together, getting food after meetings, game nights etc. We also provide resume and interview resources.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We are dedicated to student led campus sustainability. Members convert dining hall waste cooking oil to biodiesel both on the bench top and in off campus batch reactors. We lobby campus for cleaner fuel practices, host sustainability seminars, and more!

Name: Biomedical Engineering Society üíô
Description: The Biomedical Engineering Society student chapter is the largest bioengineering club on campus. We serve as a vibrant community dedicated to professional, academic, and social development in bioengineering. BMES members are students of unique backgrounds, identities, and areas of study. Our club welcomes all students who have an interest in the field. We invite you to get involved by applying to a committee, and engaging with us at our events throughout the school year! For more information, visit bmes.berkeley.edu and make sure to follow us on instagram and facebook @calbmes to stay in the loop about upcoming events.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Biomedical Engineering Society student chapter is the largest bioengineering club on campus. We serve as a vibrant community dedicated to professional, academic, and social development in bioengineering. Visit bmes.berkeley.edu for more information.

Name: Biophysics Club
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Biophysics club will facilitate networking and community building within the biophysics and quantitative biology graduate programs at UC Berkeley by hosting networking, informational, and social events.

Name: Biostatistics Graduate Student Association üíô
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The BSGSA is designed to represent the interests and needs of graduate students in biostatistics.

Name: Biotech @Berkeley üíô
Description: Biotech @Berkeley (B^2) seeks to connect and represent all graduate students from UC Berkeley who are interested in biotechnology. Our group aims to create a student biotech community that serves as a gateway to exploring biotech-focused resources and opportunities at Berkeley. This includes organizing engaging events around education, career exploration, networking, and other opportunities for students to become familiar with biotech-related industry, the public sector/government, and entrepreneurship. We also hope to use our group as a platform for promoting diversity and equity in biotechnology by taking actionable steps to enable and shape our next generation of industry leaders.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Biotech @Berkeley seeks to connect and represent all graduate students from UC Berkeley interested in biotechnology. Our group aims to create a student community and gateway to exploring biotech-focused resources and opportunities at Berkeley.

Name: Black Advocates for Equity in Health üíô
Description: Black Advocates for Equity in Health (BAEH) was founded in 2018 to provide space and resources to support and empower Black students in the School of Public Health. We aim to foster community, create networking opportunities, and provide opportunities to connect with fellow students at SPH across disciplines. BAEH exists to promote health equity and address/dismantle structural anti-blackness on campus and beyond. Our vision is that the UC Berkeley School of Public Health and the field of public health at large are more diverse and representative of Black communities in the United States. We see a future in which Black-identifying individuals are empowered to be leaders in the field of public health and racial/ethnic health disparities are eliminated. The group is comprised of students, faculty and staff.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: Black Advocates for Equity in Health (BAEH) seeks to provide space and resources to support and empower Black students in the School of Public Health. BAEH exists to promote health equity and respond to structural anti-blackness on campus and beyond.

Name: Black Business Student Association
Description: The Black Business Students Association was established in 1999 and is committed to enriching the academic, professional, and social experience of Haas students from and interested in the African Diaspora. Our mission is to foster professional and leadership development, academic excellence, and community involvement.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: The mission of BBSA is to uplift and empower the Black community at Haas.

Name: Black Campus Ministries at Berkeley
Description: BCM (Black Campus Ministries) is a ministry of Intervarsity Christian Fellowship, an evangelical campus mission serving students and faculty on college and university campuses nationwide. Our vision is to see students and faculty transformed, campuses renewed and world changers developed. See more of our events on our Instagram page.
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: Black Campus Ministries (BCM) aims to provide a space for black students on campus to experience belonging in cultivation their relationship with Jesus Christ!

Name: Black Engineering and Science Students Association
Description: ‚ÄãThe Black Engineering and Science Student Association, also known as BESSA, is the University of California, Berkeley chapter for our parent organization the National Society of Black Engineers (NSBE). We are a student run, non-profit organization that thrives on its members support, success, and commitment. We diligently work to provide academic and social support not only to our engineering and science community but to the entire Black community. In addition, we happily coordinate programs during the year to integrate our greater Bay Area community. Through these events, we are able to form and foster relationships that bridge the gap between the prestigious university and our close-but-distant community. This organization is a strong believer in academic excellence, personal growth, and a commitment to minority communities in and out of the classroom. Our Objectives: Retain, support, and increase the number of Black students within the College of Engineering (COE) as well as other science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) fields. Introduce and develop the professional skills needed to succeed in the professional field. Cultivate a network between students, professionals, and companies. Give our greater community access to our resources for support in areas that are lacking.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: To increase the number of culturally responsible Black engineers and scientists who excel academically, succeed professionally, and positively impact the community.

Name: Black Graduate Engineering and Science Students üíô
Description: The Black Graduate Engineering and Science Students Society is an academic and social support network that targets black graduate students and allies of black students within the University of California at Berkeley‚Äôs STEM disciplines. Through our programming, we help ensure that black graduate students can successfully contribute to both scientific research and the college‚Äôs learning environment.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: BGESS is a graduate organization that strives to improve the graduate experience of African American students as well other minority groups at UC Berkeley. This is done through a collaborative effort from the students, staff, industry, and community.

Name: Black Graduate Student Association
Description: The Black Graduate Student Association primarily seeks to build community amongst incoming and continuing graduate students of African descent across the African diaspora. We also seek to reach out and support other members of the Black community on the UC Berkeley campus and in the East Bay. BGSA's creation was sparked by graduate students' firm belief in the power of having an organized and active space for Black graduate students to know each other, support each other, and address various concerns of the Black community both inside and outside of the University. We also seek to build alliances and partnerships with other organizations across campus.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: BGSA was founded in the fall of 2004 by graduate students of African descent from across various disciplines at the University of California, Berkeley.

Name: Black Pre-Law Association at Berkeley üíô
Description: The Black Pre-Law Association at Berkeley believes that the catalyst to more representation of the Black Community, among other minorities and disenfranchised peoples, in the legal sphere is access to more educational and legal resources. We believe in promoting diversity of thought, space, and individuals and in addressing key legal issues (mass incarceration, housing crisis, sexual assault, wealth inequality, immigration, etc.) and connecting students with real legal actors, we create an outlet for potential lawyers to thrive.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: We aim to bridge the gap between the undergraduate pursuit of law & legal learning opportunities for black & underrepresented students by providing an infrastructure of skills, resources, and networks in order to cultivate professionalism & leadership.

Name: Black Recruitment and Retention Center
