Description: Our ‚ÄãMission:We seek to serve our community by recognizing the struggle of Black students pursuing higher education, assessing their needs, and providing resources that will support in their academic, professional, and personal development. ‚ÄãWe hold ourselves accountable for: The active recruitment of prospective Black students from diverse academic backgrounds Maintaining a strong connection with our communities, while retaining ourselves academically and socially Advocating for institutional support and resources for Black students Planning and executing events to academically and socially retain Black students Upholding the tenets of intersectionality in our work
Categories: RRC - Recruitment & Retention Center, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our mission is to recruit and retain Black students at the University of California, Berkeley.

Name: Black Student Athlete Community of Berkeley (BSAC)
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: In BSAC, we seek to equip and empower black student-athletes with the resources, skills, and community necessary to be successful in all facets of life.

Name: Black Student Union
Description: The University of California, Berkeley Black Student Union is a student-led organization that cultivates an intersectional framework for all levels of Black consciousness. We are here to foster Black liberation and the progression of the Afrikan diaspora through political activism, community building, and leadership development. To be added to our list serve or if you are interested in interning send an email chair.bsu@gmail.com
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, ABSA - Budgeted over $7500 Organizations, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: The Black Student Union at UC Berkeley serves as the unifying, political body for Black organizations and the Black student body on campus. For any questions, please contact Moorea Adams at chair.calbsu@gmail.com.

Name: Black Students in Health Association üíô
Description: BSHA serves to provide guidance to Black students interested in the health sciences, medical education, and allied health fields; facilitates advising and special counseling of students interested in health professions and allied fields; provides students with career-advancing opportunities; provides a forum for the dissemination of information relevant to the education of students interested in health fields; and provides students with opportunities to support the Black community in a health-related manner.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: Provide guidance and outreach to Black and underrepresented minority students interested in the health sciences, medical education, and allied health fields.

Name: Blockchain at Berkeley (formerly Bitcoin Association of Berkeley)
Description: Blockchain at Berkeley (B@B) is Berkeley‚Äôs hub for blockchain innovation. We specialize in educating the community, facilitating innovative projects and discussions, and helping companies benefit from blockchain technology by identifying use cases, building out prototypes, and integrating solutions. Blockchain at Berkeley (B@B) may hold educational events; disseminate educational materials to members of the campus and community; provide support for like-minded organizations; bring in outside speakers; host hackathons; host networking events. Blockchain technology is a powerful platform that touches on a large number of different areas of interest, from computer science to economics to social justice.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: To educate and connect members of the Berkeley community who share an interest in blockchain technologies. To support and foster cryptocurrency-related projects and innovation.

Name: Blood Pressure Project üíô
Description: The Blood Pressure Project (BPP) is a UC Berkeley student organization founded in Fall 2013. We are an organization committed to providing free blood pressure screenings and cardiovascular education to Berkeley‚Äôs underserved communities in order to improve and create a healthy, sustainable society. We are partnered with Heart 2 Heart, a collaboration between the City of Berkeley‚Äôs Public Health Department and Lifelong Medical Care. We also work with organizations such as Dorothy Day House and the North Berkeley Senior Center. Throughout the semester we invite health professionals from the community to speak at our general meetings. Check out our website here, or follow us on Instagram at @bloodpressureproject for the most up-to-date information on upcoming meetings, volunteering opportunities, and workshops!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: BPP's purpose is to: (1) Provide underserved communities regular and consistent blood pressure screenings (2) Promote health education (3) Increase community involvement in healthy habits (4) Utilize the campus to promote our cause

Name: Blue and Gold Yearbook
Description: Mission: Our mission is to truthfully encapsulate the current, unique Berkeley identity ‚Äî its culture, events, and lifestyle ‚Äî as students, for the students. The Blue & Gold Yearbook is the official yearbook for UC Berkeley. Published since 1875, the yearbook provides coverage of events, issues, and trends within the Berkeley community. As a historical record, the yearbook includes graduating seniors‚Äô portraits and majors, as well as campus facts, figures, and people. The Blue & Gold Yearbook staff is composed of over 50 individuals who produce, market, and distribute the yearbook. Members are split across 5 teams: Copy, Design, Photo, Marketing, and Tech. Financially self-sufficient, the organization earns its revenue without aid of grants or outside funding. The Associated Students of the University of California (ASUC) formally sponsors the organization and provides it with office space. We recruit at the beginning of every semester, so keep an eye out on our social media for more information about recruitment and our activities! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1YQoRvijY_c
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, OASIS Sponsored Organization, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated MLK Space
Summary: The Blue & Gold Yearbook is UC Berkeley's official yearbook. Published since 1875, we provide coverage of events, issues, and trends within the Berkeley community and include graduating seniors‚Äô portraits.

Name: Blueprint, Technology for Nonprofits
Description: Blueprint strives to make technology accessible and useful for those who create communities and promote public welfare. In practice, we're a team of students that develops software pro bono for nonprofits and promotes technology for social good. Each year, teams of 1 project lead, 1 designer, and 4 developers work with non-profit organizations on projects to help them better serve their communities.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We are a community of students who strive to use their skills to support nonprofits by making beautiful engineering accessible. We build and design software solutions for nonprofits and promote technology for social good.

Name: BMO Student Organization Grant Program
Description: Believe it or not, about $9 out of every $10 you deposit into the bank is sent out to finance other programs and initiatives. At BMO, we know money deposited in a bank has the power to finance positive change. That's why we take everyday action to support activities that help protect the planet, improve people‚Äôs lives, and strengthen communities. Please visit the branch in the ASUC Student Union, located on the lower level of MLK Hall. BMO Grant Program The BMO Student Organization Grant Program, administered by OASIS, is a grant program funded by BMO. All registered student organizations (RSOs) and recognized CalGreeks fraternities and sororities can apply for the BMO Student Organization Grant Program. The program provides funds for events, activities, projects, or programs that advance one of the Bank‚Äôs interest areas: Sustainability Financial Literacy Women‚Äôs Empowerment To be eligible, events, activities, projects, or programs must happen before May 8, 2026. No retroactive funding will be provided. HOW TO APPLY Fill out the application form. The application deadline is September 26, 2025. Applications will be reviewed by campus staff and BMO. BMO will determine what student organizations to fund and how much to fund them. Applicants will be notified of the award and amount in October.
Categories: Admin, Campus Departments
Summary: The BMO Student Organization Grant Program provides funding for student-led initiatives (events, activities, projects, or programs) to registered student organizations focused on women's empowerment, sustainability, & financial literacy.

Name: Board Games at Berkeley üíô
Description: We are a social club that hosts one game night a week (Saturdays!) and has thriving D&D and Magic the Gathering communities! All game nights are completely free, and there are no commitment or membership requirements for the club. For up-to-date info on our game nights and events, please use the link below for our BGB discord! NB: We have not had the resources to maintain the old newsletter. If you are still subscribed, it should return eventually, but the most up-to-date info can be found on our discord. http://bit.ly/BGBEmail Board Games at Berkeley (discord) Follow our discord for when game nights occur, or to organize meetups with other board game enthusiasts! Magic: The Gathering (discord) Join us for our online meetups where we play on Magic: The Gathering Arena Thriving EDH community with online and in-person play! Deck-building challenges and casual competition! New to Magic or need help creating your deck? We can help you get started! Dungeons and Dragons (discord) Join us for our one-shot game nights to learn the basics or for a quick game Join a campaign regardless of your skill level Become a Dungeon Master and start your own campaign -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- One semester the two club founders independently came up with the idea to start a board game club. Each went through the process of starting a club without knowing the other existed. Only after the advisor to both clubs noticed the two applications did Board Games at Berkeley coalesce into a single organization that exists to this day!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: A social club where students can meet and make new friends playing board, card, and role-playing games. Whether you're a board game veteran or haven't even touched a game before, be sure to come by and play some board games, MTG, or Dungeons and Dragons!

Name: Board of Activities for Energy, Civil Infrastructure, and Climate (BAECIC)
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: BAECIC aims to serve as a hub for students in CEE ECIC to find professional, academic, and social opportunities and resources during their time at Berkeley and in the professional world.

Name: Board of Advocates
Description: The Board of Advocate‚Äôs general membership includes over 90 students who participate in both regional and national competitions in four main areas: Alternative Dispute Resolution, Trial Advocacy, Appellate Advocacy, and Technology & Intellectual Property. Competition for a place on these teams is fierce during the Board‚Äôs yearly try-out process, with multiple students vying for each spot. Teams receive coaching from professors, Executive Board Members, alumni, and fellow students. The Board also places a strong emphasis on training fellow students and future members through internal competitions, offering scholarship money and the opportunity to be heard by federal judges in mock argument. The Board of Advocates provides further opportunities for students to hone their advocacy skills, hosting multiple skills workshops throughout the year. The Board recognizes the importance of diversity in the legal profession. The Board acknowledges the systemic exclusion of marginalized groups, especially people of color, from legal advocacy spaces and from the legal community at large. Each of the Board's branches will maintain inclusive policies for recruitment and admission that increase diversity within the teams and the broader legal advocacy community. All Board members commit to valuing diverse perspectives, experiences, and opinions in all areas of their work. The Board and its branches commit to leveraging their power to dismantle systems of oppression in all forms and make legal advocacy inclusive for everyone.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Board of Advocates consists of the Alternative Dispute Resolution, Appellate, and Mock Trial teams of U.C. Berkeley School of Law. BOA has won competition awards at multiple levels and consistently outperforms other top-ten law schools.

Name: Bone Health Initiative üíô
Description: The Bone Health Initiative (BHI) provides clear, accessible education and resources to help students and local communities understand bone health and bone disease. Our mission is to share timely, evidence-based information that supports the development and maintenance of strong bones, while promoting prevention, early detection, and effective treatment of bone diseases. Through projects with elementary and high school students, UC Berkeley peers, parents, and seniors, we strengthen community outreach and awareness across all ages. üì© Contact us at bonehealthinitiative@gmail.com to learn more or get involved.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Bone Health Initiative (BHI) provides education, resources, and tools to help students and the local communities understand bone disease (e.g. osteoporosis, arthritis) and bone health. This includes applications to sports medicine, nutrition, and more!

Name: Bootleg Comedy
Description: Ever dreamed of being on Saturday Night Live? Well, you‚Äôve come to the right place! Established in 2017, Bootleg Sketch Comedy writes, produces, and performs original comedy sketches - through both live shows and short film productions. As a creative and collaborative ensemble, we generate skits on a weekly basis using improv, lesson plans, and our own inspiration to tackle current events, relatable situations, and comedic tropes. Every semester, we have two weekend shows and produce 2-3 original short films!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Bootleg Sketch Comedy is a live sketch comedy ensemble. We write, produce, and act out our own sketches in a manner similar to that done at The Second City and UCB Theater.

Name: Boricuas at Berkeley üíô
Description: As a student organization, our mission is: 1. To create a space for UC Berkeley students (undergraduate and graduate) from Puerto Rico to connect and share academic, professional and personal experiences in order to promote a spirit of community. 2. To provide a means for fostering dialogue on issues concerning Puerto Rico, such as our status as minorities in the United States, our history, social justice, food sovereignty, politics, science, amongst others. 3. To create a space for the creative expression of Puerto Rican culture, customs and traditions including art, music, literature, amongst others. 4. To create an inclusive environment in which Puerto Rican students can interact with students of other nationalities and share our respective cultures.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our purpose is to create a space for students from Puerto Rico to connect and share academic, professional, and personal experiences. We also promote an inclusive environment for students from other nationalities in order to foster a spirit of community.

Name: Botany at Berkeley
Description: Botany at Berkeley is a club for all plant enthusiasts and those interested in learning about Botany
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Botany at Berkeley brings together plant enthusiasts from all backgrounds connect with each other to learn more about plants by doing hands on activities and going on excursions.

Name: Brain Exercise Initiative at Berkeley üíô
Description: We are a 501 C3 nonprofit organization that is completely student-run. We work with the Alzheimer's Services of the East Bay to do simple brain exercises with people with Alzheimer's, consisting of writing, math, and trivia questions. Everything we do is based on the research of the Japanese scientist Ryuta Kawashima from Tokyo University. He‚Äôs been researching the brain for the entirety of his career and has found that simple brain exercises done with Alzheimer‚Äôs patients for just 30 minutes a day, five days a week, can really improve cognitive function and memory by activating the prefrontal cortex. We are operating through Zoom and in person in collaboration with senior homes around the UC Berkeley campus (both Southside and Northside) this year to do brain exercises and build friendships with community members to promote brain health and sustained independence. Application form for the Fall 2024 semester is linked here Link to official BEI website: brainexerciseinitiative.com Supporting research: 1.https://www.tohoku.ac.jp/en/research/research_highlights/research_highlight_22.html 2. https://academic.oup.com/biomedgerontology/article/60/3/380/630607.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that uses simple math, writing and reading aloud exercises as an intervention to improve cognitive function in those with Alzheimer's Disease while encouraging intergenerational collaboration.

Name: BrainTrust
Description: Through the facilitation of peer support group meetings, a one-on-one buddy volunteer program, and lectures by physicians and researchers, BrainTrust seeks to create a powerful social support network for individuals with brain injury.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Through the facilitation of peer support group meetings, a one-on-one buddy volunteer program, and lectures by physicians and researchers, BrainTrust seeks to create a powerful social support network for individuals with brain injury.

Name: Brazilian Student Association at Berkeley
Description: BRASA strives to offer abundant resources and dedicated support for current and aspiring students of Berkeley. To foster the Brazilian community at Berkeley, we organize various activities envisioning the promotion of cultural and knowledge exchanges. Our mission is to cultivate connections among the Brazilian students and other members of the community interested in being involved with our culture. To achieve this goal our organization promotes panels, seminars, congresses on political, economic, cultural and social issues in vogue in Brazil, as well as promoting professional development to its members by serving as a bridge to Latin American Companies; People from all nationalities and backgrounds are welcome to participate in our events and join our organization!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: The primary purpose of the Brazilian Student Association at Berkeley is to establish a prolific and long-lasting relationship between UC Berkeley and the Brazilian Community.

Name: Brick by Brick at Berkeley üíô
Description: Brick by Brick at Berkeley is the first official Lego club on campus! We are a growing community of students passionate about Lego and its many applications for creativity, entertainment, education, and much more. We have weekly meetings where we discuss Lego and plan out our future projects. Our ultimate goal is to share the fun and power of Lego with as many people as we can! As a club, we're currently working on multiple main projects:- Educational outreach program for elementary/middle school students- Berkeley-related Lego MOC design/creation- Lego informational presentations- Campus mental health Lego-building sessions- Anything else you suggest!Membership is completely open to anybody interested in joining, and we encourage everyone interested to check out our Linktree for our all important links (https://linktr.ee/bbbatberkeley). If you have any interest in Lego, have ideas you want to try out, or just want to chat, come join us! Brick on!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We harness the creative and educational power of Lego to create a community of enthusiastic students, expand campus mental health opportunities, and build a positive social impact through educational outreach to underprivileged youth communities.

Name: Bridge Club üíô
Description: About The Bridge Club at Berkeley welcomes all students (undergraduate and graduate), faculty, and staff who are interested in the game of bridge. Bridge is a fun and strategic game for four players (two teams of two) using a standard deck of playing cards. We are a teaching club and everyone is welcome, even if you‚Äôve never played bridge before. Our meetings are casual and focus on playing the game socially. We also play in club games and tournaments in the Bay area, and compete in national tournaments against other college bridge clubs. During fall and spring semesters, our weekly casual games on campus (Sunday 1-4pm) focus on teaching, learning, and informal play. We compete in local club games and local and national tournaments, and are several-time Collegiate Bridge Bowl champions.
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Bridge Club at Berkeley welcomes all students, faculty, and staff who are interested in the game of bridge. Bridge is a fun and strategic game for four players (two teams of two) using a standard deck of playing cards.

Name: bridges Multicultural Resource Center
Description: The bridges Multicultural Resource Center at the University of California, Berkeley was established when five student-run and student-initiated organizations came together to form a collective to meet the needs of underrepresented students of color after the passing of Proposition 209 in 1996. We strive to recruit underrepresented students of color into higher education at all levels, and are committed to providing resources to retain these students. ‚ÄãThrough multicultural collaboration, the bridges Multicultural Resource Center seeks to: -Empower underrepresented students of color to pursue opportunities for post-secondary education -Provide support for newly admitted first year, transfer, as well as continuing and re-entry students of color -Increase cross-cultural dialogue and solidarity, cultural awareness, and political mobilization -Acquire the financial, institutional, and physical resources to facilitate the work of member organizations If you'd like to learn more and connect, visit our Instagram at http://www.instagram.com/bridgesmrc
Categories: RRC - Recruitment & Retention Center, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Welcome to bridges Multicultural Resource Center! bridges is a coalition of seven student-initiated and student-run Recruitment and Retention Centers (RRCs) at the University of California, Berkeley.

Name: BridgeUSA at Berkeley üíô
Description: The United States‚Äô political climate needs drastic change. Politics has been rendered easy and dualistic, making blind-partisanship not only permissible, but the principal mode of political practice. It has become acceptable to immerse oneself in echo-chambers of like-mindedness, to label and blindly dismiss ideological opposites, and to violently rebuke instead of constructively disagreeing. There is no productive way forward so long as this persists. BridgeUSA wants to move the conversation forward, by allowing it to happen in the home of academic progress and innovation; the college campus. If we wish to create a better national sphere of politics, we need to start by creating better collegiate political spheres open to BridgeUSA‚Äôs guiding principles of responsible discourse, true diversity of ideas, and the creation of listening spaces. Our chapter will be at the forefront of this movement to fix national governance, by starting in the spaces where they learn, live, and grow into tomorrow‚Äôs leaders. We are recruiting for the fall semester and are excited to meet you! Please don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: BridgeUSA believes that good governance starts with constructive political discussion. Our organization works to foster spaces wherein a diverse range of ideas can engage one another through the practice of responsible discourse.

Name: Brighter Smiles Initiative
Description: With our mission to provide oral health supplies to underserved communities, Brighter Smiles Initiative aims to bridge disparities in oral healthcare across underserved communities in the Bay Area. Brighter Smiles Initiative (BSI) is a nonprofit organization founded by Rachael and Diba, two passionate pre-dental students from UC Berkeley. Committed to improving oral health equity, BSI aims to address disparities in dental care by providing essential oral health supplies to underserved communities. Our mission is to bring brighter, healthier smiles to those who need it most. Starting Spring 2025, BSI will also become an official club at UC Berkeley, broadening our impact and fostering a greater community of student volunteers dedicated to making a positive change. We‚Äôre here to help bring brighter smiles and better oral health to everyone. Therefore, if you, or a community you know, need these supplies, please reach out to us. Also, you can support our philanthropic efforts by donating to us in order to support our care packages filled with toothbrushes, toothpaste, mouthwash, and floss that we deliver to communities in need. With your help, we can continue to enhance the quality of life for countless individuals through better oral health. If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about our organization, check out our website at https://brightersmilesinitiative.com/. For updates and more information, you can also check out our Instagram page @brightersmilesinitiative. Together we can create healthier, ‚ÄúBrighter Smiles!‚Äù
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We are a philanthropic non-profit organization aimed at making a meaningful difference in the lives of underserved communities. Our mission is to provide access to oral health supplies to foster healthier and more confident smiles as pre-dental students.

Name: Brown Issues üíô
Description: Brown Issues focuses on organizing the next generation of Brown leaders. This can only be accomplished through civic engagement, social and emotional health support, and narrative change. Brown Issues understands that certain narratives about Brown folks continue to negatively impact our communities; therefore, we challenge the dominant discourse that erodes our communities. Thus, increasing the focus on community issues rather than mundane rhetoric that continue to divide and affect marginalized communities.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: To cultivate the next generation of Brown Leaders through civic engagement, community support, narrative change, and political awareness.

Name: BUILD Literacy Program
Description: BUILD which stands for Berkeley United in Literacy Development is one of the largest reading programs in the East Bay, with 215 UC Berkeley student mentors providing one-to-one literacy support to 850 youth at 17 locations in Oakland and Berkeley. Each mentor is matched with 3 children with whom they work individually in 30-45 minute after-school sessions twice a week. Mentors work with the same children for at least one semester, and sometimes for years. In addition, all mentors attend an orientation, 3 trainings per semester, and weekly meetings with their mentor team. BUILD runs in fall, spring, and summer.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: BUILD is one of the largest reading programs in the East Bay, with Cal student mentor teams providing one-to-one literacy support at 18 after school locations in Oakland and Berkeley.

Name: Burmese Students Association at Berkeley
Description: Burmese Association at Berkeley (BURSA) is dedicated to showcasing Burma's culture and traditions at UC Berkeley and serves as a support network for students from Burma, Burma-affiliated, and general student body interested in Burmese culture and topics. (Formerly known as Burma Association at Berkeley)
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Burmese Association at Berkeley (BURSA) is dedicated to showcasing Burma's culture and traditions at UC Berkeley and serves as a support network for students from Burma, Burma-affiliated, and general student body interested in Burmese culture and topics.

Name: Business and Film Association
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: BAFA is a premier consulting and film club that empowers students through collaboration, growth, and career development. By uniting strengths from consulting and film, BAFA cultivates versatile students ready to excel in creative and professional fields.

Name: Business Careers in Entertainment Club
Description: The Business Careers in Entertainment Club (BCEC) is a UC Berkeley Haas School of Business and ASUC‚Äìsponsored, student-run organization with 150+ active members. Founded in 2008, BCEC connects students to the entertainment and media industries by delivering industry-focused solutions and cultivating professional development, community, and mentorship. We reflect 11 sectors of the entertainment industry‚ÄîMusic, Film, Media, Digital Marketing, Fashion, Video Games, Sports, Beauty, Television, Technology, and General Membership‚Äîproviding members with hands-on experience and a broad understanding of the field. Our mission is to empower undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral students of all majors with the skills, networks, and experiences necessary to pursue careers across the creative and business sides of entertainment. Through consulting projects, speaker events, workshops, and networking opportunities, BCEC equips students to secure internships, jobs, and meaningful connections with industry leaders. Whether you aspire to shape creative strategy, drive business development, or simply find a community of passionate peers, BCEC is dedicated to preparing the next generation of leaders in media and entertainment.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: At BCEC, we empower students to break into media and entertainment through consulting projects, real-world experience, and industry connections across 11 sectors of the creative and business world. Learn more at calbcec.com.

Name: Business Review at Berkeley
Description: So the legend goes, one fateful winter break, our founders were fed up with the business bro-culture into which they had become inculcated. They wanted to create a new model for intellectual-professional organizations on campus where students from all majors and backgrounds are encouraged to bring their best ideas about business, finance, economics and community without politics or peer pressure. Since then, BRB has strived to be the thought leader in business and financial literacy on campus. We are a student-led organization that publishes articles, interviews, and videos for people interested in business and finance-related content. Through its partnerships with other on-campus organizations and faculty, we seek to simplify the Berkeley business landscape while preparing its members with the technical expertise and writing skills that are demanded for their futures in finance and journalism. Want to learn more about Business Review at Berkeley? Check out our instagram (@businessreviewberkeley) for more recruitment information! We look forward to welcoming new members soon!
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: BRB aims to be the thought leader in business and financial literacy on campus by publishing articles about the investment landscape, global economics, financial literacy, updates in technology and the Berkeley business community.

Name: Cal Actuarial League üíô
Description: Founded in February 1998, The CALIFORNIA ACTUARIAL LEAGUE aims to‚Ä¶ Inform interested students of career paths available to actuaries and provide members with an ongoing opportunity to interact with companies seeking young actuaries Serve as a professional and social network of persons with experience and/or interest in pursuing a career as a pension actuary, casualty actuary, consulting actuary, or other related designation Serve as a contact for private and public organizations interested in recruiting for full-time positions, providing summer or co-op internship opportunities, giving corporate information sessions, offering scholarships for actuarial students, facilitating exam preparation courses to help prepare CAL members for professional actuarial examinations given by the Society of Actuaries (SOA) and the Casualty Actuary Society (CAS) Advise members and non-members of appropriate agencies and resources that can answer questions or provide direction in the pursuit of one‚Äôs actuarial career Have agencies permanently associate CAL members with genuine interest and determination in actuarial careers
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Cal Actuarial League provides resources to students aspiring to be actuaries, including company presentations, exam preparation DeCals, exam manuals for renting, an annual Actuarial Career Fair, Excel workshops, and a bi-annual Actuarial Case Competition

Name: Cal American Civil Liberties Union üíô
Description: Cal ACLU is a collegiate chapter of the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU). The ACLU's stated mission is to defend and preserve the individual rights and liberties guaranteed by the Constitution and laws of the United States. As a nonpartisan organization, the ACLU is also the nation's largest non-profit law firm and one of the leading activist organizations. Some of the ACLU's most famous legal battles include Japanese-American internment during WWII, the desegregation struggle, women's reproductive rights, and numerous free speech issues. As CalACLU, our work follows and complements that of the overarching ACLU. We work to educate and advocate for students and local communities regarding current events, legislation, and major issues. We remain in close contact with the ACLU of Northern California, as well as the Berkeley/North East Bay Chapter of the ACLU. We host panels and workshops, rallies and events, and aim to advocate for civil liberties through our work. CalACLU was re-established in Spring 2017 (Formerly known as Berkeley ACLU) Follow us on Instagram @calaclu
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Cal ACLU is a collegiate chapter of the American Civil Liberties Union. The ACLU advocates for individual rights and liberties through litigation and organizing. We, as a campus chapter, focus on education and advocacy under the umbrella of the ACLU.

Name: Cal Animage Alpha
Description: Cal Animage Alpha is UC Berkeley's anime club, founded all the way back in 1989! Check our discord server and facebook page for information on our recurring events, which are open to the public! We hold weekly Game Nights and Cosplay and Anime Art socials/workshops, in addition to weekly dinner socials and weekend events!We make magazines and video content! To stay up to date on everything CAA-related, check us out at cal.moe.
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Cal Animage Alpha is UC Berkeley's anime club. Every Wednesday we hold showings of currently airing anime and every Thursday we have game nights, where members come together to socialize. For more details, please see our website at calanime.org.

Name: Cal Archery
Description: Cal Archery is a student-run Cal Sport Club that provides an opportunity for the UC Berkeley community to experience archery as a recreational and competitive sport. People of all ages and skill levels are welcome. We host Beginner Sessions within the first few weeks of each semester; email our team captains at archery.captains@gmail.com for more information on dates and signups! Please visit our website at archery.berkeley.edu and follow our Instagram account here for club information, events, and practice times. You can also contact our Club President at california.archery@gmail.com with any questions. Sign up for our newsletter to stay up to date! We hope to see you on the field. Go Bears! NOTE: Our roster is not processed through CalLink; however, we do respond to inquiries over email! Please DO NOT send us roster requests on this website, as we will not be able to accept them.
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: Cal Archery is a student-run Cal Sport Club that provides an opportunity for the UC Berkeley community to experience archery as a recreational and competitive sport. The club provides open practices to members as well as team practices.

Name: Cal Ballroom
Description: We are UC Berkeley‚Äôs one and only competitive International Ballroom Dance Team and the largest team on the West Coast. We offer Cal Students high quality dance instruction through our professional coaches and attend competitions throughout the state and nation. Our team members have both placed and won in national competitions on the East Coast. Ballroom dancing is a partner-style dance which has risen in popularity across the world, especially in European countries. In International Ballroom there are 2 main styles of dancing called Standard and Latin, both with 5 types of dances. Find more information about us at ballroom.berkeley.edu! You can also email the president at president.calballroom@gmail.com. Feel free to get in touch with any questions!
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: Cal Ballroom is one of the largest competitive ballroom teams on the West Coast. Our aim is to teach ballroom dancing to Cal students and provide a community for students.

Name: Cal Berkeley Democrats üíô
Description: The Cal Berkeley Democrats was founded in 1960 and is the official arm of the Democratic Party at the University of California, Berkeley. We have a strong tradition of being involved in Democratic politics at the local, state, and federal levels‚Äîour members have worked on city council races, presidential campaigns, and everything in between. We have the largest active membership of chapters among the California College Democrats. We are also one of the most active chapters of the California Young Democrats. In addition to working to get Democratic officials elected, our annual events include the California Democratic Party Convention, various community service projects, partaking in debates on-campus, and our annual banquet. The Cal Berkeley Democrats are committed to making the goals of the Democratic Party realities; these include but are not limited to ‚Äì affordable higher education, good jobs with good pay, responsible environmental use, and affordable health care for every American. For more information about our club, including how you can get involved, please visit our website at www.caldems.com.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Cal Berkeley Democrats was founded in 1960 and is the official arm of the Democratic Party at the University of California, Berkeley.

Name: Cal Bhangra (formerly Golden Bear Competitive Bhangra)
Description: We are a group of 40+ students who are all extremely passionate about Bhangra. We compete in Bhangra competitions all over the nation throughout the school year, perform at various on-campus events, and also take part in several off-campus performances. We're always looking to grow our family and are excited about any opportunity to share our love for Bhangra. Check out our Instagram, Facebook, or Tik Tok for some awesome videos!
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The purpose of Cal Bhangra is to promote awareness of the Punjabi Culture through the expression of traditional, Punjabi folk dance.

Name: Cal Boxing
Description: IF INTERESTED, PLEASE FILL OUT THIS FORM Cal Boxing welcomes student-athletes with all levels of experience to reach their full potential as boxers. We compete in intercollegiate boxing events sanctioned by USA Boxing. For more information check out our website or Instagram page linked below! If you have questions - email: calboxingclub@gmail.com website:calboxing.weebly.com instagram: @calboxingteam
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: Cal Boxing welcomes student athletes with all levels of experience to reach their full potential as boxers. We compete in intercollegiate boxing events sanctioned by USA Boxing.

Name: Cal Christian Fellowship üíô
Description: Cal Christian Fellowship (IV-CCF) is a multi-ethnic community of students seeking to learn more about Jesus and how He's relevant to our lives. We are part of the InterVarsity Christian Fellowship at Cal. We meet regularly for weekly small group bible studies and large group fellowship meetings to grow deeper in our faith, stronger as a community, and wider in our impact.Our Vision: To be a community of students transformed by the whole Gospel to love God, the campus, and the world. Cal Christian Fellowship (CCF) is part of InterVarsity Christian Fellowship, which consists of four sister fellowships:International Student Ministry (ISM), Black Campus Ministries (BCM), Cal Christian Fellowship (CCF), and LaFe. Together we seek to discover God's heart in an authentic community. IV's Vision:To see students and faculty transformed,campuses renewed,and world changers developed.
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are a multiethnic Christian fellowship and one of the four sister fellowships (CCF, ISM, BCM and La Fe) of InterVarsity at Cal ‚Äî Together we seek to discover God's heart in an authentic community.

Name: Cal Club Baseball
Description: For more info see - https://recsports.berkeley.edu/programs-events/sport-clubs/club-baseball/
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: Cal Club Baseball is a great opportunity for students seeking to play baseball at the intercollegiate level. The team competes with other collegiate clubs in the state and across the West Coast.

Name: Cal Club Golf
Description: The Cal Club Golf Team brings together talented golfers who want to play competitively in college while balancing the academic rigors of UC Berkeley. Composed of undergraduate and graduate students across a wide range of majors, the team allows for a fun environment built around a love for the game. They compete during Fall and Spring in the Pacific region of the National Collegiate Club Golf Association. Through weekly practices at Berkeley Country Club and multiple 36 hole tournaments per semester, the Cal Club Golf team has risen into the top 30 clubs in the country. In the fall of 2019, Cal Club Golf had the lowest unadjusted scoring average in the nation. All interested golfers are encouraged to join. For more information about the team, please visit our Instagram, Berkeley Recreational Sports page, our National Collegiate Club Golf Association page, or our Facebook page.
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: The Cal Club Golf Team brings together talented golfers who want to play competitively in college. Composed of undergraduate and graduate students, the team allows for a fun environment built around a love for the game.

Name: Cal Club Softball
Description: Cal Club Softball is a student-run team of women who bring competitiveness, communication, and passion both on and off the field. Our goal is to keep playing the sport we love at a high level while never losing sight of the fun that comes with the game. We compete in the NCSA Division I Central Pacific Conference against UC Santa Cruz, UC Davis, UC Merced, and Sacramento State. While our main conference tournaments take place in the spring, we stay active year-round with fall scrimmages, weekly practices, and plenty of team bonding events!
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: Cal Club Softball provides a supportive, competitive environment where students can play fastpitch softball with both passion and joy. Our team values a balance of competition, fun, and lasting connections as an intercollegiate athletics organization.

Name: Cal Club Tennis
Description: Cal Club Tennis is a co-ed, competitive, club tennis team. In the fall season, we usually travel locally and play against other schools in the Bay Area, and in the spring we compete in Arizona and Nationals! We are the fourteen time defending Northern California Sectionals champions and back-to-back national champions. We will be tabling at Calapalooza on: - Wednesday, Sept 2 from 4-6PM PDT (https://berkeley.zoom.us/j/94512229967) - Thursday, Sept 3 from 4-6PM PDT (https://berkeley.zoom.us/j/91404582883) Interested in learning more or joining the team? Sign up for our mailing list here! Visit our website to find our roster, news, schedule, contact, FAQ, and more. For more information please visit: https://recsports.berkeley.edu/programs-events/sport-clubs/club-tennis/
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: Cal Club Tennis is a student-run organization that practices and competes during the school year. The club plays in USTA Tennis On Campus Tournaments and we use World Team Tennis rules in match play, which emphasizes both singles and doubles play.

Name: Cal Community Music üíô
Description: We are a music service group that connects student and alumni musicians and performs for local senior communities and at charity events. We meet every Saturday from 1-3PM in the Morrison Hall practice rooms ‚Äî email us (calcommunitymusic@gmail.com) with any questions!
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are a music service group that connects student musicians and performs for local senior communities and at charity events.

Name: Cal Copts üíô
Description: This club serves the Coptic community at UC Berkeley. Join for the community, meetings, socials, and more! Please use this link for more information and pop on by to our weekly meeting, Thursday nights at 8 PM!
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: To educate members and interested community members of Coptic history and traditions through guest lectures and meetings, to serve the community and to form a well rounded environment for Coptic students to interact with as a family.

Name: Cal Cycling
Description: For more info see - https://recsports.berkeley.edu/programs-events/sport-clubs/cycling/ For information on how to join our team, see here - https://cycling.berkeley.edu/joinus
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: Cal Cycling is a club that welcomes cyclists of all levels, from beginners to seasoned racers. The team races in road and mountain bike events in the Western Collegiate Cycling Conference (WCCC).

Name: Cal Dragon Boat
Description: Founded in 1998, Cal Dragon Boat is a competitive student-run dragon boat team at UC Berkeley that regularly participates in regional, national and international races. We are a diverse group of hardworking students studying various concentrations, ranging from medicine to engineering to architecture. We strive to make dragon boating more accessible to the students of UC Berkeley and recruit student-athletes twice a year. We are extremely proud to be one of the top college teams in the United States. Dragon boating is a water sport in which a canoe-shaped boat of up to twenty people paddle together in synchronized rhythm to make the boat move, emulating a soaring dragon. Usually, races are 200, 500 or 2000 meters in length. Dragon boating is traditionally observed during the Chinese Duan Wu festival. However, it is now a much more common year-round activity and is one of the fastest-growing sports throughout the world. We are not recruiting Fall 2020 due to Covid, but will still have engagement videos and events for people interested in Cal DB and especially those interested in trying out Spring 2021. Here is a link to our engagement mailing list: https://forms.gle/Kdot6zPN1brQMixJ9. Also, please check out our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/caldb/) or website (caldragonboat.berkeley.edu) for more info!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Founded in 1998, Cal Dragon Boat is a competitive student-run dragon boat team at UC Berkeley that regularly participates in regional and international races.

Name: Cal Equestrian Club
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: Members are of all levels and experience, making horseback riding an accessible experience for all the students. The team competes in the IHSA English ‚Äì Hunt Seat Equitation Division, Zone 8, Region 1.

Name: Cal Fencing
Description: Cal Fencing offers year-round competitive opportunities at both the local and national level, with a tournament hosted at Berkeley during the fall semester. The organization is dedicated to providing opportunities for fencers of all skill levels, from beginners to experienced competitors. We aim to foster a supportive and inclusive environment for recreational fencing, offer structured instruction for new members, and train a competitive team to represent the university at competitions. No experience is necessary and equipment is provided for new members. Come join us and stab your friends!
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: Cal Fencing has something for everyone! We provide instruction for beginners, recreational fencing, and a competitive team for local/national tournaments. No experience is necessary and equipment is provided. Come join us and stab your friends!

Name: Cal Figure Skating
Description: If you're interested in joining Cal Figure Skating this year, come out to our info sessions, and meet both current and prospective members! We will be giving you all an overview of our team and talk about our arrangements for this semester, how to join, dues, and more. Our first infosession on 9/4 from 8-9 PM in the RSF Multimedia Room. To join our mailing list and receive an invite to our slack space, please fill out our interest form here. We will also be available to answer any questions you might have. We hope to see you all there! For more info check out our team website: https://figureskating.berkeley.eduYou can also follow our instagram @calfigureskating for the most recent updates on our team!-----For prospective competition team members only: Audtions for the 25-26 competition season will be taking place in September. All auditions will be taking place at Oakland Ice Center on the 7:00-8:00 AM and 8:15-9:15 AM sessions on the dates listed below. Some audition dates are restricted to just new members or just old members, so please take care when signing up. Audition sign ups must be completed by 9/7/2025 at 11:59 PM. Click here to see the audition requirements for the 25-26 season. Please note sign up links are available in this document. Please note that you must be medically cleared to try out for the team. Medical clearance info can be found here. Audition DatesWednesday, September 10th (Returning members ONLY)Thursday, September 11th (Returning & new members allowed)Wednesday, September 17th (Returning & new members allowed)Thursday, September 18th (New members ONLY)
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: Cal Figure Skating welcomes members from all backgrounds, from those trying skating for the first time to experienced competitors looking to continue their skating careers in college through our Recreational & Competition Teams.

Name: Cal Habitat for Humanity üíô
Description: Cal Habitat is a student organization that manages a variety of volunteer events and service projects to support local communities. We aim to tackle issues such as the housing crisis through service, education, and advocacy. We achieve our mission with the support of student volunteers, community partners, and our local affiliate, Habitat East Bay/Silicon Valley. We have several committees that do various service events, so there is something for everyone! Anyone can join, at any point in the semester. Since our inception in 1999, thousands of students have joined our cause, and we have grown into one of the largest campus chapters in the country. Together, we are working towards a world where everyone has a decent place to live. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us over slack/facebook/instagram/email!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Cal Habitat is committed to building affordable housing and strengthening communities in the Bay Area and beyond.

Name: Cal Hang-Gliding Club
Description: Promote safety and education in hang-gliding.
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: A group to promote awareness of and safety in the sport of hang gliding

Name: Cal Hawai'i Club
Description: Purpose: Community: At a university where Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander students make up less than 1% of the student body, our club provides a vital space for members to connect and build relationships with others who share similar backgrounds and upbringings. Preservation of Culture: Our club recognizes the importance of preserving and perpetuating authentic Hawaiian and ‚Äúlocal‚Äù culture. We wholeheartedly embrace our traditions and customs, incorporating them into our activities and events. Advocacy: Our space serves as a reminder of the ongoing need for more Native Hawaiian and PI resources at the university, advocating for increased representation and support.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations
Summary: Cal Hawai‚Äôi Club offers a welcoming space for students of Native Hawaiian heritage, as well as those with deep connections to Hawai‚Äôi, looking for a sense of community while away from home.

Name: Cal Hiking and Outdoor Society üíô
Description: The largest and oldest outdoor club on campus! Community members, undergrads, and grad students get together to enjoy any and all outdoor activities. Hiking, camping, backpacking, climbing, yoga, slacklining... you name, we do it! IMPORTANT: We only use this CalLink page for administrative purposes with the ASUC, and only add club officers to our roster. If you want to join CHAOS, please go to our "How to Join" tab on our our website, or come out to one of our weekly meetings (details below.) We meet EVERY Wednesday at 7:30 pm! Locations are posted the Monday before on our Instagram (@berkeleychaos), our Discord (https://discord.gg/JbrP5HQmYA), our website (chaosberkeley.org), and on our Listserv (member access only). Everyone is welcome to stop by, grab dinner or just chill! Membership is $15 FOR LIFE, and gains you access to the 3000+ email listserv (which includes signups for official weekend events), access to families (smaller, intentional communities of club members), and the Gear Shed, which contains all types of outdoor gear you will need for your adventures, at no extra cost to you! Keep it Chaotic! :)
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The largest and oldest outdoor club on campus! Community members, undergrads, and grad students get together to enjoy any and all outdoor activities. Hiking, camping, backpacking, climbing, yoga, slacklining... you name, we do it! Wednesdays @ 7:30!

Name: Cal in the Capital
Description: Since 1965, Cal in the Capital is a student-led program has that prepares 75 UC Berkeley students in their search for a summer internship opportunity in Washington, D.C. Cal in the Capital interns come from all majors, backgrounds, and area of interests. To date, more than 3,900 Cal in the Capital interns have served over 1.6 million hours of service in hundreds of professional settings, including Congressional offices, think tanks, national non-profit organizations, media centers, private companies, and research institutions. We welcome all students from all academic classes and majors!
Categories: Berkeley Public Service Center Designated, ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Cal in the Capital is a student-run program at UC Berkeley that helps around 70 students each year learn the application and professional skills necessary to find a summer internship in Washington, D.C.

Name: Cal Japan Club
Description: Cal Japan Club Á¥π‰ªãÂãïÁîª„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„ÇâÔºÅWatch this quick 1-minute intro about our club HERE! Ë©≥Á¥∞„ÇÑÈÄ£Áµ°„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„Çâ„ÅÆFB„Ç∞„É´„Éº„Éó„Çà„Çä„Å©„ÅÜ„Åû! Join our Facebook group for the latest details and event information HERE! Cal Japan Club brings the Japanese student community together by providing networking, socializing, and career opportunities to Japanese, Japanese-American, and any other students involved with Japanese language or culture. We are a club open to everyone! Open to anyone involved or interested in Japanese culture, we aim to create an inclusive space for the Japanese community and beyond, providing support through social and preprofessional career events. The official language of CJC is Japanese. However, as most of our social and career events provide English translations, we hope this will not deter any future members from joining our events! Our Social Team traditionally hosts the following events every semester; 1st General Meeting, Welcome Back Party, Halloween Party (Fall Semester), and the End of Semester Banquet. This year, we hope to host smaller and more intimate events in order to stay connected with our members on an individual basis. Our Career Team specializes in providing support for Japan-specific career opportunities. On top of host panel discussions, on-campus company info sessions, and career workshops, we also focus on providing and sharing information related to recruitment in Japan, as well as hosting an in-person job-related events.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Cal Japan Club brings the Japanese student community together by providing networking, socializing, and career opportunities to Japanese, Japanese-American, and any other students involved with Japanese language or culture. We are a club open to everyone

Name: Cal Lightweight Rowing
Description: California Lightweight Crew is the club rowing team. Known as the ‚ÄòCal Lightweights‚Äô or ‚ÄòCal Lights,‚Äô the team is a member of the Western Intercollegiate Rowing Association. At Cal Lightweights, we work hard to foster a competitive yet friendly atmosphere as we work together to fortify our mental and physical strength and excel in regattas. Any experience level welcome! For more information click the links below!
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: California Lightweight Crew is the club rowing team. Known as the ‚ÄòCal Lightweights‚Äô or ‚ÄòCal Lights,‚Äô the team is a member of the Western Intercollegiate Rowing Association.

Name: Cal Men's Club Lacrosse
Description: For more info see: https://recsports.berkeley.edu/programs-events/sport-clubs/mens-lacrosse/
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: The Men‚Äôs Lacrosse club has existed for 55 years. It has prided itself on excelling in the classroom and on the field. Men‚Äôs Lax is dedicated to continuing its long tradition of success, and building into an even bigger and brighter program.

Name: Cal Men‚Äôs Club Soccer
Description: Welcome to the Men's Club Soccer team at UC Berkeley! We are a student-led organization that plays against premier schools across California and the West Coast. Competing against schools such as Stanford, UCLA and Cal Poly SLO, Mens club soccer are two-time club national champions. We hold numerous titles including 2018 National Showcase Runners-Up, Fall 2018 WCSA League Champions, and the 2014 NIRSA Open National Champions. Fall '25 Semester: We are planning on hosting tryouts during 3rd week of school (9/9 - 9/12). All you need to do is fill out this interest form: Fall '25 Interest Form AND pay a $15 tryout fee (you can pay at the tryouts) Check in with our Instagram for more information: Club Soccer Instagram Contact Us: calmensclubsoc@gmail.com Check out our own website for more in-depth information about us, events, our schedule, and donations: Men's Club Soccer at Berkeley FAQ: When are tryouts?Tryouts are expected to take place next week at either Maxwell Family Field or Memorial Stadium. The official date and location will be announced soon. Can students who are only here for one semester join?Yes. Students who are only here for one semester are welcome to participate. Are graduate students also allowed to play?Yes. Graduate students are also eligible to join and participate. How can I pay the tryout fee?The tryout fee can be paid via Venmo, Zelle, or in cash at the time of tryouts. We will be checking players in at the door, so you will pay the fee there.
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: The California Men‚Äôs Club Soccer Team is a competitive team of motivated players from around the world. We are a group players from all different prior experience (MLS Next, ECNL, High School, D1, Semi-Pro) who compete against colleges all around the US.

Name: Cal Men‚Äôs Club Water Polo
Description: UC Berkeley Men's Club Water Polo is a competitive team composed of around 25 students. Our normal years consist of a fall season and a spring offseason. During the fall, we practice four times a week and compete in three to four tournaments against other schools in our area, including rivals Stanford and UC Davis. Each season we strive to win our region and qualify for nationals, which we've done in seven of the past eight years. Springs are more relaxed, although we continue to compete in at least a couple tournaments. Outside of the pool, we're a closely knit group and are frequently found bodysurfing at nearby beaches, playing spikeball on the glade, and dominating the IM sports leagues. We look forward to talking to you at Caltopia! In the meantime, feel free to check out or reach out to us on our facebook page at the link below! Facebook Page
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: The Men‚Äôs Cal Water Polo Club is a competitive team comprised of players of many backgrounds. We are members of the Sierra Pacific Division.

Name: Cal Men‚Äôs Volleyball Club
Description: For more info - https://recsports.berkeley.edu/programs-events/sport-clubs/mens-club-volleyball/
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: The Cal Men‚Äôs volleyball club is a nationally competitive part of the college club volleyball scene. In Spring, w compete in the Northern California College Volleyball League.

Name: Cal Pre-Vet Club üíô
Description: Mission The mission of the Cal PVC is to connect pre-veterinary students at the University of California, Berkeley, in a supportive community and to provide opportunities to learn about the field of veterinary medicine. These opportunities include: lectures delivered by professionals in the veterinary and animal science fields. educational field trips to veterinary and animal care facilities. community service for or with local animal welfare organizations. informational meetings that address students' questions about academics and obtaining animal experience. Why Cal PVC? Cal PVC prides itself in being UC Berkeley's premier resource for pre-veterinary students. Cal PVC aims to serve its members in all academic and extracurricular endeavors, and these services are unique to Cal PVC alone. Through the club, Cal PVC members forge long-lasting relationships with local veterinarians, enjoy priority for behind-the-scenes tours of major organizations, and receive significant aid in preparing their applications for veterinary school. Cal PVC hosts a wealth of knowledge and experiences, and we are proud to serve the UC Berkeley veterinary community. We meet every Thursday at 7:00 PM in 3030 VLSB! No membership is required! Any pre-vet student is welcome to attend any of our meetings! Check our Instagram for weekly updates on all meetings: @calprevetclub To reach out with any questions, contact: calprevet.president@gmail.com
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of the Cal PVC is to connect UCB pre-veterinary students with one another in a supportive environment and to provide opportunities to learn about the field of veterinary medicine.

Name: Cal Queer & Asian üíô
Description: Dedicated to building community among Queer & Asian students, Cal Queer & Asian welcomes all interested students to join us. Whether you‚Äôre still questioning, seeking friends, looking for activism/leadership/educational opportunities and beyond, Cal Q&A is a great group to join. You don‚Äôt even have to be queer or Asian - anyone who has a genuine interest is considered family :) Cal Q&A was founded in 1995 on the UC Berkeley campus as a student organization dedicated to the intersectionality of the Queer and Asian identities. Through meetings, various monthly events, and our annual conference, Cal Q&A acts as a safe space, social group, and support network for any and every student on the UC Berkeley campus. Our meetings are casual and relaxed, and we invite students to come in at anytime and bring a friend if they like. Resources | linktr.ee/calqa | https://www.instagram.com/calqanda/
Categories: Undergraduate Organizations, LGBTQ+ Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Cal Q&A was established to provide a space for safety, support, and empowerment for and to meet the needs of lesbian, gay, bi-sexual, transgender, queer and questioning individuals interested in queer and Asian topics.

Name: Cal Rotaract üíô
Description: Check out our Website! calrotaract.org Check out our Instagram! instagram.com/calrotaract Stay up-to-date on Slack: Slack.2025 What is Cal Rotaract? Sponsored by international service organization, Rotary International, Cal Rotaract is a service club for individuals ages 18-30. Modeled after similar goals and standards to those of Rotary, Rotaract brings together college students and young business professionals for the purpose of humanitarian service, networking, building goodwill and promoting peace around the world. As one of the fastest-growing Rotary programs, Rotaract on the international scale includes more than 8,000 Rotaract clubs in some 155 countries. Each individual Rotaract club is sponsored by a local Rotary club, and is generally either university- or community-based. Each chapter has its own unique personality, sometimes with special emphases and focuses dependent upon the array of members and their particular interests. Like Rotary, Rotaract clubs meet on a regular basis, and are nonpolitical, nonreligious and open to anyone interested. Rotaractors address many of global and local issues pertinent to today‚Äôs society, developing projects that promote service, build friendship and provide a forum for cultural exchange. Why Join Rotaract? Service opportunities: The main focus of Rotaract is humanitarian service on all fronts‚Äìlocally, nationally and internationally. UC Berkeley offers a variety of community service opportunities several times a month, many of which are local. Additionally, transportation is always arranged for members, so members can always get to events regardless of distance. Networking: Networking is key to any profession, so what better way to make connections than in a club that gives you direct access to Rotarians, all of whom are professionals at the top of their field, both undergraduate and graduate students in a variety of majors and fields of study, and young business professionals? Awards & Scholarships: Rotaract will give you the inside on Rotary-related scholarship opportunities as they come along, including those that have specific scholarships set aside for Rotaractors. These include the extremely prestigious Rotary Ambassadorial Scholarship, The Scholar Ship and International RYLA (Rotary Youth Leadership Awards). International connections: One of the key benefits of Cal Rotaract is our affiliation with Rotary International, an influential community service organization that has clubs all over the world. For more information about Rotaract, how to join, and when our upcoming meetings are, please view our website and Instagram group above. Sponsors Cal Rotaract is proudly sponsored by: Rotary Club of Berkeley
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Sponsored by the world's oldest service organization, Rotary International, Cal Rotaract is a service club for those interested in humanitarian service, networking, building goodwill, and promoting peace around the world.

Name: Cal Running Club üíô
Description: We are a student-run running group at UC Berkeley. We meet 6 days a week, rain or shine, and have a lot of fun running with other students of all levels. If you like running, you should definitely come check us out, no membership fees or sign-ups needed! We usually meet for 3~6+ mile runs at 5:30PM, Monday through Friday, at the Class of 1914 Fountain (intersection of Bancroft and College, across from Caf√® Strada). We also have Sunday morning long runs at 9:00AM, also at Class of 1914 Fountain. Welcome to the Fall 2025 season! For more information, please join our Discord, Strava page, or check out our Instagram: Discord: https://discord.gg/aTeyBrWMWg Strava: https://www.strava.com/clubs/CalRunning Instagram: @calrunningclub
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are a friendly group of casual runners who meet 6 days/week, 5:30PM M-F, 9:00AM Sun at the Class of 1914 Fountain (Bancroft and College intersection, across from Caff√® Strada). To join the Cal Running Club, all you have to do is show up!

Name: Cal Sailing Team
Description: For more info see: https://sailing.studentorg.berkeley.edu/
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: The Cal Sailing team sails out of Richmond Yacht Club in San Francisco Bay in 13' CFJ sailboats. The team competes often in regattas throughout California, the Pacific Northwest, and Hawaii, and once per season out of conference.

Name: Cal Seismic Design Team üíô
Description: Starting with the design process all the way to the construction phase, members will be utilizing their engineering skills along with other outside resources to perform successfully. Throughout the year, the group will meet to brainstorm ideas for the design, proposals for the overall look, and actual construction of the structure. Since the college does not have specified classes for this emphasis, this group focuses on applying their knowledge and intuition into a competition based team. Competing in the Undergraduate Seismic Design Competition, held by the Earthquake Engineering Research Institute (EERI), is the main focus of this group.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Cal Seismic Design Competition Team provides a unique opportunity for UC Berkeley students to learn about earthquake engineering. The group creates a five foot balsa wood structure built to withstand different earthquakes and competes internationally

Name: Cal Table Tennis Club
Description: Welcome to Cal Table Tennis Club! We are a student-run group of people passionate about table tennis. CalTTC strives to provide a learning and casual environment for beginners as well as a competitive setting for advanced players. We will be active this fall via Zoom with game nights, socials, Zoom fitness and match analysis trainings, and more! For more info, you can join our Slack channel! You can also contact us via email at calttc@gmail.com. https://recsports.berkeley.edu/programs-events/sport-clubs/table-tennis-club/ Follow us on our Instagram @calttc !
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: Cal Table Tennis Club is a group of people passionate about table tennis. CalTTC strives to provide a learning and casual environment for beginners as well as a competitive setting for advanced players.

Name: Cal Taiko
Description: Instagram: @calraijintaiko Facebook: facebook.com/calraijintaiko Watch our trailer/past performances on YouTube (youtube.com/caltaiko) to learn more about taiko! Founded in 2005 by Tom Hata and Andrew Rowland, Cal Raijin Taiko has been a part of the UC Berkeley community as its only taiko, or Japanese drumming, team. Our group is highly committed to practicing the art of taiko and sharing the culture of taiko with the community. With roughly twenty members, Cal Taiko meets two to three times a week on campus to practice musical drills, songs, and prepare for performances. Outside of practice hours, Cal Taiko also writes its own repertoire and builds its own equipment. Whether it be practicing at night around campus or performing at events such as Calapalooza and Cal Day, Cal Taiko is excited to have become a regular part of campus activities and enjoys sharing the energy of taiko with the students of Cal. If you'd like to contact us or request a performance, check out our website at http://www.caltaiko.org, or email us at caltaiko@gmail.com !
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Cal Raijin Taiko is a Japanese drumming team comprised of UC Berkeley students who love taiko! Cal Taiko members meet 2-3 times a week to practice and prepare for on and off campus performances. We are recruiting in the fall!

Name: Cal Triathlon (Cal Tri)
Description: Cal Tri works to promote the sport of Triathlon within the Berkeley community by getting more athletes out in the water, on the road, and in races far and wide. With over 150 members, Cal Tri is one of the largest and most successful collegiate triathlon programs in the country. We see endurance training as a lifestyle, and we think of ourselves as both a team and a family. Here you will meet some of your best friends, and our adventures will take you all across California, the United States, and even the World.We are open to athletes of all skill levels and abilities, from complete beginners to seasoned professionals. On Cal Tri, you will discover a unique group of people who will help you to become the triathlete and the person you want to be. Be sure to join our recruitment mailing list and check out our Website, Facebook, Instagram, and Youtube Channel for more info. https://youtu.be/Bq-d5gyaBkY
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: The purpose of the Cal Triathlon (Cal Tri) is to bring the sport of triathlon to the student community at the University of California, Berkeley and its surrounding environs.

Name: Cal Undergraduate Public Health Coalition
Description: Cal UPHC gives students opportunities to explore and develop their interest in public health by leading service, research, and educational projects across the areas of Global Health, Health Policy and Advocacy, Community Health, Minorities in Health, and Environmental Health.
