Description: The Chicanx/Latinx Architecture Student Association (CASA), aims to serve, support, and care for students in the Design Field. We have an open door policy to cater a safe space for all students: Undocumented Students, First- Generation/Low-Income Students, Allies, LGBTQ+ Students. In addition to professional and academic support, our familia aims to generate awareness about past and current issues in Architecture, Landscape Architecture, Planning, and Sustainable Design; while also understanding current ongoing issues that ultimately affects and impacts our communities. Learning from the past and present, will allow us to record and understand positive impacts through the efforts of design. Ultimately, we strive to create a space where our students can feel comfortable and safe, all while embracing our cultural backgrounds and designing for a better future.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations
Summary: Our intent, as it was CASA's foundation, is to advance equal access to the University and assure diversity of students studying Architecture, Landscape Architecture, City and Regional Planning, and Sustainable Design at UC Berkeley.

Name: China Law Association at Berkeley
Description: CLAB seeks to provide a platform for all students and scholars interested in Chinese law and culture. Through developing social activities, CLAB seeks to enrich the academic experience of its members, building relationships between CLAB members through facilitating conversation and dialogue. CLAB also seeks to support the development of its members through hosting professional and academic events, laying the foundation for its members to develop their professional and academic experiences and capacities.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The China Law Assn at Berkeley seeks to: 1. Connect & Serve Berkeley Chinese Scholars 2. Exchange Perspectives at Berkeley Law 3. Promote Cross-border Communication

Name: Chinese A Cappella at Berkeley
Description: Hi! We are Berkeley Chinese A Cappella (BCA), UC Berkeley's co-ed Chinese A Cappella group! We love Chinese music and we hope to promote Chinese music and culture through a cappella!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The purpose of this group is to promote Chinese music and culture on campus through a cappella.

Name: Chinese Finance Club
Description: The Chinese Finance Club (CFC) organizes activities to assist Chinese students in evaluating careers in finance & identifying current career opportunities. CFC provides a platform that extends the practical finance education with job-specific knowledge, as well as connections with alumni in different finance companies.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Chinese Finance Club (CFC) organizes activities to assist Chinese students in evaluating careers in finance & identifying current career opportunities.

Name: Chinese Graduate and Postdoctoral Scholars Association
Description: Founded in 2011, Chinese Graduate and Postdoctoral Scholars Association (CGPSA, or Berkeley Sunshine) is a non-profit, non-political and non-religious organization whose purpose is to promote the intellectual, cultural and social communications among graduate students and postdoctoral scholars from China in Berkeley Area. CGPSA is a registered graduate student organization in the Graduate Assembly of UC Berkeley.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: UC Berkeley Chinese Graduate and Postdoctoral Scholars, CGPSA

Name: Chinese Martial Arts Appreciation Club
Description: We aim to promote the sport and practice of Chinese martial arts, including Wushu, Taiji, and Shaolin to bring the community together and share an appreciation for its culture, history, and evolution.
Summary: We aim to promote the sport and practice of Chinese martial arts, including Wushu, Taiji, and Shaolin to bring the community together and share an appreciation for its culture, history, and evolution.

Name: Chinese People Union
Description: Chinese People Union is the official Chinese student organization at Berkeley dedicated to promoting Chinese culture on campus. Throughout the semester, we organize various events including retreats, Kcon, cultural celebrations, and one-day getaways .
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Chinese People Union is the official Chinese student organization at Berkeley dedicated to promoting Chinese culture on campus. Throughout the semester, we organize various events including retreats, cultural celebrations, and one-day getaways .

Name: Chinese Photography Association at Berkeley
Description: Chinese Photography Association at Berkeley (BCPA) is a student organization of University of California Berkeley. Our organization aims at building a network between all amateur and professional photographers at Berkeley. We can provide a friendly environment for members to communicate, help them to enrich their experiences and enhance their skills for better photography. We will organize various kind of activities like studio shooting, portraits shooting, sports shooting, photography competition, photography workshops, lectures by professionals and etc. to create more chances for members to get involve in photography.
Categories: Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Chinese Photography Association at Berkeley (BCPA) is a student organization of University of California Berkeley. Our organization aims at building a network between all amateur and professional photographers at Berkeley.

Name: Chinese Student Association
Description: Founded in 1951, the Chinese Student Association (CSA) is the first Chinese organization serving the growing Chinese-American community in Berkeley. Today, we are one of the largest and most active organizations at UC Berkeley. CSA promotes the interests and awareness of Chinese heritage and history in the Berkeley community while fostering a supportive and inclusive social community for students, alumni, and other groups. We host many events which allow participants to have fun and meet new people. We promote these values through our events, such as our annual Lunar New Year Banquet, ShuaiGe Swagoff, Mid-Autumn Festival, cultural cuisine, game nights, and more. Everybody is welcome to join us, regardless of background! Join us to find out what CSA is all about! Find us on Facebook, Instagram, Discord, and campus throughout the year when we host events! Learn more at: linktr.ee/csaberkeley
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, ABSA - Budgeted over $7500 Organizations
Summary: CSA promotes the interests and awareness of Chinese culture in the Berkeley community while functioning as a means of social engagement. Some of our well-known events include the Annual Lunar New Year Banquet and the Mid-Autumn Festival.

Name: Chinese Student Basketball Association
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our mission is to promote basketball culture, foster teamwork, and provide a supportive community for Chinese students at UC Berkeley through organized basketball activities and events.

Name: Chinese Student Theatre Company
Description: CSTC is the first theatre club for Chinese students. As Chinese is our native language, we will product plays written in Chinese. In this way, our members can seek the implicit beauty of Chinese expressions and also get connected and feel like home through organization activities. Performances can become not only a vehicle of imparting our imagination and appreciation for Chinese expressions, but also a cultural legacy that will be inherited by future beings.
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: CSTC provides a platform for Chinese students interested in theatre performances. Our mission is to improve students‚Äô physical coordination, teamwork skills, and creativeness and also to develop students‚Äô perception of life through performances.

Name: Chinese Undergraduate Pre-Law Student Association
Description: The Chinese Undergraduate Pre-Law Student Association (CUPLSA) serves to build a community among Chinese international students who are currently on the Pre-Law track or are interested in law and applying to a law school. Our Instagram account is @cuplsa.cal
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Chinese Undergraduate Pre-Law Student Association (CUPLSA) serves to build a community among Chinese international students who are currently on the Pre-Law track or are interested in law and applying to a law school.

Name: Chinese Union Club at Berkeley
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: As the first non-profit organization in the United States to be founded by Chinese students and Non-profit Organization 501(c)-3. Founded in 2005, we are committed to passing on the spirit of mutual help and assistance among overseas Chinese.

Name: Christ Pursuers on Campus üíô
Description: The purpose of this organization shall be to bring UCB students into insights of who God is and foster both personal and corporate experience of God through in-depth Bible reading, fellowshipping, worshiping, praying, singing hymns, outings, evangelism, etc.
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose shall be to bring UCB students into insights of who God is and foster both personal and corporate experience of God through in-depth Bible reading, fellowshipping, worshiping, praying, singing hymns, outings, evangelism, etc.

Name: Christians at BerkeleyLaw üíô
Description: We provide Bibles studies and a community within the law school for those seeking spiritual support. We offer a time for those who self-identify as Christians, and those interested in learning more about the Christian faith, to encourage one another through the ups and downs of law school. We also provide networking opportunities to connect people to churches, other bible studies, and other faith groups at Berkeley. We also hold occasional social activities, including dinners and networking events with other graduate student groups.
Categories: Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Christians at BerkeleyLaw provides a safe community for students to come together for weekly fellowship to talk about the Christian faith and deepen our commitment to God and one another.

Name: Christians on Campus üíô
Description: Christians on Campus is a group of students who love the Lord Jesus Christ and His Word! We endeavor to give Him ‚Äúthe first place in all things‚Äù (Col. 1:18). We meet simply as Christians without any denominational affiliation, because we treasure the testimony of the oneness of the Body of Christ. To this end, we warmly receive all believers as our brothers and sisters in Christ, and seek to maintain the oneness of the Spirit by keeping our focus on Christ. Our goal is to cooperate with Him for the accomplishment of God's eternal purpose (Eph. 3:11) by ministering the unsearchable riches of Christ (Eph. 3:8) for the building up of the Body of Christ (Eph. 4:12). In addition to pursuing fellowship, we also desire to strengthen and spread the Lord's testimony on the UC Berkeley campus. With the above as our governing vision, we hold weekly Bible studies, smaller group meetings, monthly club fellowship nights, fun outings, and more! For more information, check out our website at https://www.christiansoncampus.info
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are a student group composed of believers from various backgrounds who love the Lord Jesus and His Word! Our gatherings include weekly Bible studies, smaller group meetings, outings, and more. Check us out at https://www.christiansoncampus.info

Name: Cinematic Arts and Production Club
Description: Cinematic Arts and Production Studios is the most production-driven student film organization at UC Berkeley and the largest collegiate film club in the nation. Our activities are heavily centered around professional film production, as we work toward our mission of creating original, high-quality, and meaningful films to premiere to our community. We meet regularly throughout the semester to work on our film projects. Our 100+ active members aim to create 30 short films (around 6 hours of content) per academic semester. Cinematic Arts and Production Studios is the ideal organization for students interested in gaining actionable exposure to the film industry, whether that's in film production or in the business side of the industry. As our projects are all original and start-to-finish, we recruit students from various backgrounds to cover all of our organizational needs. **Fall 2025 Update: Our applications are OPEN!** Visit our website, on Instagram @capstudiosberkeley, or our YouTube. Check out our latest reel here!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Cinematic Arts and Production Studios is the most production-driven student film organization at UC Berkeley. Our mission is to create original, high-quality, and meaningful films to premiere on campus.

Name: Circle K International üíô
Description: Our mission is to develop college students into responsible citizens and leaders with a lifelong commitment to serving our community. Our club adheres to the tenets of service, leadership, and fellowship. For 30 years we have organized hundreds of service projects, racked up tens of thousands of service hours, and raised thousands of dollars for charity. We benefit the community through these projects, in which we take on tasks such as cleaning up the environment, serving food to low-income families, putting on free educational workshops for underprivileged children, making no-sew blankets for animals in the shelter, and raising money for charities such as the Pediatric Trauma Program, The Environmental Defense Fund, the Kiwanis Family House at the UC Davis Medical Hospital, and the NAACP Legal Defense & Education Fund. In addition to all the service we do, we focus on creating a community through a variety of socials, from eating out, to karaoke, to San Francisco trips, and more, through our family system, and our mentor-mentee system and alumni network! If you're interested in joining us here at UC Berkeley CKI for the 2025-2026 term and to stay in the loop about our activities, fill out our interest form (we accept everyone!) today: https://forms.gle/fRUt8vcoWwb2kLHs5 We also ask you to check out our website, ucbcki.org, for more information on us, and our calendar, and to sign up for events. This way, you can also keep track of the events you've attended and your hours! And if you're interested in a board position and leadership training, we are currently accepting applications for our appointed board! Incoming freshmen, junior transfers, and all other students who will be at Berkeley for the 2025-2026 term are welcome to apply. We just ask that you are enthusiastic and can dedicate your time to the club. Email cki.yanisachai@gmail.com (2025-2026 President, Yanisa Chaisomboonpan) to let us know you're interested, and then apply to board here today!: https://forms.gle/xRnx2bRvfi7nsTff7 For any important links, please check out our Linktr.ee: linktr.ee/UCB_CKI/
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our mission is to develop students into leaders with a lifelong commitment to serving our community through mentorship and fellowship. We adhere to the tenets of service, leadership, and fellowship. Check out @ucbcki on Instagram for more information!

Name: City Planning + Public Health Master's Students Committee
Description: Over the past decade the University of California has been a vanguard in combining the fields of public health and city planning. City Planning + Public Health Master's Students Committee (MCP + MPH Students) seeks to serve active concurrent degree students, as well as students interested in interdisciplinary study to advance urban health equity. MCP + MPH Students seeks to institutionalize an informal and growing network of students, and serve as an intellectual and action-oriented home for students between departments.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: MCP + MPH Students seeks to institutionalize an informal and growing network of interdisciplinary Master's Students, and serve as an intellectual and action-oriented home for students between departments.

Name: Civil and Environmental Engineering For Anti-Racism üíô
Description: We aim to build on historical efforts in the student community and to push for immediate and sustained action to address structural racism in Civil and Environmental Engineering and the broader engineering community.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We aim to build on historical efforts in the student community and to push for immediate and sustained action to address structural racism in the Civil and Environmental Engineering department.

Name: Civil and Environmental Engineering Joint Fundraising Committee üíô
Description: To raise, distribute, and manage funds for Civil and Environmental Engineering student groups: ASCE, Steel Bridge, Seismic Design, Concrete Canoe, Environmental, Transportation, Sustainable Solutions, GeoWall, and Construction Competition Teams.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: To raise, distribute, and manage funds for Civil and Environmental Engineering student groups: ASCE, Steel Bridge, Seismic Design, Concrete Canoe, Environmental, Transportation, Sustainable Solutions, GeoWall, and Construction Competition Teams.

Name: Climbing Team of Berkeley üíô
Description: Note: we do not keep our CalLink page updated. For current information see our instagram or website. Our club is centered around climbing. We love to climb, both indoors and outdoors. We also look to grow the sport of climbing and our local climbing community through both new climbers and old. Indoors, we tend to climb at either Mosaic Boulders on Telegraph, or Berkeley Ironworks or Bridges Rock Gym. Members will occasionally participate in CCS (the Collegiate Climbing Series) competitions, but always in a fun and informal environment. Outdoors, we take short local trips to places like Indian and Mortar Rock here in Berkeley, to Mt. Diablo, to Mickey's Beach, and distant trips to places like Yosemite, Smith Rock (Oregon), and even Red Rocks (near Las Vegas Nevada).
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We climb inside and outside, and welcome beginners and experts alike! Please find more information and how to join us on instagram: @calclimbing or our website: climbing.berkeley.edu.

Name: ClinicConnects üíô
Description: The ClinicConnects Club strives to reach out to local clinics and inquire with the healthcare professionals regarding the range of problems they may have‚Äîfrom small inconveniences to larger changes‚Äîand act as the ‚Äúmiddleman‚Äù to find local resources that solve the problems. By tackling these previously less-explored problems, connecting various resources, and finding viable methods to implement the solutions, we hope to create a positive tangible impact within our local community. In addition, we hope to help with advocacy and awareness of problems that we uncover through our interactions with the local clinics.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The ClinicConnects Club strives to reach out to local clinics/inquire with the healthcare professionals about a range of problems (big and small) and act as the ‚Äúmiddleman‚Äù to find local resources that solve the problems.

Name: CMG Strategy Consulting (Formerly Creative Marketing Group)
Description: CMG Strategy Consulting is a non-profit, student-run management consulting organization at UC Berkeley that provides consulting services for companies in the Bay Area and beyond. We seek to give new perspectives to businesses while also providing experiences for our student consultants to grow professionally. We pride ourselves on delivering creative & implementable solutions developed from comprehensive research efforts.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: CMG Strategy Consulting is a non-profit, student-run management consulting organization at UC Berkeley that provides consulting services for companies in the Bay Area and beyond. Please contact us at berkeleycmg@gmail.com to learn more.

Name: CNMAT Users Group üíô
Description: The group is a mostly graduate student group working in coordination with CNMAT staff and faculty on various things like, special projects, facilities upkeep, software upkeep, general improvements in working environments, grant writing, BNMP/ECO concert production.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: To assist graduate students at CNMAT (Center for New Music and Audio Technology)

Name: Code for Good
Description: https://codeforgoodberkeley.github.io/ Code For Good works to support non-profit organizations with technology solutions to help bring positive change in our communities. Learn project management, develop your problem-solving skills, and utilize technical knowledge in an impactful way. Connect with like-minded individuals and find your community. All Coding Experience Welcome!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Code For Good works to support non-profit organizations with technology solutions to help bring positive change in our communities. Everyone gets the chance to work on something they are passionate about and push their own talents.

Name: Codebase
Description: Codebase is a UC Berkeley student organization which aims to make industry experience more accessible to students and empower students to break into the software industry through semesterly projects with high-growth tech companies. We're a tight-knit community of developers, friends, and mentors who support and uplift each other throughout the college experience.We're looking for students with little coding experience who want to learn and grow with us by developing a project to service local non-profits, as well as students who may have side project/internship experience but want to find a fun, driven community while working on an industry project together. Every semester, our members work closely with industry clients to flesh out tailor-made software development projects. Developers work in small groups with their project managers for 13 weeks developing their technical skills and gaining industry experience. Past non-profit clients include the Berkeley Food Pantry, CoFED (a QTBIPOC-led organization that partners with young folks of color to build food and land co-ops!), and campus orgs such as The Green Initiative Fund, and The Berkeley Project. Past industry clients include Amazon, PayPal, Google, Postman, Meta, Atlassian, Etsy, Ginger, DoorDash, and a range of other small to mid-size companies which can give us a tailored and fulfilling experience. Interested in joining us? Our application for Fall 2025 is coming soon -- keep an eye out on our social media. For more information:- Visit our website for more information: codebase.berkeley.edu/ - Like our FB page: www.facebook.com/berkeleycodebase - Follow us on IG: @berkeleycodebase- Learn more about us: bit.ly/codebase_about_us
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Codebase is a UC Berkeley student community which aims to make industry experience more accessible. We empower students to break into the software industry through semesterly projects with high-growth tech companies and non-profits.

Name: Codeology
Description: Whether coding is already your passion or you‚Äôve yet to print your first ‚ÄúHello World,‚Äù Codeology aims to provide a tight-knit community to support you in ‚Äúfinding your fit‚Äù in the world of tech. Through projects, professional development, industry events, and social events, we offer opportunities to help you explore different roles in the tech industry and develop technical expertise in your area of interest. Learn More About Us: Projects: Every semester, we introduce varying personal projects as well as client projects as an opportunity for our members to explore interesting niches in the tech industry and gain experience as developers. Topics can range from AI/ML to data analytics to iOS development and more. Check out what projects we've been working on! Community: Codeology offers a supportive environment for members to grow within the computer science community whether that be through mentorship, our weekly socials, Tree/Leaf program, or spontaneous trips to SF! We reward kindness and taking action in order to foster an enjoyable and motivated culture that encourages the sharing of ideas. Check out our instagram to see what our members have been up to! Interested in joining the community? Follow us on social media for Spring 2025 Recruitment updates! ‚≠êÔ∏è Instagram ‚≠êÔ∏è Facebook ‚≠êÔ∏è Website
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Codeology aims to help students of all years and majors explore the tech industry. We offer personal projects to develop experience and familiarity of various computer science area. Primarily, we are a community of people who love helping each other.

Name: Codify
Description: Codify is an organization created by and for the Berkeley computer science community. We strive to provide opportunities for students to find their place in tech, explore their entrepreneurial aspirations, and use their skills to give back to their communities. We are always looking for passionate students to join our ranks, and partner organizations to work with towards our mutual goals.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Codify aims to give students the opportunity to work on impactful technical projects in order to promote the professional growth of its members.

Name: Cognitive Science Students Association üíô
Description: The Cognitive Science Students Association (CSSA) is an undergraduate student organization at UC Berkeley whose mission is to support and enrich the academic life of students interested in the interdisciplinary field of Cognitive Science. The CSSA strives to build a sense of community among students and provides them with valuable opportunities for personal, academic, and career development. The CSSA regularly coordinates academic events such as guest lectures and information sessions; plans social events like professor-student dinners and movie nights; and advocates for cognitive science students by working with CogSci faculty and university officials. Each year, the CSSA also plans, organizes, and hosts the California Cognitive Science Conference, a large academic conference featuring talks from Cognitive Science researchers from across the state as well as showcasing the exceptional work of undergraduates conducting research in Cognitive Science. Check out our website: cssa.berkeley.edu Join our Facebook Group: facebook.com/groups/Cal.CSSA
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Cognitive Science Students Association (CSSA) is an undergraduate student organization at UC Berkeley whose mission is to support and enrich the academic life of students interested in the interdisciplinary field of Cognitive Science.

Name: College Admissions Mentorship Program (Formerly People's Test Preparation Service)
Description: CAMP (College Admissions Mentorship Program), formerly People's Test Preparation Service (PTPS) was founded in 1995 at the University of California, Berkeley and is a non-profit, student-run organization dedicated to providing volunteer college counseling for underserved communities. We strive to provide free, personalized college counseling services to high school students by guiding our students through selecting colleges to apply to, the essay process, applying for financial aid, and more! This group [College Admissions Mentorship Program] was formerly named [People's Test Preparation Service] - 9/23/21 IZ
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: An organization dedicated to providing free college admissions mentorship to low-income high school students.

Name: ColorStack at Berkeley üíô
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We exist to increase the number of Black and Latinx Computer Science graduates that go on to launch rewarding technical careers.

Name: Combat Robotics at Berkeley üíô
Description: Combat Robotics at Berkeley started with a singular obsession: make a BattleBot. Through the countless design iterations, late nights working on CAD and backbreaking machining to finish our 250lb BattleBot Glitch, CRB‚Äôs become so much more: an awesome way to develop our hands-on engineering, marketing and business skills; an outlet to pour our competitive nature into robotic optimization; and a tight knit community of friends. At Combat Robotics at Berkeley, we build robots from 1lb to our 250lb BattleBot, Glitch. New members will have the opportunity to design new 1lb robots from the ground up in small teams, moving on to work on 15lb bots and Glitch. Combat Robotics at Berkeley is a sponsored organization under the ASUC, UC Berkeley‚Äôs student association and a 501c3 nonprofit. CRB is entirely student run, with over forty undergraduate students split into four projects and four technical and nontechnical subteams.
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: At Combat Robotics at Berkeley, our goal is to promote hands-on and theoretical engineering principles while designing a combat robot to compete on the Discovery Channel's show BattleBots.

Name: Common Cause at Berkeley
Description: Common Cause of Berkeley is a campus group under the umbrella of Common Cause, a national interest group dedicated to making the government more open, accountable, and responsive to the public. We are a non-partisan political group that does not directly advocate for policy issues. Instead we advocate for a more functional and fair democracy, one free of the corrupting influence of money in politics, a change that would move forward all the most important issues today. Whatever your particular political goals are the issues that Common Cause advocates will almost certainly help you achieve your goals by allowing you to work with a government more transparent and responsive to the public and less to wealthy interests. Since we are a student group, we particularly focus on advocating for good government reform that increases the accessibility and responsiveness of government to students.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups
Summary: Common Cause believes in proactive democracy where everybody‚Äôs voice is heard and can work together for a better future.

Name: Community Projects
Description: Community Projects (CP) is a registered umbrella organization that supports a coalition of UC Berkeley service organizations in partnership with the Public Service Center.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our mission is to offer service groups the opportunity to network and collaborate, build coalitions with local organizations and across student groups, receive critical funding, and participate in social justice/leadership training.

Name: Comparative Literature Publication Association (formerly known as Comparative Literature Undergraduate Journal/ Vagabond)
Description: The Comparative Literature Publication Association runs two biannual publications‚Äîthe Comparative Literature Undergraduate Journal and the Vagabond multilingual magazine. The Comparative Literature Undergraduate Journal is a peer-reviewed, international journal that showcases undergraduate research in comparative texts and media. Our published articles treat a broad range of topics including, but not limited to, theoretical literary discourse, international trends in literature, and comparisons of at least two national literatures. The Vagabond multilingual magazine publishes undergraduate-level creative work in prose, poetry, translation, art criticism, and visual art. Selected pieces showcase an attentiveness to the resonance of multiple languages and the expressive force of varied art forms.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Publication Groups, Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: CLPA provides undergraduates around the world the opportunity to share their literary works. The Association runs two top-notch, peer-reviewed undergraduate publications--the Comparative Literature Undergraduate Journal and Vagabond Magazine.

Name: Comparative Literature Undergraduate Research Symposium at Berkeley
Description: This springtime event showcases undergraduate scholarship in Comparative Literature. Students present research, review scholarship of peers, and listen to presentations from faculty and graduate students in the Comparative Literature department.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: This springtime event showcases undergraduate scholarship in Comparative Literature. Students present research, review scholarship of peers, and listen to presentations from faculty and graduate students in the Comparative Literature department.

Name: Compas at Berkeley
Description: We are a community service org dedicated to supporting and advocating for farmworkers in the US and beyond. We provide educational resources, mentorship, and tutoring to empower farmworker communities and help their children pursue higher education.
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We are a community service org dedicated to supporting farmworkers in the US and beyond. We provide educational resources, mentorship, and tutoring to empower farmworker communities, especially Latinx, and help their children pursue higher education.

Name: Computer Science Graduate Student Association
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The purpose of the CSGSA is to promote the common good and general welfare of the computer science graduate student community at UC Berkeley, the University community, and the wider computer science community.

Name: Computer Science Mentors
Description: Computer Science Mentors (CSM) is the heart of the EECS/DS undergraduate teaching community. Our mission is twofold: we aim to provide undergraduates with the opportunity to teach, and we support students in lower division EECS/DS classes by hosting free small-group tutoring sections run by our mentors. On the mentor side, CSM provides education on how to teach undergraduate level computer science. CSM's structure of senior and junior mentors allows mentors to receive feedback, practice teaching, and improve their teaching abilities over the course of each semester. A sizable portion of EECS/DS undergraduate course staff were once mentors in CSM, contributing to better quality of education for all Berkeley EECS/DS students. CSM hosts a variety of events including club-wide picnics, speaker events with EECS/DS faculty, mentor training sessions, and an end-of-semester banquet. These are held to help mentors to learn more about pedagogy and to form a community with other like-minded students. On the mentee side, CSM's small-group sections help students receive personalized guidance in lower division EECS/DS classes despite huge class sizes and long office hours queues. In addition to weekly sections run by 250+ mentors, CSM holds exam review sessions and provides custom weekly worksheets for all of its courses. CSM‚Äôs tutoring sections help equalize access to resources and learning opportunities, especially for underrepresented groups.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: CSM offers an open and inclusive community space for students in computer science to receive individualized academic and social support. We coordinate various events, provide supplementary courses, and tutoring opportunities.

Name: Computer Science Undergraduate Association üíô
Description: The Computer Science Undergraduate Association supports the undergraduate computer science student body at UC Berkeley and acts as an entry point to industry. The CSUA hosts tech talks, hackathons, info sessions, CS workshops, LAN parties, and more! Looking for a place to learn more about computer science and meet other students, or want to become a member? If so, come visit us at our office (311 Soda)! Please check https://www.csua.berkeley.edu/join/ to create an account on our computers and be added to our mailing list, go to csua.org/discord to join our Discord (our main form of communication).
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Computer Science Undergraduate Association supports the undergraduate computer science student body at UC Berkeley and acts as an entry point to industry. The CSUA hosts tech talks, hackathons, info sessions, CS workshops, LAN parties, and more!

Name: Comunidad for Health Equity üíô
Description: Comunidad for Health Equity (CHE) is a pre-health/pre-med student-run organization at UC Berkeley that educates, empowers, and advocates for the health of the Latinx community. We are students pursuing a career in the health field (Doctors, Nurses, Dentists, Optometrists, Public Health professionals, etc.) and are interested in health issues that affect the Latinx community. Our goals are to motivate students, instill the desire to help the underserved, create a supportive environment, and provide health resources to empower the communities of Berkeley and Oakland. Our organization's General Meetings feature esteemed Latinx health professionals as guest speakers, conducting informative workshops on crucial topics like healthcare reform, mental health, and diabetes, and participating in the Minorities in Health Conference. We also prioritize community service, networking, and team-building events, while organizing socials and fundraisers like Taco Sales on Sproul. We provide academic support through study hours, and volunteering opportunities in Oakland, Richmond, El Cerrito, and many more underserved communities. We also offer scholarships for Latinx students and opportunities for leadership development through our Intern Program with Board Officers.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: CHE is a Latinx pre-health organization at UC Berkeley. All are welcome to join our weekly meetings, which feature guest speakers, workshops, and social events. Members also enjoy volunteering, conferences, study hours, and a supportive community.

Name: Concerts Under Berkeley (Formerly known as Tiny Dorm at Berkeley)
Description: This group [Concerts Under Berkeley] was formerly named [Tiny Dorm] - [10/20/25] [AP]
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: A vibrant, cozy music community for Berkeley student artists and music-enjoyers alike! We host intimate cafe concerts, open mic, and jam sessions. Find out more through our Instagram (@c.u.bclub) and Linktree

Name: Concrete Canoe üíô
Description: From our 2024-25 Project Managers: https://youtu.be/de3DcQZg3BI - Hello! We are Cal Concrete Canoe, UC Berkeley‚Äôs first civil engineering competition team. We provide a welcoming community where students can learn, gain hands-on experience, and create something they can be proud of. Concrete canoe competes annually in the ASCE-sponsored concrete canoe competition, where we are challenged to apply knowledge from our courses and experience from our team to a large-scale project. - The concrete canoe team is unique from other student organizations because we encompass many disciplines of engineering; participating in our team exposes students to disciplines like construction, materials science, structural analysis, and environmental engineering. In addition, as a competition team, we help individuals grow and build leadership and teamwork skills. Despite being a civil engineering competition team, we welcome students from all majors and backgrounds; this diversity helps bring new ideas and concepts towards our project and competition! - Our team is comprised of divisions, each specializing in a subject to allow for our team to function:‚Ä¢ Construction‚Ä¢ Materials Design‚Ä¢ Hull Design and Structural Analysis‚Ä¢ Graphics Design‚Ä¢ Paddling - Our team holds a long history of success in our competition, and with our continuous alumni support, we enable students to call upon a large, knowledgeable alumni network. In our team, students have the ability to grow outside of their courses! - If you are interested in joining us, please join our discord: https://discord.gg/Vbw2hNhZ
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are Cal Concrete Canoe, UC Berkeley‚Äôs first civil engineering competition team. We provide a welcoming community where students can learn, gain hands-on experience, and create something they can be proud of.

Name: Consciousness Collective at Berkeley
Description: The purpose of this club is to a. Establish a community at UC Berkeley wherein students can engage in a variety of mindful activities, including but not limited to: meditation, gardening, walking, reflection, group discussions, music, etc. b. Support students in using meditation and mindfulness to improve mental health and alleviate stress; increase kindness, altruism, and social responsibility; and boost concentration and overall life satisfaction. c. Practice reciprocity with the planet and those in need, by establishing a caring relationship with the natural world and our communities. Collaborate on projects for social and environmental well-being. d. Explore a variety of perspectives on consciousness: contemplative, neurobiological, philosophical, psychological, and beyond.
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our mission is to create a warm community for contemplative practice and consciousness studies at UC Berkeley. We aim to nurture well-being for our campus, society, and planet, and cultivate a cooperative spirit of social engagement for the good of all.

Name: Consortium
Description: The Consortium at Haas is the on-campus organization for Consortium Fellows at Haas. Our mission is to enhance diversity and inclusion in global business education and leadership by reducing the underrepresentation of African Americans, Hispanic Americans, and Native Americans in business education and the ranks of management.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO
Summary: The Consortium at Haas is the on-campus organization for Consortium Fellows at Haas.

Name: Construction Competition Team üíô
Description: The Construction Competition Team provides students the opportunity to learn about construction and project management skills and techniques, with the intent of competing in the Associated Schools of Construction Region 6 and 7 competition. The team aims to develop the technical, professional, and soft skills of our members, in order to prepare them for success in both the competition and multiple disciplines within the construction industry.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Construction Competition Team provides students the opportunity to learn about construction and project management skills and techniques, with the intent of competing in the Associated Schools of Construction Region 6 and 7 competition.

Name: Consult Your Community (CYC) at Berkeley
Description: Consult Your Community is a nationwide, student-run nonprofit organization that empowers America‚Äôs top undergraduate students to leverage their knowledge of business with their passion for service. Students engage with small businesses, nonprofits, and startups over the course of a semester through an innovative program in which they are trained to provide business owners with comprehensive consulting services while being advised by business school faculty, graduate student mentors, and experienced professionals from top-tier consulting firms. Through this process, students gain hands-on business experience and develop skills that prepare them for their future careers, while business owners become empowered to foster their own economic independence and secure their future prosperity, both of which contribute directly to our nation‚Äôs economic development and long-term sustainability.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Join us in inspiring a generation to empower the 6,000,000 small businesses that drive the success of our nation!

Name: Consumer Advocacy and Protection Society
Description: The Consumer Advocacy and Protection Society (CAPS) is a student-run Berkeley Law organization dedicated to the promotion of consumer law and consumer protection at Berkeley Law. Our mission is to connect consumer-minded students, organize and host consumer-related events, network the greater consumer law community, and ensure the availability of consumer curriculum and clinic opportunities at Berkeley Law. https://www.consumer.berkeley.edu
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The Consumer Advocacy and Protection Society (CAPS) is a student-run Berkeley Law organization dedicated to the promotion of consumer law and economic justice at Berkeley Law.

Name: Core Consulting Group üíô
Description: CCG aims to grant equal professional development opportunities to under resourced students that want to break into the highly competitive field of consulting through teaching members the right tools needed to succeed.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Core Consulting Group aims to grant equal professional development opportunities to UC Berkeley students, including transfers, that want to pursue a career in consulting.

Name: Creating in Relaxation: Center for Relaxed Creatorsüíô
Description: We host weekly walk-in create spaces for creators to work on their creative works to sound of relaxing music around other like-minded individuals. We also to plan to host monthly share nights or socials to build our community and individual connections with each other. This group [Creating in Relaxation: Center for Relaxed Creators] was formerly named [Writer's Ink: Center for Creative Delinquents] - [3/12/25] [AP]
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Creating in Relaxation: Center for Relaxed Creators (Formerly known as Writer's Ink: Center for Creative Delinquents) strives to give creator minds a relaxing space free of worry, stress, and burden to work on their creative works to their hearts content

Name: Creative Applications to Life in Origami üíô
Description: Our members strive to learn how to fold simple to advanced origami (no experience required!), to be able to visualize the geometry of origami, and be able to fold diagrams and "read" crease patterns. We also aim to be able to apply the concepts of origami to other use than art (i.e. math, medicine, physics). Interested in origami? Join us! Sign up to our mailing list to get the latest updates on club meetings, socials, and more: http://tinyurl.com/CALO-email-listWe also have a discord here: https://discord.gg/5g7uwg5JGU
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our members strive to learn how to fold simple to advanced origami (no experience required!), to be able to visualize the geometry of origami, and be able to fold diagrams and "read" crease patterns.

Name: Creative Residencies for Emerging Artists Teaching Empowerment
Description: CREATE is an organization supported by the Public Service Center that promotes arts-based services. Through CREATE, Berkeley students design and co-teach a class in dance, theater, visual arts, or creative writing in order to meet the enrichment needs of local schools and community centers. CREATE members are provided weekly trainings by our leadership team and are also mentored by professional teaching artists in their specific discipline. Trainings and mentor trainings cover topics such as social justice, curriculum design, positive behavior support, and personal artistry. CREATE also hosts guest artist workshops, social events, and community showcases in order to engage with members and the larger campus/Bay Area community.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: CREATE is an organization supported by the Public Service Center that gives artists, dancers, actors, writers, and others an opportunity to apply creative skills through public service.

Name: Cricket Club of Berkeley
Description: We are a club that seeks to spread awareness of the sport of Cricket and competes in regional and national tournaments. We have been active since 2018, and have a current competitive team roster of around 35 players. We have weekly practices/games over weekends and also host a tennis ball premier league open to the Berkeley community every semester. Our competitive team participates as part of the NCCA (National College Cricket Association), which consists of 40+ colleges around the USA. Cal Cricket won the Pacific Regionals in 2021, and the Houston Nationals in 2023.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The first professional and recreational cricket club at UC Berkeley!

Name: Critical Consciousness Collective
Description: Critical Consciousness Collective's (CCC) vision is to create robust community building projects for resilience rooted in anti-oppressive, anti-racist, anti-sexist, anti-homophobic, antitransphobic, anti-ableist, anti-imperialist, and anti-capitalist values. A nod to Paulo Freire‚Äôs concept of conscientiza√ß√£o, we believe that social workers and caring professionals have the responsibility to not only critically understand the world, but to take action against its oppressive elements. To accomplish this, CCC produces a variety of projects rooted in critical pedagogy with the intent to equip working professionals with mezzo-level community building skills critical to engaging clients in our field. While our projects are ever-evolving based on community-informed needs, they currently encompass critical book clubs, peer mentoring, wellness events, fundraisers for world issues, and skill-sharing workshops.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Critical Consciousness Collective (CCC) is a mezzo-level social work practice group cultivating community through radical collective learning. Our vision is to create robust community building projects for resilience rooted in anti-oppressive values.

Name: Critical Pacific Island Studies Collective (CPISC)
Description: We aim to create educational and professional development opportunities, accessible research materials, and scholarly work based on the critical and equitable study of the Pacific. CPISC conducts interdisciplinary research that bridges spaces within and external to academia and seeks to understand relationships between territorial political status, militarization, environmental justice, Indigenous cultural preservation, colonialism, climate change, and further complex problems. Our vision is ‚Äãto generate deeper, more holistic research conducted of, with, and for the Pacific, bolstered by a growing collective of Pacific Islander researchers and allies across the University of California network and greater Pacific. CPISC endeavors to partake in projects like bringing guest speakers, researching current events, writing and publishing academic papers, and creating media (film, podcast, website) focused on the Pacific Islands and their communities.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations
Summary: The Critical Pacific Islands Studies Collective (CPISC) brings together a diverse group of researchers at UC Berkeley to foster a growing academic network of Pacific Islanders and allies.

Name: Crossroads Christian Fellowship: Chinese for Christ Berkeley Church
Description: Crossroads Christian Fellowship is the college fellowship of Vinewood, the English ministry at Chinese for Christ (CFC) Church in Berkeley. We are a student-led Christian fellowship on the Berkeley campus. We meet together on Friday nights at 7:30pm to worship, study the Word, and fellowship together. We also offer weekly small groups to nurture personal spiritual growth in a more intimate setting. We are a ministry of Vinewood at Chinese for Christ Berkeley. Our church is located two blocks past Ashby on Prince Street and College Avenue. Crossroads exists as an arm of CFC Berkeley to engage college students at UC Berkeley with the Word of God: for the unsaved, to proclaim the gospel unto saving faith; and for the saved, to preach and teach the Word unto maturity of faith.
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Crossroads Christian Fellowship is the college fellowship of Vinewood at Chinese for Christ (CFC) Church in Berkeley. Our vision is to seek and raise up believers and to nurture a maturity amongst them that will transcend their college years.

Name: Cru üíô
Description: The purpose of the Chapter is to build movements of people who are transformed by Jesus Christ. The student-led movement seeks to introduce students to Christ, help them to grow in faith, encourage them to passionately live life in a manner consistent with belief in the God of the Bible, and inspire commitment to advancing the purposes of God in the world.
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: An interdenominational and multi-cultural community who follows Jesus Christ and takes His gospel to the world.

Name: CS KickStart
Description: CS KickStart is a one week introductory program in computer science designed for incoming freshman women at UC Berkeley. Participants develop coding skills, learn about the different areas of computer science, and meet students and professionals working in the computing space. The program targets those who are interested in math, science, and/or engineering. We aim to give students a hands-on experience that will reveal the creativity and power of computer science, while establishing a tight-knit community, prior to entering UC Berkeley. visit: the CSKickStart website to learn more
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: CS KickStart is a one week introductory program in computer science designed for incoming freshman women at UC Berkeley. Participants develop coding skills, learn about different areas of computer science, and meet other computer science students.

Name: Cub Consulting at Berkeley
Description: Cub Consulting is a student-run consulting organization that provides innovative and comprehensive strategies to clients in our community. We want to make a change in our community of Berkeley organizations, small Bay Area businesses, and startups.
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Cub Consulting is a student-run consulting organization that provides innovative and comprehensive strategies to clients in our community. We want to make a change in our community of Berkeley organizations, small Bay Area businesses, and startups.

Name: CYAN: Coalition of Hindus of North America Youth Action Network
Description: Submit this Google Form to join us!
Summary: CoHNA Youth Action Network empowers young Hindus on campuses to combat Hinduphobia and anti-Hindu bias as well as advocate for human rights. We do this through grassroots mobilization, engaging with experts, policymakers, and stakeholders on campus.

Name: DAES‚Äô Black Film Collective
Description: We strive to provide a space for Black students to create films, watch films made by Black creators, and to learn about the process of filmmaking. We also aim to give Black students the chance to build their portfolios for future careers in entertainment. 2024 Member Application: https://forms.gle/GBskQZx1p6VLr97M6
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: We strive to provide a space for Black students to create films, watch films made by Black creators, and to learn about the process of filmmaking. We also aim to give Black students the chance to build their portfolios for future careers in entertainment.

Name: Daily Californian
Description: The Daily Californian is an independent, student-run newspaper published by the Independent Berkeley Students Publishing Company, Inc. The Daily Californian covers both the UC Berkeley campus and the city of Berkeley. The newspaper publishes every Thursday during the academic year and the summer. Established in 1871, The Daily Californian is one of the oldest newspapers on the West Coast and one of the oldest college newspapers in the country. The Daily Cal is run entirely by current or recently-graduated UC Berkeley students, and the majority of the business division of the newspaper is student-operated as well. One of the few campus newspapers in the country that is completely independent from the university it covers, the Daily Cal supports itself through advertising revenue and does receive funding from the INK Initiative, which requires all UC Berkeley students to pay $2.50 per semester. The Daily Cal earned its independence in 1971 and publishes with the name ‚ÄúThe Daily Californian‚Äù pursuant to a licensing agreement with the UC Board of Regents. The move toward independence was initiated after the university administration attempted to fire three editors because of a controversial editorial regarding People‚Äôs Park, a university-owned lot in the Southside neighborhood of Berkeley that became an unplanned park for locals.
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Daily Californian serves the campus and local community by producing and distributing a daily newspaper and promoting ideals of excellence in journalism by providing a training ground for students. Apply at apply.dailycal.org.

Name: Dance Games at Berkeley üíô
Description: Dance Games at Berkeley exists to foster a community around and through arcade style dance games like Dance Dance Revolution, Pump It Up, and In the Groove. The club also owns and operates the Dance Dance Revolution machine in the Cal Esports Community Center.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: A club for the community around and through arcade style dance games like Dance Dance Revolution, Pump It Up, and In the Groove at UC Berkeley.

Name: Dance Marathon üíô
Description: An entirely non-profit, student-run enterprise, the Children‚Äôs Miracle Network‚Äôs Dance Marathon has raised upwards of $350,000,000 for children‚Äôs hospitals nationwide since its founding in 1991. Consisting of hours of dancing, live entertainment, educational activities and speakers, themed activities, food, and exciting contests and prizes, Dance Marathon is unlike any other event on campus. In our first year holding Dance Marathon starting in the 2022-23 academic year, we raised $33,125 and won Best New Dance Marathon in the Country at the Children‚Äôs Miracle Network Dance Marathon Leadership Conference. Coupling a lively social event with a highly relevant and worthy cause, Dance Marathon continues to attract a growing number of students. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g8xMbvAu5W0
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Dance Marathon is a yearlong fundraising campaign that unites the Berkeley community by hosting events and raising awareness and funds for the UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital as part of the Children‚Äôs Miracle Network.

Name: Danceworx
Description: Danceworx was founded in 1988 and is the oldest student-run dance group on the UC Berkeley campus. For over 30 years, we have been providing students with a creative outlet to choreograph, dance, and perform in a fun and supportive environment. Dancers are selected at the beginning of each semester and practice routines in various styles: Jazz/Contemporary, Open and Tap. Throughout the semester, we host social events such as movie nights, Mentorship Activities, workshops in a variety of styles and our End of the Semester Banquet so our dancers can get to know each other better. Each semester culminates in an evening showcase in Zellerbach Hall where dancers are able to show the pieces they have been working on throughout the semester. Our showcases attract over 500 attendees each semester and also feature guest performances from campus and local community groups to foster unity and promote diversity among UC Berkeley‚Äôs performing arts community. Danceworx also performs at campus and local events. If you would like Danceworx to perform at one of your events, please contact our Outreach Chair (dwxoutreach@gmail.com). Like us on Facebook! facebook.com/danceworx Follow us on Instagram! https://www.instagram.com/dwxberkeley/ For more information, please visit: dwx.berkeley.edu
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: The purpose of Danceworx is to provide an outlet for dancers to perform, as well as an opportunity for dancers to learn and improve technique in a fun and supportive environment!

Name: Data Science Society at Berkeley
Description: Data Science Society at Berkeley is UC Berkeley's first student-run, not-for-profit organization focused on data science and its interdisciplinary applications. Since our founding in 2016, we have united students from a wide range of disciplines behind our shared passion for all things data. Our mission is to foster a strong data science community on campus by advocating data science education and practice through our various committees and internal and external programs. Our educational and consulting initiatives have impacted hundreds of students in a variety of majors across campus and given them the technical and soft skills needed to thrive in a data-driven world.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Founded in 2016, Data Science Society at Berkeley is UC Berkeley's first student-run organization focused on data science and its interdisciplinary applications.

Name: DataGood at Berkeley
Description: DataGood at Berkeley is UC Berkeley‚Äôs first student-run organization dedicated to tackling socio-economic issues with data science. It was established with the understanding that there is a need to make data science accessible for organizations in the social good sector ‚Äî the ones that need it the most. We are a passionate group of undergraduate students conscious about wielding our skills for progress and inciting action. We are focused on creating an outlet for students to learn and utilize their data science and software development skills in meaningful impact-driven sectors. Our members are able to learn data science techniques and principles through our Research track and apply these skills through our Industry track.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: DataGood at Berkeley is Berkeley's first organization dedicated to tackling socioeconomic issues with data science. We are focused on creating an outlet for students to learn and utilize their data science skills in meaningful impact driven sectors.

Name: DataStory
Description: Welcome to DataStory, a premier student-run organization dedicated to providing top-notch consulting services in the fields of data science and software development. Our club is committed to helping businesses and organizations harness the power of data to make informed decisions and drive meaningful results. We also provide our members with multiple sources of professional development and opportunities, through workshops, case competitions, and speaker panels. Information about our Fall 2025 Recruitment Cycle will come out in mid-August.Feel free to reach out to our current leadership with any questions!President: Katie Zhang; katiezhang@berkeley.edu Internal Vice Presidents: Mason Borgerding; masonborgerding@berkeley.edu & Nikhil Rajgopal; nikhil_rajgopal@berkeley.edu External Vice President: Pulak Dugar; pdugar2@berkeley.edu
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage
Summary: As data science emerges as one of the most in-demand professions today, DataStory provides an environment for students to get a taste of what a future in the industry would look like.

Name: Datong Society of China Studies at Berkeley
Description: Datong Society of China Studies at Berkeley is a student group that aims to facilitate events and discussions on historical and social issues of China and connect students with these interests. We organize seminars, film screenings, and reading sessions to discuss and analyze popular topics in China studies. We strive to utilize the knowledge and resources on campus and beyond to help the Cal community have a better understanding of the culture, politics, and history of China.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Datong Society of China Studies at Berkeley is a student group that aims to facilitate events and discussions on historical and social issues of China and connect students with these interests.

Name: Debate Society of Berkeley
Description: The largest academic debate organization at the University of California, Berkeley. We compete internationally in the British Parliamentary format, an event featuring four teams of two persons that engage each other through a series of seven-minute speeches interspersed with questions. On the national level, our team competes within the American Parliamentary Debate Association‚Äîthe oldest intercollegiate debating association in the United States. Our teams consistently compete in the national and world championships, traveling to the Netherlands, Mexico, and South Africa. At home, we coach and judge for local high schools, support Bay Area tournaments, and organize two competitions of our own.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The premier parliamentary debate organization at the University of California, Berkeley. We compete in the American Parliamentary (APDA) and British Parliamentary (BP) formats.

Name: DeCadence
Description: DeCadence ("deh-KAY-dence") is a student-run, all-inclusive a cappella group at the University of California, Berkeley. We perform in several public concerts each semester and are available for private events. Wanna check us out? You can find us singing under Sather Gate every Wednesday at noon!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: DeCadence ("deh-KAY-dence") is a student-run, co-ed a cappella group at UC Berkeley that loves to add some music and fun to your day. We sing indie, pop, jazz, and any other genre that comes our way. Find us singing under Sather Gate Wednesdays at noon!

Name: Deewani
Description: The primary mission of Deewani is female empowerment through competitive dance and to perform high energy dances combining many different styles of Indian dance with an emphasis on Bollywood dance in a fusion style.
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The primary mission of Deewani is female empowerment through competitive dance and to perform high energy dances combining many different styles of Indian dance with an emphasis on Bollywood dance in a fusion style.

Name: Defenders at Berkeley (Formerly Criminal Defense Society) üíô
Description: The purpose of Defenders at Berkeley is to provide Berkeley Law students with a supportive community and opportunities to learn about indigent defense careers through both networking and discussions about important topics in indigent defense. This group Defenders at Berkeley was formerly named Criminal Defense Society- 9/3/20 IZ (PLC)
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of Defenders at Berkeley is to provide Berkeley Law students with a supportive community and opportunities to learn about indigent defense careers through both networking and discussions about important topics in indigent defense.

Name: Delta Consulting
Description: Delta Consulting was created based on an understanding that an organization that is able to bridge students‚Äô technical coursework and skills with an educational passion does not yet exist. Under this shared passion, our organization brings students from diverse backgrounds, from history and urban studies to EECS majors, together in a space where they can bridge classroom technical knowledge with real-life applications in the education sector. We recognize that there is already an abundance of consulting organizations present on our campus, however, our organization is the only consulting organization focused solely on the education sector. We consult for a wide array of educational organizations, from Educational Technology platforms to non-profit organizations and school districts. Through this niche focus on education and our commitment to inclusion, we believe that our organization can create unique contributions to the Berkeley Student Organization space.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Delta Consulting's mission is to help organizations build the future of equitable, accessible, and empowering educational platforms by crafting innovative solutions for long-term impact.

Name: Delta Delta Delta
Description: Our founders envisioned a women‚Äôs fraternity that would inspire the ideals of truth, self-sacrifice and friendship. Tri Delta‚Äôs Purpose keeps those values alive with our members today. LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT Whether serving as officers or participating in a chapter‚Äôs educational programming, our members are offered the support and opportunity to grow as leaders. There are four areas of growth that Tri Delta‚Äôs leadership education focuses on: organizational growth, intrapersonal growth, interpersonal growth and professional growth. Throughout the collegiate experience, Tri Delta‚Äôs members will attain core competencies and skill development in each of these areas. SCHOLARSHIP Tri Delta understands that its members are college women first, and part of Tri Delta‚Äôs Purpose is to broaden the moral and intellectual lives of members. Whether by providing scholarship funds through the Foundation to assist with educational costs, or by promoting academic success through a chapter‚Äôs Academic Excellence Initiative, Tri Delta offers encouragement and support to collegiate members as they pursue academic achievement. PHILANTHROPY Members of Tri Delta have a long history of supporting children‚Äôs cancer charities at the local level with local children‚Äôs hospitals and at the national level with our philanthropic partner, St. Jude Children‚Äôs Research Hospital. The Fraternity and its chapters also consistently provide opportunities to raise funds to support the Tri Delta Foundation. This emphasis on philanthropy and service allows our members to develop qualities of unselfish leadership and assume the highest responsibilities of college women. MEMBER DEVELOPMENT As part of the collegiate chapter experience, Tri Delta members will participate in multi-dimensional ‚Äì ‚Äú3D‚Äù ‚Äì educational and leadership programs designed to inspire them to Live, Learn and Lead in accordance with Tri Delta‚Äôs Purpose. Over the course of the collegiate experience, Tri Deltas enjoy a host of opportunities for personal growth and development while building lifelong friendships.
Categories: CalGreeks Panhellenic Council (PHC) Sororities
Summary: Tri Delta is a perpetual bond of friendship that promises lifelong sisterhood and a network of support. Through our innovative educational and leadership programs, Tri Delta provides its members with personal, professional and leadership development.

Name: Delta Epsilon Mu Inc. (Alpha Psi Chapter)
Description: Delta Epsilon Mu is the nation's premier Professional Pre-Health All-Inclusive Fraternity! Our organization works with pre-health students across medicine, dentistry, nursing, psychology, veterinary studies, and more. As a unique asset to prestigious universities across the United States, we strive to employ our principles of dedication, loyalty, friendship and support in all of our efforts. From educational programs to fundraising, to community service, members of Delta Epsilon Mu participate in a diverse set of activities. Our network is comprised of individuals of all backgrounds to produce a strong community of well-rounded students and professionals. This national organization provides students and the community with a non-judgmental, inclusive resource for uniting professionals across the health fields and "Helping People Together."
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Delta Epsilon Mu is a Professional Pre-Health Co-Ed Fraternity. We focus on diversity and work with students who are interested in various pre-health professional tracks. We strive to uphold our four pillars of loyalty, dedication, friendship, and suppor

Name: Delta Gamma
Description: Delta Gamma offers women of all ages a rich heritage baded upon the ideals of personal integrity, philanthropy, intellectual honesty and above all, Doing Good. Our primary purpose is to foster ideals of friendship, promote educational and cultural interests, create a true sense of social responsibility, and develop the finest qualities of character. Through our membership, we have all made close and lasting friendships, gained a widespread support system, and found a second home. DG offers a study buddy, a friend with whom to go on any adventure, and a confidant. As DGs, we applaud each other's successes, and help each other through individual struggles. Our chapter is made up of women of diverse individual talents, goals, and achievements brought together by a commitment to unwavering and unconditional friendship The Delta Gamma Foundation fosters lifetime enrichment for members, promotes Service for Sight, and partners with the Fraternity to ensure the future of our sisterhood. Service for Sight has been at the heart of Delta Gamma‚Äôs philanthropic mission since 1936. The Delta Gamma Foundation has given over $2,800,000 in Service for Sight grants to organizations and schools that share the Foundation‚Äôs mission: to promote sight preservation and assistance to children and adults who are blind or visually impaired. Service for Sight supports the four schools founded by Delta Gammas for the visually impaired and other North American organizations that promote sight preservation and provide assistance to children and adults who are blind or visually impaired. This philanthropy has been at the heart of the Delta Gamma mission since 1936 when a member who was blind, Ruth Billow, Eta-Akron, petitioned members to adopt "Aid to the Blind" as our official philanthropy.
Categories: CalGreeks Panhellenic Council (PHC) Sororities
Summary: Delta Gamma

Name: Delta Kappa Alpha
Description: Established March 16, 1936, Delta Kappa Alpha is a National, Gender-Inclusive, Professional Cinema Fraternity for cinematic arts students of character. As a National organization with over 75 years of history and alumni, our members are connected to the top cinema students from top cinema schools at universities such as Cornell, USC, NYU, UCLA, Chapman University, UT Austin, Columbia University, and many others. DKA is grounded in timeless personal and professional values and principles, and as an organization, our vision is to be recognized as the premier institute of upstanding entertainment industry leaders.
