Not exclusive to film studies majors, DKA welcomes all gender identities, undergraduates and graduates, who are dedicated to fostering lifelong character, collaborative and creative storytelling, ethical and productive business practices, philanthropic action, and fraternal bonds by and between students of the cinematic arts.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: The mission of Delta Kappa Alpha is to foster lifelong character, collaborative and creative storytelling, ethical and productive business practices, philanthropic action, and fraternal bonds by and between students of the cinematic arts.

Name: Delta Phi Epsilon Co-ed Professional Foreign Service Fraternity
Description: Delta Phi Epsilon is UC Berkeley‚Äôs Premier Professional Foreign Service and International Relations fraternity. Our membership is gender-inclusive and comprises of individuals with a diverse array of personal backgrounds, lived experiences, academic interests, and career trajectories. What unites us is our shared passion towards international affairs, our commitment to serve the international community, and our efforts to pursue international careers. Our Motto: Latreuo (I serve). Our Mission: To build an extensive network of members across all disciplines and backgrounds To explore and prepare for all types of careers concerning international affairs and engagement with complex global issues To become educated and informed students of international relations by studying, sharing, and debating current events To engage in the international community through charity and service What We Do: Host a bimonthly professional speaker series Offer intimate networking opportunities Provide academic and career advising to our members Conduct professional development workshops Facilitate debates among students Organize campus-wide events Reach out to the local community by arranging philanthropic events Engage with our extensive network of alumni and active members at other top tier universities around the country Learn more at dpe.berkeley.edu
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Cal's Only Foreign Service and International Affairs Co-ed Fraternity

Name: Delta Sigma
Description: While our name is novel, this sorority maintains the strong sisterhood of Sigma chapter that has been at the University for over one hundred years. In its founding, the members of Delta Sigma have shown devotion to our values and each other, and have created an organization that embraces change. The compassion and drive of Delta Sigmas extends far beyond our home at 2311 Prospect Street. Delta Sigmas are leaders on campus and in the UC Berkeley Greek community. From Cal‚Äôs cheerleading team, to Berkeley‚Äôs Society of Women Engineers, to the Berkeley Business Society, to Cal‚Äôs Campus Ambassador program, you can find our members in leadership positions in over 100 campus organizations. As a chapter, we‚Äôve achieved one of the highest G.P.A. ranks, exceeding the all-campus average, all-women average, and the all-PHC-Greek average. In addition to supporting our sisters in their diverse extracurricular involvements, we love going out together for football games and pep rallies, hosting philanthropy fundraisers, and attending formal social events in San Francisco! You can spot us having Friday morning brunch on our deck enjoying the beautiful place we call home! Check out our website, Instagram, and TikTok @caldeltasigma
Categories: CalGreeks Panhellenic Council (PHC) Sororities
Summary: Welcome to Delta Sigma at the University of California Berkeley! Delta Sigma Sorority is a local sorority at UC Berkeley that stands for women‚Äôs empowerment, diversity, inclusivity, and courage.

Name: Delta Sigma Phi
Description: Delta Sigma Phi is a national, not-for-profit Fraternity that's helped young men become better for more than a century. Our Fraternity develops strong connections, fosters success in academics, and supports all endeavors members wish to embark on.
Categories: CalGreeks Interfraternity Council (IFC) Fraternities
Summary: Delta Sigma Phi is a national Fraternity that's helped build great men for over 100 years. Delta Sig welcomes all interested in developing long lasting connections and building strong character.

Name: Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc.
Description: Delta Sigma Theta Sorority Incorporated founded on January 13th, 1913 on the campus of Howard University, is a public service organization based on the principles of sisterhood, scholarship, and service; committed to the constructive development of its members and to service of the Black community. Delta Sigma Theta Sorority Inc., Kappa Chapter was chartered on the campus of the University of California, Berkeley on February 21, 1921. It is the first historically Black Greek Letter Organization at the University of California, Berkeley, and the first historically Black sorority chartered west of the Rocky Mountains. For more than 100 years, this public service organization has served this campus, the Bay Area, and the state of California.
Categories: CalGreeks National Pan-Hellenic Council (NPHC) Fraternities & Sororities
Summary: Delta Sigma Theta Sorority Incorporated is a public service organization based on the principles of sisterhood, scholarship, and service.

Name: Delta Upsilon
Description: Delta Upsilon Fraternity was founded in 1834 upon the basis of non-secrecy, meaning we hold nothing secret: all of our rituals, initiations, and principles are open to the public. We now stand as the oldest and largest non-secret fraternity, and have grown into an organization that focuses on providing our men with a unique college experience, one grounded in our four founding principles of the Promotion of Friendship, Development of Character, Diffusion of Liberal Culture, and the Advancement of Justice. We accomplish this through a variety of educational programming opportunities, including our Leadership Institute, held annually in a different city across the country; the Winter Educational Conference held every January in Indianapolis; the Global Service Initiative, which sends a group of our undergraduate men to Jamaica where they spend a week doing service work; and staff- and volunteer-run Regional Leadership Seminars.
Categories: CalGreeks Interfraternity Council (IFC) Fraternities
Summary: Delta Upsilon is the premier men's fraternity committed to Building Better Men for a global society through service, leadership development and lifelong personal growth of our diverse membership. Berkeley Chapter founded in 1896. Rush DU!

Name: DeTrash@Berkeley üíô
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of our organization is to clean up the campus and its surrounding environment by organizing regular trash cleanup events, to help achieve Berkeley‚Äôs zero-waste goals, and unite like-minded students.

Name: Diaspora Magazine
Description: DIASPORA is an Afrocentric arts, style & culture magazine made for and by Black UC Berkeley students. We aspire to curate a safe and expressive space for Black creatives to share their artwork, interests, and genius with each other and the greater campus community in digital and print formats.
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: Diaspora Magazine serves to provide a safe space for Black students to express creativity through journalism and art. We aim to amplify Black voices and share those perspectives with the broader campus community.

Name: Digital Illustration and Concept Art at Berkeley üíô
Description: DICA @ Cal is for artists of all levels and backgrounds. We host both online and in-person events where you can share your work, grow your skills, and meet other creatives. It's a space to pause and take a break from the academic grind. While digital art brings us together, DICA's really here as a chance for you to find your community at Cal‚Äîaiming to build friendships that last beyond the classroom and a walk across the graduation stage.
Categories: Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: A space for artists of all levels to connect and explore their interests in digital illustration and concept art.

Name: Dil Se
Description: Dil Se is UC Berkeley's premier south-Asian acapella group. Our unique music combines the melody-based raagas of Hindi film music with the depth and harmony that drive western music to create a fresh perspective on the tradition of a cappella. The group consists of a diverse group of accomplished singers, from years of Hindustani and Carnatic music, to Western Classical and Jazz Choirs. Dil Se has toured across California, and established themselves as one of the best Indian-fusion a cappella groups in the state. Each song entertains audiences with a well-rounded performance that emanates Dil Se -- "from the heart."
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: UC Berkeley's Premier South Asian Acapella Team

Name: Disability Justice Coalition at Berkeley Law (Formerly known as Disabled Students Association at Berkeley üíô)
Description: Our organization aims to provide a space for Berkeley Law students to learn about and advocate for disability justice, to facilitate access to resources and accommodations, and to foster a supportive space for disabled students to find community and mentorship. This group Disability Justice Coalition at Berkeley Law was formerly named Disabled Students Association at Berkeley - [8/26] [AP]
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Disability Justice Coalition at Berkeley Law (Formerly known as Disabled Students Association at Berkeley üíô) aims to foster a supportive community where disabled students at Berkeley Law receive mentorship and facilitate access to resources.

Name: DiversaTech
Description: DiversaTech is a student-run consultancy that works with companies such as Airbnb, Adidas, PayPal, and Snackpass on impactful projects. From developing content strategy for edtech startups to ideating new features for popular social media apps, our members continuously explore new skill sets and industry challenges. At DiversaTech, we see tech differently - we believe that the most innovative solutions arise from diversity of thought, and strongly encourage people of all majors and backgrounds to apply. No prior technical or consulting experience is required!
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: DiversaTech is a student-led tech consulting organization at UC Berkeley. We form interdisciplinary teams of dedicated undergraduates to deliver innovative, practical, and actionable recommendations addressing our clients‚Äô most pressing needs.

Name: Diversity and Inclusion in Real Estate
Description: DAIRE's goal is to introduce industry tools and resources within real estate to individuals without any prior real estate experience. It's targeted primarily to mixed individuals who are searching for these opportunities and also provides those with a real estate background with a forum to refine and expand their knowledge, and expose those students to industry professionals, real-world projects, and on-campus events. DAIRE offers a wider range of activities for members, including professional development workshops, a real estate education series, investment opportunities, and speaker events.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: DAIRE's mission is to provide a unique hands-on experience for Underrepresented Minorities to learn about real estate through both our education series and junior member education series in which it teaches students how to evaluate REITs.

Name: Down Syndrome Community Outreach at Berkeley
Description: The purpose of our organization is to assist the Down Syndrome Clinic at UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital by volunteering in clinic, compiling resources, and creating a community for patients and their families through various projects. We also aim to educate the public and raise awareness about Down Syndrome.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The purpose of our organization is to assist the Down Syndrome Clinic at UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital by volunteering in clinic, compiling resources, and creating a community for patients and their families through various projects.

Name: Drawn to Scale
Description: Drawn to Scale (casually known as DtS) is a co-ed a cappella group at UC Berkeley. Founded in 2008, the group is now celebrating its 15th anniversary as part of the musical community on campus. DtS boasts an ever expanding student-arranged repertoire spanning from contemporary pop to musical theater to R&B to indie rock. They have appeared at various showcases, local performances across the Bay Area, ICCA, and, of course, weekly performances every Friday at Noon under Sather Gate. Check them out at drawntoscale.berkeley.edu or facebook.com/dtsacappella for information regarding auditions, performances, and more!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We are a co-ed, competitive a cappella group that focuses on a diverse range of musical pieces and arrangements, performing at service and community events in and around UC Berkeley. We love to sing!

Name: Dutch Student Association at Berkeley üíô
Description: The Dutch Student Association at Berkeley is a community for anyone interested in Dutch culture, heritage, and language‚Äîwhether you're from the Netherlands or just curious about the culture! We host fun social events, cultural activities, and movie nights where you can connect with others who share an interest in all things Dutch.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Dutch Student Association at Berkeley is a club to appreciate Dutch heritage and culture through social events and cultural activities.

Name: Earthquake Engineering Research Institute at Berkeley üíô
Description: The EERI Berkeley Student Chapter is promoting students' education regarding earthquake risk reduction through organized seminars with various invited lecturers from the fields of earthquake engineering, including professionals and researchers. The chapter promotes minimizing the gap between the community‚Äôs understanding of the impacts of earthquakes and the profession's assumptions on the acceptable losses after a seismic event. This is done through community outreach programs for children and the general population. The Chapter is also proud to include the undergraduate seismic design competition group that represents UC Berkeley in the annual EERI seismic design competition.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The EERI Berkeley Student Chapter is promoting earthquake engineering research and devotes itself to improving the community‚Äôs understanding of the impacts of earthquakes on society.

Name: East Asian Union
Description: East Asian Union is a pan-Asian organization that aims to unite and promote Asian culture to the broader Berkeley community. We aim to provide a medium for cross-cultural exchanges as well as a platform of support for intra and inter-club endeavors through our semesterly Asian Night Market on campus.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: East Asian Union is a pan-Asian organization that aims to unite and promote Asian culture to the broader Berkeley community. We aim to provide a medium for cross-cultural exchanges as well as a platform of support for intra and inter-club endeavors

Name: Ecology Law Quarterly
Description: ELQ provides a forum for environmental scholarship through publication of high-quality writing by scholars, practitioners, and students. At Berkeley Law, ELQ represents and advocates for the environmental law community, sustains and strengthens the environmental law program, encourages student writing, and fosters a diverse, welcoming, and inclusive social and academic community.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Ecology Law Quarterly is the oldest and premier journal on environmental law and policy. ELQ provides fresh insight and analysis from leading authors and scholars on critical environmental affairs.

Name: Effective Altruists of Berkeley üíô
Description: Effective Altruism is a global community of scholars, philosophers, scientists, and activists who are trying to use evidence and reason to help answer one basic question: "What is the best way to use our time, talent, money, and voices to improve the world as much as possible?" We aim to make not just a difference, but the most difference. Effective Altruism at UC Berkeley is a local chapter of the broader Effective Altruism movement. Our primary goal at EAB is to support Berkeley students to make helping others effectively an important part of their lives and give them the resources to do it well. Among other things, we: Discuss the most pressing problems of our time and the most promising solutions that researchers have found Host guest lectures by researchers, nonprofit leaders, and entrepreneurs, from around the world Create networking opportunities and connect members to engaging, high impact projects and internships Support and counsel anyone who's considering the kind of strong, intimidating commitments that are often necessary to make to have an outsized impact: deciding on a career, researching effective charities, quantifying our impact, and more. As students at one of the best universities in the world, we have a tremendous opportunity to steer the course of the future by carefully planning what we want to care about, where we want to give, and what we want to do with our lives. Learn more about us at our website, eaberkeley.com. If you‚Äôre interested in what we do, you can book a free impactful career advising call, sign up for our newsletter, or join our Slack. We're most active on Slack -- we'd love to see you there! Our current board members are: - Jeremy Pan - Co-president - Ian Habich - Co-president - Mario Fontes - Advisor
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: How do we use our giving to do the most good? How about our volunteering, or activism, or future careers? EAB aims to provide the resources and expertise to help everyone at Cal answer these questions and put their most ambitious plans into action.

Name: Eggster Organization üíô
Description: Eggster Organization's mission is to nurture the creativity, curiosity, and welfare of Bay Area youth! Our annual event is held at the UC Berkeley campus and is a one-day carnival of fun and learning, open to all for free. We bring the community together by integrating local businesses, reaching out to nearby schools, and collaborating with Cal students. The purpose of Eggster is to plan an annual free egg hunt and learning festival for Bay Area children and families, to expose children to the Berkeley campus and encourage pursuit of higher education, and to provide funds to support programs in the Bay Area centered around youth and education. If you're interested in joining our team, finding a close-knit community of passionate individuals, and outreaching to our Bay Area community, email us! Follow our Facebook, Instagram or Website page for more information and updates! ‚Ä¢ Facebook: Eggster at Berkeley ‚Ä¢ Instagram: @eggsteratcal ‚Ä¢ Website: eggster.org
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Eggster is a nonprofit student organization located in Berkeley that hosts the largest annual egg hunt and learning festival in the Bay Area. We aim to provide exposure to higher education to young kids in a free, accessible event.

Name: Electrical Engineering Graduate Student Association
Description: EEGSA is an organization serving the Electrical Engineering Masters and PhD students in UC Berkeley. Our primary mission is to provide support, resources, and service to the graduate student community in EECS and to the broader East Bay community.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Provide support, resources, and service to the graduate student community in the Electrical Engineering Department, including limited service as a liaison if an issue between the Department and Student arises.

Name: Electrochemical Society, Student Chapter of Berkeley
Description: The purpose of the organization is to spread interest in electrochemistry and provide a forum through which students and researchers may share expertise and build personal connections. The Electrochemical Society, Student Chapter of Berkeley will provide members with educational opportunities to prepare members for future success in a variety of related fields. Membership is open to any individual who has an interest in electrochemistry. Registration with the national parent organization, Electrochemical Society, is strongly encouraged though not required. There are no academic restrictions for membership for University students.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The purpose of the organization is to spread interest in electrochemistry and provide a forum through which students and researchers may share expertise and build personal connections.

Name: Eleven: The Undergraduate Journal of Sociology üíô
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Eleven: The Undergraduate Journal of Sociology publishes sociological work written by national and international undergraduates. We offer membership to our editorial, PR and creative teams to take part in the publishing and promotion process.

Name: Elite Hospice Outreach
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Give opportunities to interact with patients at end of life care, through meaningful/holistic measures. While learning Hospice care, inducing mental health/Bereaved psychosocial approaches, for oneself enduring life changes and the patients we serve.

Name: EnableTech
Description: Our Mission: EnableTech aims to design, prototype, and manufacture assistive technologies for project partners from Berkeley and the surrounding communities. Our goal is for engineering students to collaborate with designers, public health students, business students, and anyone else who can offer insight into the development of assistive technology projects. We are working with the Disabled Students Union and Disabled Students Program to see what the Berkeley community needs in order to improve their ease of access. Students can choose from one of these projects, or they can start their own assistive technology project. We provide space, materials, and group peers to turn their idea into a prototype, then into a product that could improve the lives of people with similar disabilities in the world.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We design and build hardware and software to address challenges faced by people with disabilities in Berkeley and the world at large. Our students collaborate with project partners to turn ideas into solutions that could improve the lives of many people.

Name: End Overdose at Berkeley
Description: 1. Work with the Los Angeles-based non-profit to prevent drug-related overdose deaths in the UCB community and beyond through education, medical intervention, and public awareness. 2. Make resources and education that prevent overdose deaths readily accessible in the UCB community and beyond. 3. Provide preventative (fentanyl test strips) and responsive (Narcan/naloxone) overdose tools to the UCB community and beyond. 4. Educate members of the UCB community and beyond through presentations to individuals and organizations. 5. Promote public awareness of drug-related overdose deaths through the use of social media.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: END OVERDOSE is a non-profit organization working to end drug-related overdose deaths through education, medical intervention, and public awareness. Our chapter is committed to educate and equip UC Berkeley students & Berkeley community as a whole.

Name: Engineering and Project Management Society üíô
Description: The Engineering and Project Management Society (EPMS) at UC Berkeley is dedicated to educating, promoting, and connecting students with industry professionals in the AEC industry. EPMS is affiliated with the Associated General Contractors (AGC) and the Construction Management Association of America (CMAA). Our goals are: 1. To help members better understand the nature of the construction industry and the role of construction contractors. 2. To cooperate with the university officials and the local AGC and CMAA chapters in sponsoring meetings, field trips and other events of interest to the student members. 3. To promote both scholarship and fellowship among the members of the Society.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Engineering and Project Management Society at UC Berkeley is dedicated to educating, promoting, and connecting students with industry professionals in the Architectural, Engineering and Construction (AEC) industry.

Name: Engineering Solutions at Berkeley
Description: Engineering Solutions at Berkeley (ESB) is a student-run, non-profit hardware technology consulting organization, dedicated to creating cost-efficient, reliable, sustainable, and high-quality mechanical solutions for its clients. ESB aims to work with companies and non-profit organizations to creatively find ways to improve efficiency in the workplace, solve independent mechanical engineering challenges, and prototype and test solutions.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: ESB provides a unique opportunity for technically-minded individuals to acquire practical, hands-on experience solving challenges faced in industry during the academic year. Our core values lie in academic excellence, professionalism, and camaraderie.

Name: Engineering Student Council üíô
Description: The Engineering Student Council's mission is to represent the engineering student body; support engineering societies in reaching their full potential; and promote a diverse community through successful collaboration between students, faculty, societies.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA - Budgeted over $7500 Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Engineering Student Council represents the engineering student body; supporting engineering societies in reaching their full potential; and promoting a diverse community through successful collaboration between students, faculty, societies.

Name: Engineers and Mentors of Berkeley
Description: BEAM is a student run organization that develops and teaches hands-on science and engineering activities to K-8 grade levels at local schools. Our goal is to make science and engineering more approachable and encourage students to pursue classes and careers in STEM-related fields. We train college students to be effective mentors, role models, and leaders in their community. As students ourselves, we understand that the best way to learn is to teach. Berkeley students earn course credit while improving their mentoring skills.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Teach hands-on science and engineering lessons to local elementary and middle schools! All majors welcome!

Name: Engineers Without Borders at Berkeley üíô
Description: We are looking for students from all majors and backgrounds who are passionate about bringing sustainable engineering solutions to communities locally and globally. Please visit our website for more information!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The UC Berkeley Chapter of Engineers Without Borders works with diverse communities to develop sustainable engineering solutions that meet basic health and sanitation needs.

Name: English Undergraduate Association üíô
Description: The English Undergraduate Association (EUA) is an academic and social organization that serves all undergraduates interested in the study of English language and literature. The goal of the EUA is to provide a forum for students to participate actively in the English major on the Berkeley campus. We exist as a liaison between students and the English Department. The EUA works to facilitate working academic relationships between professors and the student body, as well as to encourage social interaction between faculty and students. We exist to strengthen the connection between UC Berkeley students and the local literary community. To stay in the loop, sign-up for our newsletter and join our Discord Server.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The English Undergraduate Association (EUA) is an academic and social organization that serves all undergraduates interested in the study of English language and literature. EUA is a forum for students to actively participate on the Berkeley campus.

Name: Entomology Students' Organization
Description: The Entomology Students Organization (ESO) is hosted by the Department of Environmental Science Policy and Management, but represents graduate students from various departments, all with an interest in insects. ESO provides peer-academic support for the entomology community through hosting workshops and events and making connections between researchers working on different areas of arthropod science. We also participate in public outreach and events such as Cal Day and Darwin Day. In addition, we co-host the Essig Brunch weekly seminar series, along with the Essig Museum of Entomology.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The Entomology Students Organization (ESO) is hosted by the Department of Environmental Science Policy and Management, but represents approximately 30 graduate students from various departments, all with an interest in insects.

Name: Entrepreneur Through Acquisition Club üíô
Description: The Entrepreneurship Through Acquisition (ETA) Club at Berkeley is a community for students interested in acquiring and operating small-to-medium businesses as a path to entrepreneurship. We support students exploring ETA models such as traditional search funds, self-funded searches, and permanent capital holdcos. Our mission is to empower aspiring entrepreneurs with the tools, knowledge, and network to become successful business owners by acquiring existing companies. We host events featuring experienced searchers, operators, investors, and faculty, and provide practical training in deal sourcing, due diligence, capital raising, and post-acquisition operations. The club is open to undergraduate and graduate students from all disciplines, especially those with interest in private equity, small business ownership, or long-term operating careers.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The ETA Club is dedicated to educate the Haas community on entrepreneurship through acquisition and empower future business owners with a network of searchers, investors and current operators.

Name: Entrepreneurs @ Berkeley
Description: Entrepreneurs @ Berkeley is UC Berkeley's premier entrepreneurial organization, dedicated to providing students with the resources they need to launch startups and develop innovative solutions. Our mission is to serve a diverse range of clients, both established companies and fast-growing startups, while fostering a vibrant community for idea exchange and deep understanding of the startup ecosystem. We focus on nurturing entrepreneurial-minded individuals, providing them with practical experience, industry insights, and a robust network to propel their ventures. Visit Our Website!
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We empower students to become founders by building startups from ground up and partnering with established companies on innovative projects. We foster a community of creative thinkers through hands-on experience, VC networking, and dynamic collaboration.

Name: Environmental Engineering Advocacy Team
Description: Environmental Engineering Advocacy Team (EEAT) represents all graduate students within the environmental engineering program in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering. EEAT aims to provide a voice for students in issues related to program requirements, coursework, recruitment, faculty searches, and events related to the department. EEAT serves as a bridge between students and faculty members so that student concerns and feedback are more clearly understood and considered at the departmental level.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: EEAT aims to provide a voice for environmental engineering grad students in issues related to program requirements, coursework, recruitment, faculty searches, and events related to the department. EEAT serves as a bridge between students and faculty.

Name: Environmental Health Sciences Graduate Students
Description: The purpose of EHGS is to provide a forum for graduate students in Environmental Health to share ideas about advancements and growth of the division, form collaborations with students and faculty, and to promote environmental health sciences interests. A major objective of EHGS is to promote environmental health interests within the School of Public Health- where there are many diverse interests and paths to promoting human health. One primary way EHGS will promote Environmental Health is by orchestrating the annual Environmental Health Symposium where current graduate student research is highlighted. Our ultimate goal is to develop a safe and inclusive space for EHS students by promoting community, diversity, and inclusivity among students in the School of Public Health.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The purpose of EHGS is to provide a forum for graduate students in Environmental Health to share ideas about advancements and growth of the division, form collaborations with students and faculty, and to promote environmental health sciences interests.

Name: Environmental Sciences Student Association üíô
Description: ESSA's main goal is to bring students interested in the environment together in a fun, academic, and social atmosphere. Membership is open to all UC Berkeley students. We organize guest speakers, workshops, nature hikes, book clubs, and much more! When possible, we also plan semesterly camping trips. If you would like to join our email list, please log into your Berkeley email to view and fill out the following form: https://forms.gle/kHtyjG2iNgAWUB7aA
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: ESSA aims to join environmental enthusiasts together in a fun, academic, and social atmosphere. Membership is open to all UC Berkeley students!

Name: Environmental Team üíô
Description: The Cal Environmental Team (Cal Enviro) is a civil engineering competition team that participates in the annual water treatment competition at the ASCE Mid-Pacific Student Conference (Mid-Pac). The goal of Cal Enviro is to impart the fundamentals of wastewater treatment and sustainable engineering design, give hands-on laboratory and construction experience, and provide opportunities for students to improve their public speaking and technical writing skills. During the school year, relevant knowledge and skills will be developed as the team works toward placing in Water Treatment at Mid-Pac. Every year before Mid-Pac, teams are given a new scenario, wastewater recipe, material's list, and target water quality parameters. The team designs and practices constructing water filters from household materials. After a filtration system (including chemical treatment) has been finalized, the team also prepares a technical presentation, report, and poster--all of which are major components of the Mid-Pac scoring system. If you're interested in exploring water treatment practices, engineering design, or developing important presentation and technical report skills, you can contact us at calenviroteam@gmail.com or visit our instagram page @calenviro for more information.Cal Environmental Team is sponsored by the Civil and Environmental Engineering Department. Course credit available.
Categories: Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Cal Enviro is a civil engineering competition team that participates in the annual water treatment competition at the ASCE Mid-Pacific Student Conference. Students taking the class will learn fundamentals of wastewater treatment and engineering design.

Name: Epsilon Eta
Description: Epsilon Eta is a gender-inclusive environmental service organization founded in 2017. We offer a community for undergraduate students interested in environmental service and incorporating environmentalism into their careers and everyday lives. Our members come from a variety of disciplines and majors as we aim for interdisciplinary and intersectional environmentalism. We actively promote community resource sharing for academic and professional success in the environmental realm and uplifting our members‚Äô lived experiences. Epsilon Eta is a fraternity with multiple chapters across college campuses in the United States; we are not associated with traditional Greek life. As students of UC Berkeley, we recognize the privilege of our education and access to resources. We understand our role in the colonization of Ohlone land and how we actively benefit from occupying unceded territory. We ground ourselves in the principles of environmental justice. Our goal as an organization is to acknowledge the intersectionality of the climate crisis and use our collective skills to serve UC Berkeley, Bay Area communities, and sites of ongoing environmental concern.
Categories: Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Through establishing connections between students, faculty, researchers, and agencies in the Bay Area, Epsilon Eta seeks to develop a network for those who aspire to make tangible, positive change in the environmental sector.

Name: Epsilon Pi at Berkeley
Description: Epsilon Pi helps students interested in Engineering Physics cultivate the competence, enthusiasm, and social support networks essential to the advancement of the field. We focus on 1) stimulating interest in advanced study and research, 2) developing collegiality among Engineering Physics students, alumni, and faculty members, and 3) promoting public interest in Engineering Physics.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Epsilon Pi is the honor society for Engineering Physics majors at Cal. Run by students, for students, our goal is to facilitate social connections and career exploration within the EP undergraduate community.

Name: Eritrean-Ethiopian Student Association
Description: The Eritrean-Ethiopian Student Association (EESA), also known as the Habesha Club at UC Berkeley, is a vibrant and inclusive student organization dedicated to celebrating and promoting the rich and diverse cultures of Eritrea and Ethiopia, as well as those of the broader diaspora. Our organization was founded with a passion for cultural exchange and community-building, aiming to create a welcoming and supportive environment for both Ethiopian and Eritrean students at UC Berkeley. This group was formerly names Habesha Club at Berkeley [12/14/23][LL]
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations
Summary: To build a community that represent the Habesha community. Habesha means Eritreans, and Ethiopians nationality of people.

Name: ESPM Graduate Diversity Council üíô
Description: The ESPM Graduate Diversity Council is a graduate student group with a vested interest in the continued diversification of the students and faculty of the department of Environmental Science, Policy and Management. We work to increase the presence of underrepresented groups in environmental fields through recruitment and retention efforts including workshops, speakers, special presentations, and mentoring. We are committed to creating and maintaining a community among underrepresented groups in ESPM, while actively promoting and engaging in diversity initiatives in the campus community.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The ESPM Graduate Diversity Council is a graduate student group with a vested interest in the continued diversification of the students and faculty of the department of Environmental Science, Policy and Management.

Name: ESPM Graduate Student Association
Description: We represent the graduate student voice of ESPM both on campus and in the community at large. To do so we organize events and initiatives to benefit the academic and local community, and encourage students to have fun in grad school! See the list of current leadership here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1HWEOYa5nVarKLgthRuhh9EC-tdIZG34zBnF4Y7LfeLs/edit?gid=0#gid=0
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: We represent the graduate students of ESPM and emphasize sharing, support, and celebration while in grad school.

Name: ESPM Graduate Student Research Organizing Committee for the Symposium
Description: The Graduate Student Research Symposium is an annual event showcasing the research outcomes of graduating students in the Environmental Science, Policy & Management Department. This organization plans and implements the event.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: To organize and host the annual Graduate Student Research Symposium dedicated to showcasing graduate student research and facilitating interdisciplinary exchange among divisions and between students and faculty.

Name: Eta Kappa Nu
Description: Eta Kappa Nu (HKN) is the national Electrical and Computer Engineering honor society. The Berkeley chapter is among the most active engineering societies at Berkeley, providing academic services to fellow undergraduates and local STEM outreach.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Eta Kappa Nu (HKN) is the national Electrical and Computer Engineering honor society. The Berkeley chapter is among the most active engineering societies at Berkeley, providing academic services to fellow undergraduates and local STEM outreach.

Name: Eta Omega Chi
Description: Eta Omega Chi is the first and the only East Asian professional fraternity established at UC Berkeley. We strive to build an elite community to share exclusive opportunities and resources, to encourage innovation and leadership, and to further a higher standard of cultural and professional value. Our goals to pursue entrepreneurship and build lifelong brotherhood make us distinctive amongst East Asian student organization across the Bay Area.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Eta Omega Chi is the first East Asian Entrepreneurship Fraternity organized to pursue the spirit of entrepreneurship.

Name: EthiCal Apparel
Description: EthiCal Apparel is a student-run and sustainably-driven social enterprise at UC Berkeley. We provide custom orders of high-quality screen printing and design services on sustainable, ethically-made clothing. In addition, we have our own line of apparel that we design and sell. The majority of our profits are donated to support a new local organization each semester. Our team is comprised of 6 departments: Design; Finance and Operations; Marketing; Sales; Social Good; and Web Development. We handle all operations from strategic planning, customer insights, design, and event planning, to list a few. These opportunities create a unique environment where students stretch their creativity to drive the business forward with their impactful decisions. If you‚Äôre interested in working in a professional business setting to build industry skills and gain real-world experience, we encourage you to keep an eye out for our recruitment at the beginning of each semester. Thank you for checking us out, and please email us at the email below if you have any questions, comments, or concerns!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: EthiCal Apparel is a student-run social enterprise from UC Berkeley that provides high-quality screen printing and free design services on sustainable, ethically-made clothing. We also have our own line of apparel that we design and sell.

Name: Ethnic Studies 5th Account
Description: Brief History The Ethnic Studies 5th Account is a result of the effort from the Third World Liberation Front- the fight for the Ethnic Studies and African American Studies departments at Berkeley. While POC students successfully established their departments, permanent funding was demanded and thus the 5th Account was born! Our Purpose The Ethnic Studies Fifth Account funding is only applicable to student-initiated events that are for the Ethnic Studies (ES) community. Declared students of all ES majors can apply: Ethnic Studies, Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies, African American Studies, Native American Studies, and Chicanx Studies. Maintaining our Mission Our communities historically lack access to financial resources. We ask that those applying take time to reflect on their request and make sure it aligns to serve our Ethnic Studies students and our broader POC communities. For further details on the application process and restrictions on funding, please visit: https://tinyurl.com/5thAccountLogistics Logo Credits: Thank you to Anela Emma Fujiko Akiona (anelauiokalani@berkeley.edu) for creating the artwork of our logo!
Categories: Admin, Campus Departments, ASUC Government Programs
Summary: The Ethnic Studies 5th Account emerged from the Third World Liberation Front's efforts to establish Ethnic Studies and African American Studies departments. POC students demanded permanent funding for their communities; thus, the 5th Account was born

Name: Every Child Plays at Berkeley
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We aim to create a safe, welcoming, and collaborative space for neurodiverse children to develop their social communication skills and make friends through team sports. We want to help families navigate the care of children with autism.

Name: Expanding Your Horizons at Berkeley
Description: Our group is dedicated to hosting an annual "Expanding Your Horizons" (EYH) conference at Berkeley, with the goal of promoting gender diversity in STEM fields (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics). Each spring, we bring several hundred middle school girls to UC Berkeley's campus to participate in a day of hands-on science workshops with both graduate students and professionals. Although our conference is just one day, planning, fundraising, and publicity takes us all year, from the fall to the spring! If you want to find out more, check out our website!
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Our group is dedicated to hosting an annual "Expanding Your Horizons" (EYH) conference at Berkeley. EYH is a non-profit organization that aims to promote female involvement in the STEM fields (science, technology, engineering and mathematics).

Name: Expansion Pictures
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Expansion Pictures is a student organization that supports passion for filmmaking, animation, & cinematic exploration. EP provides an inclusive space for experimentation, discussion & showcase of media. We nurture collaboration & expansion of ideas.

Name: Extended Reality @ Berkeley üíô
Description: Founded in 2015 by a team of visionary undergraduates, Extended Reality @ Berkeley grew to become the largest XR student organization in the world. Our community consists of more than 50 members and 600 alumni, brought together by a common passion to free our experience from the boundaries of perception. As part of our efforts, we train new engineers in all aspects of Virtual and Augmented Reality, raise awareness about our technology‚Äôs potential for humanity, and advance the field through state-of-art research and development initiatives. Visit us at: xr.berkeley.edu.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are the dreamers and makers of the new reality.

Name: EyeChat!
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: EyeChat! provides students with insight about unconventional career paths that exist after graduating from optometry school. We invite guest speakers from industry, research, and alternative fields to share their optometric career experiences.

Name: Faces of African Muslims
Description: The Faces of African Muslims is a student organization committed to providing a safe space for Black students to engage in discussion about the Black diaspora, its contributions to Islam, and the comprehensive history of Black Muslims in the United States. We want to bring to light the divisions that exist within the Muslim community and the Black community. Our goal is to make our events and information accessible to and inclusive of all people of all backgrounds on the University Campus. As Black Muslim students, we hope to combat the misconceptions and stereotypes associated with being Black and Muslim. As Black Muslims, we are committed to providing an outlet to address the racism and marginalization that permeates through all aspects of campus life. An on-campus club would ensure a safe space for the development of our community, and would meaningfully empower the formation of the young African/African American Muslim identity to eventually bridge the gap between mutual allies.
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: The Faces of African Muslims is a student organization committed to providing a safe space for Black Muslims and a safe space for all students to engage in comprehensive history of Black Muslims.

Name: Fashion and Student Trends
Description: The purpose of Fashion and Student Trend is to provide opportunities for students interested in fashion or the fashion industry to learn from other students and experts in the field or find a community during college. We hold a 100% student-led semesterly fashion show, featuring student designers and student models. We strive to provide our students/audience with professional industry experience. We also invite experts in the fashion industry to talk to us about future career development and opportunities. In addition to designing and modeling, we have departments for photography, videography, styling, and beauty (hair and makeup artists). We also offer opportunities to participate in public relations, professional development, marketing, graphic design, finance, and publications. Our department applications open up at the start of each semester, be sure to follow our socials to stay up to date on all things FAST. No experience is necessary, just a passion for fashion!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: FAST provides a "runway" for students interested in fashion and the fashion industry to learn from other students and experts in the field. Our 12 departments run a 100% student-led semesterly fashion show featuring student designers and models!

Name: Federalist Society at Berkeley Law
Description: Law schools and the legal profession are currently strongly dominated by a form of orthodox liberal ideology, which advocates a centralized and uniform society. While some members of the academic community have dissented from these views, by and large they are taught simultaneously with (and indeed as if they were) the law. The Federalist Society for Law and Public Policy Studies is a group of conservatives and libertarians interested in the current state of the legal order. It is founded on the principles that the state exists to preserve freedom, that the separation of governmental powers is central to our Constitution, and that it is the province and duty of the judiciary to say what the law is, not what it should be. The society seeks both to promote an awareness of these principles and to further their application through its activities. The Berkeley Law chapter of the Federalist Society‚Äôs goals include: promoting thoughtful and challenging discussion of legal and public policy issues; academically and intellectually sponsoring conservative and libertarian law students; and ensuring that Berkeley Law students are thoughtfully exposed to conservative and libertarian perspectives and consider these perspectives in their analysis of legal issues. We put on a number of great events, which include bringing out leading judges, legal scholars, and practicing lawyers to address hot-button issues of importance to the Federalist Society. We are also a social club, with happy hours and some planned excursions in the mix. Membership is open to all students who are interested in thoughtful debate and the exchange of ideas, regardless of political ideology.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The Federalist Society is interested in the current state of the legal order. It believes that the separation of governmental powers is central to our Constitution and that it is the duty of the judiciary to say what the law is not what it should be.

Name: FeelGood üíô
Description: Fall 2025 Interest Form: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1AoAqM7x48u4zO8dc8S8X-RDQyH6M9AiJB2nTKdbG0vk/edit?usp=drivesdk FeelGood is a youth-led movement turning college into a time of effective global action. On campuses across the country, students run a successful social enterprise‚Äîa grilled cheese deli‚Äî to raise money and build public support for the end of extreme hunger and poverty. In the process students gain critical business, leadership and teamwork skills that serve them throughout their lives. Why grilled cheese? Artisan bread, gourmet cheeses, local produce and a panini press make for a mouth-watering comfort food that is sure to make you smile. The nostalgic simplicity of a grilled cheese is an irresistible invitation to everyone to make a systemic difference. By asking for a donation, we give everyone the space to manifest generosity by turning lunch into an opportunity to give back. People donate whatever makes them "feel good," expressing their love for humanity and our earth with every penny. Every dollar students raise is invested in the Commitment 2030 Fund: A select group of organizations working to fulfill the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs): a global initiative to eliminate extreme hunger and poverty by achieving an economically prosperous, socially inclusive, and environmentally sustainable human presence on the planet by 2030. www.feelgood.org
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: FeelGood is a non-profit, student-run grilled cheese deli working towards a world free of extreme and chronic hunger by the year 2030. All donations are invested in a select group of organizations working to fulfill the Sustainable Development Goals.

Name: Fei Tian Dancers üíô
Description: Fei Tian Dancers is the one & only Chinese dance team at UC Berkeley. Established in 2003 as a Registered Student Organization, FTD supports dancers of all backgrounds in developing their Chinese dance skill & technique, enhancing their comprehension of traditional Chinese culture, & in spreading greater awareness of Chinese classical & ethnic cultures to the bigger community. FTD incorporates classical, ethnic, & modern Chinese dances into its repertoire through creating original choreography & learning traditional works, performing on campus & throughout the Bay Area.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Fei Tian Dancers is the one & only Chinese dance team at UC Berkeley. Established in 2003 , FTD supports dancers of all backgrounds in developing their Chinese dance skill & technique, enhancing their comprehension of traditional Chinese culture.

Name: Fellowship in Christ Berkeley üíô
Description: The mission of our ministry is to glorify God by being a people who are transformed by the gospel of Jesus Christ and who then serve as agents of transformation for God in the San Francisco Bay Area and throughout the world. We hope to accomplish this purpose by committing ourselves to these five priorities: Internal Priorities.Worship ‚Äì John 4:23-24, Rev. 4:8-11, 5:8-14Teaching ‚Äì Acts 2:41-42, Eph. 4:11-16Fellowship ‚Äì Acts 2:41-42, Heb. 10:23-25 External Priorities.Evangelism / Missions ‚Äì Matt. 28:16-20, 1 Pet. 3:15Mercy Ministries / Social Justice ‚Äì Luke 10:30-37, 1 John 3:17
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Publication Groups, Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Fellowship in Christ, Berkeley (FiCB) is the campus ministry of Christ Central Presbyterian Church in Daly City. Our ministry has a joint-vision with our church to worship Christ as our Savior and to build up Christians with the message of the gospel.

Name: Fellowship of Christian Optometrists Chapter at Berkeley üíô
Description: Purpose: To serve with professional excellence as witnesses of Christ's love and compassion, and by advancing biblical principles of healthcare within the Church and to our culture. Our goal is to offer guidance and role models as students consider pursuing careers in healthcare and then actively support them as they navigate through their professional training years and into a life of serving the Lord in a healthcare career by going on medical missions to underserved countries abroad and within the States This group [Fellowship of Christian Optometrists Chapter at Berkeley] was formerly named [Christian Medical and Dental Associations Chapter at Berkeley] - [D9/2/21] IZ (PLC)
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Fellowship of Christian Optometrists Chapter at Berkeley exists to glorify God by motivating, educating and equipping Christian pre-medical and pre-dental students.

Name: Female Founders and Funders of Berkeley
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO
Summary: Our mission is to empower women founders and funders at Berkeley by fostering a supportive community and providing essential resources for connection, learning, and growth to drive innovation and equality in the startup and VC industries.

Name: Fiat Lux Scholars Association
Description: FLSA Goals: To develop a sense of community among Fiat Lux Scholarship recipients at UC, Berkeley. To enhance the educational, social, and professional experience of Fiat Lux Scholars. To collaborate with the Undergraduate Scholarship Office on recruitment efforts through the high school Outreach Program and the Fiat Lux Overnight Program. Click here for more information!
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: To unify and strengthen our community of Fiat Lux Scholars and alumni through meaningful social, academic, and professional development opportunities.

Name: Field Hockey Club of Berkeley üíô
Description: The Field Hockey Club of Berkeley is a co-ed sports team that invites students of all backgrounds, ages, and genders to participate in practicing and spreading field hockey culture. We have ranked 2nd in the nation among club teams and 3rd in California in previous seasons.
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Field Hockey Club of Berkeley gives students the opportunity to participate in field hockey matches with other students. We are spreading the love of the game around the bay area!

Name: Fighting Cancer at Berkeley üíô
Description: For updates, our Instagram is here. Our official website is here! email: bears@fightingcancer.studentorg.berkeley.edu
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Fighting Cancer at Berkeley strives to alleviate the burden of a cancer diagnosis on patients and their loved ones through educational outreach, peer support, fundraisers for research and other orgs, and both clinical and nonclinical volunteering.

Name: Fighting for Hope at Berkeley üíô
Description: Fighting for Hope aims to spread awareness and advocate for mental health efforts, promote student wellness, and provide opportunities for the mental health community within UC Berkeley and involve students in fundraisers, projects, and events dedicated to student mental health.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: To help spread awareness and advocate for mental health efforts within the UC Berkeley community and involve students in fundraisers and events dedicated to mental health. We will also routinely host guest speakers and mental health workshops.

Name: Fighting Games at Berkeley
Description: Fighting Games at Berkeley caters towards a community that currently enjoys or is looking to get into fighting games. Any level of player, casual or competitive, grad or undergrad, is welcome! We meet every Friday at the Cal Esports Community Center, playing a wide variety of fighting games, from Street Fighter to Guilty Gear! For the more competitive player, there are occasional exhibitions versus other collegiate FGCs!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Fighting Games at Berkeley caters towards a community that currently enjoys or is looking to get into fighting games. Any level of player, casual or competitive, is welcome! We host tournaments for all skill levels!

Name: Finance Club at Berkeley (BFC) [Formerly Sales and Trading Club at Berkeley]
Description: At Berkeley Finance Club, our core mission is to help undergraduates who are interested in finance reach their individual potential. In a close-knit community, we provide mentorship, professional development, and career networking opportunities. Club members will gain practical knowledge about the financial market and how to land a job in the financial industry. Alumni and upperclassmen will help our members prepare through resume critique, networking, and mock interviews.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Sales and Trading Club (also known as Berkeley Finance Club) is a student organization dedicated to help undergraduates who are interested in finance reach their individual potential.

Name: Financial Engineering Students Association
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: We aim to expose its members to the finance and data science industry in order to network and establish relationships that will lead to jobs in the field.

Name: Firework Band
Description: We are a Chinese contemporary band based in Berkeley.Â∏Ç‰∫ïÈïøÂ∑∑ÔºåËÅöÊã¢Êù•ÊòØÁÉüÁÅ´
Categories: Arts Student Organizations, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations
Summary: We are a Chinese contemporary band based in Berkeley. https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1yo4y137bC/?share_source=copy_web

Name: First Step
Description: FIRST STEP INTEREST FORM: Interest Form Linked Here! Please fill this form out if you are interested in joining First Step! First Step is an undergraduate student organization that strives for professional, academic, and creative development for first-generation and/or low-income students interested in exploring the built environment and bettering local communities. We are a Blue Heart Initiative RSO, meaning that our organization is open to all students. This form greatly helps us adjust our goals to align with those of our members. 2025-2026 SCHOOL YEAR GOAL: This school year, we aim to provide professional experience working with The Town Project, a nonprofit organization dedicated to implementing restorative justice practices within educational systems, foster youth, and local communities.
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: First Step is an undergraduate student organization that strives for professional, academic, and creative development for first-generation and/or low-income students interested in exploring the built environment and bettering local communities.

Name: First-Gen and/or Low-Income Graduate Students
Description: The mission of FGLI Grads is to build community and support first-generation and/or low-income graduate students at UC Berkeley. First-Generation grad students are students whose parents or guardians earned less than a bachelor‚Äôs degree. Low-Income grad students are generally students who were Pell-Grant eligible during undergrad. We acknowledge these terms are not perfect, so we welcome any members who identify with our mission. We also invite Cal staff and faculty who wish to support, and advocate with, FGLI graduate students.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The mission of FGLI Grads is to build community and support first-generation and/or low-income graduate students at UC Berkeley.

Name: Flying Samaritans: Berkeley Satellite
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: To provide healthcare services to underserved communities in Mexico by organizing medical service trips, fundraising, and volunteer efforts. We aim to engage students in promoting healthcare equity and volunteerism.

Name: FoCUS üíô
Description: The purpose of FoCUS is to enact God‚Äôs call for solidarity and inclusion to those who have been marginalized by the church, especially LGBTQ+ and POC communities. FoCUS reaches out to University Students to provide a safe space where each student feels they are seen and heard. We meet Wednesday's from 6:30-8PM at First Presbyterian Church of Berkeley's FoCUS Lounge. Address: 2410 Channing Way, Berkeley CA 94704
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: FoCUS, affiliated with First Presbyterian Church of Berkeley, is a university ministry serving Cal students and Bay Area students. We are a faith community committed to inclusion, social justice, and thoughtful conversations on topics that matter.

Name: Food at Haas
Description: Our mission is to creatively strengthen our sense of community and bonding through our mutual love of food and we aim to do this by increasing access to resources, alumni, and career opportunities in the food industry.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our mission is to creatively strengthen our sense of community and bonding through our mutual love of food and we aim to do this by increasing access to resources, alumni, and career opportunities in the food industry.

Name: Food Friendly Finance
Description: Food Friendly Finance (Apple Pie Finance) hopes to help sustainable restaurants and food-related business make it in the marketplace. Apple Pie Finance will be training members on hospitality and restaurant industry business knowledge while offering client-facing services in streamlining business financial statements.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Food Friendly Finance hopes to help sustainable restaurants and food-related business make it in the marketplace. Please contact us if you're passionate!

Name: Food Institute Graduate Council at Berkeley üíô
Description: The Food Institute Graduate Council (FIGC) at Berkeley was established to bring together students interested in studying and transforming food systems. We advocate for the needs of graduate students interested in this work, facilitate educational, professional, and advocacy opportunities, and seek to support the survival and success of the broader Food and Agriculture community at the University of California at Berkeley (UC Berkeley). During the semester, FIGC hosts monthly meetings that include a speaker series with guest professors, cooking project workshops in the Berkeley Teaching Kitchen, farm volunteer days, and much more. FIGC also hosts the Land & Agrifood Research Collective, in which members convene to discuss and present literature and research related to food and agriculture. *informally known as the BFI Graduate Council
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: A cross-disciplinary hub for Berkeley graduate students interested in food systems issues. It provides educational and professional opportunities, promoting the empowerment of new leaders who cultivate diverse, just, resilient, and healthy food systems.

Name: Food, Equity, Entrepreneurship, & Development
Description: Founded in 2016, Food, Equity, Entrepreneurship, and Development (FEED) is a student-run consulting organization focused on food systems and sustainability. We are a multidisciplinary club providing services to companies transforming the food system. Our diverse clients include restaurants, CPG start-ups, food banks, agri-tech companies, and more.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Food, Equity, Entrepreneurship & Development (FEED) is a consulting group dedicated to advancing food justice and sustainability. Our mission is to create a more equitable food system by delivering strategic research-based solutions to organizations.

Name: For Christ's Sake
Description: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DEx11B2X8TQ As a Christian a cappella group at UC Berkeley, we have come together across campus fellowships and churches to proclaim the good news of the Gospel through song to our campus and community. Our hope is that through music we can better understand and share with others the knowledge that every good thing in us is for Christ‚Äôs sake, as expressed in Philemon 1:6. "and I pray that the fellowship of your faith may become effective through the knowledge of every good thing which is in you for Christ's sake." Philemon 1:6 We were founded by a group of Cal students in 2000. This fall, we continue to celebrate God's faithfulness to this group, and our prayer is that you might also be blessed by the joy we experience through Him.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: As a Christian a cappella group at Cal, we have come together across campus fellowships and churches to proclaim the good news of the Gospel through song to our campus and community. We believe every good thing is for Christ's sake, as in Philemon 1:6.

Name: Foresight Pre-Optometry Club üíô
Description: Foresight Pre-Optometry Club is a student-run organization that seeks to unite UC Berkeley students and individuals around the area who are interested in pursuing a career in the field of optometry. We teach members the necessary skills and we provide members with the necessary tools to shape them into more knowledgeable applicants. We hold various events such as optometry school presentations, detailed workshops on the application process and strategies for tackling the OAT, and socials to allow members the opportunity to meet peers and potential optometry school classmates. We educate our members on the current issues facing the growing field of optometry, and we encourage individuals to volunteer to better prepare them for a career in providing eye care for their community. Foresight aims to create a network between the members of the club and current optometrists by keeping strong connections with professors and alumni.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, ABSA-Allocated BNorth Space, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: UC Berkeley's Pre-Optometry Club aims to unite students and community members who are interested in the field of optometry. We encourage everyone to not only learn more about optometry but to build friendships with their future colleagues. Welcome!

Name: Formula Electric at Berkeley (Formerly bLoop)
Description: Formula Electric at Berkeley is a team of 120+ active members that designs, manufactures, tests, and races an electric race car in the Formula SAE EV competition. We are focused on equipping Berkeley students with the technical and entrepreneurial acumen needed to help the world transition to sustainable transportation. Recruitment cycles happen twice a year, at the beginning of both the fall and spring semesters.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We are a competitive engineering team that designs, manufactures, tests, and races an electric race car in the Formula SAE EV competition each year.

Name: Formula SAE (Society of Automotive Engineers)
Description: UC Berkeley's Formula SAE team, or Berkeley Formula Racing (BFR), is an engineering student organization that designs and builds a small formula-style race car in order to compete in the annual Formula SAE competition. Our team is comprised of about 60 students from various backgrounds all belonging to at least one of our subsystems: Aerodynamics, Brakes & Driver Interface, Business, Chassis Drivetrain, Engine, Electrical, and Suspension. Since our establishment in 2001, our dedicated members have worked their way from a simple engineering club to one of the top competitors in the nation. Each year we continuously grow and improve in both our engineering design and project management skills.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We design, fabricate and compete with small formula-style racecars against other colleges from around the world.

Name: Fraternity & Sorority Life - providing advising to the CalGreeks Community
Description: The Fraternity & Sorority Life department provides direct advising to the entire CalGreeks community and supports individual members, officers, chapters, and councils in promoting the four CalGreeks pillars: Community, Leadership, Scholarship, and Service. You can find Fraternity & Sorority Life at 2610 Channing Way.
Summary: Fraternity & Sorority Life provides advising and support to all of our social fraternities and sororities and the governing councils (IFC, MCGC, NPHC, and Panhellenic).

Name: Free Peach, The
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Free Peach satirizes current events in the Berkeley community and beyond. Building subtext on the foundation of recurring tropes and dynamics present on campus, we examine Berkeley student life under the critical lens of comedy.

Name: Free Ventures
Description: We are a program run by students, for students. Our founders have gone on to become Forbes 30 Under 30, build companies that are changing the world, and continue to develop the college startup scene by creating The House. Free Ventures has been an instrumental part of Berkeley‚Äôs startup ecosystem in its formative years, helping it to develop into the most robust college startup scene in recent years. In the process we‚Äôve built the most comprehensive pre-seed program for Berkeley startups, tailored to each team‚Äôs specific needs and purely pro-bono. Each day our team actively works with our venture capital sponsors, resource partners, The House, Dorm Room Fund, and other groups to build the strongest community of Berkeley founders, providing startups with a full stack of resources to guide them from ideation to investment. We have helped our 100 alumni teams raise over $170 million from top firms such as Y Combinator, Greylock, KPCB, and SVAngel. Collectively they‚Äôve gone on to tackle problems in VR, drones, IoT, neuroscience, AI, real estate, and renewable energy, to name a few.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We provide the university's brightest student founders with workspace, mentorship, academic units, funding, and resources to scale. Our mission is to free students from the constraints that hinder starting up while in school to found high-impact startups

Name: Friends of MSF at Berkeley üíô
Description: FoMSF at Berkeley aims to garner support for Doctors Without Borders' humanitarian projects and educate students on the positive impact their involvement could have both in our community and the world at large. Our goal is to raise money and spread awareness for Doctors Without Borders projects in conflict zones and in countries affected by endemic diseases. By putting on unique and interactive events throughout the community, our Berkeley chapter emphasizes education, awareness, and fundraising. LINKTREE: https://linktr.ee/msf.ucberkeley This group [Friends of MSF at Berkeley] was formerly named [Doctors Without Borders at Berkeley] - [10/5/23] [LL]
