Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: FoMSF at Berkeley aims to raise awareness for global crises, MSF advocacy campaigns, and humanitarian medicine. Our mission is to provide impactful service by volunteering with and raising awareness for local humanitarian organizations.

Name: Frontera at Berkeley
Description: Frontera at Berkeley is composed of people with a strong interest in the U.S.A.- Mexico border region, border policy as well as the migrant experience and immigration policy. In recent times, immigration and border policy have become key agenda items at federal, regional, and local elections. With that in mind, as an organization, we strive to raise awareness among the Berkeley population about migrant issues, border policy, and the border region. Given the transnational bond between the two sides of the border, many of the residents of the regions develop a ‚Äúfronterice‚Äù identity, with strong cultural connections to both sides of the border, as an organization, our mission is to give a voice to members of that region in a place like Berkeley, where policy discussion is influential at a national level. We also aim to foster an open discussion about current issues like discrimination, the migrant crisis, and the economic potential of the region. We seek to incentivize our members to find venues of engagement and become active participants in these discussions at a national level. Committees: Marketing & Outreach: insta profile, relationship with other clubs & school dept Activism: contact nonprofits, look for engagement opportunities Policy Research: Workshops and Info sessions Recruitment & Finance: Keep track of recruitment efforts and take lead on fundraisers and grant application process
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: With Immigration and border policy becoming Key agenda Items United States politics; Frontera at Berkeley looks for solutions to the hardest policy problems, raises awareness on the "fronterice" Identity, and the southern border migrant experience.

Name: Future Advancers of Science and Technology
Description: To connect graduate level STEAM researchers with under-resourced or underserved local high school students to mentor the students through a year long research project. In early fall, mentees will be recruited through a ‚Äúpitch day‚Äù at their school where the program will be promoted through demonstrations of unknowns in science. Then, in late fall, mentors will guide recruits through brainstorming sessions to help the recruits decide on a question they want to explore. In winter and spring, students get to perform experiments to try and answer their questions. Additionally, workshops will be held to help students with career development, including applying to college. Students will also be encouraged to participate in local science fairs. At the end of the year, all FAST participants will present their work at a symposium where they will hear from professors, talk with college recruiters, earn student-nominated awards, and have the opportunity to win a scholarship. This guided but student-driven research experience has several goals: To help students build confidence, especially with research and presentation skills To encourage students from all backgrounds to pursue education and careers in research fields To enhance the high school STEAM educational experience To prepare students for competitive jobs and college applications through skill and resume building
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Connecting graduate-level scientists, engineers, and artists with high school students to tackle big problems and create amazing projects. Expanding possibilities for students from disenfranchised or under-resourced communities to shape the future.

Name: Future Business Leaders of America-Phi Beta Lambda, Inc.
Description: Phi Beta Lambda is one of the oldest and largest business organizations on campus providing a personal approach to professional development through client-facing projects and five project teams, known as committees, focus on different fields and intersections of business and pursue engaging and challenging curriculums in consulting, finance, marketing, tech, and biotechnology to foster well-rounded members. Our distinguishing feature is our organizational structure and values. We are recruiting Fall 2024 committee members who will undergo an extensive and comprehensive business curriculum that will leave members with a solid foundation of business acumen and technical skills needed to succeed in their professional careers. Atop projects that cohort members will complete, leadership will lead a variety of professional development workshops that ensure you're ready to successfully recruit and land an internship at your dream company while offering a mentorship program to give you the personalized guidance you need to succeed. Although we're a general business organization, PBL prides itself on the diversity of our members. From chemical engineering and business double-majors to CS and music students, our organization thrives by bringing together a community of people with distinct academic, professional, and personal pursuits. Given our emphasis on community, our members excel at and value collaborative teaming, opportunities to learn, and practical application of skills. Learn more about us on our website, subscribe to our mailing list to stay up-to-date with recruitment happenings and follow us on Facebook or Instagram!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2024-25-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Phi Beta Lambda provides a personal approach to professional development through client-facing projects and five project teams, known as committees, focusing on different fields and intersections of business.

Name: G.I.F.T.E.D. (Give to Inspire the Future of Talented, Educated Doctors) Pre-Med üíô
Description: G.I.F.T.E.D. Pre-Med is a non-profit organization dedicated to diversifying the healthcare field by improving access to higher education in medicine. Our primary focus is spreading awareness of and alleviating the financial barriers that many low-income and minority-identifying pre-med students face on the path to medical school. Please fill out our interest form if you wish to stay updated about becoming a general member and for any of our upcoming events: https://forms.gle/AwhTEjv5HkZi9kQ99 For more information and upcoming dates, feel free to follow our socials! Instagram: @giftedpremed Email: giftedpremed@gmail.com Website: http://sites.google.com/berkeley.edu/giftedpremed Join G.I.F.T.E.D. Pre-Med to be part of a community of diverse pre-health students fighting for a new medical field.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: GIFTED Pre-Med is a non-profit association dedicated to uplifting minority-identifying and/or low-income pre-medical students at UC Berkeley by alleviating the financial obstacles to applying to medical school.

Name: GA Basic Needs Security Project
Description: GA Basic Needs Project Group The Basic Needs Security(BNS) Officer coordinates and oversees advocacy efforts to address the short-and long-term basic needs security (i.e. security in housing, food, childcare, and healthcare) for academic and professional graduate students at the University of California, Berkeley. To this capacity, the BNSOfficer works closely with the Basic Needs Center to provide a critical graduate student perspective onthe direction, accessibility, promotion, and creation of services. Other campus partners include: theStudent Advocate‚Äôs Office (SAO), PATH to Care, and so forth.
Categories: GA Government Projects
Summary: GA Basic Needs Security Project - please fill out description when needed

Description: Located in Eshleman Hall, the Business Office is currently staffed by undergraduates who work in partnership with the GA Executive Board and Project Directors to put on programming for the graduate student population. All general inquiries ranging from funding to information pertaining to current programming within the GA are handled by the Business Office. Additionally, the Business Office provides a variety of services to support the GA Projects and Executive Officers.

Name: GA Internal Vice President
Description: The GA Internal Vice President (IVP) is the chair of the meetings of the Delegate Assembly and is responsible for recruitment of new delegates and any issues pertaining to physical space, resources, and communications. Examples of the administrators and committees that the GA IVP works closely with: Director of Graduate Student Life, Student Union Board of Directors The GA IVP oversees the following internal GA committees and staff: Graduate Social Club Coordinator, Technology Director, Funding Appeals Board Contact the current GA IVP at internal-ga@berkeley.edu if you would like to learn more about this role.
Categories: GA Government Offices
Summary: GA Internal Vice President

Name: GA Rules Officer
Description: The Rules Committee shall monitor the internal actions of the Graduate Assembly to ensure that they comply with the Charter, these Bylaws, and any Memoranda of Understanding between the Graduate Assembly and other entities. It generally shall include proposing changes to the Charter, these Bylaws, and any Memoranda as well as deciding disputes regarding the Charter and these Bylaws. The Rules Committee shall conduct an annual review process of these Bylaws and all Memoranda. The Rules Committee may make recommendations to the Delegate Assembly regarding what corrective and, if necessary, disciplinary action should be taken against members of the Graduate Assembly who, without good cause, knowingly violate the Charter and these Bylaws.
Categories: GA Government Offices
Summary: The Rules Committee shall monitor the internal actions of the Graduate Assembly to ensure that they comply with the Charter, these Bylaws, and any Memoranda of Understanding between the Graduate Assembly and other entities. It generally shall include

Name: GA Travel Funds (branch of GA Funding)
Description: This page is for awardees of the GA Professional Development Grant and the GA Graduate Student Parent Travel Grant. To submit a purchase request to be reimbursed, go to "GA Travel Funds" in the ribbon on the left. From there, click the gear icon and choose "Finance." Once on the Finance page, click the button in the top right corner, "Create Request." Requests may not exceed your award total, and must include uploaded receipts and other required documentation. Purchase Requests must be received within 30 days of the end of the conference or within 30 days of the payment of professional society fees. If you have any questions, email the GA Funding Officer at funding@ga.berkeley.edu
Categories: GA Government Offices

Name: GABRIELA at Berkeley
Categories: Cultural & Identity/Women Interest Student Organizations
Summary: GABRIELA at Berkeley seeks to raise the consciousness of our community about the struggles of Filipina women with the national democratic perspective.

Name: GAG!
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: GAG! is a creative publication exploring all mediums of expression. GAG! will foster a strong and welcoming community of creatives as they tackle individual and collective projects and be the platform in which they can see their work get published.

Name: Game Design and Development at Berkeley üíô
Description: Game Design and Development at Berkeley is a club to help those interested in game design understand common tools and work environments that other indie and major industry developers work in. We encourage students from all backgrounds to come and join, as game design has many facets that people can be involved in; development, art, music, writing, and project management. Our three goals as an organization are: Creating a space to foster a community for those interested in game design and development Getting more people interested in game design and development Providing support for a pipeline that will enable everyone to work on their own games, including industry events, workshops, and game jams (This organization was formerly known as "GameCraft")
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Game Design and Development at Berkeley seeks to foster a community for everyone and anyone interested in game design and development. Furthermore, we aim to provide students with the path and all the resources they may need to create their own games.

Name: Gamma Phi Beta (Gamma Phi)
Description: Gamma Phi Beta is an International Sorority dedicated to helping women realize their full potential. Of course, you will make lifelong friends here ‚Äì and in the future after college. But it‚Äôs here you will have the opportunity for individual growth through academic excellence, leadership development, social enrichment and philanthropic involvement that will take you wherever you want to go with your life. We believe that the result of contribution to community, developing moral and ethical integrity in all aspects of life, and striving for excellence in all levels of your endeavors are elements that one learns as a part of sorority life. Being part of a social organization is also an important "fun" aspect of college life. Becoming self-reliant, looking inward toward sisterhood for support and celebrating your individualism are benefits not found in many other organizations.Every member is selected to life membership. This choice of membership does not relate simply to one college campus or community, for every member belongs to the International Sorority and enjoys a member‚Äôs rights, privileges and responsibilities wherever she may live, study, work or travel. As a member, you have the opportunity to be a part of a sisterhood that has blossomed from Four Founders to over 140,000 members with 114 collegiate chapters and 156 alumnae chapters.
Categories: CalGreeks Panhellenic Council (PHC) Sororities
Summary: Welcome to Gamma Phi Beta at UC Berkeley! Here you'll find a lifetime of sisterhood, friendship, alumnae connections, and memories of the best years of your life with the best women you'll ever meet. Feel free to contact us with any questions. Go Bears!

Name: Gamma Rho Lambda
Description: Welcome to the Lambda Chapter of Gamma Rho Lambda at UC Berkeley! Gamma Rho Lambda (ŒìŒ°Œõ) is the first national, college-based, Queer and Ally social greek organization. We aim to provide a safe space and support system for queer and allied individuals. We center and prioritize people of color, folks of marginalized identities, undocumented folks, trans and GNC individuals, low-income, and queer! You can also find us on ig @grlberkeley and learn more about us on our website https://grlberkeley.wordpress.com/
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, CalGreeks Multicultural Greek Council (MCGC) Fraternities & Sororities
Summary: Gamma Rho Lambda is both a traditional sorority/greek org and a queer organization ‚Äì providing queer individuals and their allies a safe space in the Greek community. Check out our website! https://grlberkeley.wordpress.

Name: Gamma Zeta Alpha Fraternity, Inc.
Description: Established in 1992 at the University of California, Berkeley (founded nationally in 1987 at Chico State University), Gamma Zeta Alpha Fraternity, Inc. is a Latino interest fraternity dedicated to three principles: Academic Excellence, Community Service, and the maintenance of the Latino culture through Brotherhood. All brothers of this fraternity strongly abide by these values in their everyday lives and demonstrate this strength through performing a number of community building activities. Community service is perhaps one of our largest emphases, as we strive to return a small portion of what our families and upbringings have provided to us in our quest for success. The strong bond that we possess among our chapters statewide makes the brotherhood experience unlike any other Greek organization on campus.
Categories: CalGreeks Multicultural Greek Council (MCGC) Fraternities & Sororities
Summary: Established in 1992 at the University of California-Berkeley, Gamma Zeta Alpha Fraternity, Inc. is a Latino interest fraternity dedicated to three principles: academic excellence, community service, and brotherhood. We were established nationally in 1987

Name: Garb
Description: Garb aims to consistently publish interesting, humorous Berkeley relevant articles relating to fashion through an online blog platform. This online publication will cater to those who have a passion for fashion as well as those who seek to get into fashion world. Our blog will serve as a platform for community building based on a mutual interest in style. Articles will cover topics including but not limited to ‚Äúhow to wear‚Äù guides, garment history, "Berkeley" style, outfit and style inspiration, fashion news, the fashion industry, fashion trend analyses, beauty, and lifestyle. Through these articles, we aim to provide value to our readers by discussing and explicating fashion related subject matters. Note: Garb was formerly known as Fashion Editorial of Berkeley. Name change effective 2018-19 Academic Year
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Garb is an online blog aimed at consistently publishing fashion related articles that are relatable and relevant to Berkeley students.

Name: Garuda Capital
Description: Garuda Capital is an undergraduate investment organization focused exclusively on building and supporting UC Berkeley's entrepreneurship and investing ecosystem. Our mission centers on empowering the next generation of Berkeley investors and entrepreneurs through mentorship, capital, and a collaborative community.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Garuda Capital is an undergraduate investment organization focused exclusively on building and supporting Berkeley's entrepreneurship and investing ecosystem. Our mission centers on empowering the next generation of investors and entrepreneurs.

Name: Gender Equity in Mathematics at Berkeley üíô
Description: This organization is a safe place where UC Berkeley students interested in the field of Mathematics foster relationships and pursue academic success among like-minded individuals with an emphasis on women and other underrepresented gender groups. Through professional and social events, we create and empower a strong community within the Math Department.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Women Interest Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: This organization is a safe place where UC Berkeley students interested in the field of Mathematics foster relationships and pursue academic success among like-minded individuals with an emphasis on females and other underrepresented gender groups.

Name: Generative AI at Berkeley
Description: Generative AI at Berkeley is the first and largest Generative AI focused student organization on campus. We welcome all majors, technical skill levels, backgrounds, and fully embrace the multidisciplinary nature of Generative AI. Members collaborate on projects that combine technical and creative work: applying technologies like Stable Diffusion and LLMs to real problems, as well as attending workshops and talks given by professors and industry experts, and working with startups and big-tech companies.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Generative AI at Berkeley explores the field of Generative AI and its transformative applications. Members collaborate on projects that combine technical and creative work: applying technologies like Stable Diffusion and LLMs to real problems.

Name: Genshin at Berkeley üíô
Description: We currently have a Discord community of over 1000 people! Join our Discord server for info on how to join, future events, other announcements, and Genshin or other Hoyoverse Game discussions!(https://discord.gg/XwGc7eWDF6) Please fill out this Google Form to request to be a club member: https://forms.gle/McrQbTUaEUTdfGnNA
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We're an official club of Genshin and other Hoyoverse gamers at Berkeley. Our goal is to create a fun and supportive community where members can find belonging by playing and discussing Genshin.

Name: GeoEngineering Graduate Student Association at Berkeley üíô
Description: The main objective of the GeoEngineering Graduate Student Association at Berkeley is to provide GeoSystems graduate students, postdoctoral and visiting researchers with 1) an executive/steering committee to coordinate the activities of the abovementioned students, 2) a forum to share technical details of ongoing research, 3) a platform for constructive peer review and support, and 4) to promote student collaboration, outreach, and social interaction. See more on our Website.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The objective of the GeoEngineering Graduate Student Association at Berkeley is to provide academic, professional, and administrative support to GeoSystems graduate students, postdoctoral, and visiting researchers.

Name: GeoGames at Berkeley
Description: Games such as Geotastic and Geoguessr have objectives where the player is placed in a random location on Google Street View, and they must guess where in the world they are! The purpose of this organization is to foster an active community interested in playing and discussing these geography-related games together. We discuss a variety of topics, from general geography to useful metas used by competitive players. We will also host tournaments and games among members. All skill levels are welcome! To join, please fill out https://forms.gle/Giiw2YkC2riZghdT6 Please join our discord at https://discord.gg/5JFxE6QFFF
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Geoguessr and Geotastic are games where the player is placed in a random location on Google Street View, and must deduce where in the world they are. The purpose of this club is to foster a community interested in playing and discussing such games!

Name: Geological Association at Berkeley üíô
Description: Our mission is to inspire involvement in the geological and Earth sciences by providing a physical space for Berkeley undergraduates interested in science to form communities outside of a traditional academic environment. We meet once a week to talk about current events, hear presentations from students about Earth science research or related interests, and play an intense game of geopardy. Any and everyone is welcome to stop by for a night or join us weekly for the year! We welcome students of all majors and experience levels. We go on occasional day trips and a semesterly multi-day camping trip in addition to collaborating with the EPS department to host academic events. If you're looking for course advice or pizza or even a group of people to go hiking in Tilden with, we're your crew! For more info or to get involved contact our current president Tim: telni1@berkeley.edu or fill out this intereset form: https://forms.gle/rT8raABr1MBL6B4M6 We meet every Thursday from 6:30-7:30 in McCone 325 Instagram: @gab_berkeley
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: GAB is a geoscience-focused club where undergraduates can discuss and appreciate the geological and Earth sciences.

Name: GeoWall at Berkeley üíô
Description: GeoWall at Berkeley is the geotechnical engineering competition team. Our mission is to enrich the social, educational, and professional college experience of all civil engineering students with interest in geotechnical and geoenvironmental engineering.Our organization focuses on designing and building small-scale model mechanically stabilized Earth (MSE) retaining systems, completely out of paper, that will hold over 500lbs of sand and applied design loads! Our team competes in the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) Mid-Pacific Conference and the National Geo-Institute Conference.We offer hands-on activities that students would normally not be able to obtain in a traditional class setting and apply knowledge they do learn in class. The team also offers leadership positions which allow students to build leadership skills and communication skills as well.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: GeoWall is a competition team that is part of a larger organization called ASCE. The team allows students to learn about geotechnical engineering and apply classroom knowledge and compete against other schools in the annual Mid-Pacific conference.

Name: Gia Magazine üíô
Description: Gia Magazine is a student-run publication that centers the voices of queer and trans students of color in order to celebrate the community‚Äôs creative power. Lovingly named after one of the most impactful queer/trans advocates in Berkeley history, Gia Magazine honors the legacy of Juniperangelica ‚ÄúGia‚Äù Cordova. During her time at UC Berkeley, Gia served as an ASUC senator as well as an activist who created policy supporting the wellness of students, established commissions overseeing the impact of campus security on marginalized communities, and built coalitions of students as a community organizer. Since graduating from the university, Gia has continued to advocate for the lives and wellbeing of queer/trans folks and womxn of color on a regional and national level. In paying homage to Gia, this publication strives to institutionalize and forever uphold her vital legacy of courage, activism, and unapologetic authenticity.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Publication Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, LGBTQ+ Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Gia Magazine is an arts publication that centers the voices of queer and trans students of color.

Name: Giddha at Berkeley- Soohi Phulkariyan
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of this team is to foster a fun, welcoming environment for students around the Berkeley Region who are interested in getting closer to their culture and community through Giddha. This team is open to individuals at all experience levels.

Name: Girls Into VC at Berkeley
Description: Historically, venture capital is a male-dominated field, lacking diversity on the investment team. Women account for only 9% of venture capitalists, 8% of firm partners, and 7% of board seats. This not only negatively affects women interested in the field, but also companies and entrepreneurs. Many women are not taught about venture capital, think joining the field is an unattainable goal, and are discouraged from joining clubs or startups because of their gender. As a result, women are not being invested in because women are not making these decisions. Girls Into VC at Berkeley is dedicated to increasing the number of women in venture capital. The organization is many things ‚Äì an advocacy organization, a professional development network, and a supportive community of friends. Through the organization, members will learn about the field, build practical knowledge, grow their network in the industry, and gain a supportive community of women interested in VC! There will be education about venture capital, speaker events, pitch competitions to encourage female entrepreneurs, partnerships with firms and incubators, and more! This club will be a chapter of the larger Girls Into VC organization. In just over a year, Girls Into VC has grown to 5K+ members and 100+ mentors in 60+ countries and 6 continents. We create weekly content, including podcasts highlighting prominent figures in VC, newsletters, blog posts, and more. We also have designed, launched, and manage multiple programs, including the Mentorship Program where applicants are paired with women in established funds, Externship Program where members work with startups on substantial 8-week projects, Scout Program where members meet with women-led startups and share their memos with our network VCs, and Fellowship Program where accepted students take part in a 10-week comprehensive introduction to VC. We also established the Girls Into VC Summit, bringing together 250 members for panels, workshops, and a pitch competition. Girls Into VC has been highlighted in several media outlets including Forbes 30 Under 30.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations
Summary: Girls Into VC at Berkeley empowers women in Venture Capital (VC) by providing hands-on learning, mentorship, and networking. We address gender gaps by fostering a community where aspiring female VCs gain the skills, knowledge, and support to succeed.

Name: Girls Who Code @ Berkeley üíô
Description: Girls Who Code is an international non-profit organization working to close the gender gap in technology and change the image of what a programmer looks like and does. While our mission is to inspire self-identifying female students, we welcome all who support Girls Who Code at Berkeley's mission. Through organized seminars, technical workshops, and networking events, Girls Who Code at Berkeley aims to provide a supportive community for all majors, genders, sexual orientations, and backgrounds to create meaningful connections with like-minded people.
Categories: Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Women Interest Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our goal is to close the gender gap in tech. We are not only trying to inspire girls to build their confidence and technical skills at an early age, but also young women who may have never been exposed to technology before college.

Name: Glamity at Berkeley
Description: Founded in Spring 2023 by Minh To and Alexis Kim, Glamity is an all femme, open-style dance team that explores many genres of femme dance- including voguing, waacking, twerk, heels, and more. Glamity strives to provide a platform for underrepresented styles and dancers who originate from the LGBTQIA+ and POC communities, or enjoy hyper-feminine styles. We welcome dancers from all backgrounds and strive to create a fun, safe space for dancers to express their authentic selves, grow as dancers, and find community.
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Glamity is a femme open-style dance team that explores many genres of femme dance- including voguing, waacking, twerk, heels, and more. We strive to create a fun, safe space for underrepresented dancers to express themselves and find community.

Name: GlamourGals at Berkeley üíô
Description: GlamourGals at Berkeley is a chapter of the GlamourGals National Organization. The club is a service opportunity for students looking to spend some of their free time building meaningful connections with isolated seniors in the local community. We make monthly visits to senior homes and give seniors manicures and makeovers while forming relationships. In addition to manicures, we are open to other acts of service for the seniors. Being part of a national organization, volunteers can apply for a scholarship once they reach a certain amount of service hours.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose and objectives of this organization are to inspire and organize student volunteers to provide ongoing companionship and complimentary manicures to senior home residents.

Name: Global Health Brigades at Berkeley
Description: Global Brigades is a student-operated international volunteer organization whose mission is to provide sustained healthcare to underserved communities throughout the world. This organization works toward decreasing life-threatening diseases by improving health education and creating a means of transportation and access to wellness products and public health infrastructures. Our chapter's goal is to maximize the use of a week long brigade to advocate for a holistic approach to healthcare and prepare students for their future medical endeavors.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We are the UC Berkeley Chapter of the largest student-led global health volunteer organization in the world.

Name: Global Leadership Organization at Berkeley
Description: Global Leadership Organization enhances the world by empowering passionate individuals with the skills they need to create change. We believe that with the right attitude and skills, people can drive tangible results and leave legacies that transcend our individual lives.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: GLO is the hub and go-to for all Berkeley leaders, regardless of their major, background, or ambitions. GLO Berkeley is the home that the most daring, steadfast, and most ambitious leaders come to learn, grow, & influence.

Name: Global Medical Missions Alliance at Berkeley
Description: GMMA aims to... Leave a positive and profound impact for Christ by guiding and equipping students with training and networking opportunities so they may serve as effective healers and ministers of Christ‚Äôs love. Foster a unique community and fellowship among peers and mentors committed to medical missions and healing ministry. Become the next generation of trained and like-minded healthcare professionals. Understand what it means to live a missional life and humbly serve in a way that exemplifies Christ, both locally and abroad. Join us for our bi-weekly General Meetings! Date: Every other Monday Location: SOCS 104 Time: 7:00-8:30pm PST Check out our Instagram page for more information about upcoming events and mission trips! :)
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Leave a positive and profound impact for Christ by guiding and equipping students with training and networking opportunities so they may serve as effective healers and ministers of Christ‚Äôs love.

Name: Global Medical Training üíô
Description: Global Medical Training (GMT) is an organization that is focused entirely on our motto, "LEARN BY DOING." It gives students a unique chance to participate in more "hands-on" diagnoses and treatments of patients in Latin America under the supervision and training of medical professionals. Students will not only have time to learn more about health-related professions in the near future but also become more socially aware and culturally competent. UC Berkeley students will be given a chance to expand their understanding of medicine as well as health-related hardships of living in third-world countries while increasing awareness of the lack of healthcare in such countries by providing care and information for the betterment of the nation. GMT services are also not limited to our national partners but are provided to our community. We will offer our students the opportunity to volunteer in multiple service events focused on serving the underprivileged community of Berkeley and beyond.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Global Medical Training is an international, non-profit, and humanitarian organization focused on addressing the healthcare needs of developing countries in Latin America through providing free medical and dental care services.

Name: Global Poverty and Practice Student Association at Berkeley üíô
Description: GPPSA aims to provide a space for students currently enrolled in the GPP minor to connect with other members of the Berkeley community who are interested in issues of poverty alleviation policies, programs, institutions, and social movements.
Categories: Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: GPSSA at Berkeley aims to provide a space for students currently enrolled in the Global Poverty and Practice minor to connect with other members of the UC Berkeley community who are interested in issues of in poverty alleviation policies and programs.

Name: Global Research and Consulting Group at Berkeley
Description: Global Research and Consulting (GRC) Group is an internationally-oriented educational non-profit with an expansive network of students from universities all over the world. Our mission is to drive global social impact change and empower students to become responsible future leaders, and we have completed over 60 projects with past clients including UNESCO, World Bank, Wikipedia, Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, WWF, PATH, and many more. As a member of GRC, you become part of a powerful and growing network of current students and alumni who have gone on to work at McKinsey, BCG, and Bain in the consulting sphere, Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley in the financial services industry, Silverlake, Bain Capital, and Point72 on the buy-side, as well as at the United Nations and various social impact nonprofits.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations
Summary: Global Research and Consulting Group: UC Berkeley chapter of the global nonprofit consultancy advancing social impact in healthcare, education, sustainability, and equity through strategic research and data-driven recommendations for NGOs and enterprises

Summary: This organization is established to represent students in the Global Studies department, advocate for student initiatives, communicate career and mentorship opportunities, keep in touch with alumni, and organize projects and events.

Name: Global Surgery Student Alliance at Berkeley
Description: GSSA is an undergraduate student-run organization that strives to educate, inspire, and unite students through engagement and mentorship in global surgery, including anesthesia and obstetrics and gynecology (OB/Gyn).
Summary: To educate, inspire, and unite students through engagement and mentorship in global surgery, including anesthesia and OB/Gyn.

Name: GlobeMed at Berkeley
Description: GlobeMed at Berkeley is a student-led organization dedicated to addressing global health and social justice issues. We support movements created within and managed by local community members working to improve their community‚Äôs health conditions. We work with the Department of Community Programs within Dhulikhel Hospital in Nepal and have helped create projects promoting pesticide-use awareness among farmers in Baluwa, Nepal and water sanitation, hygiene, nutrition, and menstrual health for children at schools in Bolde, Nepal. Through partnership, discussion, activism, and education, we disband social hierarchies and systems of oppression with the goal of addressing health disparities in our local community and worldwide.
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: GlobeMed at Berkeley is the central organization for global health at UC Berkeley. We focus on social justice in a global context by dismantling systems of oppression through activism, education, and a partnership with a low-income community abroad.

Name: Golden Key International Honour Society
Description: Golden Key International Honour Society is the world's largest collegiate honor society for graduate and undergraduate students and has strong relationships with over 400 universities around the world. Golden Key is built on the pillars of academics, leadership, and service, and our chapters are committed to implementing service projects and leadership development for all students on their campus. Members qualify when they are at the top 15% of their class, and are given access to a wide range of rewards, scholarships, travel and study abroad opportunities, and more.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: ...Golden Key International Honour Society is the world's largest collegiate honor society for graduate and undergraduate students and has strong relationships with over 400 universities around the world.

Name: Golden Records üíô
Description: Golden Records strives to connect passionate students with the music industry and foster a welcoming community of like-minded individuals with the goal of preparing them for music industry related jobs. Recently, we have transitioned into a music producer focused organization open to those with little or lots of experience to participate. This organization will aim to establish events for the student community where members will be able to showcase their inspirations and gain invaluable experience performing live as well as bringing in established professionals to talk about their experiences. One of the biggest challenges of the music industry is finding the right people and this organization addresses this by giving members great networks. By nature, it also serves those interested in the nuanced fields of the music industry including but not limited to personal and business managers, publicists, entertainment attorneys, graphic designers, booking agents, and promoters. Golden Records commits to helping the development of its active members. Starting Fall 2024, it offers a DeCal course as an introduction to music production - Math 98: Music Production, Synthesis, and Mathematical Methods. JOIN OUR DISCORD FOR ALL ANNOUNCEMENTS: https://discord.gg/MVR8QNWrGF ALL ARE WELCOME! If you have any questions, please ask in the Discord!!! #beatmaking #music production #producers #music industry #DAW
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Golden Records fosters a community of Music Industry driven students. For beat makers, EDM producers, artists, DJs, and students just looking to get their foot in the music industry.

Name: Good Grief at Berkeley
Description: The founding members of Good Grief at Berkeley met in grief group counseling through the Tang Center. In group, we learned the significance of talking about our grief. We realized that we want to build a community for grieving students who can benefit from sharing their experiences in a trusted group and knowing they are not alone. Good Grief at Berkeley will have weekly, member-led meetings with the aim of hearing and supporting each other. We must disclaim that we are not mental health professionals and the services we provide in no way replace professional counseling, but we will happily get you in touch with said professionals. We also must disclaim that we are a club solely for students grieving the death of a loved one and not for any other type of grief. If any of this is of interest to you, please fill out our interest form.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups
Summary: We provide a place for students grieving the death of a loved one to share their experiences, hear those of their peers, and feel less isolated in their grief.

We do this through social events, a mentorship program, advocating for higher wages, and maintaining communication through twitter, a graduate-student blog, and a departmental newsletter.

Name: Graduate Students for Palestine
Description: Graduate Students for Palestine, also known as Graduate Students for Justice in Palestine (GSJP), is Berkeley graduate student group for education, discussion, and activism promoting the rights and liberation of the Palestinian people. We seek to amplify the voices of Palestinian resisting annihilation, genocide, and theft of their land; to combat anti-Palestinian narratives and the silencing of pro-Palestine viewpoints in American politics and academia; and to strengthen the intersectional bonds between the Palestinian struggle and other racial & social justice movements.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Graduate Students for Palestine, also known as Graduate Students for Justice in Palestine (GSJP), are a group of graduate students working to amplify and support the complete liberation of Palestine from settler-colonialism.

GSARE also engages with other departments through interdisciplinary connections across campus.

Name: Graduate Women of Engineering üíô
Description: The Graduate Women of Engineering is a group of graduate engineering students from all engineering disciplines at the University of California, Berkeley. Our primary purpose is to support all graduate engineering women (in body, spirit or identity ‚Äî past, present, future, and fluid) in all their engineering endeavors. Throughout the year a number of informal events are held to allow women engineers (and those who support women in engineering) to welcome new students, network and grow professionally, share experiences, develop study groups, discuss issues and just socialize. We are always looking for new faces to join us and welcome any suggestions for new events. Our events are advertised throughout the year via email and on the events page. If you want to be notified of our future events please sign up for the GWE mailing list or contact gradswe@berkeley.edu.

Summary: GWE is a group of graduate engineering students from all disciplines at the Cal. Our primary purpose is to support all women (in body, spirit or identity ‚Äî past, present, future, and fluid) in all their engineering endeavors.

Name: Greeks Against Sexual Assault at Berkeley (GASA)
Description: Greeks Against Sexual Assault (GASA) is a peer-education based organization that works with members of the Berkeley community, especially with the CalGreeks Community and the LEAD Center. Our mission is to educate members of our community on SVSH, reform our current culture to be more inclusive and aware of issues facing SVSH, and to advocate for those who are survivors in our campus community. This education may come in the form of workshops, roundtables, meetings, or other settings. This includes but is not limited to education about: consent, consent talks, privilege, power dynamics, bystander intervention, and national and local policies. GASA is committed to advocating for survivors of sexual violence and creating a survivor-centric CalGreeks and greater campus community.
Categories: CalGreeks Fraternity & Sorority Affinity Groups
Summary: GASA is a peer-education based organization whose goals center around education, reform, and advocacy. GASA aims to educate members of the campus and CalGreeks community about issues related to sexual violence and sexual harrassment (SVSH).

Description: Our mission is to create a sustained dialogue that fosters change around sustainability and environmental justice in all Greek Councils through education and community created solutions.

Summary: Greening the Greeks is a student organization consisting of Cal Greek members that promote environmental awareness and sustainability within the fraternity and sorority community, especially in housing facilities and at Greek-sponsored events.

Name: Gymnastics Club of California üíô
Description: As a Registered Student Organization, the Gymnastics Club of California provides a community for enthusiasts of all backgrounds to engage with each other with a common interest in the sport of gymnastics. It will create an open and inclusive space for athletes, coaches, and enthusiasts to connect and create a community where the spirit of gymnastics can thrive in the face of dying interest. We offer many opportunities for members to socialize and form bonds, and we educate our members on maintaining a healthy lifestyle grounded in gymnastics based activities. Join our discord all of our information is there: https://discord.gg/EUuaCDG56h For more information on how to join, check out this info page!
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We provide a community for enthusiasts of all backgrounds to engage in facets of gymnastics. We create an inclusive space for athletes, coaches, and enthusiasts to unite and form a community where gymnastics can thrive in the face of dying interest.

Name: Haas Africa Business Club
Description: The Haas Africa Business Club (AfBC) is a dynamic and student-driven organization committed to fostering a vibrant and inclusive community at Haas. Our mission encompasses four key pillars:Talent Attraction: We actively seek to attract and empower African talents, enhancing the diversity and richness of the Haas community.Community Support and Expansion: We are dedicated to nurturing and expanding the network of individuals at Haas who share a keen interest in Africa, creating a collaborative and supportive environment.Business Orientation and Showcase: Through engaging initiatives, we provide valuable insights into conducting business in Africa. By showcasing successful African businesses and their leaders across diverse sectors, we offer a unique orientation to the opportunities and challenges present in the African business landscape.Global Connection: We bridge the Haas, UC Berkeley, and Bay Area communities with African businesses and leaders, fostering meaningful connections that transcend geographical boundaries and contribute to a global perspective.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Haas Africa Business Club (AfBC) connects Haas, UC Berkeley, and Bay Area communities with African business leaders, offers insights into African markets, and supports those interested in Africa through events and showcases.

Description: Our mission is to produce the most educated leaders at the intersection of artificial intelligence and business, and act as a bridge between industry, UC Berkeley Haas students, and the broader artificial intelligence ecosystem at UC Berkeley. The Haas Artificial Intelligence Club intends to make AI inclusive for all backgrounds, offering educational and professional event opportunities to both practitioners and explorers. We aim to foster innovation and impact at UC Berkeley and abroad by inspiring the exploration of AI‚Äôs potential use cases for creating a better world. Name: Haas Entrepreneurs Association
Description: The Berkeley Entrepreneurs Association (BEA) holds a distinguished position as the largest and oldest student association dedicated to entrepreneurship at UC Berkeley. At the core of our mission is the commitment to foster and support the entrepreneurial spirit among students and founders within the UC Berkeley community. With a rich history and extensive network, BEA has become a thriving ecosystem that nurtures over 1,000 aspiring entrepreneurs. Our members come from diverse academic backgrounds, representing a wide range of disciplines including business, data science, computer science, and multiple hard sciences. BEA takes pride in providing a dynamic platform where students can connect, collaborate, and learn from one another. Through a variety of initiatives, events, and resources, we aim to empower our members with the knowledge, skills, and networks essential for entrepreneurial success. One of the key pillars of BEA's activities is our robust support system. We offer mentorship programs, workshops, and expert-led seminars that equip aspiring entrepreneurs with practical insights and guidance. Furthermore, our extensive network of alumni and industry professionals enables us to facilitate meaningful connections and valuable partnerships. BEA's impact extends beyond the boundaries of the UC Berkeley campus. We actively engage with the local startup ecosystem, forging connections with investors, industry leaders, and other entrepreneurial organizations. This collaborative approach allows us to create opportunities for our members to showcase their ventures, gain exposure, and secure funding. In essence, the Berkeley Entrepreneurs Association serves as a catalyst for innovation and entrepreneurship at UC Berkeley. By fostering an inclusive and supportive environment, we empower aspiring entrepreneurs to turn their ideas into reality, contribute to society, and shape the future of innovation.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO
Summary: As the largest & oldest student association for entrepreneurship at UC Berkeley, our club fosters & supports entrepreneurship & founders, serving 1,000+ aspiring entrepreneurs across diverse academic disciplines.

Description: The Haas EWMBA has been created by the students of the Evening and Weekend MBA program at Berkeley‚Äôs Haas School of Business to be the official representative of the EWMBA student body and its agent to optimize and enrich the EWMBA program experience.

Description: The Haas Finance Club at the Berkeley MBA Program serves as a comprehensive platform for aspiring finance professionals, offering students invaluable resources and opportunities to advance their careers in the finance industry. Through a blend of educational workshops, speaker series, networking events, and practical training sessions, the club aims to provide a holistic view of various finance domains including investment banking, asset management, and corporate finance. The club fosters a collaborative environment, where students can not only learn from industry experts through guest lectures but also from their peers, thereby enhancing their skill set and expanding their professional network. Membership in the Haas Finance Club is an essential stepping stone for MBA students looking to break into or advance in the competitive world of finance.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Haas Finance Club at Berkeley's MBA Program is a hub for aspiring finance professionals. It offers workshops, speaker series, and networking events to help students advance in areas like investment banking, asset management, and corporate finance.

Name: Haas Transportation & Mobility Club
Description: The purpose of this club shall be: TMC‚Äôs mission is to develop future mobility leaders who challenge the status quo by making our transportation systems more efficient, sustainable, and equitable. Bring together graduate students of the Haas MBA and broader Berkeley graduate community (Engineering, Data Science, Urban Planning, Public Policy, Law and others) to further their mobility careers through professional, academic, and social opportunities. Enable members to learn first-hand from industry experts and have opportunities to network with peers and alumni in the transportation mobility space. Provide members with the opportunity to attend an annual Haas Mobility Summit, monthly fireside chats, company presentations, treks to Bay Area companies, and other events to learn about different perspectives, expand their network, and explore career opportunities.

Summary: TMC‚Äôs mission is to develop future mobility leaders who challenge the status quo by making our transportation systems more efficient, sustainable, and equitable.

Mentoring prospective military applicants to the Haas MBA program3. Connecting club members into the professional military network4.Serving the Haas, UC Berkeley, and Bay Area communities

Name: Haas Women in Leadership
Description: WiL's mission is to serve the entire Haas community through a series of professional,educational, and social events designed to enhance the understanding and appreciation of women's roles in business while equipping WiL members for success. We organize around four main pillars to help foster an inclusive and engaging experience for our club members. 01.‚Äì Community: We have several events that run throughout the year. The most relevant one beingWednesdays with WiL, an open table for members to come together and connect with the WiL community. Another highlight is our Members Retreat each fall. 02.‚Äì Professional: To provide professional support, we collaborate with the Haas CareerManagement Group and our Alumni club (WiLA). Our flagship professional event is our AnnualSpring Conference, the longest running conference at Haas. 03.‚Äì Social: We spend a lot of time building community! Our members and allies are always invitedto our WiL happy hours and mixers. We also work directly with Haas Admissions to host social,recruiting, and informational events for prospective students. 04.‚Äì Educational: We host workshops on boundaries, allyship, and women's health, just to name afew. Our Manbassadors (male allyship group) spearhead much of this work. We alsocollaborate with and mentor the Berkeley Undergraduate Women in Business club.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO
Summary: WiL's mission is to serve the entire Haas community through a series of professional,educational, and social events designed to enhance the understanding and appreciation ofwomen's roles in business while equipping WiL members for success.

Name: HaasAbilities Club üíô
Description: HaasAbilities seeks to build awareness, foster community, and advocate for students who are experiencing any kind of disability - from acute injury to hidden disability to protected categories of disability. We are here for everyone! Disabilities come in many shapes and sizes. Have you ever had a concussion? Gotten really sick right before an exam? Broken a bone that limited your mobility? Those are acute disabilities, and the Haasabilities Club wants to support and advocate for you when those tough times happen. Do you have a visible disability that impacts your daily life? Do you have a hidden disability, like a learning disability, autoimmune disorder, or chronic pain or illness? The Haasabilities Club wants to build a supportive community for you and help spread awareness on campus about the unique strengths and abilities that come from your experience. Do you have a challenge that doesn‚Äôt fall into one of these categories? We want to hear about it! Your thoughts and experiences matter.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: HaasAbilities seeks to build awareness, foster community, and advocate for students who are experiencing any kind of disability - from acute injury to hidden disability to protected categories of disability. We are here for everyone!

Description: Hackathons at Berkeley organizes and runs large-scale computer science and technology entrepreneurship-related events. We specialize in hackathons and anything that helps make computer science fun and more engaging to beginners, as well as challenging those with more experience.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Hackathons at Berkeley organizes and runs large-scale computer science and technology entrepreneurship-related events.

Name: Healing Motion
Categories: Professional Student Organizations
Summary: Healing Motion unites passionate dancers at Berkeley to foster a supportive community, provide opportunities for creative growth, leadership development, and give back to the local community by sharing the art of dance through teaching

Summary: To provide all members at the law school with an interest in health law and life sciences law the platform and community to learn more about the field, connect with each other, and meet various professionals in the field.

Name: Health and Medical Apprenticeship Program
Description: The Health and Medical Apprenticeship Program (HMAP) was created in 1984 by four UC Berkeley undergraduates with the goal to introduce Berkeley students to ethical issues and philosophical dilemmas related to the fields of health and medicine. The results of their efforts are three subprograms: the course Public Health 116 (PH 116), the Field Study Internship (FSI), and the Health Service Internship (HSI). An entirely student-run organization, HMAP continues to expose students to a broad spectrum of experiences and opportunities, covering many facets of health and medicine while emphasizing participatory learning.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA - Budgeted over $7500 Organizations
Summary: HMAP, an entirely student-run organization, is the umbrella program for three programs that influence over a thousand students every semester: the class Public Health 116 (PH116), the Field Study Internship (FSI), and the Health Service Internship (HSI).

Name: Health, Education, and Life üíô
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Health, Education, and Life (HEAL) is an organization aimed to bridge the gap in marginalized and underrepresented communities through accessible healthcare, quality education, and life-enriching opportunities, for a brighter future.

Name: Healthcare Business Association at Berkeley
Description: Healthcare Business Association at Berkeley (HBAB) is an undergraduate organization that seeks to connect students that are interested in pursuing a career in healthcare and business. Mission: We hope to serve as a professional space for students in the healthcare business community to spark ideas, encourage questions, and build a lifelong network. Vision: We strive to become a nexus for creative, driven leaders who will transform the emerging healthcare space.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We serve as a professional space for students of the healthcare business community to spark ideas, encourage questions, and build a lifelong network.

Name: Healthcare Consulting Group at Berkeley
Description: Are you interested in healthcare consulting? Do you want to gain business insights into the healthcare industry? Come join us at Healthcare Consulting Group! We work with a wide range of U.S. and international healthcare startups to solve various complex issues in launching a healthcare business. HCG consists of an analyst training team and three project teams each semester. Linktree: https://linktr.ee/berkeleyhcg ------------------------------------------------ Analysts will attend our semester-long weekly training program where our experienced mentors will guide you through important consulting concepts and skills. You will then work as a team to tackle a project at the end of the semester and become a consultant in future semesters. ------------------------------------------------ Come to our info sessions and case workshop to meet HCG members and learn more about the open positions and application process! ------------------------------------------------ For recruitment inquiries, please email recruitment@hcg.berkeley.edu.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: HCG is a student-led organization dedicated to providing strategic, research-driven consulting services to healthcare organizations, while offering members hands-on experience at the intersection of biotech, startups, and business.

Name: Helix @ Berkeley
Description: Helix Medical invites high school students from all over the Bay Area to a free, four-week summer program that exposes them to careers in healthcare and medicine. As UC Berkeley undergrads, we design the Helix educational experience such that students explore different fields of health, meet and network with local healthcare professionals, rotate through clinical and biological skills labs, and explore avenues for futures in health-oriented careers. Following the summer program, Helix alumni take part in unique semesterly workshops and are individually matched to a mentor in their healthcare field of interest. Ultimately, we hope to contribute towards a diverse health provider population that represents and advocates for the communities they serve. For more information: thehelixgroup.org
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Helix is an ASUC Registered Student Organization that hosts a free, four-week summer program for high school populations who are underrepresented in the medical field.

Name: Hellenic Student Association at Berkeley
Description: The goals of the Association are: 1. To bring together people of Hellenic heritage and people interested in Hellenic culture. 2. To organize and support cultural, social and recreational events for its members, affiliates and the Berkeley community in general. 3. To keep its members and the community informed about current issues in Greece, Cyprus and the European Union. 4. To promote the spirit of Hellenism. The Hellenic Student Association at Berkeley is not affiliated with any political parties.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: HSAB

Name: Her Campus of Berkeley
Description: Application for Fall 2024 is now OPEN! Apply here https://forms.gle/NAKj7Sn5xaoHuB6U8. Written entirely by the world's top college journalists ‚Äì with 12,000+ contributors and counting ‚Äì HerCampus.com features national Style, Beauty, Health, Love, Life, Career, Entertainment, News, DIY, LGBTQ+, High School, and After College content supplemented by local content from 420+ campus chapters around the world. Her Campus serves as a career launching point for its team of college journalists. Since joining the Her Campus team, members have been offered jobs and internships with Glamour, Vogue, Buzzfeed, Vanity Fair, Seventeen, Marie Claire, Harper‚Äôs Bazaar, People, The Huffington Post, Teen Vogue, InStyle, Esquire, O magazine, MTV, The Washington Post, Digitas, Ogilvy, and many more. Her Campus of Berkeley is an Elite Level chapter of the global online publication, which means we‚Äôre in the top 5% of over 420 campus chapters worldwide. Not only are we a highly-ranked organization, but we‚Äôre also a strong community of creative college students. Our goal is to empower UC Berkeley students by providng a welcoming, positive creative outlet. If you‚Äôre interested in writing, design, marketing, photography, or another creative field, Her Campus is the place for you.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Publication Groups, Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Her Campus of Berkeley is an Elite Level chapter of the global online publication Her Campus. Our teams include writing, design, and marketing. We strive to create a welcoming, positive creative outlet in which members of all genders can learn and grow.

Name: Heuristic Squelch, The üíô

Name: Hidden Road Initiative üíô
Description: As a member of HRI, you will contribute to the following: brainstorm and plan projects for various villages in Armenia hold various fundraisers for university scholarships create scholarship applications for village students entering their first year of university read applications and choosing scholarship recipients create lesson plans for students for our annual summer camps have the chance to intern as a teacher, counselor, and mentor in Armenian villages during the summer make a positive impact by providing educational opportunities and resources to students looking to pursue their interests
