Summary: HRI is a non-profit organization that aims to improve the lives of students living in remote villages in Armenia through scholarships, reconstruction initiatives, and yearly educational summer camps.

Name: Hillel Student Board at Berkeley
Description: Berkeley Hillel Student Board provides a safe, welcoming, and inclusive space for Jewish students on campus. The Board is comprised of the student leaders of the Berkeley Hillel Jewish Student Center. Our goal is to enrich Jewish student life through large scale social events centered around Jewish holidays, culture, and community. We also support student initiated ventures and activities that are related to building vibrant Jewish life on campus.
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Student leaders of Berkeley Hillel Jewish Student Center enriching Jewish student life through large scale social events centered around Jewish holidays, culture, and community.

Name: Hindu YUVA-Youth for Unity, Virtues and Action üíô
Description: The purpose of UC Berkeley‚Äôs Hindu YUVA organization is to bring together both Hindu and non-Hindu students to raise awareness about what Hinduism is. As Hinduism is one of the largest and oldest religions in the world, we believe it is necessary for there to exist an organization on campus to represent the interests of the Hindu community. We hope to create a comfortable atmosphere where students can come and celebrate their culture. We hope to achieve these goals by having team-building games, yoga and meditation, lively debates, and exciting debates and presentations at our weekly meetings. All in all, we want to build a small Hindu community within UC Berkeley so that students can come and discover a home away from home.
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of UC Berkeley‚Äôs Hindu YUVA organization is to bring together both Hindu and non-Hindu students to raise awareness about what Hinduism is.

Name: Hispanic Engineers and Scientists üíô
Description: We are a resource for Latinx students in STEM as they navigate their professional/academic endeavors. We work towards diversifying the STEM workforce through professional development workshops, networking opportunities, and community outreach.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Hispanic Engineers and Scientists of the UCB are determined to increase the number of culturally responsible engineers and scientists who succeed academically, lead professionally, and contribute passionately to society.

Name: Historic Preservation Club üíô
Description: We will have fun exploring buildings on campus and taking tours. We will also work closely with campus administrators of buildings, learn about buildings' history, understand arguments regarding their proposed preservation/demolition. We'll also gather information from architects and land-mark commissioners involved in these projects. Our club will meet on a weekly basis.
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Historic Preservation Club is dedicated to political and social advocacy of historic preservation on and off campus.

Name: Historical Fencing Club of Berkeley üíô
Description: Welcome to The Historical Fencing Club of Berkeley, where we practice swordsmanship using realistically constructed and fully weighted sword replicas, protective equipment, and manuscripts written by fencing masters of old. We aim to reconstruct historical techniques and fighting systems for a wide array of weapons, including but not limited to the longsword, cavalry saber, and rapier. Our meetings involve both guided practice to learn skills and free sparring to put those skills to the test. Come try us out if you‚Äôd like to engage in combat in a safe and welcoming environment or just have fun handling a sword! We teach from a list of manuals, some of which are Keith Farrell's German Longsword Manual for longsword (adapted from the teachings of Johannes Liechtenaur), Fiore de‚Äôi Liberi‚Äôs Il Fior di Battaglia(c. 1400) for longsword and dagger, and Charles Roworth‚Äôs Art of Defence on Foot(1798) for cavalry saber. There is no independent study required for members(though you might find it valuable to read the source for something you‚Äôre confused about) and our instructors will give you all the information you need. We have no club dues, no application, no need for prior experience, and you don‚Äôt need to buy any gear. The club will provide everything you need to participate. While our instructors teach lessons that build upon each other, we welcome new members throughout the year and will be more than happy to get you up to speed on anything you‚Äôve missed! You might have heard fencing associated with the Olympics and some of our members have backgrounds in sport fencing. In contrast to modern/sport/Olympic fencing, which trains to the rules of the sport in question, historical fencing and other Historical European Martial Arts(HEMA) train in practical swordsmanship for self-defense, dueling, or military contexts of the past. Look no further if you‚Äôd like to learn more about swordsmanship and its historical usage! Come join us on Memorial Glade every Saturday afternoon (weather permitting) for lessons and informal sparring! Communication about scheduling, material, and general conversation occurs on our Discord, which you can join at https://discord.gg/J6Wzu3PCSY Other information can be found on our link tree at bit.ly/m/steelonsteelhfc
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Historical Fencing Club of Berkeley is a community dedicated to the study and practice of Historical European Martial Arts, especially historical fencing.

Name: History Graduate Association üíô
Description: The History Graduate Association serves to represent all graduate students of UC Berkeley‚Äôs Department of History and their interests, actively foster a professional, inclusive, and supportive graduate community, act as a liaison between the Department‚Äôs graduate students, faculty and staff, as well as the the wider UC Berkeley community, and coordinate graduate community events and workshops.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The HGA serves to represent all graduate students of UC Berkeley‚Äôs Department of History and their interests, act as a liaison between the Department‚Äôs graduate students, faculty and staff, and coordinate graduate community events and workshops.

Name: History of Art Undergraduate Association üíô
Description: By creating an art history community, peers are able to engage creatively, socially, and academically with their interest in and study of art history. By being affiliated with the History of Art department on campus, students can become more active in department events and learn about access to resources. The goal of H.Art is to create a welcoming and academically-focused community of undergraduate scholars in the art history department and beyond.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The History of Art Undergraduate Association (H.Art) aims to create a vibrant academic community for undergraduates students studying art history.

Name: Hmong Student Association at Berkeley üíô
Description: The Hmong Student Association at Berkeley (HSAB) is a student-initiated service group with the mission to promote higher education and cultural understanding of the Hmong community. HSAB provides academic and social support to current and prospective students at Berkeley through the implementation of educational discussions, social activities, and outreach services. Established in 2008, HSAB continues to represent a voice for the Hmong student community at University of California, Berkeley.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Hmong Student Association at Berkeley (HSAB) is a student-initiated service group with the mission to promote higher education and cultural understanding of the Hmong community.

Name: Home of Students Christian Fellowship üíô
Description: Welcome to Home of Students (HOS)! We are a Mandarin-speaking Christian student organization that has been a home away from home for thousands of students in the past fifteen years. Every week, we organize fun and meaningful activities to make new friends, share our lives together, and learn about Jesus. We invite you to join us and make HOS your home at Berkeley :) We meet weekly on: 1) Friday Fellowship @ 2407 Dana Street, Geneva Hall Room 202 (6:15-9pm) 2) Sunday Worship Service @ 2715 Prince Street (11am-12:30pm or 5-7pm)
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Welcome to Home of Students (HOS)! We are a Chinese-speaking Christian student organization that has been a home away from home for thousands of students in the past ten years.

Name: Hong Kong Affairs Association of Berkeley
Description: We are a group of students from the University of California, Berkeley, who are deeply concerned about the political situation in Hong Kong. To address these concerns, we have established the Hong Kong Affairs Association of Berkeley (HKAAB) with the following goals: Raise Awareness: Educate students and the wider community about civil liberty and human rights issues in Hong Kong. Foster Exchange: Create a platform for intellectual and cultural dialogue on Hong Kong-related topics. Build Connections: Collaborate with advocacy groups and student organizations focused on similar issues. For updates, follow us on Instagram at instagram.com/hkaaberk or reach out via email at hkaaberk@gmail.com. For other channels and event sign up, use linktr.ee/hkaaberk. For engagement, please fill out tinyurl.com/joinhkaab.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: We are a group of Berkeley students who are concerned with the political situation in Hong Kong. With a focus on strengthening Hong Kong's civil society overseas, we provide a platform for scholars and activists to engage in discourse freely and fully.

Name: Hong Kong Student Association üíô
Description: Hong Kong Student Association Email: berkeleyhksa@gmail.com Instagram Page: https://www.instagram.com/cal.hksa/ What is HKSA? Hong Kong Student Association (HKSA) is a Registered Student Organization (RSO) at UC Berkeley. Sponsored by Associated Students of University of California (ASUC), we avidly champion the culturally rich blend of the traditional Cantonese legacy and fast-paced modernity, with the objectives of building up an intimate Cantonese community on campus and facilitating cultural exchanges. Every semester, we organize a wide variety of activities, such as BBQ socials, campus tours, family events, detective games, Chinese New Year and Valentine's Day parties, karaoke contests, and senior banquets. As a member club of East Asian Union (EAU), we also collaborate with other member clubs, such as Chinese Student Association, Taiwanese Student Association, and Singapore Malaysia Student Association on organizing events, such as the EAU Night Market, Halloween parties, et cetera. Our club is open to anyone and everyone who is interested in Hong Kong culture and further build their community here at Cal.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: HKSA avidly champions the culturally rich blend of the traditional Cantonese legacy and fast-paced modernity, with the objectives of building up an intimate Cantonese community on campus and facilitating cultural exchanges.

Name: HOSA Future Health Professionals of Berkeley üíô
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: HOSA FHP of Berkeley serves to inspire and support pre-health students at UCB. As a National HOSA chapter, this club involves volunteering, educational symposiums and conferences, competitive & recognition events, and leadership opportunities.

Name: Human Rights Review at Berkeley
Description: Read. Reflect. Advocate.Thought human rights were just policy and paperwork? Think again. The Human Rights Review at UC Berkeley is where bold voices meet critical ideas. We‚Äôre the university‚Äôs only human rights journal, publishing Human rights-centered work as a team of undergrad and grad students. From global injustices to the stories that go unheard, we write to, spark change, challenge narratives, and bring awareness. Because awareness is the first step toward change, and every story has the power to make an impact. Stay informed, stay engaged.
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations
Summary: The Human Rights Review at UC Berkeley is a student-run journal with a diverse team of undergraduate and graduate students. We aim to shed light on pressing global issues, challenge perspectives, and foster meaningful dialogue that drives change.

Name: Hurling Club at Berkeley üíô
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are committed to the promotion and practice of the Gaelic sports of hurling and football in both the local Cal community and the greater collegiate scene. We are always recruiting, and there are no fees to join the club!

Name: IDEA Factory
Description: IDEA Factory is a creative consulting agency run by students of UC Berkeley. We provide insightful marketing and advertising solutions through compelling strategy, interactive concepts, and unique insights to our clients varying from local start-ups to international businesses.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: IDEA Factory is a creative consulting agency run by students of UC Berkeley and Academy of Arts University. We provide insightful marketing and advertising solutions through compelling strategy, interactive concept, and unique production to our clients.

Name: IDEAS at Berkeley
Description: IDEAS at Berkeley is dedicated to empowering undocumented students at UC Berkeley. We strive to create a space where students feel safe, supported, and empowered to succeed academically and personally, despite the barriers they may face. Through community events, leadership development, and advocacy, we address the unique experiences of undocumented students. Our goal is to foster connections, provide resources, and promote equity on campus and beyond. IDEAS at Berkeley also collaborates with allies to raise awareness of immigration issues, building understanding and solidarity within the broader community. Together, we work to ensure that all students, regardless of immigration status, have the opportunity to pursue their dreams in an inclusive and supportive environment.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: Improving Dreams, Equity, Access, and Success (IDEAS) is dedicated to empowering undocumented students at UC Berkeley.

Description: Ideas on Consciousness is a student organization focused on providing spaces for students of different disciplines and backgrounds to cross paths, share ideas, and explore questions relating to the nature of consciousness. Ideas on Consciousness hosts weekly club meetings and social events, and hosts a large event 4 times a semester, bringing together a panel of different professionals in the field of consciousness to answer questions in front of an audience. We also facilitate a two-unit DeCal class that students are encouraged, but not required, to enroll in.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Ideas on Consciousness is a student organization focused on providing spaces for students of different disciplines and backgrounds to cross paths, share ideas, and explore questions relating to the nature of consciousness.

Summary: IGenSpectrum demonstrates and ensures that physics is a viable career path for LGBT+ students and academics through social and professional development, community outreach, and by providing general LGBT+ advocacy, support, and safe spaces.

Name: IEEE Power and Energy at Berkeley
Description: The goal of this community is to promote the technical knowledge in the areas of power and energy research. We aim to provide a space for students, both graduate and undergraduate, to further their technical knowledge, presentation and discussion skills. This community works to aid in the transfer of knowledge and cooperation of its members and affiliates. In addition, this community aims to provide the necessary resources for students, connecting them with industry members in the Bay Area and globally. We host members of the power and energy community as part of our seminar series, to inform our members on technical advancements outside the university. We represent a student branch of the IEEE PELS/PES/IAS chapters.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The goal of this community is to promote the technical knowledge in the areas of power and energy research.

Name: IEEE Student Branch üíô
Description: The University of California, Berkeley IEEE Student Branch connects engineering students with opportunities in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science. Learn more about us here!

Summary: World's largest technical and professional organization dedicated to the advancement of technology for humanity. We're passionate about connecting engineers with opportunities and empowering our members to break into the tech industry.

Name: iGEM at Berkeley üíô
Description: About us:iGEM at Berkeley is a ‚Äúby students for students‚Äù synthetic biology lab space. Over time, students can receive hands-on and virtual training to fully participate in experimentation in either our wetlab, or compbio team. These students can then take on leadership roles as officers who both manage experimentation and provide the members with a well-maintained hackerspace through various critical administrative roles. Progression through the club is based on contribution and not on previous experiences. All majors and years are welcome. Recruitment for the Fall semester has officially started! Our infosessions are on September 3 and September 4 from 8-9 PM in Wheeler 222! General Membership form: fill out this brief form if you're interested in being a general member, training team member, or outreach team member. As a general member, you get access to all of our training resources and professional development events, with the flexibility of completing everything on your own schedule. As a training team member, you can get a more guided introduction to synthetic and computational biology in a group-learning setting. No previous biology research experience is required or expected. Application Page: check out our applications if you're interested in joining one of our computational or wetlab experimental teams, ideation teams, DeCals, or admin teams. As an experimental team member, you will join a specific project and design experiments to research a specific question. We have 7 experimental teams that are recruiting this semester and 2 ideation teams. A brief description of each project is listed in the form, but come to one of our infosessions to learn about each project in more depth. Students in an experimental project team (Wetlab or CompBio) will: Design, implement, and analyze wet and computational projects with an application to synthetic biology. This will develop their problem solving abilities by trouble-shooting research projects, and push them to think creatively to design new experiments and protocols and adapt them to evolving data and feedback. Learn genetic engineering techniques, and via project brainstorming sessions, become literate in analysis of scientific publications. Students will be pushed to read primary literature and evaluate the contemporary problems of their research topics, in order to produce plausible solutions in the form of project ideas. Via training modules, students will also receive hands-on skills to enter the wetlab space and to perform data analysis with computational tools. Develop their abilities to communicate and accomplish goals with their peers. Our students will gain a sense of ownership of their research project, and play important roles in running and maintaining a simple BSL-1 lab space. Our effort is entirely student driven, and it will take a diverse set of students of different interests and backgrounds to keep our hacker-space thriving. All information about our club including all of our applications can be found on igem.studentorg.berkeley.edu.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our mission is to provide undergraduates the unique opportunity to perform original, student-led genetic engineering research projects. We seek to increase accessibility of the synthetic biology community to students at Cal.

Name: Improv4Charity
Description: Improv4Charity is a short-form improvisational comedy team that donates 100% of their show proceeds to charity! Most recently, we have donated to local charities such as Cal Habitat for Humanity, the Berkeley Student Cooperative, and Bay Area Women Against Rape. We put on multiple shows per semester and even collaborate with other improv teams! If you're interested in audition info or show details follow us @improvforcharity on Instagram!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Improv4Charity is a short-form improv comedy team that donates 100% of their show proceeds to charity! We have donated to Cal Habitat for Humanity, the Berkeley Student Cooperative, and more!

Name: Indian Students Association
Description: Indian Students Association at Berkeley is an on-campus student organization conceived with the objective of representing the South Asian Diaspora and the Indo-American community on the UC Berkeley campus. The council is composed of ~40 individuals dedicated to designing, marketing, financing, and coordinating events spreading and celebrating South Asian culture with the Berkeley community. Our grandest events include the largest "Green" Holi on the West coast, Diwali and Raas-Garba. These events are highly anticipated by the Berkeley community and receive upwards of 3,000 people in total. Apart from these events, we host ‚Äúcross-cultural conversations‚Äù via mixers with South Indian Society, Asian American Association, Pakistani Student Association and more so that members are able to make connections and learn about the wide range of cultures at Berkeley. We also recognize the power of our voice on campus and host panels, social justice events, and speakers with a diverse range of backgrounds to speak on issues that affect the South Asian experience globally. Diversity and inclusion is a staple of ISA and something that we strive toward with our events and actions. Check out our social media/website to either join the council or join our general member program with exclusive access to our events & a community that awaits you!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, ABSA - Budgeted over $7500 Organizations
Summary: ISA is an on-campus student organization dedicated to representing the South Asian Diaspora and the Indo-American community to the UC Berkeley campus and the Bay Area in general through meetings, events, and media.

Name: Indigenous and Native Coalition (INC) Recruitment and Retention Center
Description: Indigenous and Native Coalition (INC) Recruitment and Retention Center, formerly known as Native American Recruitment and Retention Center (NARRC), is a student-initiated organization consisting of university faculty, staff, and undergraduate students who recognize the significance of keeping higher education accessible and attainable for Native Americans, Indigenous people, Native Hawaiian, and Pacific Islanders. We recognize the complexities of Native and Indigenous histories and identities and work to convey this to the larger campus community. INC concentrates its recruitment efforts on diverse Native and Indigenous communities, encouraging Native Americans, Indigenous, Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islanders of all ages to apply and attend various forms of post-secondary education. We seek to increase Native and Indigenous presence at all levels of higher education, including but not limited to, community colleges, tribal colleges, four-year institutions, and technical schools. We promote community involvement beyond campus borders by hosting collaborative events with organizations such as the Native American Health Center, Intertribal Friendship House, and the American Indian Child Resource Center. INC works to create and to provide a variety of support programs and resources for Native American, Indigenous, Native Hawaiian, and Pacific Islander students at UC Berkeley in order to help them succeed and ultimately graduate. Our organization aims to establish a support system at Cal by providing safe spaces on campus as well as collaborating with other on-campus organizations. INC-RRC plays a key role in helping students balance individual success at Cal while maintaining pride in their heritage(s). Members of INC set an example for younger Native and Indigenous students, demonstrating that they can get here and also be successful in this competitive environment. It is our purpose to keep Native and Indigenous students at Cal and to increase and maintain adequate retention within the University. We must provide students with the necessary resources to achieve and foster a sense of community amongst our members.
Categories: RRC - Recruitment & Retention Center, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: To actively recruit secondary and transfer students to apply to UC Berkeley, as well as guide them through the process. Also, to improve the retention of Native American students on campus through academic, social, cultural, and professional support.

Name: Indus
Description: The primary purpose of this association shall be to organize and engage in activities designed to preserve and spread South Asian culture among its membership and the surrounding area. To achieve this aim, Indus shall: 1. organize educational and cultural activities meant to educate the campus population at-large about classical and modern South Asian culture; 2. provide a forum of cultural, social and recreational activities designed to enhance the relationships between South Asian students on campus
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations
Summary: The primary purpose of this association shall be to organize and engage in activities designed to preserve and spread South Asian culture among its membership and the surrounding area.

Name: Industrial Workers of the World at Berkeley
Summary: The purpose of this organization is to carry on the struggle for the emancipation of the working class and to build through its industrial organizations an administrative structure for the continuation of production after the abolition of capitalism.

Name: Infectious Diseases and Immunity PhD Student Group
Description: The Infectious Diseases and Immunity PhD Student Group provides a forum for the IDI PhD students to discuss programmatic issues, plan and organize activities, and foster a sense of community between the students.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The Infectious Diseases and Immunity PhD Student Group provides a forum for the IDI PhD students to discuss programmatic issues, plan and organize activities, and foster a sense of community between the students.

Name: Information Management Student Association
Description: Comprised of students from UC Berkeley's School of Information, we are committed to being the unified voice of all students, we strive to listen actively and provide support in every way possible, fostering an inclusive, respectful, and empowering environment for everyone in our community.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The Information Management Student Association (IMSA) serves as the official representative body for MIMS students at the I School.

Name: Inside the Living Room
Description: Inside the Living Room (ILR) creates meaningful internship & service opportunities for UC Berkeley students seeking to understand immigrant refugee rights, legal processes and frameworks, and immigrant advocacy through the working of legal cases and educational programs for immigrants and the public with the East Bay Sanctuary Covenant.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Inside the Living Room (ILR) creates meaningful internship & service opportunities for UC Berkeley students seeking to understand immigrant refugee rights, legal processes and frameworks, and immigrant advocacy.

Name: Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers
Description: The Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers (IISE) at Berkeley is the largest industrial engineering student organization on campus. Our mission is to provide Industrial Engineering and Operations Research (IEOR) and Analytics majors with the opportunity to engage with students, professionals, and alumni. We strive to create an inclusive environment for current and future students, and we focus on supporting one another in terms of academic, social, and career development. Learn more about us at https://iise.berkeley.edu and contact iise@berkeley.edu to join us and meet your fellow IEOR / Analytics students!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Institute of Industrial Engineers at Berkeley holds social and professional activities throughout the semester tailored to undergraduate students demonstrating an interest in the fields of Industrial Engineering and/or Operations Research.

Name: Institute of Transportation Engineers at UC Berkeley üíô
Description: Cal ITE hosts regular technical events featuring local companies to bring opportunities to students. These events may also include office visits and field trips around the Bay Area. Participate in resume workshops, talks/panels, and lunch meetings with professionals. Meet students interested in transportation from other universities in annual competitions and conferences. Attend fun transportation-related socials to meet many transportation enthusiasts, including rail, active transportation, and transit. Everyone is welcome!
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of Cal ITE shall be to promote student exploration of transportation engineering by fostering meaningful connections between students and transportation professionals.

Name: Intellectual Property Law Society üíô
Description: The Intellectual Property Society (IPLS) caters to the interests of all budding Intellectual Property lawyers! IPLS is committed to cultivating research, discussions and advocacy in the field of Intellectual Property Law. We strive to provide all kinds of fruitful opportunities for the students interested in intellectual property law, thereby strengthening their ties with the Berkeley Law community. We work towards: Building networks between intellectual property law attorneys, advocacy organizations and the Berkeley Law student body in order to promote the field of intellectual property law; Spreading awareness of intellectual property law as a career path for young scholars in the Berkeley community at large; Providing training opportunities for students and supporting the intellectual property law curriculum at Berkeley Law.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Intellectual Property Law Society is organized to serve as a focus group for Berkeley Law students interested in practicing intellectual property law.

Name: Interfraternity Council (IFC)
Description: The Interfraternity Council (IFC) is one of four Greek councils at Cal that abide by the pillars of Friendship, Leadership, Scholarship and Service. We are the binding organization that ties all of the recognized fraternity chapters on campus. The number of fraternities is now over thrity, which amounts to approximately 1300 of the undergradute men at UC Berkeley. IFC serves chiefly as the official connection between the individual chapters and the University of California. As a council we are by and large self-governed through the efforts of representative delegates from each chapter, who work year long with the officers on IFC to strategize, plan, organize and execute short and long term goals to ensure the growth of the fraternity system at Cal. IFC can also be thought of as the organization capable of doing things for the benefit of the entire community that no individual chapter has the resources to do on their own. We frequently engage in activities that include Greek-wide philanthropy and social events, public relations with the University and rest of the Berkeley community, risk management and safety of the entire community and Greek wide recruitment, to name a few. Recruitment into IFC chapters is generally available at the beginning of every semester to every undergraduate male seeking to enhance their time at Cal by being a part of an organization that is truly greater than the sum of its parts. Greek members graduate with uncomparable experiences of the brotherhood, leadership opportunities and social life that is inherent in every chapter, regardless of the letters.
Categories: CalGreeks Fraternity & Sorority Affinity Groups
Summary: The Inter-Fraternity Council represents over thirty Greek organizations on Berkeley's campus. The Council aims to ensure that its members get the most out of their time at Cal by emphasizing four pillars‚ÄîLeadership, Friendship, Scholarship and Service.

Name: Intermission Orchestra, The
Description: The Intermission Orchestra is a community of fans of anime, video games, and films, who enjoy playing the music from these mediums. Our goal is to spread our love for these genres of music. Find us on Facebook, Instagram and our Youtube Channel! If you are interested in joining us, please check out and fill out our website and fill out the applications!We are recruiting players (including singers!) and staff (art, audio, and photography/video). If you don't have a lot of music experience but still want to get involved, sign up for our staff positions! They are beginner-friendly and we will be holding workshops to teach you everything you need to know! How will this club work?To put it simply, club members arrange full orchestra pieces for members to rehearse throughout the semester. This culminates into a concert where we invite people from the school and the community to come watch us play. Club members can also form small ensembles to play their own pieces in between whole-orchestra pieces.Other than that, we have social events (dinners, boba runs, and game night) and workshops (singing, arranging, audio engineering, etc.)!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: The Intermission Orchestra is a community of fans of anime, video games, and films, who enjoy playing the music from these mediums. Our goal is to spread our love for these genres of music.

Name: International & Undocumented Student Project (GA Project)
Categories: GA Government Projects
Summary: GA account for GA IUSP

Name: International Building Performance Simulation Association/ASHRAE Berkeley
Description: We are a student organization recognized by the national chapter of the International Building Performance Simulation Association - USA and ASHRAE chapters. We seek to unite students and researchers from across campus who work towards the design, construction, operation, and maintenance of sustainable and healthy built environments through the use of Building Performance Simulation tools and connections to industry's professionals with the end goal of increasing quality research and scholarship.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Do you work towards high-performing built environments at UC Berkeley? Are you interested in Building Performance Simulation? Join IA-Berkeley and get in touch with the diverse, inter-department community on Berkeley's campus who have the same goals.

Name: International Consulting Club at Berkeley
Description: We pride ourselves on: Strength in diversity & inclusion We believe that localized, global innovation is best achieved with the synergy of minds from diverse majors, years, nationalities, cultural backgrounds, and skill sets. We don‚Äôt just recruit diversity ‚Äî we nurture it. A drive for constant growth, both personal and club-wide Our members are always engaged in their own growth and the growth of our club, giving and receiving constructive feedback, and supporting each other as we progress. The international nature of our work We occupy a unique niche within the consulting club landscape on campus, conducting an average of four projects each from a different country every semester. We aim to bridge global knowledge gaps, and to progress in service of a globalized world. Our goals for you: To find a like-minded and diverse community of fellow students, bound together by genuine connections To broaden your horizons, in working with people, cultures and challenges from all over the world To develop as a leader, via an accelerated pace of opportunities in a high-growth student organization Qualities we‚Äôre looking for: Open-mindedness An openness both to new opportunities and knowledge, and to new people, cultures and backgrounds Synergistic An ability to work well in teams of diverse people, pulling weight, contributing to team morale and adapting to different situations in a way that creates a whole more than the sum of its parts Dynamism A forward-facing attitude, informed by self-reflection and constructive feedback, recognizing that personal growth contributes to the growth of the club Our Story The International Consulting Club at Berkeley (aka Berkeley International Consulting "BIC") was founded in the summer of 2020 with the intention of helping international businesses that traditionally lack access to high-quality consulting resources grow and tackle difficult problems at hand. Since its inception, the club‚Äôs mission has expanded to offer a broader set of services to companies based all over the world. Besides working with international clients to offer recommendations in important areas like DE&I, marketing, and sustainability, BIC has partnered with student-run consulting organizations at some of the best business schools in the world. Our broad international experience ensures that we approach each project with a fresh perspective; a priority in today‚Äôs borderless economy. Previous clients include: Emirates, Nestle, Heinz, Latam Airlines, Adobe, L'Or√©al, Kering (Gucci, Balenciaga, etc), Albertsons Companies, Falabella, Challegermode, Bobacino, So Syncd, Playstories, Cleanwave, Tocco Toscano, BeforePay Fa24 Recruitment Updates Check out our website and social media for recruitment timeline. Application will be live soon and can be accessed at https://berkeleyint.org/recruiting.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage
Summary: Global innovation, localized insights. Berkeley International Consulting (BIC) aims to be a diverse, inclusive home for students with a drive to apply curiosity about the world and forward-facing creativity in service of companies all over the globe.

Name: International Graduate Student Ministry üíô
Description: We are a community of international graduate students and alumni at UC Berkeley. Founded in 2003, International Graduate Student Ministry (IGSM) is a Christian student group at UC Berkeley. We meet regularly to discuss the bigger questions of life through the lens of Christianity, and we are committed to building an authentic community together and providing a home away from home experience for international graduate students. If you want to know more about us, please contact us here, or check out any of our upcoming events!
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Christian student organization which provides a loving community and introduces basics of Christianity to international students at UC Berkeley.

Name: International Healthcare Association
Description: The International Healthcare Association at Berkeley (iHCA) provides professional development for international and globally-minded students interested in the healthcare industry. We focus on the challenges that international students face when seeking a healthcare-related career, whether in medical or non-medical roles. We aim to be a community and support system for students in their professional careers. Join us for... - Professional development workshops at general meetings - Networking with peers and professionals in all fields of healthcare - Opportunity for medical interpretation training and internship - Health Policy Hackathons Watch this video to learn more!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: To help international students better understand U.S. healthcare through experiential learning. We provide professional opportunities and foster connections between international and domestic students to create a generation of global citizens.

Name: International Law Society üíô
Description: The International Law Society (ILS) produces social and academic events in comparative and international law. ILS connects between LLM students and JD students, is a landing base for LLMs as they transition to America, and creates opportunities for JD/LLM students to engage with international law practitioners and learn about international law careers. ILS hosts lunch time talks, job fair and social activities to help the law school and our students‚Äô career aspirations.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: ILS produces social and academic events in comparative and international law for community members.

Name: International Public Policy Group üíô
Description: The International Public Policy Group at UC Berkeley is an association and working group of policy students and professionals. We analyze and discuss global policies and issues, as well as comparative domestic policies across a range of issue areas ‚Äì economics, security, health, environment, governance, and technology, among others. Situated primarily in the Goldman School of Public Policy at UC Berkeley, IPPG welcomes students and alumni from all departments at UC Berkeley. Unless otherwise noted, all IPPG events are open to the UC Berkeley community.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The International Public Policy Group at GSPP, UC Berkeley is an association and working group of policy students and professionals. We analyze and discuss global policies and issues, as well as comparative domestic policies across a range of issues.

Name: International Service Club üíô
Description: International Service Club has bimonthly meetings to plan and host service events related to international causes ranging from water sanitation to ending polio.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: International Service Club has bimonthly meetings to plan and host service events related to international causes ranging from water sanitation to ending polio.

Name: International Software Product Management Association at Berkeley
Description: Established in Fall 2023 by Vladyslav Shevkunov with the help of ISPMA Board of Directors to begin the first student chapter of the International Software Product Management Association. ISPMA has now been renamed to Software Product at Cal (SPC). SPC intends to create more opportunity at the undergraduate level to learn about software product management. We aim to educate and provide experiences in software product management as well as create a community of like-minded individuals.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Software Product at Cal is the first North American chapter of the International Software Product Management Association. SPC intends to educate and provide experiences in product management as well as create a community of like-minded individuals.

Name: International Student Fellowship
Description: College can be tough, especially for international students who are far away from home, and we all need a community to go through the ups and downs of life. Throughout the week, ISF gets together to study, hang out, talk about life's questions from a Christian perspective, and much more! We also have an extensive alumni volunteer network of various disciplines and professions, giving students a wealth of wisdom and experience accessible to them. If you want to find out any of our upcoming events or join our community, check our website!
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: ISF is here to support and enrich the lives of international students. Throughout the week, we meet to study, hang out, talk about life's questions from a Christian perspective, and much more! We hope you'll find ISF to be your home away from home!

Name: International Student Mentorship Program at Berkeley üíô
Description: ISMP at Berkeley aims to mentor international undergraduate and graduate students academically, professionally, and personally, including adjusting to culture and life in the U.S. and equipping them for career growth in the future. We will be pairing international students with UC Berkeley alumni as mentors based on their interests and needs, as well as hosting webinars and workshops to help them grow.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of this organization is to mentor international students academically, professionally, and personally, including adjusting to culture and life in the US and equipping them for career growth in the future.

Name: International Students Association at Berkeley
Description: ISAB is the largest international students association on the UC Berkeley campus. It was established in 2009 and has been nominated as an outstanding student organization in 2010-2011. ISAB aims to create a positive intellectual and social atmosphere for international students, stimulate cultural awareness among all students in Berkeley, and strengthen Berkeley‚Äôs multicultural community. We work closely with other student organizations to generate cultural awareness and strengthen multicultural ties. We also collaborate with the Berkeley International Office to create enriching and engaging events for the international community. Recruiting for Fall 2025 soon! Learn more at: https://linktr.ee/isabcal Follow us on Instagram (@isab_cal) for updates!
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: ISAB aims to create a positive intellectual and social atmosphere for international students, stimulate cultural awareness among all students in Berkeley, and strengthen Berkeley's multicultural community.

Name: InterVarsity Christian Fellowship üíô
Description: The purpose of InterVarsity Christian Fellowship/USA is to establish and advance witnessing communities of students and faculty who follow Jesus as Savior and Lord at colleges and universities; growing in love for God, God's word, God's people of every ethnicity and culture and God's purpose in the world. IVCF is an umbrella organization at Cal that encompasses four sister fellowships: Cal Christian Fellowship, International Student Ministry (ISM), Black Campus Ministries (BCM), and LaFe. For more information about each, search us up on Callink!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: InterVarsity at Cal is the umbrella organization of four ethnically-dedicated groups on campus: CCF, ISM, BCM, and LaFe -- Together we seek to discover God's heart in an authentic community.

Name: Invention Corps of Berkeley
Description: We are a not-for-profit, multidisciplinary student organization focused on human-centered design by partnering with professors, graduate students, and companies on specific projects that utilize design thinking to improve existing solutions on poverty, health, environment, and society. As a diverse organization of all skill sets and backgrounds, we are fueled by our individual passions and converge upon those passions to create a holistic organization by continuously prototyping with the goal of empowering ourselves and others. Our aim is to invent new ways to make a better world.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: We are a not-for-profit, multidisciplinary, projects-based student organization that utilizes human-centered design by partnering with professors, graduate students, and companies to improve existing solutions on poverty, health, environment, and society

Name: Iranian Student Association in America
Description: The Iranian Student Association in America (ISAA) is a non-political, non-religious, voluntary graduate student organization, acting as a source of union and support for the Iranian community at the University of California, Berkeley. ISAA strives for improving the academic, professional, and societal experiences of Iranian students, increasing the voice of Iranians within the United States, and promoting the Iranian community, identity, and culture.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The Iranian Student Association in America (ISAA) is a non-political, non-religious, voluntary graduate student organization, acting as a source of union and support for the Iranian community at the University of California, Berkeley.

Name: Iranian Students Cultural Organization üíô
Description: Established in 1988, the Iranian Students‚Äô Cultural Organization (ISCO) aims to promote cultural awareness among undergraduate students at UC Berkeley through recreational events, cultural celebrations, and philanthropic endeavors. ISCO welcomes members of a variety of backgrounds and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disabilities. Although ISCO is neither politically or religiously affiliated, we stand with the Women, Life, Freedom movement and hope to one day see a free Iran.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of the group is to educate and promote cultural awareness among both natives and non-natives of Iran through various group activities. The group is in no way politically or religiously affiliated.

Name: Iraqi Student Union
Description: The Iraqi Student Union (ISU) aims to build the Iraqi community at UC Berkeley through event hosting, projects, and outreach to the greater Iraqi community. All are welcome to come to our meetings! To stay up to date with the ISU: Follow our instagram:@isu.california We hope to see you there!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: To support the Iraqi community on campus of UC Berkeley.

Name: Israel Action Committee
Description: The Israel Action Committee is the oldest organization in Berkeley dedicated to educating and promoting discussion about Israel to students, faculty, and the community. IAC aims to provide Berkeley with a link to Israeli politics, current issues, the diversity of cultures that exist in the state today, and the various perspectives surrounding the country and its presence in the Middle East. IAC is a group and social network for students who believe in and are passionate about the state of Israel. IAC provides a forum for its members to discuss and learn more about Israel, as well as an opportunity to interact and engage directly with various leaders, organizations, and sectors of Israeli society.
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: IAC

Name: Issues: Berkeley Medical Journal
Description: Each semester in the Berkeley Medical Journal, we showcase original articles by UC Berkeley undergraduates exploring cutting-edge medical innovations, public health issues, and biomedical research in the Bay Area. Students in this DeCal will take on the role of scientific journalists. Paired with an editor, they will choose their own topics, and write a short report and a feature piece, with the chance to be published in the Berkeley Medical Journal. Throughout the semester, students will engage in workshops, peer reviews, and editorial meetings designed to strengthen their scientific communication skills. In addition to guided writing support, students will complete short assignments to deepen their understanding of science journalism, conduct an interview with a research expert, and will have the opportunity to interact with an industry professional at our semesterly guest lecture. The course culminates in a final presentation of each student‚Äôs feature article. Selected articles will be considered for publication in the Berkeley Medical Journal.
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Welcome to Issues: Berkeley Medical Journal (MCB 98/198), a student-run medical journal at the University of California, Berkeley that connects news about recent medical innovations in the Bay Area to our student body through events and articles.

Name: Jain Students Association üíô
Description: The Jain Student Association (JSA) at Berkeley strives to foster a tight-knit community where students can explore their cultural roots and engage in events that highlight Jain values in today‚Äôs world. Rooted in the core Jain principle of ahimsa (non-violence), we aim to build a supportive space for Jain students to connect with one another and navigate the challenges of college together, while promoting compassion, mindfulness, and community service.
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: JSA builds a network of Jain students at UC Berkeley, furthers our understanding of Jainism and its values, and promotes Jain values within our community.

Name: Jakara Movement Club at Berkeley üíô
Description: The mission of the Sikh Collegiate Federation (SCF) is to uplift the Sikh community through strengthening the Miri and Piri principles on collegiate campuses.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are forging a Gurmat-inspired generation through creative leadership development, community organizing, and social activism. We believe a world of engaged communities, strong families, healthy individuals and inspired youth is possible.

Name: Jeeva Clinic üíô
Description: There is a large South Asian presence in the Bay Area which are known to be at risk for obesity-related metabolic disorders. For example, South Asians have the highest death rate from heart disease and comprise 60% of the heart disease population in the world. Our organization aims to implement a community based model in order to address cardiovascular disease in the South Asian community, a major public health concern. We previously catered specifically to the South Asian population but we now seek to expand awareness to populations that our healthcare system can better support. We hold general member meetings biweekly. Our club is an avenue for those interested in public health, in their local community or otherwise, to further explore their interest and help others.
Categories: Health & Wellness Student Organizations, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Jeeva Clinic aims to implement a community-based model to address the prevalence of cardiovascular disease in the South Asian community. We also seek to educate ourselves and others on how to best bridge gaps in healthcare across marginalized groups.

Name: Jericho!
Description: jericho! is U.C. Berkeley's premier longform improv team. We specialize in bringing various longform improv formats to the stage, as well as digital media and live sketches!We hold auditions each year, come to our public workshops and/or sign up for an audition time. We hope to see you there!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Improvisational and sketch comedy troupe at UC Berkeley.

Name: Jewish Student Union
Description: The JSU is a coalition of stakeholders within the UC Berkeley Jewish community, serving as a representative body for the Jewish student population. We work to support Jewish life and ensure the needs and interests of our community are met on campus.Membership in the JSU is open to all currently registered student, faculty, or staff member at the University of California, Berkeley.Visit our website: jsu.studentorg.berkeley.edu Become a member here.To contact the JSU, please email caljsu@jsu.studentorg.berkeley.edu
Categories: Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations
Summary: The JSU is a coalition of stakeholders within the UC Berkeley Jewish community, serving as a representative body for the Jewish student population. We work to support Jewish life and ensure the needs and interests of our community are met on campus.

Name: Jewish Students Association at Berkeley Law üíô
Description: We host Shabbat dinners, holiday events, and cultural excursions for Jewish students at Berkeley Law
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Jewish community organization at Berkeley Law.

Description: Journal of Black Law and Policy (JBLP) (Formerly known as The Berkeley Journal of African American Law & Policy (BJALP))is committed to publishing works dedicated to addressing social, political, and economic issues affecting the Black diaspora while promoting the works of scholars of marginalized identities, activists, and attorneys. Name: Jugger at Berkeley üíô
Description: Jugger at Berkeley is California's oldest jugger club. Originally founded in 2014 by graduate students under the name Berkeley Riot, the club has been running by various different monikers and run by many different groups of people until settling on its current name the club name, with our flagship team branded 'Ursae Majoris'. Jugger is a five-a-side team sport involving facets of capture the flag and sparring, with both teams fighting to get a 'skull' into the enemy team's goal.It is played worldwide, originating in Germany, but now having spread to Australia, Asia, and obviously America, with the country hosting around 35 recognized teams across the US. We play 3-4 times a week over UC Berkeley term time, with sparring and drill-based midweeks across Monday to Friday, and full 5v5 games on Saturday. Our central hub is always on Memorial Glade. We have no recruitment or application process, anybody is welcome to come to any of our public practices and learn how to spar and play the game. Just ask one of our players to try it out and you will be shown the basics. For more formal announcements, follow our Instagram. To follow along with our community and directly ask questions of our players, join our discord. The link can be found in the bio of our instagram. (formerly known as Juggers of the Seven Regents)
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Jugger is an internationally played field sport that combines aspects of fencing, rugby, and capture the flag. Our group exists to bring the sport to the Berkeley community through playing on campus. All are welcome!

Name: Kairos Dance Co.
Description: Kairos Dance Co. is a contemporary-centered dance group established in Fall 2019 that aims to foster growth and passion for contemporary dance across the UC Berkeley campus through a tight-knit and dedicated community. Kairos holds weekly technique and set-building practices, puts on open workshops for the Berkeley dance community, and performs in various showcases at the end of each semester. Auditions are held at the beginning of each semester. Check out our social media platforms (Instagram, Youtube, FB) to learn more about the Kairos family! https://youtu.be/f0dEO9YGclg https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f3VfdS32ETo https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lee6xhp3gm8

Name: Kappa Alpha Order
Categories: CalGreeks Interfraternity Council (IFC) Fraternities
Summary: Many young Americans today think a gentleman is an age-old concept lost in the past. However we, the knights and brothers of Kappa Alpha Order, strive to live up to the highest ideals of chivalry and gentlemanly conduct in our everyday lives.

Name: Kappa Alpha Pi Pre-Law Fraternity
Description: The Fraternity is designed to advance ideals of liberty and equal justice under law; to inspire the virtues of compassion and courage; to foster integrity and professional competence; to promote the welfare of its members; and to encourage their moral, intellectual, and cultural advancement; so that each member may enjoy a lifetime of honorable professional and public service. We hold our members to a high caliber of professional competence and fraternal fellowship while promoting public service. We differentiate ourselves by the rigor of our Leadership Program and the selectivity of our members, which allows its members to develop into prominent leaders on and off campus. Additionally, we maintain a unique national network of Kappa Alpha Pi chapters, including: The University of Michigan, Ann Arbor; The University of California, Los Angeles; The University of California, Riverside; Cornell University, among others. Social Justice We are committed to improving the quality of legal access and advocacy in the Bay Area. By partnering with organizations such as the East Bay Community Law Center and hosting a biannual Free Legal Clinic, our members make impactful strides toward equality for underserved populations. Our philanthropic history also includes working with the Bay Area Urban Debate League and other similar causes. Leadership Development Our rigorous Leadership Development Program fosters public speaking, strategic planning and organizational skills in a positive environment. Throughout eight weeks, you will bond with a class of strong campus leaders and expand your personal horizons through a broadened sense of professionalism and the legal field. Various projects such as a legal panel, mock trial, and J.D. shadow increase exposure to the law and profession. Growth continues even after the formal program ends. Law School Preparation We strive to have continuous opportunities to prepare our members from law school, beginning with the big question: is law school really for you? Following the Leadership Development Program, we offer at minimum three events and workshops for members every semester to further prepare them for law school. These events include round-table discussions with Deans of top law schools, workshops on the law school admissions process, and provide other useful resources to our members. Professional Network We are committed to maintaining strong bonds with every professional we work with. These esteemed individuals include top consultants, private and public attorneys, and top law school deans. By maintaining relationships with firms, companies, public entities, non-profit organizations and more, we ensure continuous and unique opportunities for our members. Alumni Network The Kappa Alpha Pi alumni network runs deep. Our members have attended the nation‚Äôs top law schools and currently hold high-level positions both in government and the private sector. With such a diverse membership, we also have members in top business and graduate school programs. Each new member has the opportunity to connect with and learn from an alumni mentor working in their particular field of interest. Academic Support Our academic support resources include peer reviews of courses across a wide array of majors. We offer group study hours on a weekly basis and test banks for our active members. We also maintain strong relationships with elite test prep companies such as TestMasters and Blueprint. Membership will receive additional advantages, which include discounted prep courses. Fraternalism Our members forge bonds that transcend professional networks; we are family. Various events throughout the semester, from casual hangouts to weekend-long retreats, provide ample opportunity to relax and make the most of your time at Cal. If you seek a group of brothers and sisters who embrace new challenges and strive for new heights, then Kappa Alpha Pi is the place for you. We invite you to join us.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The purpose of this Fraternity shall be to form a strong bond uniting students and teachers of the law with members of the Bench and Bar in fraternal fellowship.

Name: Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc.
Description: The Gamma Alpha Chapter of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Incorporated was chartered October 23, 1947, which now spans the campuses of the University of California, Berkeley, San Francisco State University, and the University of San Francisco.
Categories: CalGreeks National Pan-Hellenic Council (NPHC) Fraternities & Sororities
Summary: This is a sponsored student organization that is part of the National Pan-Hellenic Council (NPHC)

Name: Kappa Alpha Theta
Description: Kappa Alpha Theta, the first Greek letter fraternity among women, was founded in 1870 by Bettie Locke Hamilton, Alice Allen Brant, Bettie Tipton Lindsey, and Hannah Finch Shaw. Theta has over 170 chapters with houses throughout the United States and Canada. More than 250,000 women have been initiated into Kappa Alpha Theta, forming strong friendships in chapters from all over, holding the sisterhood strong. The Omega Chapter was founded at University of California, Berkeley in 1890. Our Chapter occupied the first women's chapter house built by Omega sister Julia Morgan, the first woman to study architecture at the Ecole de Beaux Arts in Paris. Kappa Alpha Theta is proud to be national supporters of Court Appointed Special Advocates (CASA). CASA is an organization that provides mentors for abused, abandoned and neglected children. These mentors establish close bonds with the children as they interact one-on-one and serve as a voice for the children during the judicial process. The Omega chapter of Kappa AlphaTheta supports CASA in a number of ways including donations from our annual philanthropic fundraising events, Theta Dodgeball and Cafe Casa (our famous Theta Brunch held at our beautiful Theta home, open to the Berkeley community). For any questions regarding Recruitment or Letters of Reference, please contact our Vice President of Membership at omegathetacro@gmail.com.
Categories: CalGreeks Panhellenic Council (PHC) Sororities
Summary: At Omega Theta, we believe the bonds of sisterhood are something that can never be broken. We are so lucky to be surrounded by a group of such lovely, intelligent, and kind women.

Name: Kappa Delta Rho
Categories: CalGreeks Interfraternity Council (IFC) Fraternities

Name: Kappa Gamma Delta
Description: Kappa Gamma Delta, UC Berkeley's premier pre-health sorority, encourages the development of leadership and communication skills, and provides support academically, socially, and emotionally while promoting individuality, unity, and diversity among sisters. Our three pillars are sisterhood, service to humanity, and professionalism. The women of Kappa Gamma Delta are crucial members of the UC Berkeley community acting as club founders & members, research assistants, campus employees, etc. Additionally, they are highly integrated members of the greater Bay Area community, like tutors at local underserved elementary schools, volunteers at nearby hospitals, and interns at medical practices, among many roles. Read more about us at: www.calkgd.com
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Kappa Gamma Delta is dedicated to providing academic, social, and emotional support to the pre-health community at Cal. We are also committed to various service events and projects in the community.

Name: Kappa Kappa Gamma

Name: Kappa Sigma
Description: Kappa Sigma is the largest social fraternity in the world with over 200,000 living brothers consisting of around 20,000 undergraduates and 180,000 alumni. Our house is located at 2400 Warring Avenue, Berkeley, CA 94704. It has multiple stories, huge balconies, and large common areas. Plus it is at the center of greek row located right above Channing Circle.Our alumni are some of the most extensive of any fraternity. We have multiple officeholders, such as senators, governors, and even a presidential candidate. Many Kappa Sigma alumni are professional musicians, actors, and performers. We also have many alumni who are pro athletes across many sports. Kappa Sigma has even been to the moon! Edgar Mitchell was a part of the Apollo 14 mission and was the sixth person to walk on the moon.Kappa Sigma is returning this Fall of 2025 and are looking for any interested outstanding men to come out to rush. The Beta Xi chapter of Kappa Sigma rechartered in Spring 2024 and is now reinstated in Spring 2025. We currently have a group of 30+ guys consisting of many different years and majors. Many of our brothers are interested in a variety of activities such as weight lifting, barbecuing, sports, climbing, hiking, and more!As we are a new fraternity, we are looking to start new traditions and events here at Cal and we want to branch out into all aspects of student life such as philanthropy, sports, and academics. We want to contend in competitive intramural teams like soccer, football, and basketball. We also have a full year of fun brotherhood events like retreats, road trips, barbecues, and date parties!If you are interested in meeting the brothers and becoming a part of an amazing community then come on out to our Rush events (@calkappasigma), meet the brothers and learn about what it means to be a brother of Kappa Sigma. Please email calkappasig@gmail.com for any questions or inquiries about our brotherhood.
Categories: CalGreeks Interfraternity Council (IFC) Fraternities

Name: Khmer Student Association (Formerly known as Berkeley Cambodian Students Association)üíô
Description: Khmer Students Association, formally known as the Berkeley Cambodian Students Association, was founded to unite and support people who share an interest in Cambodia and Southeast Asian culture by fostering an appreciation of that culture. Currently, the Khmer Student Association has evolved to place greater emphasis on the awareness and retention of Khmer and Khmer-American experiences and identity within the UC Berkeley community. The Khmer Student Association aims to reclaim Khmer cultural practices, create socially aware individuals, inspire leadership and community awareness, while bridging the older and newer generations together. Our goal is to eliminate the invisibility of the Khmer and Khmer-American community and empower its members while also recognizing shared experiences within Southeast Asian identities. This group [Khmer Student Association] was formerly named [Berkeley Cambodian Students Association] - [10/7/24] [AP]

Name: Kidney Disease Screening and Awareness Program üíô
Description: KDSAP is an undergraduate student-run organization that provides free kidney-disease screenings in underserved communities across the Bay Area to improve kidney health and promote health equity. KDSAP has two main objectives: community outreach and student career development. Students help facilitate screening events, acquiring community outreach and professional development skills while serving medically underserved populations and addressing limitations within the U.S. healthcare system. KDSAP‚Äôs screenings are co-hosted with our community partners and are free of charge, do not warrant any documentation, provide trained interpreters, include a consultation with an MD and renal dietitian, and are open to anyone who is interested.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: KDSAP provides free kidney disease screenings in underserved communities across the Bay Area to improve kidney health and promote health equity. Working with UCSF physicians, undergraduate volunteers gain hands-on exposure while serving communities.

Name: Kids Enjoy Exercise Now at Berkeley üíô
Description: Kids Enjoy Exercise Now San Francisco (KEEN SF) is a non-profit organization that works to empower our athletes ‚Äîchildren and teenagers with disabilities, through noncompetitive one-on-one physical activities. During a session, you will be paired with an athlete and will accompany them in staying active through various activities (basketball, bowling, tag, etc.). This is a space where imagination is the limit. You may be playing catch, running around, or pretending to be a pirate with the athlete. Your role as a volunteer is to be supportive and most importantly, have fun! In partnership with Kids Enjoy Exercise Now San Francisco, KEEN at Berkeley will host fun and exercise filled sessions for youth with disabilities in the Bay Area, focusing on the East Bay. Any and all students at Berkeley are welcome to volunteer at these sessions.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: KEEN at Berkeley hopes to carry on the mission of KEEN San Francisco as well as promote community service among students at UC Berkeley as well as create a supportive network for KEEN athletes and their families in the East Bay.

Name: Kids in Nutrition üíô
Description: We are an organization that teaches interactive and inspiring nutrition and health lessons to elementary school children in the Berkeley community. The curriculum includes a variety of activities to complete with the students for an hour once a week. KIN‚Äôs leadership includes passionate individuals who seek to make a meaningful impact on America‚Äôs public health and environmental sustainability systems. We believe that food has direct implications on public and individual health, as well as environmental sustainability, and have decided to dedicate our time to advocating these issues.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: KIN aims to connect college and elementary school students in an effort to inspire and educate our younger generation to lead active and healthy lives. KIN is an educational program on the nutrition, exercise and implications on individual health.

Description: KOJOBS named as Korean Job Search has been dedicated to be leading "Job searching" and Global Networking for Korean Students all around the world. Our project is focused on offering job informations and events for students' career. Our club holds the general meeting twice a month during the semester.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Student-run career based organization for the Korean and Korean American student body at Berkeley. Focus on providing career related opportunities and guidance for students interested in landing a job in the United States as an international student.

Name: Korean American Basketball Association (Formerly known as Berksan) üíô
Description: As a Korean basketball organization, Korean American Basketball Association (KABA) (Formerly known as Berksan) aims to provide coordinated practices and host regulated games for passionate basketball players around the campus. Members of KABA will meet weekly at the RSF or the Hearst Gym to practice drills and play pickup games. Inclined members will participate in the intramural basketball league or the annual LG Cup, an LG Display sponsored friendly basketball match against Stanford Korean basketball club. In addition to playing basketball, KABA wishes to promote a sense of unity within, but not limited to, the Korean community at UC Berkeley. This group [Korean American Basketball Association] was formerly named [Berksan] - [12/11/24] [AP]
