Name: Korean Business Society
Description: The Korean Business Society is a dynamic community that serves as both a professional network and a prestigious social group. Established with the mission of promoting ethical business practices, it aims to prepare members for successful business careers both academically and professionally while also supporting those who wish to turn their start-up ideas into reality. To achieve these objectives, the organization focuses on four core initiatives: educating members on various business disciplines, hosting professional events and a development semester to prepare members for business careers, enhancing networking capabilities through professional contacts, and offering hands-on experiences essential for success in any business field.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our organization aims to help members with professional development through events such as client work and networking. Additionally, we seek to foster an environment where members can learn more about business through active learning.

Name: Korean Graduate Students Association
Description: This is the Korean Graduate Students Association (KGSA) for PhD/MS/MEng students from South Korea at UC Berkeley. Korean PostDoc/Visiting researchers at UC Berkeley and LBNL are welcome as well.

Summary: Korean Graduate Student Association (KGSA) at UC Berkeley.

Name: Korean Juris Doctors (Formerly Global Student Association at Berkeley Law) üíô
Description: Koreans at Berkeley Law (K-ABL) is a student-run organization at Berkeley Law open to all interested Berkeley Law students. The group seeks to make it easier for current and future Korean international and Korean American students to navigate various career paths and to address the unique concerns of international students pursuing a legal career in the United States and to build a vibrant network of legal professionals, practitioners, and academics who share and celebrate their Korean culture and/or heritage. Activities of the group include but are not limited to speaker series, networking opportunities, and/or cultural events, summer fellowships and symposia, and providing access to relevant journals and other publications.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of the organization is twofold: first, to make it easier for current and future international students to navigate various career paths; and second, to build a vibrant network of legal professionals, practitioners, and academics.

KPG strives for excellence in its productions, and aims to challenge its dancers and foster a rewarding team environment. https://www.youtube.com/user/KPGCal

Summary: Founded in 2010, KPG is a UC Berkeley-based dance team with a passion for kpop and dance. The team focuses on the performance and production of kpop covers. KPG aims to challenge its dancers and foster a rewarding team environment.

Name: Korean Undergraduate Networking Association
Description: KUNA, officially known as Korean Undergraduate Networking Association (KUNA), is one of the largest Korean clubs in UC Berkeley. It provides networking for Korean students in Berkeley who struggle to assimilate to the new environment by providing opportunities, such as chances to meet peers and alumni through events, involvement in sport subcommittees, and receiving recruitment information. Furthermore, KUNA aims to spread awareness about Korean culture to the general student body at Berkeley. Email: ucberkeleykuna@gmail.com
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: KUNA, officially known as Korean Undergraduate Networking Association (KUNA), stands in the center of UC Berkeley's Korean community. KUNA provides networking events mainly for Korean students and focuses on spreading awareness about Korean culture.

Name: Korean-American Scientists and Engineers Association (Silicon Valley Chapter)
Description: KSEA @ Berkeley is an organization whose purpose is to create a community of motivated students, and address topics that are related to the technical, personal and career development of Korean-American Scientists and Engineers; to educate members to become successful scientists, engineers, and/or leaders; and to train the staff members on networking, organization, and leadership skills.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: An organization whose purpose is to create a community of motivated students and to address topics that are related to the technical, personal, and career development of Korean-American Scientists and Engineers.

Name: Koreans 4 Decolonization
Description: Koreans for Decolonization is a project by and for diasporic Korean students who are interested in getting involved politically and connecting with other Korean activists. We are guided by principles of anti-imperialism, anti-militarism, and belief in decolonization and Korean reunification (tongil). We provide political education on the history of colonization and imperialism in Korea as well as past and present resistance movements on the peninsula and abroad. Toojeng!
Categories: Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations
Summary: Koreans 4 Decolonization is a political organization for Korean students to learn more about Korean history and form community with other Korean students.

Name: KOSMOS

Name: La Alianza: Law Students of Latin American Descent üíô
Description: We are a group dedicated to mentoring, supporting, and advocating for Latin@ Law Students and the Latin@ community in Berkeley at large. This group [La Alianza: Law Students of Latin American Descent] was formerly named [La Raza Law Students Association] - [10/05/2021] [EC]‚Äù
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Academic, social, emotional and political support for Latin@ Law students and commitment to Latin@ community empowerment.

Name: La Raza Law Journal üíô
Description: The Berkeley Latine Journal of Law and Policy (‚ÄúJournal") produces knowledge designed to capture the imagination of legislators, stir the consciences of judges, and provide a dynamic tool for practitioners concerned with the impact of their work on behalf of the Latine community. The Journal was imagined in 1980 and established in 1981 by Latine students and our allies at Berkeley Law at the University of California, Berkeley. The Journal is one of the few law reviews in the United States that center Latine conditions, communities, and identities. The Journal was established to provide a forum, which previously did not exist, to analyze legal issues affecting the Latine community. Previous issues have addressed bilingual education, affirmative action, immigration law, labor law and policy, voting rights, community empowerment, new models of organizing labor, rural communities, and Latine Critical Legal Theory. Each spring, we traditionally host a symposium to bring together law and other students, with professors, lawyers, activists and other community members to learn about and discuss current issues affecting the Latine community. Additionally, we irregularly hold colloquia and installments of our speaker series. These events and others are part of our evolving project to transform conventional legal education at Berkeley Law in order to help Latine law students and our allies become better advocates for social justice, self-determination, and liberation in the United States and abroad.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our purpose is to provide an open forum for the analysis of legal issues affecting the Latinx community; to publish articles written by Latinx students, scholars, practitioners; and to serve as a legal research resource.

Name: Labor Coach Program
Description: Labor Coaches have the unique opportunity to develop personal relationships with their patients, for whom they are on-call during the last month of the patient's pregnancy. We work with limited English proficiency patients who are usually giving birth for the first time in the US. The Labor Coach Program is great for those with a soft spot for babies, multi-lingual skills, and a desire to work closely with the OB-GYN hospital staff. We currently connect with Cantonese, Mandarin, and Vietnamese speaking patients. Through this program, Labor Coaches have the potential to make a great impact in reducing the stress and pain of women, as well as share the excitement and immense joy at welcoming a new life to the world.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Labor Coach Program works with the Asian Health Services to provide support and interpretation services for mothers during their labor and deliveries.

Name: LAHBA at Haas üíô
Description: The Latin American and Hispanic Business Association (LAHBA) unites students from all backgrounds who share an interest in learning about our cultures. With over 150 members, LAHBA is one of the largest student-run organizations at Haas. Our goal is to create a sense of community among Latino and Hispanic students. To achieve this objective, LAHBA organizes several activities throughout the year including: lectures, socials and professional networking events. One of the distinct characteristics of the Berkeley MBA is our warm, collaborative environment. LAHBA promotes collaboration through a number of events to foster relationships within the membership and the Haas community at-large. Additionally, LAHBA provides a forum where diverse experiences, perspectives, and resources can be shared.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: LAHBA at Haas aka Latin American and Hispanic Business Association

Name: Lambda Phi Epsilon
Description: Founded on August 17, 1988, the Delta Chapter of Lambda Phi Epsilon International Fraternity, Inc. at UC Berkeley is dedicated to promoting leadership, philanthropy, and lifelong brotherhood. As part of the nation‚Äôs largest Asian-interest fraternity, with more than 70+ chapters chartered, our chapter fosters a supportive community where members grow personally and professionally while celebrating cultural diversity. Through service, campus involvement, and academic excellence, we strive to make a lasting impact at Berkeley and beyond.
Categories: CalGreeks Interfraternity Council (IFC) Fraternities
Summary: Founded on August 17, 1988, the Delta Chapter of Lambda Phi Epsilon International Fraternity, Inc. at UC Berkeley is dedicated to promoting leadership, philanthropy, and lifelong brotherhood.

Name: Lambda Theta Alpha Latin Sorority, Inc.
Description: The purpose of Lambda Theta Alpha shall be to provide a sisterhood based on Unity, Love, & Respect. To develop strong Leaders who will then provide and practice political, social and cultural activities. To promote Latino Unity through charitable and educational programs. To maintain a high standard of learning and serve as a voice for the Universal Woman, all Latino students and disenfranchised communities. Lambda Theta Alpha is the FIRST Latina Sorority created in the Nation as well as the Largest Latina Sorority in existence.
Categories: CalGreeks Multicultural Greek Council (MCGC) Fraternities & Sororities
Summary: The purpose of Lambda Theta Alpha shall be to provide a sisterhood based on Unity, Love, & Respect. To develop strong Leaders who will then provide and practice political, social and cultural activities. To promote Latino Unity through charitable

Name: Lambda Theta Nu Sorority, Inc.
Description: Lambda Theta Nu Sorority, Inc. was the first Latina Sorority on the West Coast and on the UC Berkeley Campus. Established in 1986, Lambda Theta Nu Sorority, Inc. continues to provide its members with a support system based on academic excellence, community service, and sisterhood. The purpose of Lambda Theta Nu Sorority, Inc. is to open the doors of opportunity to the Latinas of our community. Our primary focus is academic excellence and meeting the needs of Latina women in higher education. Lambda Theta Nu Sorority, Inc. also promotes the advancement of Latinas through various campus activities and community services, and provides an environment for personal growth within a unit of sisterhood. Lambda Theta Nu Sorority, Inc.'s priorities, however, will be placed upon academic excellence and community service. Divine Delta Chapter | University of California, Berkeley | Est. April 6, 1991 In the Spring of 1991 three strong, brave, and intelligent Latina women, Jennifer Garcia, Maria Martinez, and Rosalinda Valdez felt the need to establish an organization that supplemented their needs as women in higher education at UC Berkeley. This need led to the formation of the Delta chapter of Lambda Theta Nu Sorority, Inc., and the establishment of the first Latina organization at UC Berkeley. Twenty-seven years later, the Delta chapter continues it's commitment to academic excellence, community service, and sisterhood. Although we are a Latina-based sorority, we accept applicants regardless of race or color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation or handicap. Pillars Academic Excellence, Community Service, Sisterhood Traditions Stepping: In 1987 the sisters of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc. first introduced stepping to ladies of Lambda Theta Nu sorority Inc. by inviting them to step on stage in a unity step. Our sisters at California State University, Chico added the use of machetes as a symbol of strength, a symbol with direct cultural ties. Machetes: In 1989 Lambda Theta Nu Sorority, Inc. became the first sorority to incorporate the use of machetes in a stepping performance. The use of machetes has traditionally showcased the bravery of men. However, for Lambdas, breaking down this male-based tradition not only served as symbol of empowerment but also exemplified the determination of Latinas to integrate into every aspect of life that was not traditionally meant for Latinas. The incorporation of machetes in our performances personify our culture and our strength as women whose perseverance is multidimensional. Strolling: Strolling, also known as party walking, is a synchronized dance used to encourage commonalities among sisters and showcase our organization and/or to compete in shows. Lambda Theta Nu Sorority, Inc. Facts Founded Nationally: March 11, 1986 at California State University, Chico Founded at UC Berkeley: April 6, 1991 Colors: Burgundy, Silver, White Nickname: Lambdas, Sexy Silver Roses Symbol: Rose Chapters: 45 Chapters Strong, 10 States Wide Add us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/berkeley.lambdas Follow us on Instagram: lambdathetanu_berkeley
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, CalGreeks Multicultural Greek Council (MCGC) Fraternities & Sororities
Summary: Our mission is to promote and foster Latina leaders through educational and professional development, relationship building, and community involvement. Our intent is to provide our members exposure to resources for continued growth.

Name: Lambda Theta Phi, Latin Fraternity, Inc.
Description: On December 1, 1975, history was made ‚Äì history on a college campus, which would transcend other colleges/universities throughout the United States; history which would have a positive impact on the Latino community and our nation; history which would forever change the Greek system, more specifically, the entity known as a fraternity. On December 1, 1975, Lambda Theta Phi was founded on the campus of Kean College in Union, New Jersey.The ideals of this brotherhood are the following: Academic Excellence; Brotherhood; Leadership; Latino Unity; Service. On a daily basis, our brothers live up to these ideals, as set forth by fourteen young Latino men decades ago. Since our founding, Lambda Theta Phi has established chapters in every region of the country at both the undergraduate and professional levels. Our brotherhood continues to provide the necessary skills and resources for the advancement and empowerment of our people and for the betterment of this nation. The University of California, Berkeley was home to the newest chapter of Lambda Theta Phi, Latin Fraternity, Inc. in the Spring semester of 2004. Ten undergraduate students came together with the idea of introducing a positive image of a Latino fraternity to the UC Berkeley campus. They wanted to embrace and take part in the unity, brotherhood, pride and respect for all cultures that Lambda Theta Phi offered.On May 9, 2004, Luis Sanchez, Renato Manay, Renzo Manay, Arquimides Pacheco, and Rafael Hernandez created a historical landmark and established the first Latino Greek Letter Fraternity officially recognized by the National Interfraternal Council (NIC) on the UC Berkeley campus.Now, since its establishment and through its further development and growth, Lambda Theta Phi in UC Berkeley has continued to carry through its ideals of a service/social fraternity by giving back to the community while engaging in social activities that would allow further bondages among our members and with other organizations. Such include our participation in the Annual AIDS Walk, our service in low-income Oakland Elementary schools, and advocacy of immigrant rights to day laborers within the county of Alameda. Apart from these community service events, this chapter has sought to create strong ties and mutual respect with other Latin and non-Latin organizations through social activities and collaborative efforts.Lastly, the main goal of Lambda Theta Phi in UC Berkeley is to pursue the educational success of our fraternity brothers. At the national level, from New Jersey to California, many go on to become doctors, lawyers, engineers, among other professionals.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, CalGreeks Multicultural Greek Council (MCGC) Fraternities & Sororities
Summary: The FIRST and The LARGEST at the #1 Public Institution in the NATION. WE ARE THE INSTITUTION OF EVOLUTION! Beta Chi Chapter at the University of California, Berkeley.

Name: Lambda Upsilon Lambda Fraternity, Inc.
Description: Established with ASUC 11/9/11 SB 138 Fall 2011
Categories: CalGreeks Multicultural Greek Council (MCGC) Fraternities & Sororities
Summary: La Unidad Latina, Lambda Upsilon Lambda Fraternity, Incorporated primarily seeks to take a leadership role in meeting the needs of the Latino community through academic achievement, cultural awareness, community service & promotion of the Latino culture

Name: Laotian American Student Representatives üíô
Description: The primary goal of LASR is to create a community for UC Berkeley students who originated from Laos and to establish awareness for those who are interested in the cultures and experiences of Laotians. This community on the UC Berkeley campus provides social and academic support for all the members within the club.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The primary goal of LASR is to create a community for UC Berkeley students who originated from Laos and to establish awareness for those who are interested in the cultures and experiences of Laotians.

Name: Latin American Leadership Society
Description: The Latin American Leadership Society is made up of people from very diverse backgrounds. What unites us is our profound interest in Latin America, be it the current political and economical scene, the region‚Äôs rich culture and traditions, or the growing influence of Latin American communities in the United States. LLS members are students from Latin America who aim to eventually return to their respective countries to contribute to the development of the region, students born in the US of Latin American descent interested in finding a community, and non-Latin students who simply posses a great interest in the region and wish to be part of the growing, continent-wide LLS network. LLS has the mission of providing students with opportunities to create professional networks and personal bonds, through social events, career development programs, and community service among other activities. We also promote engagement in discussion about topics concerning Latin America in relation to leadership, policy and entrepreneurship. Our vision for LLS is for it to achieve recognition in Latin America for the exemplary leadership and contributions of its alumni. We think of LLS as the first chapter of a long list of initiatives nationwide. To know more about LLS and to stay tuned to our future events feel free to visit our website, follow us on Instagram, or like us on Facebook.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: LLS strives to connect Latin American students with the purpose of creating a network of future leaders of the region. LLS also strives to promote awareness and debate on critical political, economic, social, and economic topics in Latin America

Name: Latine Pre-Law Society
Description: Established in fall 2002, the purpose of the Latine Pre-Law Society is to provide a solid professional, educational, supportive, and networking foundation within the Latine community in the legal profession, the Latine population at UC Berkeley, and the community at large. LPLS is a non-partisan organization that focuses on a progressive agenda for preparing and empowering Latine folks to pursue a legal education and career. This organization, Latine Pre-Law Society, was formerly named Latinx Pre-Law Society.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Latine Pre-Law Society is an inclusive organization that strives to provide educational and professional opportunities for students pursuing a legal education or career.

Name: Latine Social Work Caucus (Formerly known as Latinx Social Work Caucus)
Description: The Latine Social Work Caucus (LSWC) works to build connections to ensure students and faculty feel a sense of belonging and community. The LSWC is committed to closing the opportunity gap in higher education and supporting the personal and professional well-being of its members. The Caucus strives to unite the efforts of social welfare students who desire and are committed to working towards improving the quality of life of Latine people and their communities. We enact our social justice values through political engagement and community building. The objectives of the Caucus are to: work together to fill the gaps in social work education while looking into the community needs and bringing forth advocacy for the diverse needs of Latine graduate students empower Latine students to find avenues for change within the community create partnerships with faculty, students, and social work professionals to bring Latine voices into the classrooms and curriculum enrich the educational experience of Latine students‚Äô who are committed to serving the Latine community
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of the Latine Social Work Caucus (LSWC) is to build connections that ensure students and faculty in the School of Social Welfare feel a sense of belonging and community.

Name: Latines in Film and Television at Berkeley
Description: We serve as a safe and collaborative creative space for Latine students interested in professional careers in film and television, providing skill development and content creation opportunities to push boundaries in the typical Hollywood status quo.
Summary: We serve as a safe and collaborative creative space for Latine students interested in professional careers in film and television, providing skill development and content creation opportunities to push boundaries in the typical Hollywood status quo.

Name: Latino/a Association of Graduate Students in Engineering and Science üíô
Description: The Latino Association of Graduate Students in Engineering and Science (LAGSES) at UC Berkeley was founded in 1994 by Latino students to provide a cohesive group for incoming and continuing Latino/a graduate students at UC Berkeley. Now a multicultural organization whose mission is to recruit and retain Latino/a graduate students at UC Berkeley. We provide academic and social activities for support and networking. LAGSES members are committed to helping Latino/a students enter and graduate from UC Berkeley graduate programs in engineering and science. Please contact us if you are interested in attending UC Berkeley for graduate school and/or would like to join our organization.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The mission of LAGSES is to promote the recruitment and retention of Latino/a graduate students in engineering and science.

Name: Latinx Business Student Association üíô
Description: The mission of the Latinx Business Student Association (LBSA) is to foster the academic, professional, and personal growth of Latinx students in all areas of business. We are committed to creating a supportive space rooted in community, where members uplift and empower one another through access to invaluable resources, mentorship, and development opportunities. Through our pillars of Professional Development, Academia, Community Service, and Familia, we strive to build lasting relationships and equip our members to thrive at Cal and beyond. LBSA partners with a wide range of leading companies to provide members with direct access to professionals across industries. Through 2‚Äì3 high-impact workshops each week, students connect with recruiters, explore diverse career paths, and gain the skills needed to succeed in the business world. Past partners include Google, Visa, Bain & Company, PwC, EY, Goldman Sachs, KPMG, LinkedIn, Accenture, and many more. Stay connected with us through our Instagram Page: instagram.com/ucberkeleylbsa
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: LBSA's mission is to empower the Latinx community at UC Berkeley by providing our members professional development resources, academic support, and a sense of belonging through our LBSA family.

Name: Launchpad
Description: *** Our application can be found here: https://launchpad.berkeley.edu/apply *** We are a project based organization that implements cutting edge research in machine learning, artificial intelligence, and data science into useful open source projects. Not only do we develop our members internally with semester-long projects, hack nights and tech tutorials, but we also hold external talks, technical workshops, and info sessions to help the general Berkeley CS community. Our vision is to turn the theory we learn from intelligent software classes into real applications that our teams can take ownership of.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: We are a community of passionate engineers who tackle real-world problems using machine learning and artificial intelligence.

Name: Lavender Alliance at Berkeley üíô
Description: This organization aims to represent LGBTQ+ Chinese international students at Berkeley while advancing equal access to resources on campus for everyone who identifies as part of the community, and serves as a hub for transnational LGBTQ+ grassroot organizing among this community and allies.
Categories: Undergraduate Organizations, LGBTQ+ Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: This organization aims to create a platform to support LGBTQ+ community from Greater China Area or of Chinese descent, and serve as a networking platform for students, faculties, alumni and staff who such identify and/or are allies of this community.

Name: Law and Political Economy at Berkeley Law (Formerly known as Law and Political Economy Society of Berkeley)
Description: The Law and Political Economy at Berkeley Law (Formerly known as Law and Political Economy Society (LPE Soc) of Berkeley) offers a community through which Berkeley Law students can build creative thinking, dissent, and systemic critique into their study and practice. LPE Soc is a student-run organization dedicated to fostering interest and discussion in the emerging LPE movement, which seeks to expose how legal rules concentrate economic and political power among dominant social groups, and simultaneously build and expand modes of legal thinking which embed the economy in social life. By revealing the artificial divide between law, politics, and economics, we seek to help students exercise their power to reimagine the social order. This group [Law and Political Economy at Berkeley Law] was formerly named [Law and Political Economy Society of Berkeley] - [11/7/24] [AP]
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: A community of students and faculty members interested in how law shapes politics and the economy through roundtable discussions, reading groups, and scholarly presentations.

Name: Law Students for Climate Accountability at Berkeley
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: LSCA Berkeley‚Äôs purpose is to activate and mobilize the power of Berkeley Law students to transform the legal industry‚Äôs role from exacerbating climate injustice to meaningfully supporting a just transition.

Name: Law Students for Justice in Palestine
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: LSJP joins the Berkeley Law community in advocating human rights and self-determination for the Palestinian people. We educate the wider community on legal issues around Israel/Palestine and support law students working for Palestinian liberation.

Name: Law Students of African Descent üíô
Description: As Berkeley Law‚Äôs chapter of the National Black Law Students Association, LSAD is a place for Black law students to build community and find mutual support in their legal journey. LSAD actively participates in the recruitment and retention of Black students. Over the past four years, we‚Äôve seen our membership steadily grow, in part due to the dedication of each class to mentor and support one another. LSAD offers targeted programming focused on academic support, professional development, and relationship building for Black students. In addition, we seek to engage in advocacy and community outreach that centers the interests of the Black community in Berkeley and beyond. Whether you are a student or alum, administrative staff or faculty, sponsor or community member, we are excited about building with you.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: The purpose of LSAD is to provide support and career development opportunities for Black students at Berkeley School of Law.

Name: Laya of Berkeley
Description: The purpose of Laya is to draw together individuals who have a passion for music. Although the primary focus is classical Indian music, the goal is to blend and fuse other genres of music from around the world to create a unique performing group. The group will focus on cultivating and rehearsing these fusions through regular practices. Along with performing, the group hosts concerts and lecture demonstrations to foster an environment of musical learning. The primary focus of the group is to grow interest in classical Indian music as well as inspire individuals to expand their musical creativity.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: A performing group with an aim to bring the intricacies and flows of Carnatic and Hindustani classical music to the diverse, cosmopolitan environment of Cal and the larger Bay Area. We also host concerts and lec-dems to foster musical learning.

Name: Le Cercle Fran√ßais of Berkeley üíô
Description: In this group, you can share your passion for the French language among like-minded peers, whether you're a novice or a native speaker! We meet weekly to socialize in French, discussing topics and issues that go beyond the strictly academic discourse you might find in a traditional French class. We also host cultural events, such as French film screenings and potlucks with French food, to promote appreciation and awareness of French culture. Not to mention our academic events featuring French professors, helping members expand their professional network. Plus, we can't forget to mention our fantastic food from authentic La Fourn√©e croissants to cr√™pe get-togethers at La Cr√™pe √† Moi. For updates, follow us on Instagram @lecerclefrancais.ucb or message Natasha Mullins (nzmullins@berkeley.edu) to be added to the mailing list! Merci :)
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Le Cercle Fran√ßais of UC Berkeley assembles francophone students of all levels and cultural backgrounds to engage in informal French conversation and camaraderie outside of the classroom setting.

Name: LEADers - Leaders for Equity & Democracy in Education
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: We work to engage passionate, equity-conscious, practicing leaders with the theories, research design principles, and networking opportunities.

Name: League of Filipino Students üíô
Description: LFS-UC Berkeley Chapter Organizing Committee (COC) is an anti-imperialist grassroots organization of Filipino student youth (and our allies) committed to fighting for National Democracy in the Philippines. We believe that our homeland will never be truly democratic or free until it is liberated from the control of U.S. imperialism, local landlords, big capitalists, and the corrupt politicians. LFS-UCB endeavors to deepen our understanding of the concrete connections between Filipinos in the United States and in the Homeland by studying and propagating the rich and proud revolutionary heritage of our People‚Äôs continuing struggle for liberation and National Democracy. We take it upon ourselves as youth and students to renew our Filipino culture and history, define our present situation as Filipinos all over the world, come to a proper understanding of how to remedy our current condition, and take action. Armed with the lessons of the past, and the unwavering commitment to advance the national democratic aspirations of the Filipino people, the League of Filipino Students (LFS), together with the Filipino masses, will continue to struggle for true liberation and a democracy which will genuinely serve the Filipino masses.
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The League of Filipino Students at UC Berkeley is an anti-imperialist grassroots organization of Filipino student youth (and our allies) committed to fighting for National Democracy in the Philippines.

Name: Lean On Me At Berkeley
Description: Lean On Me at Berkeley is a support text hotline that aims to better the mental health landscape at UC Berkeley and reduce the stigmas around mental health by removing the barriers to emotional support resources and providing accessible and anonymous peer support.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Lean On Me at Berkeley aims to better the mental health landscape at Berkeley and reduce the stigmas around mental health by providing students with an accessible and anonymous peer support resource.

Name: LeetCode at Berkeley
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups
Summary: LeetCode at Berkeley provides students of all backgrounds and skill levels a community to LeetCode together. Along with weekly meetings, we host resume workshops and networking events to help students prepare for internships and full-time roles.

Name: Legal Innovation and Entrepreneurship at Berkeley
Description: LINE fosters a dynamic and inclusive environment, bridging the gap between law & tech. We plan to promote awareness about legal innovation and tech solutions, enhance legal education (to promote entrepreneurship) and drive professional development & networking. We aim to drive the future of legal services through cutting-edge events, hands-on workshops, impactful research, and strategic partnerships while advocating for ethical practices and improving access to justice for marginalized communities.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: LINE fosters a dynamic and inclusive environment, bridging the gap between law & tech. We plan to promote awareness about legal innovation and tech solutions, enhance legal education, to promote entrepreneurship, and drive professional development.

Name: Leukemia & Lymphoma Society at Berkeley üíô
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: To support The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society through fundraising and awareness on the University of California, Berkeley‚Äôs campus. We aim to unite the campus behind a common cause: bringing light to the darkness of cancer.

Name: Liberty in North Korea at Berkeley üíô
Description: LiNK at Berkeley is a student chapter of Liberty in North Korea (LiNK), the largest and only grassroots non-profit organization to actively aid in the rescue and rehabilitation of North Korean defectors. As one of 297 rescue teams worldwide, our mission is to raise awareness of the North Korean human rights crisis and fundraise to provide emergency relief and resettlement funds for North Korean refugees. For more infomation see: link.berkeley.edu. Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/linkberkeley/ If you are interested, contact us at linkbayarea@gmail.com.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: LiNK at Berkeley is a student chapter of LiNK, a human rights NGO based in Long Beach, California. Our mission is to raise awareness of the North Korean human rights crisis and fundraise to provide relief and resettlement funds for North Korean refugees.

Name: LIFE Campus Ministry üíô
Description: LIFE Campus Ministry serves to reach out to the members/students of the Berkeley Community who seek to enrich and grow in their personal beliefs, understanding and knowledge of the Bible. We conduct weekly 30-minute Bible Talks to discuss various issues and topics that we encounter in our present-day society. We also offer free, personal Bible studies that cover the fundamentals of the Christian faith. The college experience is rich in various life lessons, hardships, and victories. It is a time of refinement where students truly come into themselves as the next generation of contributing members to society. We seek to cultivate the bonds and friendships that will help UC Berkeley's students during such a crucial and valuable time in their lives.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: This student organization aims to deliver high-impact, transformational projects, and programs that provide relief and care to the poor and needy around the Bay Area, particularly our local city of Berkeley and the surrounding communities.

Name: Lifestyle Medicine at Berkeley üíô
Description: Our organization is dedicated to promoting lifestyle medicine by providing education and resources to the Berkeley community. We recognize lifestyle changes as essential strategies for both the prevention and treatment of chronic diseases. Our mission includes raising awareness about the six core pillars of lifestyle medicine: sleep, nutrition, physical activity, substance use, stress management, and social connection. We currently conduct weekly blood pressure screenings at the North Berkeley Senior Center and plan to host social, educational, and culinary medicine events, as well as expand community volunteer opportunities. As a member, you will gain broadly applicable skills and knowledge, including motivational interviewing and health coaching. There will also be opportunities for pre-med mentorship and leadership roles. If you're interested in supporting the community, learning about lifestyle medicine, and gaining clinical experience, contact us at lmigucberkeley@gmail.com!
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: "Promote lifestyle medicine to the Berkeley community by recognizing lifestyle change as an essential treatment intervention and prevention strategy in addressing chronic disease."

Name: Lighting Campfires for Social Wellness
Description: Lighting Campfires for Social Wellness (LCSW) promotes student mental health and wellness through contact with nature. We organize camping trips, hiking trips and other outdoor activities to foster wellness, community and connection with nature.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Lighting Campfires for Social Wellness (LCSW) promotes student mental health and wellness through contact with nature. We organize camping trips, hiking trips and other outdoor activities to foster wellness, community and connection with nature.

Name: Lindy On Sproul üíô
Description: Lindy on Sproul is the organization responsible for Lindy on Sproul, the free weekly DJ'd dance event. Our main goal is to bring swing dancing to the Berkeley community.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Lindy on Sproul is a free outdoor DJ'ed swing dance event on the UC Berkeley campus. We meet every Saturday from 12:00pm-2:30pm on Upper Sproul Plaza. No partner or experience is necessary. For more information, find us on facebook and instagram!

Name: Literary Society of Berkeley, The (Formerly The Book Club of Berkeley) üíô
Description: The Literary Society of Berkeley (formerly The Book Club of Berkeley) is a place for readers to talk about books with other readers. We are a small but welcoming community seeing to spread the joy of reading to the community through bookish events, book drives‚Äîmost importantly‚Äîour book club. We gather every week to gush over, criticize, or argue about a portion of our current read, and we would love for you to come join us! Find out what we're reading next on our instagram, @literarysocietyofberkeley, or just come to chat‚Äîwe promise we want to meet you regardless of whether or not you've read the book.
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Literary Society of Berkeley provides a space for students to engage in recreational reading and literary discussion with their peers and the Berkeley community. We also provide writing, editing, and publishing support to our creative writer peers.

Name: Live Poets Society üíô
Description: LPS meets to share original works of poetry and prose written by our members and works by current and historical writers selected by members. For each work, we hold an in-depth discussion covering the differing interpretations of the work, the context of the piece in relation to its author, and constructive critiques of the piece. LPS holds events such as workshops and monthly open-mics for poetry and original songs. We hope to create an open, encouraging community for poets and readers of all backgrounds and identities. Through comparing our interpretations of poetry, we also aim to understand ourselves as creative writers.
Categories: Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: LPS meets to read and discuss original works of poetry and prose as well as works by current and historical writers selected by our members. Together, we hope to develop an understanding of the history of poetry as well as ourselves as creative writers.

Name: Logging Sports Team üíô
Description: Our logging sports team focuses on learning and teaching old-time logging techniques while simultaneously building connections with professionals in the forestry field. Our practices are generally on the weekends, and no experience is necessary to join. Our team competes in timber sport competitions throughout California. We invite members from all majors, not just forestry, to join. We hope to create a community of Bucking Bears committed to learning and enhancing their skills while also having fun!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Logging Sports is a competitive timbersports team on the west coast that teaches team members old-time logging techniques, such as chopping and crosscut sawing, and networks team members with professionals in the forestry or related fields.

Name: Logically Organized Students
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: ≈ÅOS encourages academic discourse and social interaction between the student members of the logic community at the University of California, Berkeley.

Name: Love Stories Book Club üíô
Description: The purpose of Love Stories Book Club is to provide a space for readers to connect with their peers through a love of reading romance novels while engaging in literary discussions to de-stigmatize romance novels and empower readers identities and sexualities.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: A space for readers to connect with their peers through a love of reading romance novels while engaging in literary discussions to de-stigmatize romance novels and empower readers identities and sexualities.

Name: Low Vision Club at Berkeley
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We aim to educate optometry students about the low vision profession by providing opportunities for students to explore low vision residences and career paths, foster connections with low vision specialists, and shadow in various clinical settings.

Name: LSBE Student Board
ShortName: Robinson Life Sciences, Business, and Entrepreneurship Student Board
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The purpose of our organization is to provide student representation for members both in an interested in the Robinson Life Sciences, Business and Entrepreneurship program.

Name: LUXX üíô
Description: LUXX is a beginner-friendly K-pop dance team at UC Berkeley! Open to all levels with no auditions required, our group showcases the talents of our members through cover videos and public performances. Come out and dance with us!! Join our Discord (invite link below). We are available to dance at your events, connect with us on Instagram <3 Recent Covers! Name: Machine Learning at Berkeley
Description: Machine Learning at Berkeley fosters an environment for passionate students to explore ML through projects, events, and education. Internally or externally, industry clients or research groups we provide many avenues to actively engage with the field. For more information see ml.berkeley.edu
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Machine Learning at Berkeley fosters an environment for passionate students to explore ML through projects, events, and education. Internally or externally, industry clients or research groups we provide many avenues to actively engage with the field.

Name: maganda magazine
Description: {m}aganda magazine is a student-run academic publication based at the University of California, Berkeley. Founded in 1989, it has evolved from its beginnings as a bi-annual magazine and is now a diverse anthology of submitted work that is published once a year. {m}aganda aims to foster critical dialogue within and across our communities through arts, literature, and education. We come from a heritage of Pilipinx- American artists, writers, and cultural historians, but we extend our hands and voices to any and all who own truths that need to be spoken. We believe in the necessity of art as a means of influencing social change. We attempt to accomplish this by providing integral spaces and opportunities for all of us to develop ourselves as creatively conscious individuals in our communities. {m}aganda provides a means for: Creative cultivation: through spaces like our annually published {m]aganda magazine, workshops, and open mics, we provide forums for collective dialogue to take place, and opportunities for individuals to begin to explore their own creativity. Community consciousness: through educational workshops, partnerships with community organizations, and spaces that promote discussion, we aim to stir our communities into a critical consciousness of our socio-political, intellectual, and cultural circumstances today. Growing artists: through the resources and experience we provide, for artists, writers, journalists, poets, playwrights, musicians, photographers, and other creative explorers, we connect you to spaces that promote artistic growth, offer our support to you in your creative endeavors, and we aim to cultivate professional artists throughout our communities.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Publication Groups, Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: {m}aganda aims to foster critical dialogue within and across our communities through arts, literature, and education. We come from a heritage of Pilipinx-American artists, writers, and cultural historians.

Name: MAHIWAGA A Cappella
Description: Our a cappella group showcases the Philippines' cultural richness through diverse OPM (Original Pilipino Music) genres. We aim to be musical ambassadors, uniting communities through our enigmatic and soulful tunes, from Kundiman to pop music.
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our a cappella group showcases the Philippines' cultural richness through diverse OPM (Original Pilipino Music) genres. We aim to be musical ambassadors, uniting communities through our enigmatic and soulful tunes, from Kundiman to pop music.

Name: Mahjong Club üíô
Description: Welcome to the UC Berkeley Mahjong Club. We both teach and play Mahjong, a 4-player board game using Mahjong tiles. Players take turns drawing and discarding tiles until they form a winning hand. Each player tries to complete their hand faster than the others in order to win the hand. Mahjong has a long history, so we hope to spread the game to anyone interested in learning. At our meetups, we generally play Riichi Mahjong, a Japanese variant of the game. If you are familiar with another style of Mahjong, we are happy to teach you how to play Riichi Mahjong. Additionally, if you do have a group interested in playing or want to create a space for another type of Mahjong, we can accommodate.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Mahjong is a 4 player tile game where players aim to make a 13-tile winning hand. The Mahjong Club hopes to both teach new players how to play the game as well as create a place for experienced players to find others to play with.

Name: Main Stacks Dance Team
Description: Founded in 2008 by Vivian Peng and May Matsuo, Main Stacks is a competitive dance team that uses dance as a medium for developing its members and its community. As a family, we seek to continue creating an environment of inclusivity through our pillars of Growth, Humility, and Community. Main Stacks focuses on providing opportunities for personal Growth through education, dance training, competition, and social action. We aim to be a family that supports our diverse dancers and alumni under a unified love and passion for dance. True growth and inclusivity is unattainable without Humility. For us, that means understanding our place as guests in the house of hip-hop, learning its history, and respecting Black culture. We take pride in what we do, while embodying the ‚Äústudent for life‚Äù mindset. Through sharing our knowledge and resources, we aim to foster relationships between dancers and teams in order to uplift the Community. As the proud host of Prelude Norcal Dance Competition, Main Stacks strives to push the envelope and build connections both internally and externally. Main Stacks is committed to upholding these values as we dance to grow, dance to build.
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Founded in 2008 by Cal students May Matsuo and Vivian Peng, Main Stacks was meant to provide the growing Berkeley dance community with an opportunity to dance competitively. Now, the team consists of about 50 UC Berkeley students, alumni, & friends!

Name: Malaysian Student Association at Berkeley üíô
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We aim to provide a forum for socialization, cultural interaction, recreational and professional activities for the Malaysian community in University of California, Berkeley or those who wish to partake in Malaysian culture.

Name: Management Consulting Club at Berkeley
Description: The Management Consulting Club at Berkeley (MCCB) was established in 2011 by a passionate and dedicated group of UC Berkeley students aspiring to pursue careers in the business field. As a non-profit, student-led management consulting organization, our primary objective is to offer consulting services to companies both within the Bay Area and beyond. Each semester, we engage in multiple impact-driven strategy consulting projects catering to a diverse clientele representing various industries and sectors. Our team formulates dynamic business strategies to tackle clients' challenges while also organizing workshops focused on enhancing our members' knowledge in areas such as consulting, finance, and technology.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Management Consulting Club at Berkeley is America's first Korean consulting club in pursuit of excellence in management consulting and strategic management.

Name: Management, Entrepreneurship & Technology Student Board
Description: The M.E.T. Student Board will serve as the premier representative organization for the student body of UC Berkeley‚Äôs Management, Entrepreneurship, and Technology Program by fostering social integration, professional development, academic excellence, and outreach. The student board will be comprised of the following executive members: President, VP External Relations, VP Student Resources, VPs Social Integration, and VP Admissions & Marketing, along with their coinciding committees. Membership is available to any student accepted into the Management, Entrepreneurship, and Technology Program at UC Berkeley.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The M.E.T. Student Board serves as the premier representative organization for the student body of UC Berkeley‚Äôs Management, Entrepreneurship, and Technology Program by fostering social integration, professional development, and academic excellence.

Name: Mariachi Luz de Oro
Description: Mariachi Luz de Oro de Berkeley is a musical student-run group that performs traditional and modern mariachi music. We aspire to promote musical and cultural diversity by increasing exposure to the Mexican art form of mariachi. We aim to establish and maintain a performing group to inspire the lives of the community and its members. We are looking for passionate and motivated students! Students interested can contact ucbmariachi@gmail.com with their name, year, instrument(s) they play, major, and any previous experience they have had either performing or playing mariachi music. Website: mlo.berkeley.edu Email: ucbmariachi@gmail.com Instagram: @ucbmlo
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Mariachi Luz de Oro de Berkeley is a musical student-run group that performs traditional and modern mariachi music. We aspire to promote musical and cultural diversity by increasing exposure to the Mexican art form of mariachi.

Name: Mario Kart at Berkeley
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations
Summary: Our club brings together students who love Mario Kart to enjoy social casual and competitive gaming, fostering fun, community, and skill development through friendly tournaments at both casual and collegiate levels.

Name: Mass Media at Berkeley Law
Description: Media influences how we understand the law; the law shapes how we engage with media. Mass Media at Berkeley Law (MMaBL) is a group for law students interested in various intersections of law and media, including public perception of legal issues, careers in media law, legal literacy, and journalism. Founded by Berkeley Law students with previous media experience, we are interested in building a community for students that explores how digital media can work in service of progressive legal goals and break down barriers to make the law more accessible.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Mass Media at Berkeley Law (MMaBL) is a group for law students interested in the intersection of media law and journalism.

Name: Materials Science and Engineering Association
Description: The Materials Science and Engineering Association is the official undergraduate student organization for the Materials Science and Engineering (MSE) Department at UC Berkeley. We host a number of social events and professional development opportunities for students. We also participate in outreach to elementary and high school students. MSEA plans a number of department-wide as well as undergraduate-only events throughout the year such as general meetings, peer advising, major-wide socials, and an overnight host program for prospective students. We also organize Dinners of the Month where we arrange for faculty members to join students for a casual dinner at a local restaurant, and Big Feast, an end-of-the year banquet. MSEA also works with industry representatives to host company information sessions, alumni tech talks, and company tours for students.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: MSEA is the official undergraduate student organization for the MSE Department. We organize a number of social events and professional development opportunities for students in and interested in MSE, as well as participate in outreach to local students.

Name: Materials Science and Engineering Graduate Student Council üíô
Description: The Materials Science and Engineering Graduate Student Council (MSE GSC) strives to create a cohesive, inclusive, & safe community among MSE graduate students that fosters growth and a positive department culture.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Materials Science and Engineering Graduate Student Council (MSE GSC) strives to create a cohesive, inclusive, & safe community among MSE graduate students that fosters growth and a positive department culture.

Name: Maternal, Child and Adolescent Health Student Interest Group üíô
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of the MCAH SIG is to build a local peer network of students with a shared interest in Maternal, Child and Adolescent Health. The MCAH SIG will offer opportunities and events to engage in student-led dialogue, learning, and skill building.

Name: Math Tournament at Berkeley
Description: Welcome to the Berkeley Math Tournament (BMT)! Since 2011, BMT has grown into one of the largest student-run math competitions and is internationally renowned for our flagship in-person tournaments: BMT (2000+ high school contestants) and B(mini)MT (2000+ middle school contestants). We also run asynchronous, online versions of each contest as well as a handful of international satellites (China, Toronto, Singapore, and more) every year. Historically, we've hosted a mini-math festival after each big competition with activities like integration bees and estimation games, coding/art contests, and guest speakers including Grant Sanderson (3Blue1Brown), Po-Shen Loh (USIMO Coach), Steve Chow (BlackPenRedPen), Richard Rusczyk (AoPS Founder), and Cliff Stoll (Acme Klein bottles) to share their experiences with math throughout their lives. --- FALL 2025 & RECRUITING: --- There is no need for any prior contest experience or even a formal mathematics background to be a valued contributor to our organization! Running large events like ours requires a lot of diverse skill sets, and we'll more than likely have tasks suited for anyone interested in joining. Anyone with interests and passions in math, STEM, education, event planning, or running day-to-day operations of a nonprofit is highly encouraged to join! If interested, please join our discord: BMT Discord. Please verify your Cal-affiliated email to gain access to channels. --- We are currently recruiting new problem-writers as well as logistics organizers -- activities, design, DEI (diversity, equity, and inclusion), finance/sponsorships, marketing, operations, satellites/asynchronous, and tech! We believe everyone can contribute something valuable, and as such we strive to remove as many barriers to entry for a student organization as possible. If you're interested in problem writing, all you need is to join the discord server, verify yourself, DM an admin or a member of leadership for the 'problem writing' role and you can start attending meetings (dates/times announced in the server). Those interested in logistics will need to verify themselves in the discord and fill out a brief Google form; we'll then organize a low-stakes brief coffee chat just to get to know a little bit about you and your specific interests. The interest form will be posted on our discord server. If you have any questions, please feel free to email us at team@berkeley.mt. ---
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: BMT hosts multiple math competitions each year with a mission to design holistic, high-quality tournaments, providing engaging/challenging new experiences to over 4000 middle/high-school contestants, and is focused on improving educational outcomes.

Name: Mathematics Graduate Students Association
Description: MGSA's purpose is to foster a cohesive graduate student community and represent graduate student interests in the Mathematics Department at the University of California, Berkeley.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The MGSA's purpose is to foster a cohesive graduate student community and represent graduate student interests in the Mathematics Department at the University of California, Berkeley.

Name: Mathematics Undergraduate Student Association üíô
Description: MUSA is the Mathematics Undergraduate Student Association at the University of California, Berkeley. We provide multiple weekly events for undergraduate students interested in pure or applied mathematics. We focus on bolstering our community and providing members with access to a variety of informational sessions: academic advising, professional development, and undergraduate lectures, as well as social outings: board game nights, math conference trips, and volunteer opportunities. We also have an office that serves as a collaborative and inclusive space. Joining MUSA is an excellent way to connect with other math enthusiasts. You can learn about the many opportunities for math students, and many of our members are happy to be a part of our thriving community. If you want to participate, we encourage you to join our mailing list and Discord, and check out our website. If any of the links are broken, see here for a list of regularly updated links.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The two objectives of MUSA are: (1) to bring together the community of undergraduates interested in math, and (2) to represent intended and declared math and applied math majors to the Berkeley math department.

Name: Matriculate
Description: Matriculate seeks to empower high-achieving, low-income high school students to apply to the nation's top selective schools; college advisors work one-on-one with high school students to mentor them through the college application process. Matriculate is a non-profit organization that exists on campuses across the nation. Matriculate holds a full team of professional staff in New York that oversee curriculum and training of undergraduates within its advising cohort, specifically to target low-income, high-achieving high school students to support college application logistics.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Matriculate seeks to empower high-achieving, low-income high school students to apply to the nation's top selective schools; college advisors work one-on-one with high school students to virtually mentor them through the college application process.

Name: Maya at Berkeley
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Maya is UC Berkeley's Indian Classical Dance Fusion team. Our mission is to inspire young dancers to innovate fusion dance from existing classical forms to foster creativity and gain awareness of different cultures.

Name: MBA Association
Description: MBAA responsibilities span many areas including academics, admissions, and career services. The MBAA funds activities such as social events, community events, conferences, and student club activities. The organization advocates for its Full-Time MBA students, works alongside faculty, and integrates DEI into the MBA student experience.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO
Summary: The MBA Association is the student government organization for the full time MBA program.

Name: Mechanical Engineering Graduate Student Council üíô
Description: We serve to host developmental and social activities to foster a sense of community among graduate students in the Mechanical Engineering department. We address specific problems and concerns regarding academic- and research-related policies and overall quality of life issues, as well as interface with the faculty and administration to promote change and improvement for students.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: To promote community among all graduate students in the department of Mechanical Engineering.

Name: Media Studies Student Association
Description: MSSA is a student-run organization that will advocate for Media Studies students within the larger university environment, and create a central hub for Media Studies student-focused resources and opportunities on campus and professionally.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups
Summary: MSSA is a student-run organization that will advocate for Media Studies students within the larger university environment, and create a central hub for Media Studies student-focused resources and opportunities on campus and professionally.

Name: Medical Reallocation Initiative üíô
Description: MRI aims to support underserved communities abroad by facilitating the reallocation of unused medical supplies from clinics and hospitals in the US. While other organizations may provide service to communities abroad by visiting different countries and joining frontline work, our organization offers members an opportunity to make an equally substantial impact from Berkeley, primarily through resource allocation. Through our weekly fundraising events and service events with local partners, we constantly provide members with a variety of opportunities to make an impact. Apply now at https://mri.berkeley.edu!
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Medical Reallocation Initiative facilitates the shipment of surplus medical supplies from the United States to underserved hospitals and clinics abroad and helps its members develop a greater understanding of global health inequalities.

Name: Medical Volunteering Association at Berkeley üíô
Description: We are partnered with Comfort Homesake and affiliated with the Arthritis Foundation and Highland Hospital to provide medical volunteering experiences to students at UC Berkeley. We believe that clinical experience is a valuable indication of whether you would like to go into the field, and we want to provide as many opportunities as we can.
Categories: Berkeley Public Service Center Designated, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our purpose is to make a difference to those in need of assistance and to create opportunities for students to develop new skills and experiences.

Name: Meditation and Self-Discovery at Berkeley
Categories: Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations
Summary: We aim to empower students to develop a balanced mindset and acquire skills that promote success in both their personal and professional lives by advancing self-awareness.

Name: MEDLIFE
Description: MEDLIFE (Medicine, Education, and Development for Low-Income Families Everywhere) is an international non-profit organization dedicated to helping families achieve greater freedom from the constraints of poverty, empowering them to live healthier lives. Our club is great for any students interested in health equity and global health or students interested in pursuing health careers such as medicine or dentistry!To bring the mission of our acronym to the people in need, we work globally through our DeCal which focuses on global health issues, including topics such as the cultural and historical contexts of health disparities in Peru, where our summer and winter medical brigade is based. We also work and volunteer locally with our club at Berkeley. Our club will also feature global health professionals who will speak on topics in relation to health equity!Join our fight to systematically eradicate poverty through public health efforts and community development!Find all our information and applications on our linktree here: https://linktr.ee/ucbmedlife Follow our Instagram here: https://www.instagram.com/ucbmedlife/?hl=enContact us at ucbmedlife@gmail.com with any questions!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: MEDLIFE is a non-profit that partners with low-income communities to improve their access to medicine, education, and community development. Our students volunteer on Service Learning Trips abroad and empower underserved communities in the Bay Area.

Name: Men‚Äôs Ultimate at Berkeley
Description: Cal Men‚Äôs Ultimate is a D1 Ultimate Frisbee team that competes at high-level tournaments in California and the rest of the US. Cal Men's Ultimate prides itself on a well built culture of togetherness, competitiveness and fun! We have a strong tradition for success, placing 11th, 5th and 2nd at Nationals in past seasons, and earning trips to Nationals in 2019 and 2020. Cal players succeed at the highest level of Ultimate; current and former players have joined the ranks of professional and top-tier club teams such as Polar Bears, Revolver and the San Jose Spiders. The team is coached by Dan Silverstein, the head coach of the San Jose professional team. For more info - https://recsports.berkeley.edu/programs-events/sport-clubs/mens-ultimate/
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Sports Club
Summary: Men‚Äôs Ultimate at Berkeley is a D1 Ultimate Frisbee team that competes at high-level tournaments in California and the rest of the US. Cal Men's Ultimate prides itself on a well built culture of togetherness, competitiveness, and fun!

Name: Meor at Berkeley
Description: Meor is dedicated to providing meaningful activities and personal growth opportunities.
Summary: Meor is dedicated to providing meaningful activities and personal growth opportunities.

Name: MERGE Labels üíô
Description: We are MERGE Labels, a mock music label that is the newest addition to the UC Berkeley music industry. As a music label, our purpose is to allow anyone and everyone to essentially simulate the real music industry. From releasing songs, creating albums, filming music videos, hosting live performances, to our end of the year awards show, we are covering a full holistic approach to what the entertainment business is about. We are looking for music artists, artist managers, producers, songwriters, designers, filmmakers, and anyone else interested in the industry of all levels in every field, from beginner to advanced. To all those who apply, we will be pairing up everyone into groups known as ‚Äúsubunits.‚Äù All subunits will have at least an artist and a manager, leading us to ‚Äúmerge‚Äù these different positions together, hence our name. Our name also stands for: ‚ÄúMusic Exploration Receptive to Genres and Engagement,‚Äù since we are open to all genres and we encourage collaboration, networking, and utilizing different strengths to create a grand product. We welcome you to join this organization on our rise to success, stardom, and growth.
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Music Exploration Receptive to Genres and Engagement - A mock music label at UC Berkeley, giving prospective music artists, artist managers, producers, songwriters, designers, filmmakers and more the opportunity to learn, experience, and grow.

Name: Mexican Association of Students at Berkeley üíô
Description: The Mexican Association of Students at Berkeley's (MEXASB) mission is to provide a network for students who share an interest in Mexico. In particular, it aims to: Actively promote communication and collaboration of the UC Berkeley Community who share a common cultural interest in Mexico, Mexican-Americans, and US-Mexico Relations. Recognize issues of interest to the Mexican community in the University and act as a platform to address those issues effectively. Encourage and promote communications between the MEXASB community and Berkeley Alumni in Mexico. Support incoming Mexican students in the often tough transition to life in their new academic home, as well as in a new city (and often country). Serve as a platform helping to connect Mexican students with scholars, employers, and organizations working on issues related to Mexico. Promote cultural activities traditionally important to the community of Mexican, Mexican-American, and Chicanx students or those otherwise interested in Mexican heritage and culture. Provide a space for academic discussion on issues related to Mexico and US-Mexico relations, as well as for the dissemination of academic work done by the community of Mexican students (broadly construed) at UC Berkeley. Support prospective Mexican students interested in attending UC Berkeley by connecting them to current members and alumni that may provide suggestions and guidance.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Mexican Association of Students at Berkeley's (MEXASB) mission is to provide an academic, professional and social network for students who share an interest in Mexico.

Name: Microbial Biology Graduate Student Group üíô
Description: The purpose of this organization is to provide a context for professional development, community involvement, networking opportunities, and social interactions to foster intellectual exchange within the field of microbiology. This is accomplished primarily through our annual Microbiology Student Symposium held in the Spring. The Symposium is open to everyone, both on and off campus. Presentations and posters are solicited primarily from microbiology graduate students in California and, to a lesser extent, from undergraduates and post-doctoral researchers. Graduate students also nominate and vote to recruit two keynote speakers. Keynote speakers are research group leaders, typically professors, from around the world. This organization also functions to support graduate students both academically and emotionally on their path through graduate school. We believe that these goals are crucial for career development and for stimulating collaborative research efforts.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: This organization provides opportunities for professional development, networking opportunities, and intellectual exchange for microbiology graduate students, primarily through our annual Microbiology Student Symposium which is open to everyone.

Name: Microfinance at Berkeley
Description: Founded in 2012, Microfinance at Berkeley is a student-run, business organization that supports small businesses and entrepreneurship in the Bay Area. We are a team of diverse and driven UC Berkeley undergraduates who are passionate about helping the local business community innovate and thrive. Microfinance at Berkeley offers services for Bay Area business owners: microloans, consulting, and marketplaces.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: MFB is a student-run nonprofit group with a mission to support Bay Area small business owners. Since 2012, MFB has facilitated local entrepreneurship through 3 pro-bono services - microfinance, strategy consulting, and marketplace.

Name: Middle Eastern and North African Law Students Association üíô
Description: The Middle Eastern and North African Law Students Association (MENALSA) empowers and builds community among Middle Eastern and North African students at Berkeley Law. MENALSA works in solidarity with other organizations to develop students academically and professionally, as well as provide a fun social forum and address challenges our broader community faces.
