Name: Prison Education Project at Berkeley
Description: We teach 8-week in-person and online classes on topics like 'Intro to Soft Skills', 'Psychology', 'Financial Literacy', and more to currently incarcerated juveniles and adults in California. In-person classes are taught at San Mateo County Juvenile prison and online classes are taught across 25 different facilities. Once a year (spring semester), we run the Reintegration Academy, where we support a group of ~20 formerly incarcerated adults through an 8-week, in-person resume and job skills training to help reintegrate them into life after prison.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Prison Education Project at Berkeley aims to educate, empower, and transform the lives of incarcerated individuals in California in collaboration with PEP, an organization with 3000 volunteers supporting 25 facilities across California.

Name: Privacy Law at Berkeley üíô
Description: Privacy Law at Berkeley (formerly the Berkeley Information Privacy Law Association (BIPLA)) With members from across Berkeley Law, we track the evolution of information privacy and seek to understand its wider implications. We work at the intersection of law, technology, society, the government, and the market. We engage with scholars and practitioners, lawyers and information scientists, policy analysts and software coders, and others in the Bay Area and across the world. We strive to prepare students for careers in the field of privacy law. PrivLAB promotes cross-disciplinary examinations of information privacy. We host talks by eminent privacy experts, write briefing notes and opinion pieces, analyze foundational and cutting-edge privacy scholarship, and promote a multifaceted and inclusive understanding of information privacy in Berkeley and beyond.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: PLAB promotes cross-disciplinary examinations of information privacy. We host talks by privacy experts, write briefing notes and opinion pieces, organize crypto-parties and privacy events, analyze foundational and cutting-edge privacy scholarship.

Name: Pro Bonotes A Cappella
Description: The Pro Bonotes are Berkeley Law's premier and flagship A Capella group, performing at an annual spring showcase and other events in and around the Berkeley Law School.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Berkeley Law's flagship A Cappella group.

Name: Probability Student Seminar
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: To bring together graduate students across multiple departments interested in research topics in or related to probability theory. Students give weekly talks to each other in a relaxed environment that helps build our community.

Name: Product Management Club of Berkeley Haas üíô
Description: The Product Management Club at Haas strives to be the premier hub for students and professionals at every stage of their product management journey. Our mission is to empower our members‚Äîranging from beginners exploring the fundamentals of product management to seasoned professionals looking to deepen their expertise and network. We aim to provide comprehensive resources, learning opportunities, and a supportive community to foster growth, innovation, and leadership in the field of product management. Update: We have merged with Haas ID (Innovation Design) club, which will continue to function as a sub-group in PM Club from 3rd March 2025
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Help students become product leaders who drive change and embody the Haas leadership principles.

Name: Product Space
Description: Product Space @ Berkeley is the UC Berkeley chapter of Product Space, a nation-wide family of students who are passionate about product management. We strive to cultivate a tight-knit community of product leaders who are well-prepared to guide impactful products in industry. As an organization, we offer the fellowship program and client projects for our members who come with various levels of experience. Check us out at https://product.berkeley.edu/!
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our mission is to promote an understanding of the Product Management role within the UC Berkeley community, facilitate networking and recruiting opportunities, and cultivate the product leaders of tomorrow.

Name: Project Lux at Berkeley üíô
Description: Project Lux is a 501(c)(3) approved national nonprofit organization that aspires to bridge the gap between houselessness and healthcare through helping clients receive access to adequate health insurance and basic health needs. We are an organization that is committed to health equity. We work toward achieving this goal through visiting multiple shelters and clinics and enrolling individuals experiencing houselessness in health insurance programs, such as MediCal, and helping these individuals with other basic health care needs. Additionally, we work with student volunteers whom we hope to inspire to continue to create change in their communities. We aim to help these volunteers recognize this broad issue and give them a platform through which they can make a tangible impact. We envision a world in which no individual is discouraged from receiving medical aid due to unaffordable services.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: To register student volunteers as health insurance enrollment counselors in order to help eligible but uninsured individuals register for health insurance.

Name: Project Reproductive Health Justice üíô
Description: Project RHJ‚Äôs mission is to ensure students are informed on their rights and access to reproductive healthcare. In times of uncertainty, keeping communities connected and informed on current events and changing accessibility is what our organization places our greatest value on. Through presenting approachable educational content on reproductive justice, offering safe spaces for discussions on reproductive health, and providing peer-to-peer healthcare resources, we aim to keep our communities informed and passionate about reproductive freedom and accessible reproductive healthcare.
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Project Reproductive Health Justice educates, advocates, and builds a supportive community for reproductive justice. Our mission is to ensure students are informed about their rights and access to reproductive healthcare.

Name: Project RISHI, The Berkeley Chapter
Description: Project RISHI is a non-profit organization whose mission is to promote the sustainable development and growth of rural Indian communities. In partnership with local people and social enterprises, we identify issues central to our target communities and provide the resources to implement solutions through extensive field research and on-campus initiatives.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: To provide for the basic, social and healthcare needs of rural Indian villages and to provide UC Berkeley undergraduates with exposure to community service, international outreach, and rural development.

Name: Project SCIFI üíô
Description: The Scientific Coat Initiative for Future Innovators nonprofit promotes students‚Äô scientific passions for higher education, provides teachers the resources necessary for hands-on scientific instruction, encourages the growth of mentor-mentee relationships, and fosters a visible community supporting young scientists‚Äô endeavors. Our Berkeley Chapter (Experimental Innovation) has current mission is focused on hands-on experimental learning using real wet-lab equipment we obtained from BioLink Depot and an experiment the students complete in a 1 hour period: we go in-person to local middle/high schools with pipettes, MCT tubes, vortexes, microscopes, and more to introduce students to aspects of research they may not otherwise get to see. In the past we have also achieved adjacent goals by partnering with corporate and academic sponsors who endorse the purchase of laboratory coats embroidered with the sponsors‚Äô logos. We then distribute these coats to qualifying under-resourced schools, along with other materials intended to aid educators in taking on a hands-on approach to scientific instruction. Our motivation as a non-profit organization stems from our early exposure to science, which ultimately inspired us to pursue scientific educations and careers. Thus, our goal is to empower and inspire future generations of scientists by providing K‚Äì12 students the necessary tools to develop fundamental scientific reasoning, address societal problems, and move onto further scientific instruction.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Project SCIFI promotes students‚Äô scientific passions for higher education, provides teachers the resources necessary for hands-on scientific instruction, and fosters a visible community supporting young scientists‚Äô endeavors.

Name: Project Shifa
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations
Summary: To empower Middle Eastern immigrants, marginalized communities, and refugees by bridging the gap in healthcare access and education.

Name: Project Sunshine at Berkeley üíô
Description: Looking for a unique clinical experience + community service opportunity? Project Sunshine is a chapter-based organization of volunteers that brings comfort and joy to pediatric patients across the United States. Project Sunshine volunteers serve as companions to pediatric patients, and bring creative art activities (i.e. drawing and coloring) and other opportunities for social interaction and learning. Amidst the pandemic, Project Sunshine has transitioned to TelePlay, a program where you work with children via remote activities over Zoom. Project Sunshine has chapters at schools such as USC, UCLA, Harvard, Duke, and more. Please check us out if you are interested in joining the Project Sunshine chapter at UC Berkeley! You can read more about Project Sunshine at https://projectsunshine.org/
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Volunteer to bring joy and play to meet the psychosocial and developmental needs of pediatric patients!

Name: Prytanean Women's Honor Society
Description: Prytanean Women‚Äôs Honor Society, founded at Cal in 1901, is the oldest collegiate women‚Äôs honor society in the United States. The founders engaged in issues relating to student health care and housing; their efforts contributed significantly to ameliorating student life on campus, notably by establishing the Tang Center, UC Berkeley‚Äôs medical clinic. The organization has since expanded to funding awards and providing support for outstanding scholarship and volunteer work on behalf of the University. Founded and actively maintained by Berkeley women, Prytanean is the emblem of high quality womxn-identifying scholars and leaders who aim to make a difference in the world.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Women Interest Student Organizations
Summary: Founded in 1901, the Prytanean Women‚Äôs Honor Society is the oldest collegiate women‚Äôs honor society in the US. Members engage in issues relating to student health and housing; promoting women in leadership; and giving back to the Berkeley community.

Name: Psi Chi
Description: We are the local chapter of the International Honors Society in Psychology. Psi Chi is a member of the Association of College Honor Societies and is an affiliate with the American Psychological Association (APA) and the Association for Psychological Science. Membership provides lifelong access to awards, grants, and research opportunities offered through the international organization. On campus, we host club meetings with professors and graduate students, Q&As, study groups, and socials. Membership is open to graduates and junior/senior undergraduates who are involved in the psychology program or a related discipline and meet the minimum qualifications. Applications for the next semester are available at the beginning of each semester. Please attach an unofficial printout of your transcript with your GPA (a printout of CalCentral is acceptable). Payment is not due until you are accepted as a potential member. OUR WEBSITE: https://psichi.studentorg.berkeley.edu/ (Applications open at the beginning of each semester; updates will be posted here and on the website.)
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Psi Chi is the International Honors Society in Psychology. Membership gives lifelong access to awards/grants/research opportunities offered through the International Organization as well as an invitation to all on-campus club meetings and events.

Name: Public Health Advocate
Description: The Public Health Advocate (PHA) is an undergraduate publication featuring current public health issues with local, national, and international perspectives. PHA was established in 2005 along with the UC Berkeley Public Health major, and the publication has since been awarded ‚ÄúBest New Magazine‚Äù in 2006 and ‚ÄúBest News Magazine‚Äù and ‚ÄúOutstanding Article in a Student Publication‚Äù in 2011. The Public Health Advocate is dedicated to giving students interested in health the opportunity for their work to be published in our print issue or our online platform. Print issues of the publication are made available to the campus community towards the culmination of every year and are distributed locally upon request.
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Public Health Advocate (PHA) is an undergraduate publication featuring current public health issues with local, national, and international perspectives. We publish an annual journal and regular online content throughout the year on our website.

Name: Public School Records
Description: Public School Records, a student-run record label, aims to promote the student music scene by providing real-world experiences in management, marketing, and production. PSR will foster a community for creatives to interact and easily collaborate.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Public School Records, a student-run record label, aims to promote the student music scene by providing real-world experiences in management, marketing, and production. PSR will foster a community for creatives to interact and easily collaborate.

Name: Punjabis at Berkeley
Description: ‚ÄòPunjabis at Berkeley‚Äô is aimed to be a cultural, intercultural, and interfaith organization bringing to light the culture, language, identity, and religious backgrounds of the Punjabi students at Berkeley and the greater Local community. It is aimed to promote intercultural and interfaith understanding. Punjabis worldwide may have the same culture, but religion has proved to be a drastic divide between relations. Therefore, it will promote and encourage a greater interfaith acceptance and tolerance. It hopes to foster a greater understanding of the Punjabi heritage, tradition, and culture through several lucrative events and festive celebrations. Additionally, it also aims to build a close-knit community within the organization.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: ‚ÄòPunjabis at Berkeley‚Äô is aimed to be a cultural, intercultural, and interfaith organization bringing to light the culture, language, identity, and religious backgrounds of the Punjabi students at Berkeley and the greater Local community.

Name: Q at Haas
Description: Q@Haas is the organization for LGBTQ+ MBA students, partners and allies at Berkeley Haas. However a community member identifies, we are proud and honored to welcome them. The mission of Q@Haas is to create a community where all LGBTQ+ people are accepted in their full identities. We have four main GOALS to help us accomplish our mission: Connection: build and support lasting connections both within the LGBTQ+ community and with our broader community of classmates, faculty, staff, and alumni Inclusion: welcome all individuals across the spectrums of gender identity and sexual orientation Education: raise awareness around diversity and intersectionality Development: Enhance the professional and personal development of LGBTQ+ students at Haas
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO
Summary: Q@Haas

Name: Quantum Computing at Berkeley üíô
Description: To create a community for students interested in quantum computing and also both Physics and Computer Science. To make quantum computing more accessible and to provide a platform for students, faculty, and industry to exchange ideas and knowledge. We do not handle memberships on Callink! Please visit our website qcb.berkeley.edu to learn how to become a member or email us at contact@qcb.berkeley.edu to be added to our roster/mailing list.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: To foster a community of students broadly interested in the field of quantum computing, both theory and experiment. We focus on the physics, electrical engineering, computer science, and mathematical aspects of the field.

Name: Queeks
Description: Queeks is a club for Queer guys, gals, and nonbinary pals in Greek life here at Berkeley. We aim to provide a safe space for LGBT+ students to express themselves within the queer community.
Categories: CalGreeks Fraternity & Sorority Affinity Groups
Summary: Queeks

Name: Queer Alliance & Resource Center
Description: The Queer Alliance and Resource Center (QARC) provides social, educational, and safe sex programming for the queer community on campus. QARC also acts as an umbrella organization and caucus for all active queer and queer-allied organizations at Cal.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, LGBTQ+ Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, ABSA - Budgeted over $7500 Organizations
Summary: The Queer Alliance and Resource Center (QARC) provides social, educational, and safe sex programming for the queer community on campus. QARC also acts as an umbrella organization and caucus for all active queer and queer-allied organizations at Cal.

Name: Queer Caucus
Description: Queer Caucus at Berkeley Law is comprised of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, gender variant, and queer law students and allies. We strive to provide social opportunities and support for our members, to develop an academic environment that supports queer scholarship, and to organize events relating to political, social, and legal issues affecting the queer community. In addition to maintaining a strong and visible community of LGBTQ students, the Queer Caucus works with LGBT attorneys at public interest organizations, private firms, and government agencies to create networks of support between Berkeley Law students and alumni. Since its founding in 1978, the Queer Caucus has worked to eradicate the legal, political, and social oppression of LGBTQ people, and to provide an affirming, supportive base for students of diverse sexual orientations and gender identities. This mission is complimented by our commitment to intersectional work and coalition building with a broad group of other student organizations and journals on campus.
Categories: LGBTQ+ Student Organizations
Summary: A place for LGBTQ law students and allies!

Name: Queers in Computer Science and Engineering üíô
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are a social organization that puts on events like lunches, coffee breaks, happy hours, and more to foster community among the LGBTQ+ grad students, post docs, faculty, and staff in the EECS department.

Name: qui parle: Critical Humanities and Social Sciences
Description: For over thirty years, qui parle has published outstanding theoretical and critical work in the humanities and social sciences. Run by an independent group of graduate students since its founding at the University of California, Berkeley, the journal aims to foster critical conversations and introduce new analytic modes by bringing together diverse scholarly and artistic voices.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Twice a year Qui Parle publishes provocative articles covering a range of outstanding theoretical and critical work in the humanities and social sciences.

Name: Quidditch League at Berkeley üíô
Description: Our club competes in the fast-growing, full contact, and co-ed sport known as Quadball (formerly Quidditch). With regional, national, and international competition, players get the exclusive opportunity to travel, develop leadership skills, and compete all over the world. Our team competes in about four-six tournaments each year with the goal of qualifying for World Cup. Some of the notable tournaments include Western Cup, our regional tournament, and the Big Sweep, our match up against Stanford. Our club welcomes anyone interested to learn more about Quidditch, make friends, and compete. We have a traveling competitive team and a noncompetitive team.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our club competes in the fast-growing, full contact, and co-ed sport known as Quidditch. With regional, national, and international competition, players get the exclusive opportunity to travel, develop leadership skills, and compete all over the world.

Name: Quiz Bowl Club üíô
Description: We hold buzzer-based academic question-and-answer trivia competitions that contain questions relevant to the interests of all majors and academic inclinations! Come see what we're about! New members can get involved with our organization by emailing Anuttam Ramji at anuttamr@berkeley.edu. We usually hold practices on Sundays and Tuesdays from 7-10PM, and we're a very relaxed club that does not require anything of its members (apart from those who wish to travel for national tournaments). We compete in several college tournaments a year, including ones at Berkeley, and host multiple high school tournaments a year. Contact us if you want to compete at tournaments or learn how to help out!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We facilitate participation in academic quiz competitions held at Berkeley and other universities. Everyone is welcome to join!

Name: Ra-On
Description: Welcome to the official page of Ra-On, Berkeley's premier Korean rock band! Established in 2006, we are the only Korean band on campus. Comprising musically talented students, Ra-On is more than just a band; it's a creative outlet for those passionate about music. Our mission is to showcase the performing arts of Korean culture, primarily through rock music. Our repertoire includes both Korean and English cover songs, and we also delight in composing original music. To broaden our reach and promote our unique genre, we regularly film our practice sessions and share them with not just the Korean community, but with the diverse audience that makes up Berkeley. Throughout the semester, we engage in various projects, gigs, and performances. The highlight is our very own concert, held at the end of each semester. We welcome anyone with a passion for music and an interest in Korean rock! Please e-mail raon.staff@gmail.com for inquiries.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: We are Ra-On, the only Korean Band in UC Berkeley, established in 2006.

Name: Raas Ramzat
Description: UC Berkeley Raas Ramzat is Cal‚Äôs official competitive Raas/Garba team. Raas & Garba are folk styles of dance native to the Indian state of Gujarat. These dance forms originated in celebrations of the festival season of Navratri and often use props such as dandiyas. At a collegiate level, it has evolved to be a high-energy dance that draws from aspects of both South Asian and Western culture. In our last competitive years, we won 1st place at our competition in Indiana, and 2nd place at our competitions in Texas and Virginia! We are proud to be a close-knit team that shares a common passion for dance and beyond. Join UCB Raas Ramzat as we take on the Raas Circuit! ‚ÄãCheck out our 2023-24 routine! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lcRbwT-3uVE&t=398s Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ucb.raasramzat/ Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/calraas Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCkgR1tMDsMqAUb6LCVcJAg Email: ucb.raasramzat@gmail.com
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Raas Ramzat is Berkeley's premier competitive Raas and Garba dance team. Raas and Garba are folk dance styles from Gujurat, India. We hope to spread this high-energy dance form and build a valuable community of dancers and friends!

Name: RAKUGO Club at Berkeley
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: 1.Celebrating and promoting the rich tradition of Japanese comedic storytelling, known as Rakugo. 2. Enhancing language proficiency and building bridges between diverse groups through Rakugo

Name: Ra√≠ces Recruitment and Retention Center
Description: "An effort to demystify education, conceptualized and realized by the Ra√≠ces Center!" As one of the Recruitment and Retention Centers part of the bridges Multicultural Resource Center, the Ra√≠ces Center works to demystify higher education through various programs and events throughout the academic year. The Ra√≠ces Center's goal is to increase and retain the enrollment of Latinx students into institutions of higher education. (formerly known as Raza Recruitment and Retention Center)
Categories: RRC - Recruitment & Retention Center, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Please refer to our website and social medias for more information: facebook.com/RaicesRRC instagram: @theraicescenter Linked: Raices Recruitment and Retention Center

Name: REACH! Asian and Asian Diaspora Recruitment and Retention Center (formerly known as "REACH! Asian Pacific American RRC")
Description: In 1994, the Retention and Empowerment of Asian/Asian American Youths Considering Higher Education (REACH!) began with a handful of committed folks, as a program under the Asian Student Union (ASU) at UC Berkeley to target ‚ÄúAsian American*, high school students, especially those who are underrepresented, low-income, and non-college tracked‚Äù. Its goals were two-fold: 1) promoting higher education as an attainable goal and 2) empowering students through ‚Äúbuilding ethnic pride and programs that foster community activism and support APA* youth culture‚Äù. As REACH! grew organizationally, the vision and purpose of REACH! grew with it. While the mission remained, ‚Äúthe service and empowerment of recent immigrant and urban Asian Americans living in at-risk life situations,‚Äù we added on that ‚ÄúOur goal is to promote higher education as a means to empower ourselves and improve the economic and social conditions facing our communities.‚Äù We saw that REACH! had a unique role on campus and in the A/AA community at large, because REACH! was not just going to increase the numbers of underrepresented Asians at Berkeley but REACH! would be a training ground for future educators, activists, and leaders who would address society‚Äôs injustices through their life‚Äôs work. Thus, we created programs to raise political awareness, build coalitions, develop youth leaders, and build leadership in ourselves. Each year, programs have been refined and recreated by (insanely) dedicated and intelligent coordinators, who look for a better way to do things. However, our single most important legacy is the steady stream of community leaders we have and will produce. *As of May 1st, 2022, we have redirected our efforts from serving API communities to fully serve the Asian/Asian American communities. This group [REACH! Asian and Asian Diaspora Recruitment and Retention Center] was formerly named [REACH! Asian Pacific American Recruitment and Retention Center] - [2024/04/26] [AZ]
Categories: RRC - Recruitment & Retention Center, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: "Committed to the service, empowerment, and mobilization of immigrant, refugee, and under served Asian/Asian Americans by promoting higher education to empower ourselves and challenge the economic and social inequalities facing our communities." - 2022

Name: Real Talk Buddies
Description: Established in 2021 by a group of first-year graduate students in Environmental Science, Policy, and Management, Real Talk Buddies seeks to fill the niche of informal mentorship, where undergraduate students can connect and discuss issues or aspirations with graduate student mentors without the expectation of homework or project completion, and without strict meeting requirements. Real Talk Buddies provides the space to discuss issues of academics, graduate school, career, identity, family, and much more. We aim to provide a safe and encouraging space where students can feel that they are supported in their individual needs. Through this program, we encourage greater undergraduate student retention, inclusivity, confidence, competence for pursuing graduate school, and a sense of ‚ÄòI can do this‚Äô during their undergraduate career.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Real Talk Buddies supports undergraduate students by providing them the opportunity to receive mentorship from graduate student mentors.

Name: Redline at Berkeley
Description: Redline at Berkeley is a UC Berkeley student organization dedicated to providing students with an automotive motorsport community to share their passion for cars with each other, through car meetups, group drives and collaborative events. We produce media and content to promote car culture within the university and beyond as well as carry out photoshoots for our members and their cars. We intend to educate our members about their automotive vehicles regarding maintenance, modification as well as teaching them how to race properly on track, whilst also providing a social community where they feel like they belong.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Redline at Berkeley is focused on building a car community. We educate students on customizing and maintaining vehicles while hosting meetups, group drives, and collaborative events, creating a space where car enthusiasts can connect and belong.

Name: Redwoods at Haas üíô
Description: Redwoods @ Haas is dedicated to building community at Haas through enjoyment of the outdoors, increasing access to recreation by providing resources and education, and building a sense of stewardship for natural spaces. Since October 2025 Redwoods @ Haas has incorporated the Haas Wellness Club.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The premier MBA outdoor recreation, adventure, and stewardship society in the world. Dedicated tirelessly to expanding outdoor access, educating participants to be responsible visitors to outdoor spaces, and building lasting friendships under the stars.

Name: Reformed University Fellowship üíô
Description: RUF is a Christian student fellowship centered around experiencing and expressing the love of God to our classmates, our community, and our campus. No matter who you are, what you've done, or what you believe, everyone is welcome at RUF. Because grace changes everything.
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: RUF Berkeley is a community centered around two things: experiencing and expressing the love of God.

Name: Regents' and Chancellor's Scholars Association
Description: The Regents‚Äô and Chancellor‚Äôs Scholars Association (RCSA) is dedicated to fostering a community for Regents‚Äô and Chancellor‚Äôs Scholarship recipients at the University of California, Berkeley. By hosting a diverse set of events, from alumni industry dinners to faculty game nights, RCSA provides around 900 scholars with numerous opportunities to connect with others and share vital resources. Membership is an included benefit of the scholarship, and scholars can extend their involvement by joining one of eight committees‚ÄîTEDxBerkeley, the Regents' Overnight Host Program, Social, Faculty, Web Development, Corporate Relations, Alumni, Media and Marketing.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: RCSA hosts a diverse set of events, from alumni industry dinners to faculty game nights, in order to foster a community for Regents‚Äô and Chancellor‚Äôs Scholarship recipients at the University of California, Berkeley.

Name: Renters' Legal Assistance (Formerly ASUC Renters' Legal Assistance)
Description: Renters' Legal Assistance, formerly known as "ASUC Renters' Legal Assistance", was established in 1981 as a joint project of the ASUC, CALPIRG, and the Municipal Lobby to help educate tenants about their rights. Renters' Legal Assistance offers free advice to U.C. Berkeley students and the surrounding community through counseling, education, and public interest research. RLA provides in-office counseling, group counseling, phone counseling as well as workshops and seminars for the public. To aid students in asserting their rights, RLA distributes pamphlets and sample letters covering numerous topic. RLA maintains a comprehensive library containing material on housing issues and tenant's rights, current California Civil Codes, Berkeley Rent Control regulations and other housing related legal texts. RENTERS' LEGAL ASSISTANCE INTERNSHIP PROGRAM UC Berkeley student can apply to intern at Renters' Legal Assistance every semester. Initially, interns will familiarize themselves with California and Berkeley rent law through trainings, reading and observation. As interns become more familiar with the law, they may begin counseling clients. Interns can expect to develop skills such as public speaking, counseling, legal researching, problem solving, program development and enhanced writing skills. Interns will assist clients virtually and attend weekly meetings. Interns must also attend a training session early in the semester and pass a written exam. This group [Renters' Legal Assistance] was formerly named [ASUC Renters' Legal Assistance] - 3/15 IZ
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: RLA offers assistance to U.C. Berkeley students and the surrounding community through counseling, educational workshops, and public interest research.

Name: Representation of Asian and Pacific Islander in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering (RAPID-CEE) üíô
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We aim to foster academic growth, professional development, and cultural exchange, while providing a platform for collaboration, mentorship, and support for API graduate students in CEE.

Name: Research Experience Pathways
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Research Experience Pathways program aims to increase access to research opportunities for underrepresented undergraduate students from low-income backgrounds by connecting students to paid research opportunities at UC Berkeley.

Name: Residence Hall Assembly
Description: The Residence Hall Assembly shall maintain and improve the quality of life within the Residence Halls by: Serving as an advocacy group for student concerns with the Department of Housing and Dining Services, to the Associated Students of the University of California (ASUC), to the larger university, and to the City of Berkeley; Providing a forum for residents to communicate with each other and work together to resolve common concerns and achieve common goals; Providing resident representation on committees of the University and local community; Facilitating in the planning and execution of programs on a systemwide and local level; Initiating any activities and programs necessary and proper to ensure and improve the quality of life within the Residence Halls. Remaining non-partisan and ensuring all functions in the residence halls do not promote or oppose any political biases including, but not limited to: political parties, candidates, etc. Advocating for the best interest of the residential community through issue-specific correspondence as approved by a three-fourths majority of the Assembly on specific propositions, measures, ordinances, and laws.
Categories: OASIS Sponsored Organization, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Residence Hall Assembly shall act as the primary representative body for all residents at UC Berkeley and as the umbrella organization for all Hall Associations.

Name: Restorative Justice League
Description: Promote restorative justice principles and practices on campus by creating spaces on campus for people to express themselves, address harms, resolve conflicts.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Promote restorative justice principles and practices on campus by creating spaces on campus for people to express themselves, address harms, resolve conflicts.

Name: ReUSE
Description: The ReUSE Store is a campus not-for-profit thrift store run by student members of ReUSE. We take donations and trades of clothing and other household items from the Cal community and give them back to the community via our store. We also offer free clothing repair services. We are committed to creating a more sustainable environment through promoting reuse and making items affordable for students. Textbooks, readers, and office supplies are all free, and everything else in the store is $3 or less. Things we can‚Äôt sell or give away are donated. All proceeds go to charity and maintaining the club. We also host various special events, such as Tie Dye during Earth Week and Super Sproul Sales. Members of committees plan and host special events. Volunteers generally help in the store for one or two hours a week when their schedule allows and receive store credit as well as first dibs on new items. Contact ucberkeleyreuse@gmail.com to schedule a training session and start volunteering! Get involved for Fall 2024 by following our Instagram @reuseberkeley for updates and more!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated MLK Space
Summary: ReUSE is a student organization that runs the ReUSE Thrift Store in MLK, gives away free textbooks, and hosts other special events. We also manage the ReUSE Stations on campus. We are committed to creating a more sustainable environment through reuse!

Name: REVERB
Description: REVERB is UC Berkeley‚Äôs hub for electronic music culture. This is a community where students dive deep into DJing, production, and the music industry. REVERB teaches and empowers students to turn their passion for music into creative skills. From hands-on workshops to music showcases, we‚Äôre here to amplify your sound and continue building Berkeley's electronic music scene from the ground up. REVERB prides itself on being accessible to all students, whether they have previous music knowledge or are simply dedicated and interested in learning about DJing. * If you have any questions please contact either President Tibet - tyakut@berkeley.edu or Vice President Chris - chris_jenstad@berkeley.edu. WEBSITE - INCLUDES APPLICATION LINK
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: REVERB aims to assist in the creative and professional development of electronic music producers, artists, and DJs through music production and business education, showcases, guest speakers, networking, career seminars, and equipment rentals.

Name: Rhythm at Berkeley üíô
Description: We play osu! (and other rhythm games) join the community discord: https://discord.gg/br9Ubfb join the club discord for club info: https://discord.gg/GtQFxbKYux Rhythm at Berkeley aims to create and foster a community for people who play rhythm games, particularly focusing on the game osu! and its related gamemodes. We host biweekly meetings and tournaments, promoting engagement within the rhythm game community at Berkeley.
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We play osu! (and other rhythm games)

Name: Riot Games at Berkeley üíô
Description: Through hosting a variety of open admission events, Riot Games at Berkeley (Berkeley Legends) ensures that students with any interest in League of Legends, VALORANT, and other Riot Games have a place to create relationships, thus diversifying the quality of life at Berkeley. Find out more at our Discord, or email us at riotgamesatberkeley@gmail.com.
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Riot Games at Berkeley aims to unite the community of League of Legends, VALORANT, and other Riot Games enthusiasts on the UC Berkeley campus. It aims to bring together players of all skill levels and seeks to foster and promote friendships between them.

Name: Rocket League at Berkeley
Description: Rocket League at Berkeley is here to create a community for Rocket League players at Berkeley. Come join if you enjoy the game of Rocket League and want to play with Berkeley friends, are new to the game and want to improve, or are experienced in the game and want to learn more about playing competitively. We will host weekly Rocket League nights as well as fun events with all our members! Join our discord!: https://discord.gg/XqhevzG6qa Interest form: https://forms.gle/BuTr8JbeR8NPKy2R6
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Rocket League at Berkeley is here to create a community for Rocket League players at Berkeley.

Name: Romanians at Berkeley üíô
Categories: Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We celebrate Romanian culture and unite Romanians at UC Berkeley, no matter from how near or far we‚Äôve come. By fostering lasting friendships through shared Romanian cultural understanding, we aim to make Berkeley feel like home.

Name: Rubik's Cube Club at Berkeley üíô
Description: Video
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Dedicated to the development of novel problem-solving approaches to Rubik's cubes and educating community members about them. Teaches two DeCal classes (https://cube.berkeley.edu/decal.html), and runs official competitions year-round.

Name: SAAS (Student Association for Applied Statistics) [Formerly SAAS]
Description: We are a community of UC Berkeley students with a shared interest in data science. We offer consulting projects, workshops, resources, and professional events. We strive to foster an inclusive community for students at UC Berkeley with an interest in applied statistics. Through hands-on learning opportunities, we hope to equip our members with the confidence and technical skills needed for a successful transition from academic to post-graduate life. Our internal events provide opportunities for members to build relationships with like-minded peers through both friendship and mentorship, and our external events allow members to connect with faculty, companies, and other campus organizations.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We are an organization of students from various academic disciplines who share a passion for statistics and data science. We offer a community of resources, workshops, professional events, and research and consulting projects.

Name: SACNAS for Graduate Students at Berkeley üíô
Description: We are the graduate division of the official SACNAS chapter at the University of California, Berkeley. SACNAS fosters the success of Hispanic/Chicano and Native American scientists ‚Äì from college students to professionals ‚Äì to attain advanced degrees, careers, and positions of leadership in science. We share the goals and values of SACNAS, striving to meet them through our various outreach activities. Our chapter seeks to improve recruitment, retention, and success of students underrepresented in STEM fields. We welcome all students who share our goals, no matter their background. Please see our website: Berkeley SACNAS ‚Äì A graduate student organization at UC Berkeley (wordpress.com)
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: To promote the recruitment, retention, and success of underrepresented minorities in science. We attend the annual SACNAS conference; organize fellowship workshops, career and mentoring events, social hours; and volunteer for recruitment events.

Name: Sage Mentorship Project, The
Description: The Sage Mentorship Project is a one-on-one and classroom mentorship organization created to address the major disconnect between tutoring and mentoring programs. The program is meant to build ‚Äúreal‚Äù connections, which with consistent time and effort by the mentors, will turn into powerful relationships. The program‚Äôs ultimate goal is to provide youth with a personal connection to mentors through academic and extracurricular activities in order to foster life skills and personal growth. Sage matches hundreds of committed UC Berkeley students to an elementary school-aged mentee each year. Our mission is to provide youth from Berkeley, Oakland, and El Cerrito elementary schools we reach with a personal connection to mentors through academic and extracurricular activities in order to foster life skills and personal growth. Every semester, The Sage DeCal is offered to all mentors and is worth 1 unit. The classroom and mentoring portions of the class each run concurrently all the way through the semester, allowing the students to directly apply lessons learned in the classroom and utilize the classroom as a resource for issues that come up while mentoring. This course offers UC Berkeley students a unique opportunity to critically engage in the theory and practice of working with the youths in our community. This course will teach what it takes to be an effective mentor, tutor, and big brother or sister for their mentee. By the end of this course, students will be able to: 1. Develop the skills to forge strong personal relationships with the youths in our community 2. Think critically about the theory and practice of working with children 3. Learn and use pedagogical methods relevant to elementary age students 4. Recognize the potential legal and ethical boundaries a mentor must navigate 5. Apply team-building and leadership training to collaborate on a group project
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The mission of the Sage Mentorship Project is to provide youth with a personal connection to mentors through academic and extracurricular activities in order to foster life skills and personal growth.

Name: Salsa at Cal
Description: Salsa at Cal is a group of university students who would like to spread their appreciation and knowledge of Salsa and other Latin dances to students on campus. We host dance events, trips to local clubs, and FREE classes in Salsa and other styles. We've taught everything from Rueda, Cubana, and Bachata, but our main focus is on Salsa.We teach a weekly series of beginner and intermediate classes in Hearst Gym as part of our for-credit DeCal course for students only. Dancers of all levels--from complete beginners looking to learn for the first time, to seasoned Salseres just looking for a fun crowd to dance with--are welcome in our classes and events, and no partner is required. Be on the lookout for upcoming community events including "Open Pr√°ctica", Salsa on Sproul and other social dancing opportunities! More info can be found on our instagram: @Salsaatcalberkeley
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: A club dedicated to spreading the joy of Latin dance at Berkeley. We offer free beginner and intermediate classes, and hold social dancing events on and off campus throughout the semester.

Name: Saudi Arabian Association at Berkeley
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Saudi Arabian Association at Berkeley provides its members a community that expresses Saudi culture and traditions. It also creates a strong network among Saudi UC Berkeley students and alumni.

Name: SBC Strategy Consulting [Formerly known as Seed Base Consulting]
Description: SBC Strategy Consulting is a premier student-run management consulting agency that provides business solutions to clients of all growth stages, ranging from seed to Fortune 500 companies. Our members are selected carefully to create a diverse pool of top talent with various academic backgrounds from UC Berkeley. We are on a mission to catalyze student growth and client impact. Our organization aims to provide every member with the unique experience of collaborating with a wide range of clients and delivering insightful research and data-backed recommendations across a multitude of industries. These semester-long engagements are dedicated to creating measurable impact for our clients and members. [Formerly known as Seed Base Consulting]
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: SBC provides business solutions to international and local companies of all stages and helps them achieve product-market fit through market research and budgeting, and provides real consulting experience for Berkeley students.

Name: Scholars of Finance
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Scholars of Finance is a nonprofit organization dedicated to developing undergrad finance students into the next generation of highly capable financial executives - who will act and lead with integrity and a commitment to serving the greater good.

Name: School of Education Graduate Coalition (formerly known as GSESA) üíô
Description: The School of Education Graduate Coalition is a graduate student group in the Berkeley School of Education (BSE). We are a standing body of graduate students dedicated to advocating for the interests of graduate students within the BSE. Our primary purposes are: to advocate for a more democratic BSE, to serve as a centralized point of communication between BSE (faculty and administration) and the graduate student body, to ensure that graduate students are included as key stakeholders in decisions and processes within the BSE, and to select students to serve on BSE committees, to serve as a forum for graduate student concerns, and advocate for equitable representation and treatment for diverse groups of students, paying special attention to: race, immigration status, gender, sexuality, student parent status, language, religion, ability and access, socioeconomic status, academic discipline, and research interests. Our secondary purposes are: to encourage interdisciplinary and collaborative research, to build community within the BSE, and to organize department-wide student academic/professional opportunities. School of Education Graduate Coalition name changed from Graduate School of Education Student Association 3/19/22 - MMC
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The School of Education Graduate Coalition is a graduate student group in the Berkeley School of Education. We are a standing body of graduate students dedicated to advocating for the interests of graduate students within the BSE.

Name: School of Public Health Student Government
Description: With the firm belief that student participation in the University of California, Berkeley (UCB) School of Public Health (SPH) is important in improving the quality of student life and representing students in decision making processes, the students of the UCB SPH hereby create this Constitution which shall be the bylaws of the School of Public Health Student Government (SPHSG) of the University of California.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The University of California, Berkeley (UCB) School of Public Health (SPH) Student Government strives to work with administration to improve the quality of student life and represent students in decision making processes.

Name: School Psychology Student Association
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The School Psychology Student Association will provide a venue for school psychology students at various points in their graduate career to share expertise, undertake professional development, and network.

Name: Science Fiction and Fantasy Short Story Workshop üíô
Description: Do you like science fiction? Do you like fantasy? Do you like to read, or write, or interact with others who have similar interests? If you said yes to any of those questions, you are more than welcome to join the Science Fiction and Fantasy Writing Workshop. We specialize in wacky writing warm-ups, writing contests, and workshopping stories in constructive ways. We accept all sorts here - whether you like time travel, dragons, space, castles, demons, ghosts, it doesn't matter what you write as long as you're passionate about it. Do you have a story you want to workshop? Then drop on by. Do you want to practice writing but can't dedicate more than an hour a week? Us too, so join in! Do you want a good de-stresser during midterms and crazy work weeks? This club was designed to do just that. We don't take attendance all that seriously - if you want to come for a meeting, we are happy to have you, and if you stay every week, then all the better. In short, we are a club filled with members who love science fiction and fantasy in all forms. If you share those interests, you'll fit right in.
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Science Fiction and Fantasy Writing Workshop We write and workshop stories. New members always welcome! For more info, join our mailing list: tinyurl.com/sffwwbemail

Name: Science Leadership and Management üíô
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: SLAM, a program for graduate students and postdoctoral researchers in the sciences, fosters and supports the development of effective leadership and management skills for individuals seeking to reach their full potential in a variety of career paths.

Name: Science Olympiad at Berkeley üíô
Description: BSO organizes volunteers from the Berkeley community for an annual Science Olympiad Invitational at Berkeley. We also strive to play an active role in our local community through outreach initiatives.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: BSO organizes members of the Berkeley community to volunteer at an annual Science Olympiad invitational tournament at Berkeley. We strive to play an active role in supporting Science Olympiad at the high school level and fostering a scientific spirit.

Name: SCUBA at Berkeley üíô
Description: We extend a warm welcome to all members of the Berkeley academic community - students, faculty, and staff - to join Scuba at Berkeley, a recognized student organization (RSO) dedicated to the thrilling world of scuba diving and ocean conservation. Whether you're an experienced diver or a curious enthusiast, our inclusive community offers unforgettable experiences with monthly excursions to Monterey's captivating waters, special club discounts, and opportunities to forge lasting connections with like-minded dive buddies. No prior certification is required, as we believe in nurturing newcomers to earn their first SCUBA certifications. Take the plunge and dive into a world of exploration, camaraderie, and a shared commitment to marine conservation with Scuba at Berkeley!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: SCUBA @ Berkeley is the only student organization on campus dedicated to students that have an interest in scuba diving.

Name: SDG Undergraduate Research Group
Description: SDG Undergraduate Research Group is an undergraduate research group affiliated with the UC Berkeley Office of Sustainability and guided by the UN Sustainable Development Goals. We strive to research local cross-cutting issues, empower undergraduate voices, and increase the accessibility of research on campus. Researchers will join working groups that tackle an area of sustainability tied to the UN SDGs that interests them, contribute to a collaborative research report, and present their findings to key stakeholders. To learn more about SURG, check out linktr.ee/surg.berkeley and get connected to our Instagram and website! This group [SDG Undergraduate Research Group] was formerly named [Students for Environmental Advocacy and Global University Leadership on Sustainability] - 9/9/20 IZ
Categories: Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: SDG Undergraduate Research Group is an undergraduate research group affiliated with the UC Berkeley Office of Sustainability and guided by the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

Name: SEAONC at Berkeley
Description: SEAONC at Berkeley is a graduate student organization committed to connecting students in the Structural Engineering, Mechanics, and Materials program with relevant, professional, and academic resources. Primarily, SEAONC at Berkeley sets students up for success in their studies (whether it be the Master‚Äôs program or pHD track) and beyond. We aim to facilitate mentoring programs with industry professionals, organize office visits with local workplaces, and coordinate other opportunities (like study groups, seminars, workshops, etc.) for students to feel more confident learning the challenging, structural engineering material and entering the workforce. We also work closely with the Civil and Environmental Engineering Department to accomplish these goals, and offer support/feedback to improve the graduate program for future years. This organization‚Äôs specific goals of bettering the SEMM program are unique and increase students‚Äô opportunities beyond the graduate curriculum.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: SEAONC at Berkeley will be an organization committed to connecting graduate students in the Structural Engineering, Mechanics, & Materials program with relevant, professional, academic resources.

Name: Seed College Ministry at Berkeley üíô
Description: Our organization‚Äôs purpose is to see college students transformed by the Gospel of Jesus Christ. We strive to create a vibrant community where students are focused on growing together in their love for one another and for God, deepening their understanding of the Bible, and fulfilling the Great Commission by making mature followers of Christ. This organization encourages college students to integrate themselves with a home church through weekly college group meetings (with students from UC Berkeley, San Francisco State University, University of San Francisco, California College of the Arts, & Academy of Arts University), bimonthly Friday night fellowship activities, and Sunday services. Ultimately, as part of Radiance Christian Church, and part of the Acts Ministries International organization, we hope to advance the Gospel of Christ in San Francisco & to the world.
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We strive to create a community that will grow in their love for others & God, deepen their understanding of the Bible, and develop mature Christians.

Name: SEEDS: Strategies for Ecology, Education, Diversity, and Sustainability
Description: SEEDS is a chapter of the national SEEDS program established by the Ecological Society of America. The purpose of this club is to promote accessible opportunities in the field of ecology for underrepresented students at the University of California, Berkeley. We seek to diversify ecology by engaging students interested in the field with hands-on experiences with science. We provide students with opportunities to interact with a diverse group of their peers and ecologists to deepen students‚Äô understanding of the science as well as future career options. Examples of what we do: 1. Graduate student or faculty panels to showcase cutting-edge research and the diversity of ecology 2. Field trips and educational opportunities for Berkeley students to learn more about the field from top experts 3. Volunteer projects to promote ecological principles and sustainability in our community 4. Research and job opportunities, networking, and professional development resources 5. Support and social community of like-minded peers at Berkeley
Categories: Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: SEEDS is a student group committed to increasing diversity and opportunities for underrepresented students to engage with the field of ecology. We are a chapter of the national SEEDS program of the Ecological Society of America (ESA).

Name: SEMM DSR
Description: SEMM DSR is a graduate student organization committed to building community among doctoral students and researchers (DSRs) in the Structural Engineering, Mechanics, and Materials (SEMM) program of the Civil and Environmental Engineering (CEE) department at UC Berkeley. DSRs include MS students with the goal of including research in their graduate work, students on the PhD track, post-doctoral researchers, and visiting scholars. Prior to the formation of this group, there have been no distinct avenues towards connection or peer support among DSRs. To amend this deficit, SEMM DSR aims to establish four initiatives: (1) Connection Forum, (2) Community Events, (3) Industry Information Sessions, and (4) Research Facility Upkeep.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Build community among doctoral students and researchers (DSRs) in the Structural Engineering, Mechanics, and Materials (SEMM) program of the Civil and Environmental Engineering (CEE) department at UC Berkeley.

Name: Sexual Orientation & Gender Advocacy (GA Project)
Description: The Sexual Orientation and Gender Advocacy Project (SOGA) seeks to improve the lives and experiences of queer and gender-diverse graduate students at UC Berkeley. SOGA works closely with other GA projects to initiate outreach targeting graduate queer and gender-diverse students at UC Berkeley. Additionally, this coordinator serves as an advocate for queer and gender-diverse graduate students, addressing specific needs and concerns of the community to ensure their success in higher education and beyond. If you are interested in getting involved, contact the SOGA Project Director at sogaga@berkeley.edu
Categories: GA Government Offices
Summary: SOGA

Name: Shakespeare Society of Berkeley
Description: Our aim is to make Shakespeare's works accessible to a wider, more inclusive community by hosting play readings, discussions, talks, experimental productions, and more, working to bridge the gap between academic study and theatrical performance.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Media & Film Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We aim to make Shakespeare's works more accessible to a wider, more inclusive community by hosting play readings, discussions, talks, experimental productions, and more, bridging the gap between academic study and theatrical performance.

Name: Sigma Alpha Nu
Description: Sigma Alpha Nu is Cal's premier co-ed pre-law fraternity. Our fraternity offers its members a chance to explore the intricate field of law with the support of its tight-knit community. As a member, you will learn to polish your basic professional skills, such as interviewing and speaking in a way that allows your unique voice to shine. Members will also be prepared for applying to law school as well as a future career in the field. Sigma Alpha Nu connects members with law professors, judges, and attorneys on a personal basis, leading to exclusive internships in the field of law. Join us at our rush events to meet our members and learn more about the fraternity! Fall 2025 Rush Details will posted on our platforms very soon! Instagram: @sigmaalphanu Website: www.calsan.org Fall 2025 Rush Events: MEET THE CHAPTER - Tuesday, September 2, 8-9 pm, The Standard (yes, MTC is in a different location than the other events!)LEGAL NIGHT - Thursday, September 4, 8-9 pm, Wheeler 20PROFESSIONAL NIGHT - Monday, September 8, 8-9 pm, Wheeler 20SOCIAL NIGHT - Wednesday, September 10, 8-9 pm, Wheeler 20 *All events will be held in-person from 8-9pm. Applications for Fall 2025 will be due Thursday, September 11 at 11:59pm at calsan.org
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Sigma Alpha Nu is a co-ed pre-law fraternity created to help its members become competitive law school applicants and successful members of the profession.

Name: Sigma Chi
Description: Please visit CalSigmachi.org for more information on the Alpha Beta Chapter of Sigma Chi. Sigma Chi is a brotherhood with roots in the collegiate experience that cultivates a lifelong commitment to strive to achieve true friendship, equal justice and the fulfillment of learning as part of our overall responsibilities to the broader communities in which we live. Sigma Chi best serves this purpose by developing, implementing and monitoring programs that foster leadership, build character and promote positive relationship skills that, in turn, enable our members to become productive and caring participants in their families, colleges and communities. Moreover, Sigma Chi offers a host of social life rewards, but it does so in the context of molding good character within its members. Integrity, sound judgment and loyalty are all lofty goals that can occasionally be found contradictory to the impulses of collegiate life. Our fraternity provides a medium for character development that assists young men in developing the qualities of their character. Our direct input in developing American leaders is so thorough that on June 13, 2005, Sigma Chi was the first Greek-letter society to be honored by the United States Congress for the fraternity's 150th anniversary. The Alpha Beta Chapter here at the University of California, Berkeley was the first Sigma Chi chapter to be founded on the West Coast. Started in 1886 with the help of former Confederate General Harry St. John Dixon, our fraternity expanded to all corners of the United States. In 1913, the fraternity moved into its current location on the corner of College and Channing. The house is a block away from the biggest dining hall at Cal, Crossroads, and only two blocks away from campus. Currently, our chapter consists of 50 members, 22 of which live in.
Categories: CalGreeks Interfraternity Council (IFC) Fraternities
Summary: Sigma Chi is a character building organization that serves to provide a community and brotherhood for motivated students at Berkeley, focusing on the ideals of friendship, justice, and learning. For more information please visit calsigmachi.org.

Name: Sigma Epsilon Omega
Description: UC Berkeley‚Äôs first and only queer-founded fraternity, is a community built by and for LGBTQ+ students of all genders and identities. We are committed to creating a safe, affirming, and celebratory space centered on respect, equity, and chosen family. Founded by three queer students at UC Berkeley, SEO has and is continuing to break barriers and stereotypes of both the queer and Greek communities. Founded in 2007 by three visionary students, SEO has grown from an Alpha Class of 23 to a network of more than 130 siblings, current members and alumni, breaking barriers in Greek life and thriving across diverse fields worldwide. In 2017, we celebrated our ten-year anniversary, and we continue to evolve as a home where queer and trans students can grow as leaders, friends, and changemakers. Our siblinghood is grounded in activism, service, and joy. We engage in philanthropy, awareness campaigns, and volunteer efforts that uplift our communities, while also holding space for vibrant social connection and celebration of queer and trans identities. SEO believes that Greek life should reflect the diversity and resilience of the LGBTQ+ community. We are proud to foster a siblinghood based on authenticity, solidarity, and opportunity for all, moving towards our vision for queer Greek-Life. For questions or to connect with us, please email president@sigmaepsilonomega.org we'd love to hear from you!
Categories: CalGreeks Multicultural Greek Council (MCGC) Fraternities & Sororities
Summary: Sigma Epsilon Omega (SEO), UC Berkeley‚Äôs only queer fraternity, is a siblinghood inclusive of all genders and identities. Striving to create a supportive, inclusive, chosen-family community that queer and trans students can call home at Cal.

Name: Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority, Inc.
Description: Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority, Inc. was founded on November 12, 1922 on the campus of Butler University in Indianapolis, Indiana by seven accomplished community-driven young educators. They believed that the self-respect, knowledge and discipline gained through study would help individuals to recognize their duty and responsibility for their society. Founded on the precept of education, Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority, Inc., as a leading national service organization, continues to meet the challenges of the day, promoting and encouraging high scholastic attainment, and continues to grow through Sisterhood, Scholarship and Service.
Categories: CalGreeks National Pan-Hellenic Council (NPHC) Fraternities & Sororities
Summary: Beta Psi Chapter's aim is to enhance the quality of life for individuals within and around Northern California (East Bay), through public service, leadership development and education of youth.

Name: Sigma Kappa
Description: Welcome to the Lambda Chapter of Sigma Kappa at the University of California, Berkeley! üíú Founded in 1910, our chapter is built on the values of friendship, loyalty, service, and personal growth. We are a diverse group of women who come together to support one another academically, socially, and personally. Our chapter is dedicated to making a positive impact on campus and in the community through various philanthropic efforts, including our strong partnership with the Alzheimer‚Äôs Association. Located at 2409 Warring Street, our beautiful house is a hub of activity where lifelong friendships are formed. We take pride in our commitment to academic excellence, leadership development, and creating a welcoming, inclusive environment for all members. Our motto, ‚ÄúOne Heart, One Way,‚Äù reflects our unity and dedication to living out our values every day. From our cherished sisterhood events to our involvement in the Panhellenic community, Sigma Kappa offers countless opportunities for personal and professional growth. Our chapter is passionate about philanthropy, supporting causes like the Alzheimer‚Äôs Association, Inherit the Earth, and our national foundation. Whether you‚Äôre looking for lifelong friendships, meaningful service opportunities, or a space to grow as a leader, Sigma Kappa at UC Berkeley is truly a home away from home. Join us as we live with heart, lead with purpose, and inspire positive change.
Categories: CalGreeks Panhellenic Council (PHC) Sororities

Name: Sigma Mu Delta
Description: Sigma Mu Delta is a premedical/pre-health fraternity which promotes the advancement of premedical students through three principles deeply valued by our brothers: brotherhood, education and dedication. It is through these pillars that the fraternity members work together towards obtaining the primary goal of admission into medical school, while simultaneously helping to shape the physicians of tomorrow. Sigma Mu Delta fulfills these goals of the premedical student through our rapidly growing alumni network, rich peer advising, and supportive brotherhood. We help our brothers achieve their true potential during their undergraduate years at University of California ‚Äì Berkeley with resources ranging from our exclusive test bank to our partnership with The Princeton Review. In the past few years, our brothers have gone on to top-tier medical schools including Harvard Medical School, Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine, Stanford School of Medicine, UCSF Medical School, etc. Our members help the community through service events for organizations such as the American Cancer Society‚Äôs Relay for Life, Berkeley‚Äôs Alzheimer‚Äôs Center, and Glide Memorial Church. Members of this chapter work at Seed of Health, a non-profit organization aiming to build and support clinics in under-served communities, globally, such as Ethiopia. Finally, we offer sponsored professional events to help both actives and non-actives understand the premedical process, bringing the premedical community at Berkeley closer to fulfilling their dreams.Sigma Mu Delta partners with Kappa Gamma Delta ‚Äì Epsilon chapter for social events, professional events, and volunteer opportunities.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The mission of Sigma Mu Delta is to unify pre-medical students in a brotherhood dedicated to academic excellence. Sigma Mu Delta's foundation is based on the principles of brotherhood, education, and dedication.

Name: Sigma Nu
Description: Our Mission: To develop ethical leaders inspired by the principles of Love, Honor, and Truth. To foster the personal growth of each man‚Äôs mind, heart, and character. To perpetuate lifelong friendships and commitment to the Fraternity.
Categories: CalGreeks Interfraternity Council (IFC) Fraternities
Summary: Founded in 1868, the Beta Psi chapter of Sigma Nu Fraternity aims to excel with honor in all aspects of life. We develop ethical leaders inspired by the principles of Love, Honor, and Truth.

Name: Sigma Omicron Pi
Description: The sisterhood of Sigma Omicron Pi was established at San Francisco State University in 1930 by ten Asian American women: Elizabeth Hall, Frances Hall, Dorothy Lau, Gertrude Lee, Hannah Lee, Louise Lee, Fannie Lim, Nancy Lim, Emma Lum, and Beatrice Ng, pursuing the interest of teaching. They chose the Greek letters, Sigma, Omicron, and Pi to represent themselves as the "Sisters of Pedagogy." The Constitution was derived from an existing "Honorary Society of Education." The sorority was active in the Asian Community for the next fifteen years. At the advent of World War II, the organization was forced to become inactive. In 1946, a group of women from the University of California, Berkeley re-established Sigma Omicron Pi on their campus. Since its inception, Sigma Omicron Pi has grown in membership with student chapters at: Beta Chapter: San Francisco State University, 1988 Gamma Chapter: San Jose State University, 1992 Delta Chapter: University of California, Davis, 1993 Epsilon Chapter: California State University, Sacramento, 1993 Zeta Chapter: University of California, Santa Cruz, 1995 Eta Chapter: University of Maryland, 1997, retired 2000 Theta Chapter: University of California, Irvine, 2001 Iota Chapter: Pennsylvania State University, 2001 Kappa Chapter: University of California, San Diego, 2002 Lambda Chapter: The Johns Hopkins University, 2002 Mu Chapter: University of California, Riverside, 2003 Nu Chapter: Binghamton University, State University of New York, 2008 Though the sorority no longer centered around the interest of teaching, it still maintained its commitment to the Asian American community. All of the chapters became extremely involved in their respective communities, volunteering their time at community agencies and raising money to donate to favorable charities. Sigma Omicron Pi earned a respectable reputation as a benefactor to the Asian American cause. The purpose of Sigma Omicron Pi is to promote unity, lifelong friendships, leadership, and community service. This organization offers women a supportive network of sisters to achieve academic and social growth. The sisterhood of Sigma Omicron Pi provides an environment where sisters may utilize and develop their organizational skills. Each one of our sisters has different interests and aspirations, yet we all share one common ground - SOPi. We have based our sisterhood on four objectives: UNITY, FRIENDSHIP, LEADERSHIP and SERVICE. In addition, Sigma Omicron Pi has a tradition of lifelong friendship that has prevailed for over eight decades.
Categories: CalGreeks Multicultural Greek Council (MCGC) Fraternities & Sororities
Summary: The sisterhood of Sigma Omicron Pi, established in 1930, is the first national Asian American Interest sorority. SOPi remains dedicated to its four objectives of unity, friendship, leadership, and service.

Name: Sigma Phi Epsilon
Description: "This Fraternity will be different" Since its founding in 1901 at the University of Richmond, Sigma Phi Epsilon has sought to be a leader in the fraternity world and to set itself apart from the rest. SigEp believes in strengthening character, building interpersonal, leadership, and professional skills, and cultivating lifelong friendships.
