We are the first American college fraternity to abolish pledging, instead implementing the Balanced Man Program through which we aim to improve upon our brother's strengths to help them achieve their true potential and attain a fulfilling college experience without needless hazing. We are a community where brothers strive to grow together and excel in all aspects of life: academically, professionally, physically, and socially. Here at the California Alpha chapter at UC Berkeley, our brothers come from all around the globe and are leaders in campus organizations, presidents of honor societies, and participate in club and varsity athletics. Our alumni have gone on to attend graduate school at Harvard, Stanford, Yale, and other prestigious institutions, and pursue careers in medicine, law, public office, and tech (Google, Facebook, etc.). We invite you to check out our website at http://berkeleysigep.com/ for more information
Categories: CalGreeks Interfraternity Council (IFC) Fraternities
Summary: SigEp brothers strive to grow together and excel in all aspects of life through an enriching fraternity experience. We are leaders in various campus organizations and the community while maintaining academic and social excellence.

Name: Sigma Pi Alpha Sorority, Inc.
Description: Sigma Pi Alpha is a Chicanx/Latinx based Sorority. It was founded in the Spring of 1996 at the University of California, Berkeley by nine women who saw the need to create a close network of Chicanx/Latinxs who want to make a difference in the community, starting with themselves. Sigma Pi Alpha addresses the academic, cultural, communal, and social needs of its members. For ourselves, we are a sisterhood of academic and personal support, trust, and understanding. We base our work on our three pillars of Campus Involvement (includes Academics), Community Service, and Sisterhood. For our campus, we sponsor informative and social activities. We support our fellow Latinx and Multicultural Greek organizations and network with other campus resources and groups. For our community, our priority is to promote higher education through mentoring, tutoring, scholarships, and to support Chicanx/Latinx youth. Most importantly, we support Chicana/Latina youth and address many community issues. We uphold our following seven goals: 1. To enhance Chicana/Latina heritage within the sorority. 2. To be involved within campus and our communities. 3. To promote higher education in future generations. 4. To address academics, sisterhood, and personal and individual needs. 5. To create a sisterhood in which we can communicate and express ourselves with trust and security. 6. To form a sisterhood where we can receive support and a commitment that will last a lifetime. 7. To follow a code of conduct representative to us as a sorority and as Chicana/Latina women.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, CalGreeks Multicultural Greek Council (MCGC) Fraternities & Sororities
Summary: Sigma Pi Alpha Sorority, Inc. is a Chicana/Latina Sorority. It was founded on May 2nd, 1996 at Berkeley by nine women who saw the need to create a close network of Latinas who wanted to make a difference in their communities starting with themselves.

Name: Sigma Psi Zeta Sorority, Inc.
Description: Sigma Psi Zeta Sorority, Inc. is a progressive and multicultural, Asian-interest Greek Organization that provides a means to success and support for womxn, particularly womxn of color. The sorority builds on the unity of strong and independent leaders to affect change in our organization, our campuses, and our local communities. Sigma Psi Zeta is an official partner of It's On Us, the White House Initiative to end sexual assault on college campuses. We aim to be a community of pioneers and innovators offering opportunities for womxn to develop professional and interpersonal skills in service of education, cultural awareness, and our national philanthropy. The Alpha Iota Chapter of Sigma Psi Zeta was established on October 25, 2014 by a group of nine womxn. We are part of the Multicultural Greek Council (MCGC). We strive to build a sisterhood that is rooted on the principle of trust and to establish an organization that would continue to have a positive effect on the community for generations to come.
Categories: CalGreeks Multicultural Greek Council (MCGC) Fraternities & Sororities
Summary: Sigma Psi Zeta Sorority, Incorporated is a multicultural, Asian-interest Greek Organization that strives to promote unity among womxn and the awareness of Asian culture and heritages.

Name: Sikh Students Association
Description: The UC Berkeley Sikh Student Association was formulated over a decade ago with the intention to provide Cal Sikhs a forum for the discussion and advancement of the Sikh faith as well as to educate the greater campus about Sikhi and its many followers. It exists as a medium through which members can perform community service. As an organization, it servs the purpose of engaging non-Sikhs in an ongoing educational dialog.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: The UC Berkeley Sikh Student Association was formulated over a decade ago with the intention to provide Cal Sikhs a forum for the discussion and advancement of the Sikh faith as well as to educate the greater campus about Sikhism and its many followers.

Name: Singapore Student Association üíô
Description: SSA is a community of Singaporeans and students interested in Singapore culture. We organize activities for leisure and recreation like trips into SF, freshman BBQs and retreats, cultural celebrations like annual Lunar New Year dinners and National Day celebrations, as well as networking and professional events, linking students with companies offering internships and recruiting opportunities in both Singapore and the United States. For the past few years, we have worked hard to increase the student body's awareness of Singapore, brought students together and given a sense of home for many Singaporeans abroad. We continue to aim to be an inclusive and open organization sensitive to the Berkeley and Singaporean community. (formerly Singapore Malaysia Student Association)
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Singapore Student Association is a community of Singaporeans and students interested in Singapore culture providing a closely knit yet open community which preserves Singaporean heritage, spreads awareness and connects members to their roots.

Name: Skateboarding at Berkeley
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: At UC Berkeley's only skateboarding organization, we provide a space and community for skateboarders of any level to progress in themselves as an athlete and as a student.

Name: Ski and Snowboard Team at Berkeley
Description: The Ski and Snowboard Team at Berkeley is a group of skiers and snowboarders from the University of California, Berkeley. We compete in the NorCal conference of USCSA (United States Collegiate Ski and Snowboard Association) against Stanford, UC Davis, University of Nevada, and Sierra Nevada College among others. We have both men's and women's teams in Alpine ski and snowboard racing, ski and snowboard Freestyle, and Skier-X and Boarder-X. We have sent individual competitors and teams to USCSA Nationals competitions around the country. We do not require potential members to try out or have prior competitive experience--instead, potential members should be skiers or snowboarders who are passionate about their sport and enjoy spending time in the mountains. We hire expert ski and snowboard coaches every season and everyone improves tremendously. Competition and training is a large part of what we do, but there is plenty of time for freeskiing and earning gnar points. We get season passes every year; for 2025-26 we will be getting a discounted Ikon pass in order to ski primarily at Palisades Tahoe/Alpine Meadows. Many members travel to Tahoe each weekend during the ski season, so getting up to the mountains is very accessible. In the Fall we prepare for the season with optional dryland workouts and social events to get to know everybody on the team and stay in shape during the off-season. During the last two weeks of winter break, we will all live in Tahoe and ski early every day and have the times of our lives. Cal Ski Team #1. Keeping Tahoe Blue and Gold.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: We are a group of skiers and snowboarders who are passionate about our sport. The team competes in both race and freestyle events in the USCSA for men's and women's skiing and snowboarding. We also work to improve our free-skiing and riding.

Name: SKY Campus Happiness Club at Berkeley
Description: SKY at Berkeley aims to build a community of empowered college students and promote wellness in the face of stress and uncertainty. Through evidence-based meditation, creative expression, and social connection, we support students as they explore their relationships with mindfulness, happiness, and themselves. SKY does not force a belief system; our goal is to promote the formation of open and non-judgemental spaces where wellness is explored together. SKY at Berkeley offers the SKY Happiness Retreat, a comprehensive well-being and resilience program designed to help students, faculty, and staff achieve their fullest potential. The cornerstone practices of our programs include the SKY Breath Meditation, whose effects have been studied in open and randomized controlled trials, both in healthy populations and in those with psychopathology. SKY at Berkeley also offers the Step Out of Overdrive DeCal, which features the SKY Happiness Retreat, through the UC Berkeley Psychology Department. We host game nights, art therapy sessions, meditation events, yoga gatherings, and organize service initiatives to improve ourselves and our community. Email us at club@skyhappiness.berkeley.edu for more info and check out our instagram @skyberkeley! Come join us on our mission to put a smile on every person‚Äôs face :)
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: SKY at Berkeley uses evidence-based breathwork and service-oriented leadership to decrease student stress and increase happiness. By improving the clarity of the mind, we support students as they aim to conduct themselves with greater purpose.

Name: Smart Ass, The üíô
Description: The Smart Ass is a campus forum for progressive issues and public policy concerns with a mixture of news, humor, features, commentary, satire, and analysis.
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Come join the Smart Ass team this semester and become part of one of the best-named publications on campus! We work with the Cal Berkeley Democrats to publish progressive pieces on current events in politics.

Name: Social Welfare Association for the Greater Good
Description: 1) To exemplify social work values such as service, social justice, integrity, and the importance of human relationships through volunteerism and advocacy throughout the community. 2) To enhance the experience of social welfare undergraduates by connecting students, the campus, and the larger community. 3) To become a liaison between UC Berkeley students and the social welfare community through sponsoring charity fundraising, guest speakers, advocacy, and lobbying events, as well as promoting and educating others about the profession of social welfare.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Social Welfare Association for the Greater Good seeks to exemplify social work values such as service, social justice, integrity, and the importance of human relationships through volunteerism and advocacy throughout the community.

Name: Society of Engineering Sciences üíô
Description: This is the primary social and professional group for students in the Engineering Science department (our "home base"). Check out our Linktree or shoot us an email at sesofficers@berkeley.edu to find out more!
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We encourage a sense of community among students in the Engineering Science discipline, advise and provide academic support to students in Engineering without a declared major, and serve as a representative of Engineering Science to the community.

Name: Society of Engineers, Scientists, and Entrepreneurs
Description: The Society of Engineers, Scientists, and Entrepreneurs (SESE) hosts career fairs and research seminars to empower student engineers, scientists, and entrepreneurs by fostering meaningful connections with industry leaders and academic pioneers. SESE facilitates dialogue between Berkeley‚Äôs top engineering talent and influential figures, including Nobel laureates, bridging academia and industry. By consistently delivering exceptional talent to both sectors, SESE plays a vital role in providing resources, career opportunities, and academic pathways, fulfilling its mission to advance the future of engineering and innovation.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Society of Engineers, Scientists, and Entrepreneurs (SESE) hosts career fairs and research seminars to empower student engineers, scientists, and entrepreneurs by fostering meaningful connections with industry leaders and academic pioneers.

Name: Society of Linguistics Undergraduate Students
Description: The Society of Linguistics Undergraduate Students (SLUgS) is a club that organizes social activities, guest speakers, field method simulations, living catalogs and much more for all undergraduates interested in linguistics.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Society of Linguistic Undergraduate Students (SLUgS) is a club affiliated with the department of linguistics that facilitates interaction between students interested in topics within linguistics and aims to promote linguistics on campus.

Name: Society of Physics Students at Berkeley üíô
Description: We encourage and assist students interested in physics to develop the knowledge, competence, enthusiasm, and social responsibility that are essential to the advancement of physics; stimulate interest in advanced study and research in physics; develop collegiality among physics students and faculty members; promote public interest in physics; and provide liaison between students and the member societies of the American Institute of Physics.Anyone and everyone is welcome!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Society of Physics Students is an organization dedicated to physics-related ideas and cutting-edge research.

Name: Society of Women Engineers üíô
Description: Society of Women Engineers is an international nonprofit organization. Our objective is to encourage and empower non-male students to reach their full potential as scientists and engineers. SWE strives to highlight the achievements and contributions of non-male individuals as technical and community leaders in STEM. Supporting both students and professionals, SWE consists of over 17,000 members in 90 sections and 300 student sections. The UC Berkeley collegiate section has been established for over 30 years and strives to support the next generation of non-male scientists and engineers by: providing professional development resources and networking opportunities to help students navigate the start of their careers; hosting socials to connect engineers with others in their area of study; organizing STEM advocacy and inclusion workshops, to encourage both women engineers and allies to fight for an equitable workplace; and leading outreach programs for local K-12 students ‚Äî geared especially towards young women and underrepresented students ‚Äî to help them learn more about STEM. For any additional questions on our chapter or how to get involved, please email execs@swe.studentorg.berkeley.edu or visit our website swe.berkeley.edu. You can also find more information about SWE by visiting their website swe.org.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are a multi-faceted organization, holding academic, professional, service, and social events. Everyone is welcome to attend: the only requirement is that you support women and non-binary individuals in engineering!

Name: Society of Women in Physical Sciences üíô
Description: SWPS is a student group run by female and nonbinary students in Physics, Astronomy, Earth and Planetary Sciences and Chemistry at Cal. Our goals are to support marginalized communities studying the physical sciences and to create a friendly and supportive environment in these departments for all students. Our events include monthly general meetings, biweekly homework parties, speaker teas, trips, various outreach events, etc. https://www.swpsberkeley.com/
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: SWPS is a student group run by female and nonbinary students in physical sciences. Our goals are to support marginalized communities studying the physical sciences and to create a friendly and supportive environment in these departments for all students

Name: SOON Movement Global üíô
Description: Our purpose is to win, build, and send. We WIN students for Christ through sharing the Gospel on campus. We then BUILD them to disciple others through small group discipleship meetings with trained SOONjangs (disciplers). Finally, we SEND them to the nations on summer missions to fulfill the Great Commission stated in Matthew 28:19 ("Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit"). This organization encourages 2nd and 3rd generation Asian American college students to be a part of the Christian movement, teaching them to be disciple-makers of Christ amongst their friends, families, communities, churches, to the ends of the earth.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: WIN students by sharing the gospel on campus. BUILD them by helping them in their relationship with God through group and 1 on 1 discipleship meetings. SEND students to the next place where God will grow them and win, build, and send others.

Name: South Asian Business Association üíô
Description: The South Asian Business Association (SABA) at Berkeley Haas is a vibrant community that brings together students and partners with an interest in South Asia‚Äôs rich cultures, diverse histories, and dynamic economies. Our mission is to foster meaningful connections within the Haas MBA community through social gatherings, cultural celebrations, and professional development opportunities. Spanning the entire South Asian region‚Äîfrom India to Kazakhstan, Sri Lanka to Nepal, and everywhere in between and beyond‚Äîwe aim to bridge borders and celebrate what unites us. SABA is open to all Haas MBA students and partners, whether you have roots in the region, professional interests, or simply a curiosity to learn. Through our events and initiatives, we create a welcoming space where the Haas community can share stories, exchange ideas, and build lifelong friendships‚Äîwhile showcasing the vibrancy of South Asia to the world.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Haas MBA RSO, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our mission is to foster strong relationships amongst individuals in the Haas MBA community interested in South Asia, through social, cultural and professional events. We strive to unite the entire South Asian region.

Name: South Asian Law Students Association
Description: Berkeley‚Äôs South Asian American Law Student Association (SALSA) is a social, academic, professional, community service, and political law student organization. SALSA is dedicated to serving and empowering the South Asian community at Berkeley Law and the Bay Area community at large. SALSA serves to create a safe space for South Asian students to explore their identities, build community, honor their cultural histories, and work for justice for South Asian community and aligned communities. SALSA works closely with other affinity groups and student organizations to coordinate social, educational, and community service events.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The Berkeley Law South Asian Law Students Association (SALSA) is dedicated to representing the interests of all law students of South Asian descent. We aim to provide our members with both social and professional development events and opportunities.

Name: South Indian Society
Description: The purpose of our organization is to provide a venue for the celebration of South Indian culture at Berkeley. We hope to support such a major facet of Indian culture in addition to the current assortment of South Asian organizations on campus. Therefore, we hope that the establishment of this organization will help bridge this gap, through cultural events and awareness.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: UCB South Indian Society aims to increase awareness about South Indian culture on campus. We serve as a venue for the celebration of South Indian culture at Berkeley.

Name: Southeast Asia Graduate Working Group at Berkeley
Description: Created to facilitate a space for academic and personal growth for graduate scholars working on topics relating to Southeast Asia, the SEA Grad Working Group @ Berkeley was established in 2023. Open to graduate students working on Southeast Asia, whether as their main focus or as part of their research, this working group organises events and sessions designed to promote academic collaboration, personal growth and career development. So whether in Anthropology or Zoology or whether your focus is Angkorian Art or Zamboangue√±a dance - you are welcome! For the purposes of this group Southeast Asia is defined as: Brunei, Cambodia, East Timor, Indonesia, Laos, Malaysia, Myanmar/Burma, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam. However it is not limited to modern national borders and encourages involvement and participation from scholars working on areas such as Northeast India, Southern China etc that may share historical and ethnic links. This working group is open to ANY graduate student from ANY department with an interest and welcomes international and domestic scholars.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: This group exists to promote cooperation and networking between graduate students from all national and departmental backgrounds working on topics related to Southeast Asia across disciplines.

Name: Southeast Asian Mentorship
Description: Our mission statement is "to empower high school youth and mentors by utilizing academic advising and mentorship as a way of addressing political and socio-economic issues facing the Southeast Asian community; to build a two-way exchange of knowledge and resources, instilling within both mentees and mentors the power to create social change.‚Äù Southeast Asian Mentorship academically and politically works to motivate and empower high school youth from all over the United States. We provide virtual mentorship to both college and non-college-bound mentees.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: SEAM is a mentorship program that aims to serve Southeast Asian (SEA) high school students across California/ U.S. Our goal is to foster a culturally informed community by providing the next generation with college student mentors and opportunity

Name: Southeast Asian Prison Outreach Project üíô
Description: Inspired by the African American Studies Department‚Äôs Prison Pen Pal Program, a SASC member, by the name of Amy Tran, developed a similar project for the Southeast Asian community in prisons during the spring of 2009. The following semester, Larry Bach, Kristine Nguyen and Irene Van formed the first committee with Amy to execute the goals and vision of this project. From three initial contacts, the project today now connects Berkeley students and community members with over 35 incarcerated men and women.
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Through the power of communication, the Southeast Asian Prison Outreach Project seeks to bridge the gap between overlooked Southeast Asain communities in prison and in free society.

Name: Southeast Asian Student Coalition
Description: SASC Mission Statement: "SASC‚Äôs founding in 2000 was initially focused on the refugee experience, which aimed to unite individuals bounded by the historical context of the American Wars in Southeast Asia. We hope to continue to preserve this space of growth and inclusivity. Together, our goal is to foster a space to explore Southeast Asian American identity and culture. As a coalition, we unite and empower our communities by addressing the social injustices, economic inequalities and political under-representation that our communities may face.‚Äù SASC Hxstory: In 2000, Professor Khatharya Um hosted a Southeast Asian Conference at UC Berkeley to commemorate the 25th year of the Southeast Asian diaspora after the war in Southeast Asia (more familiarly known as the Viet Nam War). She asked a few Southeast Asian UC Berkeley students in her class and some she knew to help get involved with the conference. Their role was to head up the youth portion of the conference. Using data information collected the conference Professor Um along with the UC Berkeley students developed the booklet that SASC has called A Dream Denied about Southeast Asians and their struggle to gain access to higher education. After the conference, the youth summit organizers, consisting of members from the Laotian, Hmong, Cambodian, and Vietnamese student groups felt connected and saw a need for a space/coalition to address issues across the community. They recognized that there were distinct groups that already existed to promote cultural awareness and knew that that was not one of their primary goals. They were also aware that they wanted the group to be more than just a student organization, but a coalition between the Cambodian, Vietnamese, and Laotian students coming together on common issues to strengthen the community as a whole, hence the name Southeast Asian Student Coalition. The name was created by the students as they sat at Sproul Fountain. Their goals at the time included greater promotion of higher education, community building between the different groups, outreaching to the larger community.At the time they believed that there was a niche that needed to be filled ‚Äì an organization that would work with the different cultural groups as well as the recruitment and retention center to address the SEA community in particular. Their goal was to both build coalition as well as empowerment, and to step beyond the needs at Berkeley to incorporate the communities we came from. They went around the East Bay community asking and understanding what it is exactly that they can do. After all of that, in 2002 SASC Summer Institute was born. They wanted something where they can effectively outreach, teach, and learn to/from young people.Since then SASC has grown into a larger community and has expanded its reaches into the community. SASC‚Äôs current programs include SEA Grad, SEAMentorship, and SEA Prison Outreach Project.In 2005, a group of SASC folks had multiple meetings about the rebuilding of SASC, due to issues of sustainability and finding leaders in the community. From these meetings SASCommunity, a non-hierarchical committee, was created. SASComm strives to create a community of committees hoping to explore SASC‚Äôs mission statement in different and multiple dimensions. The Round-Table structure for SASCommunity is set up to create a cohesive unit and non-hierarchical organizing system.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Together, our goal is to foster a space to explore Southeast Asian American identity and culture. As a coalition, we unite and empower our communities by addressing social injustices, economic inequalities and political under-representation.

Name: SPACE at Berkeley
Description: Student Project for Artemis Challenges in Engineering SPACE at Berkeley is a student-run organization focused on competing in NASA Artemis Student Challenges, where undergraduate and graduate students will build foundational knowledge on topics and technologies critical to the success of the Artemis missions. This involves many areas that NASA is still exploring, such as new uses with user interfaces, lunar/regolith robotics, EVA tools, man-powered rovers and more each year. The Artemis program is how NASA intends to reestablish human presence on the moon and beyond since Apollo. Our teams work hard throughout the year to develop innovative solutions to complex problems. At the end of the school year, we travel to NASA facilities to participate/compete in test week alongside/against other university teams. Our mission is to inspire and educate the next generation of space explorers alongside the ongoing Artemis Program.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We are a student-run organization that annually competes in the NASA Artemis Student Challenges where students gain skills as they go through the engineering design process and build various engineering prototypes related to future space exploration.

Name: Space Enterprise at Berkeley üíô
Description: Co-founded in October 2016, Space Enterprise at Berkeley (SEB) is a student run liquid-fuel rocket team dedicated to achieving spaceflight and developing rocket technologies at University of California, Berkeley. SEB is one of the most ambitious college rocket teams in the world, with the goal of achieving spaceflight with a liquid-fueled rocket. Working toward this dream, SEB has launched UC Berkeley's first two liquid fuelled rockets, Eureka 1 and 2, setting records for Berkeley's highest liquid-fulled rocket launches. We've also launched 10 test-bed rockets and gained a wide array of technical knowledge and skill in rocket subsystems such as composite airframe manufacturing, in-flight data acquisition, and propulsion. Along the way, we've successfully demonstrated thrust vector control, and throttling capabilities too! Aside from the rocket projects, SEB takes pride in our inclusive, diverse, and friendly team culture. SEB is one of the few student organizations on campus that maintains open admission policies for interested students. This involves not screening students by resumes, majors, or specific engineering-related experiences. SEB firmly believes that these elements are not as important to becoming a contributing member of the team as pure commitment and willingness to learn new skills and have fun! The team‚Äôs pattern of also mentoring newcomers and turning them into team veterans helps to keep the organization constantly growing as a rocket team and close friends! Find out more on our website, berkeleyse.org, or contact us at spaceenterpriseatberkeley@gmail.com with questions or comments!
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Co-founded in October 2016, Space Enterprise at Berkeley (SEB) is a student-run liquid-fuel rocket team dedicated to achieving spaceflight and developing rocket technologies at University of California, Berkeley.

Name: Space Technologies and Rocketry üíô
Description: The goal of Space Technologies and Rocketry is to create new and innovative technologies for use in high-power rocketry and other space-related vehicles, and enter associated competitions. Among our many projects, we research propulsion, develop avionics and software, and, of course, design, build, test, and fly high-power rockets out of spaceports in the Central Valley and the Mojave Desert. Another primary function of our club is hosting outreach events in the Berkeley community in order to engage children and adults in the fields of science, engineering, mathematics, and aeronautics. During the 2025-2026 school year, we are developing our third liquid engine (LE3), which is planned to fly in our second liquid engine vehicle in Spring 2025. This vehicle will later compete in Spring 2026 The ultimate goal of STAR is to use competition rocket as a vehicle to educate members on rocketry and hone their engineering skills.Check out our website at https://stars.berkeley.edu/ and join our Discord at https://discord.gg/CJEcftUA3c
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are a competitive high-power rocketry team. We engineer payloads, avionics, control systems, and rocket engines. Additionally, we host local STEM outreach events and work with local companies to create a stronger aerospace community on campus.

Name: Space Technologies at California
Description: Space Technologies at Cal (STAC) is a student-run engineering organization at the University of California, Berkeley with 100+ highly motivated undergraduate and graduate students focused on developing innovative space technologies and research. We are creating a collaborative student space platform, incorporating multiple research labs and industry partners, to enable research projects such as microgravity experiments, a CubeSat qualifying and testing a quantum gyroscope, an Autonomous Lunar Rover project, space bioengineering for astronaut health, and a jumping robot for exploring lunar landscapes. As student researchers, scientists, and engineers, we aim to push the frontier of space innovation with each of our projects and provide valuable experience for our members. With QubeSat launching to the ISS next year and TIME II launching with Blue Origin, STAC is eager to send UC Berkeley to space and beyond! In addition to innovating and working on cool projects, STAC is committed to energizing the UC Berkeley aerospace community. In 2022, we hosted the third Space Tech Symposium @ Berkeley, with over 200 attendees from all corners of the Bay Area space community. Our events' past speakers have included CEOs and Co-founders of companies like Planet, Astra, Google's Project Loon, Astranis, NASA and UC Berkeley researchers, and investors from venture capital firms. We're committed to continuing our annual tradition of bringing together the best and brightest in space.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage
Summary: We are advancing the frontier of student space exploration at UC Berkeley through team-based projects focused on satellite fabrication, lunar rover and robot prototyping, and microgravity and bioengineering experimentation for space applications.

Name: Speaker Series: India at Berkeley
Description: Speaker Series: India at Berkeley (@speakerseries_cal) is UC Berkeley's only Indian-centric speaker series student organization. We aim to present our international audience with India's rich cultural fabric by featuring a diverse array of distinguished guests from various sectors of Indian society, including politics, business, sports, and entertainment. Past speakers include luminaries such as poet Javed Akhtar, Bollywood actor Boman Irani, singer Javed Ali, and politicians Smriti Irani and Shashi Tharoor. Through conversations with these esteemed speakers, we aim to foster a deeper understanding and appreciation of India's dynamic cultural and societal contributions on the global stage.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our speaker series features a diverse array of distinguished guests from various sectors of Indian society including politics, business, sports, & entertainment. Through conversations with esteemed speakers, we aim to foster intellectual conversation.

Name: Spectrum: Autism at Cal
Description: Our mission is to foster and promote an inclusive campus community, and a safe space for autistic students. We raise awareness and acceptance throughout the Berkeley community, offer a variety of volunteer opportunities, and hold fundraising events and general meetings. We also aim to educate students about neurodiversity and debunk misconceptions, in part by spotlighting autistic advocates.
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We aim to raise acceptance of and awareness about ASD, provide local volunteering opportunities, fundraise, and create an inclusive environment and a safe space for all. Our org is dedicated to autistic and neurodivergent students and non-autistic allies

Name: Speech at Berkeley üíô
Description: Speech at Berkeley, formerly a part of Speech and Debate at Berkeley, now utilizes only the "speech" aspect of "speech and debate." We are a student-run, peer-coached team of speech enthusisasts committed to bettering ourselves through competition in collegiate speech events. We offer members the opportunity to perform all 11 AFA-sponsored events competitively at local and national tournaments. We meet weekly to construct and practice our speeches (including those with limited preparation) and attend multiple tournaments throughout the academic year, including the prestigious American Forensics Association's National Individual Events Tournament. There are no auditions to be on our team--all that is required to join is enthusiasm to learn the practical skills that come with learning how to perform in a speech event. We are an awesome, strong, competitive team, consistently taking home individual and team sweepstakes awards at tournaments. As we do have limited resources and this activity is a big time commitment, we ask that our members show their own dedication, diligence, and discipline. If you have what it takes, you will find this activity incredibly rewarding. As one Speech at Berkeley member said, "Getting good at speech is basically cheating for school, in that it prepares you to think really critically, really well, really fast." Students can join the discord at https://discord.gg/Q9DEWHRfuB for more information.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We compete in the 11 AFA-sponsored speech events at speech competitions hosted by colleges on the local and national level. Our competitive team seeks to push the envelope of research, performance, and rhetorical skill.

Name: SPICMACAY at Berkeley üíô
Description: Purpose: Society for Promotion of Indian Classical Music And Culture Amongst Youth (SPICMACAY) at Berkeley is dedicated to preserving and cultivating an appreciation for the rich and varied cultural heritage of South Asia. Through the mediums of classical music, folk and traditional dance, craftsmanship, yoga, meditation, cinema, theater, and enlightening discussions, we strive to spark and nurture a profound cultural awakening among today's youth. We achieve this through direct engagement with esteemed artistic pioneers.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Purpose: Society for Promotion of Indian Classical Music And Culture Amongst Youth (SPICMACAY) at Berkeley seeks to conserve and promote an awareness of the rich and diverse cultural tapestry of South Asia.

Name: Splash at Berkeley üíô
Description: A Splash program is an educational event that brings local high school students to UC Berkeley for one day of for-student-by-student learning. Students take classes of their choice from a wide selection of both conventional and unconventional subjects taught by Berkeley undergraduate and graduate students. If you would like to get involved, please visit our webpage for more information https://berkeley.learningu.org/teach/splash.html. If you make a teacher account on our webpage, you will be informed about all Splash related events.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Splash at Berkeley hosts educational events that bring local high school students to UC Berkeley for one day of for-student-by-student learning, with short classes in conventional and unconventional subjects taught by Berkeley students.

Name: Splatoon at Berkeley üíô
Description: Splatoon at Berkeley offers players of all skill levels the opportunity to meet other students who share a passion for Splatoon! We provide opportunities for all players to compete in collegiate tournaments and leagues. Our goal is to establish Splatoon as an official esport at Berkeley.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We aim to gather and assemble a Splatoon community within the UC Berkeley community. We want to welcome all people interested in Splatoon and provide a learning environment for all members, including beginners and veterans.

Name: Spoon University at Berkeley
Description: Spoon University at Berkeley is a college-flavored online publication centered on food content of all article types‚Äîfrom restaurant reviews to kitchen tips and recipes. We strive to be the resource that Cal students with any amount of experience in the kitchen turn to when they crave food-related guidance or inspiration.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Publication Groups, Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Spoon University at Berkeley is an on-campus online publication that creates weekly food articles and host several food-related events throughout the semester. Our publication will give students a way to share, learn, and teach each other about food.

Name: Sports Analytics Group at Berkeley
Description: Analytics and data science are taking over every part of the billion-dollar sports world. Major sports teams, agencies, and media outlets alike have begun revolutionizing their decision-making strategies across all parts of the industry - not just in how the game is played and how teams are built, but also now touching on everything from biomechanics to brand health. The Sports Analytics Group at Berkeley aims to give members learning and practical experience doing sports analytics work wherever it interests them within our three divisions: Projects, Business, and Data Journalism. The Projects division works on sports strategy consulting projects for professional and collegiate sports organizations, teams, and agencies. Whether its predicting free agent contracts or visualizing baseball player swings, SAGB Projects continues to explore ways to revolutionize sports through data. The Business division works with the business departments of professional sports organizations from around the country - helping teams with a variety of operational tasks such as ticketing, marketing, and overall brand development. Working with teams such as the Red Sox and Clippers, SAGB Business has grown extensively over the past few years in size and scope, and has continuously given members the opportunity to grow and experience what it is really like in the business side of professional sports. The Data Journalism division discusses trending topics in the sports world using evidence backed by analytics and statistics. Visit our website sportsanalytics.berkeley.edu to see some of the articles and podcasts that our members have published. Stay tuned to our Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and website (sportsanalytics.berkeley.edu) for any news and updates regarding our application, upcoming infosessions, and other events we'll be hosting throughout the semester. If you have any other questions, feel free to reach out to us at sagberkeley@gmail.com.Upcoming Infosessions: - Infosession #1: 8PM-9PM Tuesday, September 2nd 2025, Wheeler 222 - Infosession #2: 8PM-9PM Wednesday, September 3rd 2025, Wheeler 222 - Women's/URM Night: 8PM-9PM Thursday, September 4th 2025, Wheeler 222 - Meet and Greet!: 6PM-7PM Friday, September 5th 2025, TBD
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Sports Analytics Group at Berkeley educates and prepares members for careers in the field of sports analytics and to pursue sports-related research through participation in one of three divisions: Projects, Data Journalism, and Business.

Name: Spring Foundation
Description: Spring Foundation is a nonprofit student-run organization founded in the University of California, Berkeley in 2011. We strive to improve the living standards and education accessibilities of underprivileged children in rural China. Each year, we organize fundraisers to fulfill our financial commitment and raise awareness through podcasts, forums and other events. Every summer, our members bring project-based learning to children in rural China through our annual summer camp. In the future, we hope to leverage Spring Foundation‚Äôs experience to help other college charity organizations with similar missions and develop strong cooperation through long-term sponsorships, partnerships with organizations and businesses in the Bay Area and within China.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Spring Foundation is a student-run nonprofit organization at UC Berkeley dedicated to raising awareness and fund for education and healthcare of underprivileged children in rural China.

Name: Squash at Berkeley
Description: See https://recsports.berkeley.edu/programs-events/sport-clubs/mens-squash/
Summary: Cal Squash is dedicated to fostering mental and physical strength, good health, and a sense of community. Ending last season as the top club team in the nation, the organization has no intention of slowing down.

Name: Sri Lankans at Berkeley
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Sri Lankans at Berkeley provide a space for Sri Lankans to find their community and to share Sri Lanka‚Äôs vibrant culture. Welcome to all!

Name: Standup Comedy (at Berkeley) üíô
Description: To provide UC Berkeley students with an accessible outlet to explore stand-up comedy through collaboration, mentorship, and performance opportunities.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: To provide UC Berkeley students with an accessible outlet to explore stand-up comedy through collaboration, mentorship, and performance opportunities.

Name: Statistics Graduate Students Association
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Our purpose is to safeguard the interests of graduate students in statistics and biostatistics, to serve as the formal link between students and faculty, and to organize social events for students or for students and faculty.

Name: Statistics Undergraduate Student Association
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: To offer a statistics student association that strives to improve the quality of studying statistics as an undergraduate by providing open and accessible events, resources, and services to each and every member of the campus community.

Name: Steel Bridge Competition Team üíô
Description: The Steel Bridge team is a UC Berkeley competition team that will be competing in the National Student Steel Bridge Competition sponsored by the American Institute of Steel Construction (AISC). We design, fabricate, and compete with a bridge that is generally around 20 feet long. As we design our bridge in the fall semester, we teach new members how to use industry-standard software such as AutoCAD, SAP2000, and SolidWorks. We also train students how to use all the machinery in the Davis welding shop and give them opportunities to get trained in the Cory machine shop, where students can learn to use the mills, lathes, and CNC machines. In the spring, we fabricate the bridge and compete in our regional and national competitions. Fall 2025 meeting time and location are TBD. Please view our website at steelbridge.studentorg.berkeley.edu or email us at steelbridge.berkeley@gmail.com for more information! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4sGy8FKufJ0 **Form at the end of the video is outdated
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Steel Bridge team at UC Berkeley competes every year in the AISC sponsored steel bridge competition. Our team challenges students to apply the theoretical knowledge they have obtained in their courses to a practical project.

Name: Stiles Hall üíô
Description: We offer a variety of volunteer programs open to Cal students. These include mentoring and tutoring programs at local Berkeley elementary and middle schools. Other programs include Experience Berkeley High School and Transfer which help current high school seniors and community college students with the UC application process. Interested in volunteering? Program descriptions and volunteer applications are available on our website: www.stileshall.org
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Founded in 1884, Stiles Hall is a private, non-profit agency dedicated to serving the broader community while enriching the lives of students at the University of California, Berkeley.

Name: Student American Academy of Optometry
Description: The UC Berkeley Optometry Chapter of SAAO reflects the values, goals, and interests of the American Academy of Optometry (AAO) at the student level by encouraging optometrists in training to maintain and enhance excellence in optometric practice. We promote the art and science of vision care while encouraging personal growth, education and active participation within the optometric community.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The UC Berkeley Optometry Chapter of SAAO reflects the values, goals, and interests of the American Academy of Optometry (AAO) at the student level by encouraging optometrists in training to maintain and enhance excellence in optometric practice.

Name: Student Association at Berkeley Law
Description: The purpose of the Association is to represent the collective interests of its members before the faculty and administration of Berkeley Law, the University of California, and the public at large.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The purpose of the Association is to represent the collective interests of its members before the faculty and administration of Berkeley Law, the University of California, and the public at large.

Name: Student Association for Environmental Justice and Health Equity üíô
Description: We blend cutting-edge research, policy analysis, and hands-on activism to tackle the pressing environmental issues of our time and their impacts on community health. Through producing digital archives that promote environmental research, engaging with local politics, prioritizing community outreach, and assisting with environmental clean-up efforts, we are here to make a difference in our local and global communities. Plus, we team up with various environmental organizations to engage in conservation research and education events, giving you the chance to network and gain real-world experience in the intersection of environmental research, policy, and activism! A few plans for 2024-2025 include... Community science projects with NOAA Workshops on how to engage with local and global environmental politics Digital archives that highlight student research and also keep people informed on current environmental issues Collaborations with UC Berkeley environmental clubs and organizations Environmental Hackathon Collaborations with the UC Disaster Resilience Network (e.g. Disaster Resilience Day, Speaker series, etc) Present community research at local conferences Maintain a foundation of community within SAEJHE through various club activities/trips ...and much more! Anyone and everyone is welcome to be a member of SAEJHE‚Äìwe have no application requirements beyond filling out our interest form linked below! We also have available leadership opportunities starting fall 2024. We'll be posting up-to-date information on our instagram (@saejhe.berkeley)‚Äìkeep an eye out for our first info sessions!
Categories: Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: SA-EJHE aims to empower students to connect environmental justice and health equity by investigating the science behind environmental determinants of health and advocating in fair and just practice.

Name: Student Association for Fire Ecology at Berkeley
Description: We are the only student group whose sole focus is wildland fire.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: To inspire future scientists, managers, and citizens to promote fire research, responsible management, and education by building a fire community through research, training, and outreach.

Name: Student Food Collective
Description: We're dedicated to providing fresh, local, healthy, environmentally sustainable, and ethically produced food at affordable prices to the Berkeley campus and greater community. We seek to educate students about nutrition and food systems, empower new leaders, and train youth to work in and manage a sustainable business. Through inclusive, democratic decision-making, we operate a cooperative grocery market that promotes community-building and environmental stewardship.
Categories: Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Berkeley Student Food Collective works to provide healthy, sustainable, and affordable food for the East Bay community. A volunteer-run grocery collective, the BSFC is a local hub for both leadership development and food-related education.

Name: Student Nutrition Advocacy Club
Description: The Student Nutrition Advocacy Club (SNAC) is a student-run organization that works to promote nutritional awareness on the UC Berkeley campus and around the Bay Area. SNAC is a resource for students interested in ANY sector of the nutrition field -- personal interest or career! We provide opportunities on student nutrition projects, networking events, academic assistance, and (remote) volunteer and job opportunities. In the past, we've partnered with Kids in Nutrition, The LifeLong Health Center, Cal Dining, Registered Dietitians, and more. We hope to continue our cooking socials at the Cal Teaching Kitchen in the future. SNAC Committees: Dietetics Outreach Marketing Why Join SNAC?‚Ä¢ Connect with Registered Dietitians, professionals, and peers in the nutrition field‚Ä¢ Collaborate on student nutrition projects ‚Ä¢ Gain skills in dietetics, teamwork, leadership, outreach, and/or marketing ‚Ä¢ Create a warm and welcoming community at UC Berkeley Questions? Want to join our email list?Contact ucbsnac@gmail.com Find us:Instagram: @ucbsnacLinkedIn: UCB Student Nutrition Advocacy Club
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Student Nutrition Advocacy Club (SNAC) is a student-run organization working to promote nutritional awareness around/on the UCB campus. SNAC is a resource for students interested in ANY sector of the nutrition field -- personal interest or career!

Name: Student Organic Gardening Association üíô
Description: Student Farms of Berkeley is an agro-ecological association based on land on and around the UC Berkeley Campus. Student Farms of Berkeley is a transparent and non-discriminatory organization that prioritizes coalition building, systematic inclusion, and equitable distribution of fruit and land through collective action and resistance. Our goal is to prioritize BI-POC/LGBTQ leadership and build alliances between marginalized community members inside and outside of the Cal community. For more information on the organization and our gardens, check out our Instagram @BerkeleyStudentFarms.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Student Farms Berkeley coalition is a transparent and democratic student-led and community-based organization that prioritizes movement building, meaningful inclusion, and equitable distribution of food, land, and knowledge through collective action.

Name: Student Parent Food Donations Program
Description: The Student Parent Food Donations Program focuses on mitigating food insecurity faced by the student parent community (including students with dependents) at UC Berkeley. We understand that student parents operate at heightened stress levels due to a complex mix of academic, financial, and family responsibilities. With the primary goal of alleviating some of these stresses, and the secondary but equally important goal of supporting efforts to reduce food wastage, this program was established in 2014 to rescue over 2,000 lbs of food donated by local community grocery stores and distribute them to the student population at UC Village every week.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Student Parent Food Donations Program aims to provide UC Berkeley student parents and their families with fresh and healthy food in a way that promotes community building, social justice and alleviates pressures of food insecurity among these families.

Name: Student Policy Institute at Berkeley
Description: The Student Policy Institute at Berkeley is an interdisciplinary, student-led policy think tank that brings students from diverse backgrounds to get involved in the policy discussions that affect our everyday lives. We are open to all students at UC Berkeley and are most interested in helping students of any experience level grow their skills and experience in public policy. Please feel free to visit us or email us to join or connect!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Student Policy Institute at Berkeley is an interdisciplinary, student-led policy think tank that seeks to help students and RSOs develop skills and projects in policy writing, research, and advocacy.

Name: Student to Student Peer Counseling
Description: Student-to-Student Peer Counseling (SSPC) is a group of undergraduate students that offers free, confidential, one-on-one mental health counseling for other undergraduate students. SSPC also provides workshops and participates in on campus events to promote mental health and wellness such as Stress Free Week and Suicide Awareness Week. To become a Peer Counselor with SSPC, you must attend one of our two information sessions that take place at the beginning of each semester. Visit our website at sspc.berkeley.edu for more information or send us an email at sspcemail@gmail.com and we will get back to you ASAP.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage
Summary: Student-to-Student Peer Counseling offers free and confidential counseling and referrals for UC Berkeley students on a drop-in or appointment basis. For more information, visit our website at sspc.berkeley.edu.

Name: Students for Comprehensive Healthcare (formerly Coalition of Concerned Medical Professionals at Berkeley) üíô
Description: Students for Comprehensive Healthcare (formerly known as CCMP at Berkeley) empowers students to use their skills and knowledge to help disadvantaged community members overcome systemic barriers to comprehensive healthcare. Through our club meetings and training, we will prepare our members to serve as health advocates at an organization in Oakland called Coalition of Concerned Medical Professionals (CCMP) and make a difference in our community. This group Students for Comprehensive Healthcare was formerly named Coalition of Concerned Medical Professionals (CCMP) - [3/6/24] [LL]
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: SCH aims to help provide people with access to comprehensive medical care. Through club meetings and trainings, we will prepare our members to volunteer at organizations such as CCMP, Gift of Life, and AiArthritis.

Name: Students for Justice in Palestine
Description: We are a group of students, faculty, and community members working together at the University of California, Berkeley, in solidarity with the struggle of the indigenous Palestinian people against settler-colonialism, genocide and occupation. In addition to organizing protests, memorials, and other events focused on Palestine, we collectively organize frequent educational events that highlight the criminal conditions Palestinians are subjected to under colonialism. Our work is guided by the resistance and resilience of the Palestinian people, who continue to resist against the settler-colonial regime hellbent on their elimination.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: We are a diverse group of students, faculty, staff, and community members at UC Berkeley, organized to promote the complete liberation of the Palestinian people.

Name: Students for Life at Berkeley üíô
Description: Students for Life at Berkeley: Mission Statement As UC Berkeley‚Äôs pro-life student group, Students for Life (BSL) recognizes the inherent and inviolable dignity of human life, from that of the unborn to that of the aged and terminally ill. We are dedicated to working within our campus and local community to put an end to abortion, embryonic stem cell research, and euthanasia. Since BSL is based at a prestigious educational institution, we see the need to educate our community about the truths surrounding offenses against human life. To that end, we facilitate and engage in intellectual discussion on relevant issues, challenging widely held relativist assumptions on the dignity of human life, the role of individual autonomy, and society's role in protecting human life. We seek to engage both the minds and hearts of UC Berkeley's student population as well as those of our surrounding communities in addressing these issues. We desire to change the prevailing mindset in today's society so that it might be more receptive to a culture of life that fully recognizes the dignity of every human being. Furthermore, we aim to form leaders that will encourage the development of a more just society grounded in the recognition of the inherent and transcendent value of human life. We seek to enter our respective professions armed with the knowledge and tools needed to uphold the dignity of life in every facet of society. Also at the heart of BSL‚Äôs mission is its commitment to community service. We believe that socioeconomic circumstances do not justify the taking of human life, and we affirm that such difficulties can be overcome. To that end, BSL provides information to assist women facing crisis pregnancies and refers them to local crisis pregnancy centers that provide women with what they need to bring new life into the world. We also volunteer at local crisis pregnancy centers to help promote their mission to encourage the cherishing and welcoming of new life into our community. Though the focus of our outreach is primarily local, we collaborate with other pro-life organizations from across our state and nation and are united to them by virtue of our common cause. As a member of Students for Life of America (SFLA), BSL engages in the fight for life at the state and national level. As an organization that concerns itself with matters of great public relevance, BSL strives to do everything in its capacity to shape public opinion on relevant university, state, and federal policies, as well as to influence said policies, so that these might more accurately reflect our vision for a world in which every human life is valued and protected.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Students for Life at Berkeley recognizes the inherent, inviolable dignity of human life in all its forms. We are dedicated to working within our campus and local community to engage in discussion and action directed towards protecting the right to life.

Name: Students for Sexual and Reproductive Freedom üíô
Description: Our organization will organize a community of UC Berkeley undergraduate activists who can participate in events on UC Berkeley campus and in their surrounding communities to: Take action for reproductive freedom and demand change in a post-Roe America. Raise public awareness about reproductive health and rights including where people can receive abortions, STI testing, and gender-affirming care and the local law surrounding such procedures. Educate young people about sexual health including issues like STIs, PrEP use, condom use, consent, safety when exploring kink, drug use, prostitution, and more. Discuss the connections between reproductive health and other issues like race, LGBTQ rights, civil rights, immigration, the environment, and identity. Our focus on sexual health and abortion rights is vital in a time of terrifying attacks on our human rights including the recent destruction of Roe v. Wade and the wave of anti-trans legislation across the nation. Join us and take action! The group Students for Sexual and Reproductive Freedom was formerly named Planned Parenthood GenAction at Berkeley - 10/27/23 LL
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We equip the UCB student body with the organization and advocacy skills necessary to lead the nation-wide reproductive and sexual rights movement and fight stigma through education campaigns, election awareness and participation, and more.

Name: Students of Applied Science and Technology
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The community of graduate students of Applied Science and Technology.

Name: Students of Color in Public Policy üíô
Description: SCiPP's mission is to ensure the serious consideration of issues of racial and ethnic diversity in policy design. SCiPP provides a support network for students of color at the Goldman School of Public Policy (GSPP) and a forum for discussion of policy implications for people of color. The group holds a number of programmatic events throughout the year, including an annual race and policy symposium and coordinates the SCiPP Peer Advising program.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: SCiPP's mission is to ensure the serious consideration of issues of ethnic and racial diversity in policy design.

Name: Students Supporting Israel of Berkeley
Summary: Our mission is to be a confident pro-Israel voice at UC Berkeley.

Name: Students vs Pandemics at Berkeley üíô
Description: Students vs Pandemics is a public health club that aims to improve communication about a different disease each year through education and outreach. Join one of our committees: Public Health Research, Supporting Houseless Populations, and Supporting Local Schools. We are open to all majors! Follow us on Instagram @berkeleysvp or check out our website for more info: studentsvspandemics.com/berkeley-chapter!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Students vs Pandemics is a public health club that aims to improve communication about a different disease each year through education and outreach.

Name: Suitcase Clinic
Description: The Suitcase Clinic is a student and volunteer run organization founded by students from the UCB-UCSF Joint Medical Program (JMP) and UC Berkeley‚Äôs School of Public Health out of a desire to address the unmet needs of the city of Berkeley‚Äôs homeless and low-income population. Structured around the principles of public health, social welfare, community activism and empathy, the Suitcase Clinic currently operates three weekly multi-service drop-in centers in the city Berkeley: the General Clinic, the Women‚Äôs Clinic and the Youth Clinic. In addition to providing services, the Suitcase Clinic strives to educate students, promote health care access, engage in community organization, and support public policy efforts that address homelessness and the needs of the underserved in the local community. The mission of the Suitcase Clinic is to promote the health and overall wellbeing of underserved individuals through service provision, cooperative learning, and collective action among community and professional volunteers, students, and participants.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Suitcase Clinic is a student and volunteer-run organization that promotes the health and overall wellbeing of homeless individuals through service provision, cooperative learning, and collective action among volunteers, professionals, and clients.

Name: SUR at California üíô
Description: Welcome to SUR! SUR is the first club dedicated to South American students and their success at Berkeley. Our club was born out of a necessity to fill a gap in the representation of South Americans within the Latine organization space on campus. SUR allows us to assert our own narratives and affirm our latinidad. SUR is committed to celebrating the diverse cultures, traditions, and histories of South America recognizing that each student brings a unique experience and perspective into our space. Through our general meetings, workshops, and socials, we aim to provide a platform for members to share their experiences, perspectives, and passions. Whether you identify as South American or enjoy South American food, culture, or history, you are welcome to join us!
Categories: Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: SUR is dedicated to providing a space for South American students at Berkeley to affirm our cultural identity. We strive to build community and unity through curated events, discussions, and campus collaborations.

Name: Surfrider Foundation UC Berkeley Club üíô
Description: FALL 2024 MEETING INFO AVAILABLE ON OUR INSTAGRAM instagram.com/calsurfrider We are UC Berkeley's chapter of the Surfrider Foundation, a nationally-recognized 501(c)(3) nonprofit grassroots organization dedicated to the protection and enjoyment of the world‚Äôs ocean, waves and beaches for all people, through a powerful activist network. Our specific chapter works to host beach and campus cleanups with other registered student organizations, partners with Community Resources for Science with their Bay Area Scientists Inspiring Students (BASIS) program, has gotten UC Berkeley certified as the first college campus in the world with all of our dining halls registered as Ocean-Friendly Restaurants, runs a #NoSolo campaign in efforts to make UC Berkeley the first campus with 100% single-use-plastic-free social events, will soon have a Blue Water Task Force to allow us to provide critical water quality information to protect public health in the East Bay, measuring fecal indicator bacteria levels in the Berkeley Marina and comparing those results to local water quality standards. We invite anyone to join our organization at any point of time in the year, no recruitment, applications, interviews, or experience required. Feel free to email us or contact us on any of our social medias to learn more about us or future events! linktr.ee/calsurfrider last updated 9/19/24
Categories: Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our mission is the protection and enjoyment of oceans, waves, and beaches through a powerful activist network focused on sustainability.

Name: Surge - Electric Motorcycles at Berkeley
Description: This group was formerly named Surge - Electric Endurance Motorcycle Team at Berkeley - [3/6/24] [LL]
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Our mission is to push the boundaries of electric motorcycle endurance racing, crafting cutting-edge race-quality bikes while pioneering innovative range-extending technologies for the future of electric mobility.

Name: Sustainable Efforts in Environmental Design üíô
Description: Sustainable Efforts in Environmental Design (SEED) aims to build a strong community amongst the Sustainable Environmental Design major while creating connections in the professional field. Through community based projects, social events, and career building opportunities, one can join a community of SED majors. This group "Sustainable Efforts in Environmental Design" was formerly named "Sustainable Environmental Designers Interacting Networking Connecting" - [9/29/21] AM
Categories: Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Sustainable Efforts in Environmental Design (SEED) aims to build a strong community amongst the Sustainable Environmental Design major while creating connections in the professional field. Through community based projects, social events, and career build

Name: Sustainable Entrepreneurship at Berkeley
Description: As the world finally begins to shift toward climate neutrality, sustainability will be increasingly essential in every aspect of life ‚Äî especially with regard to entrepreneurship, which will require a new level of climate consciousness to continue developing successfully and innovatively. We feel the intersections between these two sectors are drastically under-addressed, and hope to bridge the gap between sustainability and VC culture to cultivate a more interdisciplinary understanding of the present and future. By encouraging students to invest responsibly and familiarizing students with diverse aspects of the ESG space, we hope to equip students with the unique ability to consider profit and sustainability in tandem, thriving in their post-college careers.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Sustainable Entrepreneurship At Berkeley is a UC Berkeley-based professional development network initiative that hopes to connect, educate, and mentor students interested in impact investing and the sustainable startup sector.

Name: Sustainable Housing at California
Description: SHAC is designing and building a more sustainable world through interdisciplinary building projects focused on energy, affordability, and scalability. We work closely with professionals and our community to promote and implement equitable building development processes and informed sustainability educational programs. All of our work draws heavily from political, urban planning, architectural, systems, and engineering theory. As a student-run organization at UC Berkeley, we provide opportunities for eager learners to apply academic knowledge to hands-on projects and gain experience in cutting-edge technologies and tools. Through our projects, members of the team will gain a better understanding of design processes, sustainable technologies, construction, marketing strategies, and other valuable technical and social skills. We participate in local and international competitions (eg. The Tiny House Competition and Solar Decathlon, respectively) where team members are encouraged to deepen their knowledge on their areas of interest. Through participation in these hands-on projects, members of the team will gain a better understanding of design processes, sustainable technologies, construction, marketing strategies, and other valuable technical and social skills, all the while gaining real world experience. By applying this knowledge to the creation of highly efficient houses that rely entirely on renewable energy sources, students will have the opportunity to convert abstract concepts into a tangible learning experience and product. Our projects will serve as a platform to showcase solar and renewable energy technologies in addition to contributing to an ever-broadening body of work about sustainable building practices, embodying Berkeley‚Äôs innovative spirit and leadership in the realms of sustainability, engineering, and interdisciplinary collaboration. Check us out at shac.berkeley.edu! (Formerly THIMBY/Solar Decathlon - merge and name change 2020)
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Sustainable Housing at California aims to design and build a more sustainable world through interdisciplinary housing projects focused on energy, affordability, and scalability.

Name: Sustainable Internet Lab
Description: The Sustainable Internet Lab is an undergraduate led academic research organization designed to bring sustainability to the large systems of digital infrastructure behind the internet. By working with industry partners, researchers are examining environmental issues of the emerging edge of internet infrastructure industries.
