Researchers have presented at some of the largest industry conferences in the data center and subsea cable industries, are working with professors across the globe to develop the world‚Äôs first undergraduate digital infrastructure curriculum, and teach one of the largest student-taught classes in Berkeley‚Äôs history.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Sustainable Internet Lab is an undergraduate led academic research organization designed to bring sustainability to the large systems of digital infrastructure behind the internet.

Name: Swim Club at Berkeley üíô
Description: The Swim Club at Berkeley aims to be a fun, supportive, and competitive community for swimmers of all skill levels to practice and compete together. We provide resources and opportunities that are geared to help you enhance your swimming talents, make improvements, and achieve personal and team goals. ‚ÄãWe practice together and compete with the California Intercollegiate Swim Club Association (CISCA), regional schools including the UC's, Stanford, Cal Poly SLO, U of Oregon, U of Utah, among others. We are registered with the College Club Swimming (CCS) organization, a larger collective organization that unifies college club swim programs across the country supported by U.S. Masters Swimming. Learn more about SCB during our Spring 2024 info-sessions. Email: swimatberk@gmail.com Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/swimatberk/?hl=en
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Swim Club at Berkeley aims to be a fun, supportive, and competitive community for swimmers of all skill levels to practice and compete together.

Name: T-Cal
Description: Want to talk about the issues you encounter as a transgender, nonbinary, gender-non-conforming, or gender-questioning person? T-Cal is a supportive social space for students like you. T-Cal holds weekly meetings to support each other though the rough patches, celebrate the successes, and to provide a warm community space. Further, our leadership advocates for transgender students on campus.
Categories: Undergraduate Organizations, LGBTQ+ Student Organizations
Summary: A supportive social space for transgender & gender non-conforming students.

Name: T.I.n.Y. Chinese Theatre Group
Description: We provide an environment for students interested in Chinese performing arts to gather and explore various types of Chinese performing arts, especially in the field of Chinese drama, short film and Chinese song writing. We aim at building a platform for self-expression in the form of Chinese performing arts. We also offer customized event-organizing service and other activities to help external clubs, organizations and individuals in various aspects.
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Non-profit and non-political student organization Produce Chinese dramas, short films and Chinese songs Provide customized event-organizing service

Name: Taiwanese American Student Association üíô
Description: The Taiwanese American Student Association (TASA) is a social and cultural student organization that promotes the integration of Taiwanese and American culture! We aim to create a community that both celebrates Taiwanese culture and fosters an environment that welcomes students from all cultural backgrounds who are interested in all-things Taiwanese or share any interest in the culture! Every semester, we hold biweekly events on Thursdays from 8-10 PM PST and host a variety of other opportunities throughout each semester, ranging from different family events to big/little pairings! To learn more about our organization, check out our website at tasa.berkeley.edu and browse through our photo gallery to get a glimpse of our community/events! Be sure to follow our Instagram, where we post all of our announcements, updates, and upcoming events! Also, follow our Facebook page and join our Discord server to get to know the community better throughout the semester: ‚Ä£ Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/tasa.berkeley/ ‚Ä£ Discord: https://discord.gg/XYRacvEGTx ‚Ä£ Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/tasa.berkeley ‚Ä£ Mailing List: https://berkeley.us6.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=9eec0da79b013380e34061d39&id=38d3c5d02c ‚Ä£ To get even more involved with TASA, join one of our families this semester by submitting the family preference form on the website: https://tasa.berkeley.edu/join We hope to see you around! :)
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: To promote Taiwanese American culture and identity to Berkeley and build a strong community of Taiwanese Americans through social, cultural, community service, and professional networking events.

Name: Taiwanese Student Association üíô
Description: The purpose of this non-profit organization is to promote general understanding of Taiwanese culture within the student body. Through our events we strive to provide an environment where students from different ethnic backgrounds can come together to appreciate and learn from each other. There are many Taiwanese students in U.C. Berkeley who have just come to the U.S., and it is also one of our main objectives to provide guidance and resources for these students to adapt well to college life here.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated MLK Space, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of this non-profit organization is to promote understanding of Taiwanese culture. We strive to provide an environment where students from various backgrounds can bond, and where Taiwanese students can find themselves a platform to adapt.

Name: TAMID Group
Description: Join UC Berkeley‚Äôs Chapter of TAMID consulting! During your time as an undergraduate student, finding an experience that positively impacts both your education and social life is essential in optimizing your college experience. Whether you have any experience or not, joining a professional club can be a highlight of your four years. At TAMID at UC Berkeley, our members have the incredible opportunity to gain Hands on FINANCE AND TECH CONSULTING experiences working with CEOs and high level executives of fast growing startups on our consulting track Work experience through an ALL EXPENSES PAID SUMMER INTERNSHIP ABROAD Fundamental knowledge in financial models, stocks, etc for a FUTURE FINANCE CAREERS through our fund track A vast PROFESSIONAL NETWORK with students and alumni from 60+ UNIVERSITIES in the US and around the world PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT through speakers, case competitions, alumni panels, interview simulations, networking, etc. For more information check out our website ucbtamid.com, follow us on Instagram @tamidberkeley, and come out to our info sessions!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: TAMID develops the next generation of entrepreneurs and business leaders through experiential learning. Members consult for Israeli startups, manage a live investment fund, develop a professional demeanor, and possibly spend a summer interning in Israel.

Name: TASSEL at Berkeley üíô
Description: TASSEL (‚ÄúTeaching And Sharing Skills to Enrich Lives‚Äù) is a U.S. 501(c)(3) public charity established in 2012. Initially TASSEL's sole activity was having U.S.-based, trained volunteers provide free English classes over video conferencing to the poor in rural Cambodia. But it has quickly evolved to include actively encouraging, recruiting, training and funding high potential Cambodian adults to become teachers as well as providing food aid, medical care access and other support services to the poorest families who have limited capabilities to earn income. In just seven years, TASSEL has grown from six U.S. volunteers, two local teachers, and 20 local children to 800 volunteers, 24 local teachers, and 2,300 local children (as of August 2019.) Volunteers are located in the U.S., U.K., Japan, South Korea, China, Singapore, and Israel. The Cambodian teachers and children are in five rural villages in Battambang and Kampong Cham provinces.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: TASSEL is a non-profit organization focused on changing the lives of rural Cambodians through English education; creation of teaching jobs; food and medicine aid; and sponsorships.

Name: Tau Beta Pi
Description: Tau Beta Pi is the oldest national engineering honor society in the country, and one of the most recognized national societies. Members experience a wide array of activities and opportunities throughout the year. TBP stresses scholarship, personal character, and service to the profession, community, and college. Every semester, we invite the top fifth of seniors and the top eighth of juniors from all engineering majors to join. Professional Development TBP provides many opportunities for students to develop their professional side while still in school. All candidates have their resume individually critiqued by TBP's professional development committee. Additionally, members' resumes are put into a resume book for our corporate sponsors. TBP also helps students hone their professional relations skills through interview workshops. Community Tau Bates are members for life. Tau Beta Pi offers a chance for students to work and socialize with their fellow engineers outside of a school setting and to form lasting bonds with their peers. Fun Tau Beta Pi loves to have fun! Throughout the semester there are over a dozen fun events to destress and have a good time. Everything from ultimate frisbee to karaoke is welcome here. Opportunity Joining Tau Beta Pi means becoming part of an organization that is bigger than any one person or university. With over 200 chapters, Tau Bates initiate into an active network of information and support.
Categories: Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Tau Beta Pi, the Engineering Honor Society, is a group which supports the top students across all engineering disciplines. TBP stresses scholarship, personal character, and service to the profession, community, and college.

Name: Tau Kappa Epsilon
Description: TKE Nu at Cal was created in 1919 and was the first chapter of Tau Kappa Epsilon in all of the West Coast.Tau Kappa Epsilon Overview:-Founded in 1899 at Illinois Wesleyan University.-TKE is the Largest Social Fraternity in the World.-274 Chapters Nationwide Tau Kappa Epsilon's vision is to create lifelong relationships that enhance educational, interpersonal, community, and professional success. Follow @caltke on Instagram. Go bears.
Categories: CalGreeks Interfraternity Council (IFC) Fraternities
Summary: TKE Nu at Cal was created in 1919 and was the first chapter of Tau Kappa Epsilon in all of the West Coast. We are diverse and driven men who strive to become better men for better world.

Name: Taylor Swift Society of Berkeley üíô
Description: We are Berkeley's only Taylor Swift fan club! We come together for karaoke nights, listening parties, general Taylor discussions, and so much more! Follow our instagram @swiftiesofucberkeley to receive updates, and hear about our meetings and events. You can also email us with questions at tsocberkeley@gmail.com.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our mission is to create a community for Taylor Swift fans to come together and celebrate her work and accomplishments.

Name: TBD Comedy
Description: TBD Comedy is the only troupe on campus performing both long form and short form improv, as well as sketch comedy. We work together to explore the fun of improv comedy and make ourselves and other people laugh. Auditions & ShowsTBD holds auditions at the beginning of each fall semester. We look for dedicated and diverse members who will bring a new perspective and a friendly attitude - no prior experience in comedy or improv is necessary! Look out for audition and show announcements on our Instagram (@tbdcomedyy)!!! For more info visit https://linktr.ee/tbdcomedyy
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Long form and short form improv troupe at UC Berkeley Check out audition and show info in our description!

Name: Teach in Prison
Description: We are a student -run collective working towards building knowledge, connecting to community, and being active in abolition/ care work. The organization consists of two main components: once a week tutors assist students inside the prison, and once a week they attend the on-campus class where they learn about the current issues affecting the California prison system. Students will learn best tutoring practices and the current state of mass incarceration and the prison industrial complex. Additionally, students study prominent issues around rehabilitation and reentry of formerly incarcerated populations. Specific issues may include the history of incarceration in the state of California and the intersections of carcerality with settler colonialism, disability, gender, queerness, race, poverty, houselessness, and more.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Black/African American Student Community
Summary: We are a prison abolitionist student-run collective. Our DeCal involves specific topics surrounding carceral histories and apparatuses. The other component involves Cal students assisting with education programs inside of San Quentin.

Name: Team Enough at Berkeley
Description: Team ENOUGH at Berkeley is an undergraduate-student-led organization whose mission is to educate the UC Berkeley student body about gun violence and mobilize them to take meaningful action against it. Supported by Brady, we harness the expertise and experience of today‚Äôs youth to advance our intersectional work across the country
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations
Summary: Team ENOUGH at Berkeley will be an undergraduate youth-led organization whose mission is to educate young voices about gun violence and mobilize them to take meaningful action against it.

Name: Team HBV at Berkeley
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Team HBV addresses the disproportionately high occurrences of chronic hepatitis B in Asians and Asian Americans through collaboration, advocacy, research, and education/outreach. We are the collegiate extension of Stanford Asian Liver Center at Berkeley.

Name: Telegraph for People üíô
Description: Telegraph For People is a student organization at UC Berkeley fighting for safe and vibrant streets for people in our city. Our flagship priority is making Telegraph Avenue car-free near the UC Berkeley campus (on 3 blocks from Haste to Bancroft). We want to create a vibrant public realm, more space and safety for pedestrians and cyclists, faster and more reliable public transportation, and reimagined public safety while centering equitable and radical urbanism. We proudly embrace a mobility justice centered vision, with disability and racial justice at the forefront of our work. We take an all-of-the-above approach to organizing and believe that students have the power to make real change in Berkeley if we organize and fight for our needs. Our weekly meetings are Mondays 7-8 PM in 214B Wurster Hall. Interested in joining? Join here! Learn more at https://telegraphforpeople.com
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Telegraph For People wants to create a vibrant public realm, more space and safety for pedestrians and cyclists, faster and more reliable public transportation, and reimagined public safety while centering equitable and radical urbanism.

Name: Tether Dance Company
Description: Tether aims to serve the broader UC Berkeley student body by providing a platform for engaging in modern dance within a student group setting. We aim to foster a close-knit, inclusive community that encourages unconventional and creative dance expressions. Further, we will offer a different movement experience to students, introducing members to specific modern dance techniques, improvisational and choreographic agents. The company will rehearse twice weekly, focusing on an all-company movement piece intended for major BDC showcases! There will be multiple opportunities for company members to practice crafting choreography and improvisation.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our purpose is to cultivate a vibrant student dance community at UC Berkeley, emphasizing artistic expression and unconventional creativity through modern dance.

Name: Thai American Cultural Association üíô
Description: Interested in learning more about Thai food, culture, and language? Looking to explore the Thai American identity at Cal? Then the Thai American Cultural Association (TACA) is for you! TACA aims to provide all students with a tight-knit community united by a common Thai American identity and interest in Thai culture. We hope to provide a space for all students to explore cultural identities and learn about Thai culture, food, and language (you do not have to be Thai to join)!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: TACA aims to provide all students with a tight-knit community united by a common Thai American identity and interest in Thai culture. We hope to provide a space for students to explore cultural identities and learn about Thai culture, food, and language.

Name: The 510
Description: Watch our most recent performance here: https://youtu.be/1NsuoNz9a5k?si=IEr_pUkBPQnS10BH Want more? Check out our playlist! https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLPDTc7T4qoWt86TAt3QA-jQ037XnKshd2&si=QKRC61tUpW6VPAWs Follow us on IG @_the510 for updates & reach out with any questions :)
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our goal is to introduce the Hip-Hop dance community to mainstream events and activities across campus. We strive to bring dancers of different training and cultural backgrounds together to parallel the diversity that makes up the Bay Area.

Name: The Beauty Hub at Berkeley üíô
Description: In today's rapidly expanding beauty world, numerous talented individuals provide services ranging from professional makeup artistry or hair styling, to nail or lash application. Our organization seeks to bridge the gap between these student-run beauty businesses and the student community by facilitating meaningful connections. Our organization introduces a novel concept in Berkeley's history, as it is entirely devoted to the amplification of beauty-related services. What sets us apart is our distinct focus and innovative approach to using social media platforms and a "hub" for business growth, enabling us to create a genuinely one-of-a-kind organization that connects student entrepreneurs with student clients. By specializing solely in the beauty service sector, we can direct all our resources and efforts towards becoming a specialized and unparalleled force in the industry. This unique positioning allows us to cater to the specific needs and demands of beauty enthusiasts and small beauty businesses. We offer various forms of mentorship via our Entrepreneurial, Legal, Finance, and Media mentors who cater to whatever help or advice our student-run beauty entrepreneurs need. Our innovative approach empowers entrepreneurs to establish a robust online presence and reach a broader audience, which is often challenging for small businesses in traditional settings. By bridging the gap between entrepreneurs and clients, we facilitate a deeper understanding of preferences and needs, leading to exceptional and tailored beauty services. As pioneers in this domain, we are committed to revolutionizing how beauty-related businesses operate in Berkeley, fostering direct connections, and enriching the overall beauty landscape in the community. Through our dedication to advancement and adaptation, we aim to create a lasting impact on both entrepreneurs and clients alike. Foremost, we aim to dispel stereotypes surrounding beauty enthusiasts. With a substantial portion of students regularly indulging in beauty services, this platform stands to be mutually advantageous for participants across the beauty service spectrum, whether they are providers or consumers.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We aim to provide students with a ‚Äúhub‚Äù of local beauty products and services, strengthen beauty businesses through entrepreneurial mentorship, and deliver beauty-related content catered to students!

Name: The Berkeley Forum (Formerly known as Berkeley Forum, The)
Description: Founded in 2012, the Berkeley Forum is a non-partisan, diverse, and accessible forum dedicated to hosting free events with distinguished speakers from various industries. Forum events are open to both students and the wider Berkeley community. Some past speakers include infectious diseases expert Dr. Anthony Fauci, basketball star Jaylen Brown, iconic author Daniel Handler, AKA Lemony Snicket, Grammy-winning singer-songwriter Carla Morrison and Oscar-winning film editor Paul Rogers. The Berkeley Forum provides students with unique hands-on experience and a channel to explore the ideas that they are passionate about. Forum is entirely run by undergraduates dedicated to connecting students with icons and leading experts from all around the world. From inviting speakers to advertising the event, Forum members commit hundreds of hours to every step of the event-planning process. From a social perspective, members of the Berkeley Forum are motivated, intellectually curious students from a diverse range of backgrounds. Forum cultivates a vibrant, tight-knit community that is so much more than just academics. Forum members strive to make close friendships with each other while working towards a goal to inspire the wider campus community. For those interested in joining our community, we open for recruitment in both the fall and spring semesters. Regardless of membership status, all events are free to attend. Additionally, we teach the undergraduate-led DeCal ‚ÄúHistory of Free Speech at Berkeley,‚Äù which is available to all students. Keep in touch through our Instagram, @berkeleyforum for more information on recruitment or events. This group [The Berkeley Forum] was formerly named [Berkeley Forum, The] - [11/7/24] [AP]
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, ABSA - Budgeted over $7500 Organizations
Summary: The Berkeley Forum is a non-partisan forum for the expression and debate of a wide range of ideas. Founded in 2012, the Forum organizes talks, panels, and debates by leading experts and distinguished persons on issues both topical and timeless

Name: The Berkeley Group
Description: Established in 2003, The Berkeley Group (TBG) is a professional student group committed to providing impact-driven consulting services for nonprofits and social enterprises. We create innovative solutions to help organizations tackle the critical challenges they face in today's society. We believe that helping social sector organizations with business challenges is a unique way to impact the community by providing long-lasting, sustainable effects.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Berkeley Group is a professional consulting group on campus that provides services to local, national, and international nonprofits.

Name: The Berkeley Project
Description: The Berkeley Project began in 2006 as a one-day service event. We have since expanded Berkeley Project Day to an annual 2,000 person event where volunteers work on service projects throughout the City of Berkeley. From working at elementary schools to planting trees and making meals for the homeless to helping out at senior centers, our volunteers devote a total of 12,000+ hours and save the City of Berkeley over $400,000 every year. Members may join a committee to help plan the service events, volunteer, site lead, and/or become a Core Director. Sign up for Berkeley Project Day today at www.berkeleyproject.org!
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: The Berkeley Project is the largest student-run volunteer organization on campus. Every semester, we host Berkeley Project Day with over 2,000 volunteers at 50-60 sites around the city of Berkeley.

Name: The California Review
Description: The purpose of The California Review is to provide a place to speak for those who disagree with people and institutions in or outside the academy. Our mission is to listen to those who see what is hidden, with whom no one may agree, and who seek to report objective truth. This group [The California Review] was formerly named [California Patriot] - [9/27/24] [AP]
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: UC Berkeley's Independent Newspaper

Name: The Dialectic üíô
Description: The Dialectic was formed by a group of individuals who yearned for a space to discuss all kinds of issues related to politics, social justice, economics, etc. Dialectic General Meetings are informal discussions on predetermined topics. Our goal is to involve the UC Berkeley student body in informational and non-partisan dialogue.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Dialectic promotes an open space where members of the UC Berkeley community can advance their political knowledge and opinions through dialogue, panels, debates and other events, whilst sharing this knowledge with the greater public through media.

Name: The Environmentalist
Description: The objective of The Environmentalist magazine is to educate Berkeley students and locals about the various environmental issues in Berkeley and the greater Bay Area. The student-run magazine will cover student and University actions on these environmental issues through a multimedia format. It places an emphasis on investigative journalism that aims to give a voice to marginalized communities impacted by climate change and keep Berkeley students and University administration accountable for their ecological footprint and contribution to climate change. It also aims to cultivate a community of environmental reporters, photographers, and designers equipping them with the skills to become professional environmental journalists.
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage
Summary: Educating UC Berkeley students and Berkeley residents on local environmental issues. Aiming to give voice to marginalized communities impacted by climate change and keep students and administration accountable for their contributions to climate change.

Name: The IT Club at Berkeley üíô
Description: We aim to address the global e-waste problem by promoting right-to-repair. We also work with universities, corporations, and retailers to repurpose phased-out, RMA'ed, or returned computers to support underserved communities. We also fix computers for free. If you want to work on computers, learn to build your own computer, have a device that needs fixing, or just want to hang out because computers are cool, feel free to join! We also offer free computer repair and upgrade services to Berkeley students.
Categories: Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The IT Club strives to address the global e-waste problem by promoting right-to-repair, offering computer repair/upgrade services, and refurbishing disused computers for underserved students. We also provide free IT services to Berkeley students!

Name: The Rebel Alliance of California üíô
Description: ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ ‚ãÜ‚ãÖ‚ú¶‚ãÖ‚ãÜ ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê A long time ago, in a galaxy far, far away...UC Berkeley's famous Star Wars club was born! Whether you're a Sith or a Jedi, Rebel trooper or Imperial spy, all are welcome to the one-and-only Rebel Alliance of California. ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ ‚ãÜ‚ãÖ‚ú¶‚ãÖ‚ãÜ ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò Our goal is to foster camaraderie among our members, forging a robust social environment for those invested in all Star Wars media. Through ongoing activities, such as film viewings, scheduled roleplay meetings, and themed game nights, TRAC strives to facilitate long-lasting connections between all its members. Aligning with the social activism of Star Wars' legendary protagonists, TRAC undergoes several themed volunteer initiatives throughout the year. Trash cleanups, social media awareness campaigns, and food donation drives are among the means by which we demonstrate our commitment to the saga's timely lesson: the galaxy's greatest heroes are dedicated to helping those in need. We look forward to seeing you at our meetings, and may the Force be with you!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Welcome to the premier club for everything Star Wars! We foster a tight-knit community that freely exhibits its passion for the personalities, landscapes, and legends of a galaxy far, far away. Meet fellow Rebels and embark on cosmic adventures!

Name: The Wardroom
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Navy ROTC Wardroom aims to propel students in leadership ability and training, as well as to continue a strong esprit de corps in the Battalion. This group The Wardroom was formerly named Navy ROTC Wardroom - [3/6/24] [LL]

Name: The Wildlife Society at Berkeley üíô
Description: Wildlife Society is a social and professional club for students fascinated by the natural world. We aim to facilitate a welcoming, interdisciplinary, and environmentally-conscientious community -- supporting anti-racism, representation, and belonging in this historically inequitable field. To this end, we provide a career network and weekly meetings, as well as free and subsidized events, including a diverse array of speakers, service events, and outdoor activities. If you have blurry insect pictures on your phone, a deep sense of wonder for ecological processes, or simply like wandering around outdoors, Wildlife Society is a group of nature nerds that would love to have you. We‚Äôve camped at Mt. Diablo, hosted a Cal Falcons founder, toured the Museum of Vertebrate Zoology, hauled invasive eucalyptus, enjoyed funny and heartfelt member lectures, and celebrated the spring equinox. We‚Äôve gone night salamander hunting, found the Cesar Chavez burrowing owl, and run around campus for our annual halloween scavenger hunt. More to come this year! We have no membership requirements and welcome you to one or many meetings, and support a diverse community of students from across all disciplines. The linktree below takes you to all our channels of communication, including our membership registration form, discord, and instagram. Look out for information on our first info sessions and weekly meeting times on our socials!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Wildlife Society at Berkeley is a social and professional club for all fascinated by the natural world, aiming to increase access and community in the field of wildlife ecology and conservation.

Name: The [M]ovement
Description: Caroline Kim and Trisha Mitra founded The [M]ovement in the fall of 1999. They began with a vision of bringing together a diverse group of people sharing a passion for dance. Starting with only 20 members, the group has expanded to over 100 members introducing different styles of contemporary, open, jazz, and swing to the UC Berkeley campus. Aside from having free workshops on Upper/Lower Sproul, The [M]ovement also hosts semesterly showcases (which are highly attended and anticipated!) to highlight the hard work of our dancers and choreographers. Despite our continued growth, [M]ovement members work to cultivate a supportive and encouraging environment for all dancers; we have endless love for our dancers and welcome all to be a part of our fa[m].
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage
Summary: The Movement is one of UC Berkeley's premier dance groups featuring open choreo, jazz/contemp, and ballroom. With over 100 members, Movement maintains a large but close family environment that is supportive of each member and our passion for dance.

Name: Theater for Charity üíô
Description: Theater for Charity is a non-profit theater group on the UC Berkeley Campus that puts on a bunch of awesome shows each semester, and donates all the proceeds to charity! Everything is student run, written, directed, produced, and performed. We do 2-3 shows a semester, so keep an eye out if you want to try out! Even if acting isn't yo thang, we are always on the look out for writers, directors, and technical people as well!If you have any questions, email us at ucbtheaterforcharity@gmail.com
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: UC Berkeley's premiere student-written comedy theater group, where every penny goes to charity! Your home for foul-mouthed philanthropy!

Name: Theta Chi
Categories: CalGreeks Interfraternity Council (IFC) Fraternities
Summary: The Mu Chapter of Theta Chi is proud to uphold over 100 years of tradition and brotherhood. Contact us at calthetachi.com

Name: Theta Tau
Description: The purpose of Theta Tau is to develop and maintain a high standard of professional interest among its members, and to unite them in a strong bond of fraternal fellowship. The goals of the fraternity are to promote the social and professional development of its members during and after their college years. Today, Theta Tau is the oldest and largest professional engineering fraternity in the United States, with a diverse membership of men and women studying engineering at more than 40 campuses. It is also the only professional co-ed engineering fraternity at UC Berkeley.Want to learn more? Check us out! Website: http://www.calthetatau.com/ Instagram: http://instagram.com/thetatauberkeley
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The purpose of Theta Tau is to develop and to maintain a high standard of professional interest among its members and to unite them in a strong bond of fraternal fellowship.

Name: Theta Xi
Categories: CalGreeks Interfraternity Council (IFC) Fraternities

Name: Thomistic Institute at Berkeley, The
Description: The Thomistic Institute's Campus Chapters program began in 2015, and has since expanded to over 80 campuses worldwide. What are chapters? Campus Chapters are student led organizations recognized by a university that encourage undergraduate and graduate students to collaborate with each other and with their faculty to develop lectures, events, retreats and programs built upon the intellectual tradition brought about by St. Thomas Aquinas. As a campus chapter in Berkeley, we organize reading groups to facilitate academic discussions in philosophy and theology, lectures given by experts in St. Thomas, and social gatherings to provide a fun and comfortable outlet to discussing the complexities of St. Thomas. We also attend intellectual retreats, each focused on a specified topic as it relates to Thomas Aquinas. Thomistic? St. Thomas Aquinas stands at the heart of what we do. We believe Aquinas' philosophy and theology facilitates great intellectual discussions and debates. With St. Thomas as our touchstone, our speakers and events open endless possibilities for discussion and growth in intellect! Many speakers are experts not only in areas of Thomistic research, but in philosophy, science, literature, theology, and more. Events There are many different kinds of events a chapter can organize: select a speaker from our network of academics for a lecture, organize a reading group, or even a student retreat or conference! There are many new and interesting ways to be involved, and we would love to grow our chapter. Learn more at our website or search for us on social media @calthomisticinstitute to stay updated
Categories: Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Thomistic Institute at UC Berkeley organizes lectures and student reading groups based upon the Intellectual Tradition in the Middle Ages, specifically the works of St. Thomas Aquinas. Lectures and speaking events are open to the public.

Name: Threads
Description: Threads is an organization at the University of California, Berkeley whose mission is to be a creative cultural outlet for the Cal Muslim community, and the greater collegiate Muslim community.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Publication Groups, Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA - Budgeted over $7500 Organizations
Summary: Threads is a student-produced semesterly publication at the University of California, Berkeley whose mission is to be a creative cultural outlet in the form of a lifestyle magazine for the Cal Muslim community, and the greater collegiate Muslim community

Name: THRIVE Campus Ministry formerly known as D.R.E.A.M. Campus Ministry üíô
Description: THRIVE Campus Ministry serves to reach out to the members/students of the Berkeley Community who seek to enrich and grow in their personal beliefs, understanding and knowledge of the Bible. We conduct weekly 30-minute Bible Talks to discuss various issues and topics that we encounter in our present-day society. We also offer free, personal Bible studies that cover the fundamentals of the Christian faith. The college experience is rich with different life lessons, hardships and victories! It is a time of refinement where students truly come into themselves as the next generation of contributing members to society. We seek to cultivate the bonds and friendships that will help UC Berkeley's students during such a crucial and valuable time in their lives. This group [THRIVE Campus Ministry] was formerly named [D.R.E.A.M. Campus Ministry] - [9/18/2025] [Balty]
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: "My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you. Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends. You are my friends.." John 15:12-14a

Name: Thrive Dance Company
Description: Thrive Dance Company's mission to help Berkeley students grow, develop and THRIVE in their passion for dance. We do this through promoting the art of contemporary dance through performances in UC Berkeley and other Bay Area venues that feature cutting-edge choreography, and provide a welcoming community where dancers can work on their own expression of dance.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We are UC Berkeley's original and premier contemporary dance group. Our goals are to promote the art of contemporary dance and to provide a welcoming community where dancers can work on their own expression of dance.

Name: Tikvah
Description: Tikvah is an independent grassroots student-led organization at UC Berkeley, founded in 2007, whose mission is to promote education about Israel within the UC Berkeley community.
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Tikvah is an independent grassroots student-led organization at UC Berkeley, founded in 2007, whose mission is to promote education about Israel within the UC Berkeley community.

Name: To An Unknown God
Description: Vision Therefore, the One whom you worship withoutknowing, Him I proclaim to you.‚ÄîActs 17:23 To An Unknown God is UC Berkeley‚Äôs first student-run Christian journal. Every semester, we publish writing and artwork produced by Cal students, hoping to foster dialogue both between Christians and students of other faiths and philosophies. We are not affiliated with any church or other religious group, and opinions expressed in articles and posts do not necessarily represent those of the editors. We are completely student-run and funded by the student body as an ASUC-sponsored student publication. A large portion of our funding, however, comes from private donations. Distribution is free while supplies last. If you would like a print copy, please email us your mailing address.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Publication Groups, Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: To An Unknown God is UC Berkeley‚Äôs first student-run Christian journal. Every semester, we publish writing and artwork produced by Cal students, hoping to foster dialogue both between Christians and students of other faiths and philosophies.

Name: Toastmasters on Campus üíô
Description: Toastmasters has been the world leader in teaching public speaking since 1924. My name is Agranya Ketha, and as the president of Toastmasters on Campus, I'd like to invite you to join us at our weekly Toastmasters meetings, which take place every Wednesday at 6:15! Just show up to a meeting as a guest, and a member will get you up to speed in no time! Time: Every Wednesday (year-long) from 6:15 PM to 7:30 PM. We will start promptly after setting up (and there's no Berkeley Time), so please try and be there a few minutes early. Location: We will meet at BNorth Conference Room 82D (inside the MLK Jr. ASUC Student Union), on UC Berkeley's campus (map link).
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Toastmasters on Campus is UC Berkeley‚Äôs premier branch of the century-old Toastmasters International, dedicated to improving public speaking & leadership. Practice prepared speeches, improv, and evaluations alongside other students & professionals!

Name: Tokiha
Description: Tokiha is a club that prepares you for a summer camp program in Japan where local high school students and college students from America gather. We aim to have high school students to be exposed to new ideas, rethink who they are, and ultimately liberate themselves from their own shells. We lead college student counselors to create their own workshops that leave an enjoyable and rewarding experience to both themselves and participants. The program which is run in English consists of student-made workshops, team activities, guest speakers, and fun events. If you are interested in joining us, please email our director at: moniquegomes@tokiha.org
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Tokiha is a club that prepares you for a program in Japan where high schoolers and American college students gather. We aim to have high schoolers be exposed to new ideas, rethink who they are, and ultimately liberate themselves from their own shells.

Name: Toxicology Student Association of Berkeley üíô
Description: ToxSA supports students interested in the field of toxicology and related disciplines by providing mentorship, career preparation, and community service opportunities as well as exploring past and current issues in toxicology. Toxicology major/minor is not required to join! Mentorship and Career Prep Our career preparation services will support students by bringing in guest speakers and mentors, providing resume and interview workshops, access to a collaborative research/scholarship/internship database, and more. Members of ToxSA will also become members of the NorCal Society of Toxicology (SOT) and be Undergraduate Affiliates with the SOT. This will give students the opportunity to interact with real life toxicologists and access scholarship and other career opportunities. Past events have included a career fair with a variety of professional toxicologists from biotechnology companies, state departments, academia, consulting, and more. Community Service/Projects In the past, ToxSA sponsored the Lead Education Awareness Program (LEAP) which spread awareness about household hazards and air pollution, and has also worked with the NorCal Society of Toxicology and the Lawrence Hall of Science to encourage and introduce students to toxicology through a variety of events and services. Members will have the opportunity to join projects and work on collaborations like these in the future. Additionally, members will have the opportunity to participate in monthly Journal Clubs where students will present and discuss relevant research studies with other members of the club. Community Our goal is to create a supportive and inclusive space for students curious about toxicology to explore and develop their interests with others. Beyond just academic and professional pursuits, we also hope to encourage personal growth and a positive environment. From study groups and resource sharing to social events, ToxSA supports students not only through their years at Berkeley, but also helps them for the future by exploring careers and networking while being a part of a growing community of toxicologists!
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: ToxSA is dedicated to bringing together a community students who are interested in toxicology, pharmacology, environmental health and related fields by providing mentorship, career preparation/networking, and community service opportunities.

Name: Traders at Berkeley
Description: Traders at Berkeley is UC Berkeley's premier undergraduate quantitative finance club dedicated to hosting an inter-collegiate trading competition, teaching an introductory DeCal course on quantitative finance, and connecting students with industry professionals.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Traders at Berkeley is UC Berkeley's premier undergraduate quantitative finance club that partners with leading industry sponsors to host a trading competition and teach an introductory DeCal course on quantitative finance.

Name: Transportation Team at Berkeley üíô
Description: We provide our members with an opportunity to address real-world challenges in today's challenging urban landscape. We aim to compete in the regional ASCE Mid-Pacific Conference as part of the CEE Department.
Summary: Our purpose is to serve as an avenue for transportation enthusiasts across all major to gain practical, hands-on experience in the design and planning of transportation solutions.

Name: Tri-Service Corps of Cadets üíô
Description: The Tri-Service Corp of Cadets is an organization that seeks to bring unity between the Army, Navy, and Air Force ROTC branches and veteran groups on campus. We seek to develop aspiring military officers, create inter-branch camaraderie and competition, and manage Tri-Service events.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of this RSO is to plan and coordinate tri-service activities between the members of the Army, Navy, and Air Force ROTC cadet programs.

Name: TrueLement
Description: TrueLement or better known as ‚ÄúTL‚Äù was established in 1998 at UC Berkeley. Since then, the team has evolved into a well-recognized dance group among campus peers and various communities throughout the Bay Area. TL is known for its upbeat, diverse, and high-energy performances that highlight some of Berkeley‚Äôs most talented dancers. With such talent, TL has had the privilege to perform at many showcase venues, club events, and street festivals. TL was founded on the basis of not only promoting and performing the art of dance but also providing a unique experience for its dancers. That experience is meant to push its dancers physically and mentally while maintaining a positive and goal-oriented attitude. The combination of all the dancer‚Äôs strengths, training, friendships, positivity, and love of dance creates the TL family, a very rewarding experience that can only be offered through a small dance group like TL.
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: A dance organization on campus aimed at giving students opportunities to perform and become a part of a larger dance community and family.

Name: Turkish Student Association at Berkeley
Description: Our organization is unique in bringing together Turkish members of the Berkeley community and promoting an environment for dialog between graduate and undergraduate students within the Turkish community. We are showing effort to keep the Turkish community at Berkeley intact and making sure that we help one another in times of need. We organize professional development events, socials and networking events in order to ensure compatibility and communication within the Turkish community at Berkeley, and to help grow the opportunities of Turkish people at Berkeley.
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The members of the Turkish Student Association at Berkeley aim to increase the campus‚Äô awareness regarding Turkiye and promote Turkish/Turkish-American community and culture.

Name: Turning Point USA at Berkeley üíô
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Turning Point USA at Berkeley's mission is to educate students about the importance of free speech, limited government, fiscal responsibility, and capitalism through innovative campus activism and non-partisan, thought-provoking discussions, and events.

Name: Tzu Chi Compassion Relief Foundation üíô
Description: Tzu Chi Compassion Relief Foundation, formerly known as the Buddhist Compassion Relief Tzu Chi Foundation, is an organization dedicated to charity, medical care, education, and humanity in the community. We hold weekly community service events that promote the organization's values and principles. These events include shoreline clean-up, hot meal distributions, convalescent home visits, recycling, sign language learning, flower arrangement, and much more.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Tzu Chi Compassion Relief Foundation is an organization dedicated to charity, medical care, education, and humanity in the community.
