Description: MechBytes Talks: https://mechanics-berkeley.github.io/
Summary: The objective of this Chapter is to act as a student chapter of the U.S. Association for Computational Mechanics and to serve the computational mechanics on the UC Berkeley campus.

Name: UC Berkeley Model United Nations
Description: Please do not request to join on Callink! Instead, if interested, please follow our Instagram, @UCBMUN. UC Berkeley Model United Nations is a traveling collegiate debate team that allows college students to engage in discourse on contemporary and historical topics relevant to international relations. We travel to various Model UN debate conferences hosted by other universities, as well as host our own conference in San Francisco. In addition, we hold numerous other events, including smaller regional conferences, social events, and club meetings.
Categories: OASIS Sponsored Organization, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, ABSA - Budgeted over $7500 Organizations
Summary: UC Berkeley Model United Nations is a nationally-ranked intercollegiate team that competes on behalf of Cal at Model UN debate conferences across the country, hosts a collegiate conference, and hosts a high school conference.

Name: UC Jazz Ensemble
Description: UC Jazz Ensembles is the primary source for jazz performance opportunities on campus, open to students of all majors.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: UC Jazz is the primary source for jazz performance opportunities on campus, open to students of all majors.

Name: UC Rally Committee üíô
Description: The University of California Rally Committee‚Äôs members are charged with upkeeping Cal‚Äôs Spirit and Traditions. They serve as the ambassadors of the University, making Berkeley a fun school to attend. From cheering in the front row at football games to waving Cal flags during night rallies, the committee is behind much of the magic on campus. The UC Rally Committee is also in charge of many campus traditions, including Card Stunts, which originated at Cal in 1910, and our annual Bonfire Rally which hosts almost 10,000 students in the Greek Theatre every November dating back to the early 1900s. The Committee has much to offer to its members. Whether you enjoy yelling your heart out for the Golden Bears, learning about the University‚Äôs fascinating history, or coordinating some of the largest and most successful events on campus, the Rally Committee enables you to preserve and promote the California Spirit‚Äîall while making friendships that will last a lifetime. The Rally Committee promotes and protects the spirit that sets the University of California Berkeley apart from any other school in the country. If any of this sounds interesting to you, we highly encourage you to consider joining the UC Rally Committee. Not only does membership in the UC Rally Committee include getting a super cool rugby that is proudly worn on game days and at other events where the committee upholds University traditions, but it also includes the opportunity to get a behind the scenes scoop of what planning and executing campus wide events entails and welcomes you into a big, spirited family. Just fill out our interest form at https://tinyurl.com/ucrcinterest2023! Go Bears!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, OASIS Sponsored Organization, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, ABSA - Budgeted over $7500 Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The University of California Rally Committee is charged with the protection and guardianship of the Spirit and Traditions of UC Berkeley. Founded in 1901, the Rally Committee maintains over 120 years of tradition and promotes service to the University.

Name: Ukrainian Club of Berkeley üíô
Description: The Ukrainian Club of Berkeley is at the forefront of uniting members of the UC Berkeley community who stand with Ukraine and those who want to learn more about Ukraine, history and culture or who identifies her/himself as Ukrainian. Our mission is to go beyond ourselves in bringing and uniting the world‚Äôs best minds around Ukraine, for protecting the Ukrainian identity, people, civilization, culture and history, for reimagining and rebuilding Ukraine, for enriching and preserving the world‚Äôs civilization. Among our current & upcoming projects: :: Run to Rebuild Schools (Learn more and join us) :: Ukraine-Berkeley Forum 2023 Our club is for actionable plans not just talks. Our club is for a global synergy and development. Our club is about talents who strategize and act empowered with common values of equality, justice and sustainability for peace.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our organization seeks to unite members of the UC Berkeley community who share a Ukrainian identity or an interest in Ukrainian history, culture or who simply stand with Ukraine

Name: Unbounded Representation
Description: The purpose of our group is to promote dialogue about different kinds of diversity among those who do work in Mathematics. We are a group of Math graduate students and have a particular interest in the Math graduate student experience at Berkeley. However, we would like to investigate how all people in math-related fields grapple with the issue of diversity. We will do so through a variety of panel presentations, round-table discussions, and surveys. Our events will be open to the wider community.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: The purpose of our group is to promote dialogue about different kinds of diversity among those who do work in Mathematics. We are a group of Math graduate students and have a particular interest in the Math graduate student experience at Berkeley.

Name: Undergraduate Astronomy Society - Berkeley üíô
Description: We are a club focused on providing a space and community where students interested in astronomy and all related topics can learn, socialize, and grow. We hold community meetings, telescope trainings, star parties, and more! Join our Discord and check out our Instagram, we're happy to have you!
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We are a collective of undergraduate astrophysics students at UC Berkeley dedicated to the formation of a structured representation within the Berkeley Astronomy Department.

Name: Undergraduate Biotech Association üíô
Description: Undergraduate Biotech Association is a student-run organization at UC Berkeley that focuses on the multi-faceted world of biotech. Within the organization, we plan to have speaker events, career development workshops, networking events, and socials. Students will be able to find a diverse community that is united in their shared interest to further themselves and the biotech industry. There are no pre-requisites to join, just passion. In a school with lengthy and extremely competitive application processes for certain student organizations, the Undergraduate Biotech Association allows equal access to all with the notion in mind that not everyone has the same resources, but deserves the same opportunities.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Undergraduate Biotech Association is a student-run organization at UC Berkeley that focuses on the multi-faceted world of biotech.

Name: Undergraduate Business Group
Description: UBG is a group of diverse students in the Berkeley business community dedicated to helping our members accomplish their professional goals in investment banking, consulting, technology, and quantitative trading, as well as personal goals. Develop professionally with our extensive mentorship and resources and forge lifelong relationships with members of our connected community.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Undergraduate Business Group aims to foster a close-knit community of business students on campus through career mentorship, professional training, and social activities.

Name: Undergraduate Composers Club üíô
Description: Founded in 2005, the Undergraduate Composers Club (UGCC) brings together composers and performers at UC Berkeley in order to share original compositions/arrangements and enhance the musical and creative development of its members. The UGCC is open to all undergraduate students who wish to create, share, discuss, and perform original music regardless of their major, preferred musical genre, or compositional experience. With support from the Music Department, the UGCC allows undergraduate composers to hear their works performed by their peers at least once per semester in Hertz Hall and/or Morrison Hall. The UGCC also regularly invites experienced composers and musicians for guest lectures and masterclasses.
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: A supportive space for musical community and exploration among undergraduate composers, performers, and music lovers. Our club is open to undergraduate students of all majors, interests, and experience levels!

Name: Undergraduate Economics Association
Description: Undergraduate Economics Association is a club for undergraduates at Cal who are Economics majors, considering enlisting in the major, or just interested in economics. We hope to build up interest and camaraderie among economics undergrads, and to provide resources which will help you get the most out of the department's offerings. Please come to our events to find out more about us or contact one of the UEA officers.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Undergraduate Economics Association is a club for undergraduates at Cal who are Economics majors, considering enlisting in the major, or just interested in economics.

Name: Undergraduate Finance Association|Undergraduate Management Consulting Group
Description: Our mission is to serve as a primary contact point on campus for investment banks and management consulting firms. With our strong industry relationships, we strive to bridge the gap between students and top firms by organizing some of the largest and most successful recruiting and informational events and workshops on campus
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our mission is to serve as a primary contact point on campus for investment banks and management consulting firms

Name: Undergraduate Laboratory at Berkeley (ULAB)
Description: We believe that every student interested in participating in research at Berkeley should have the opportunity to do so. We are committed to individually helping new students find research on campus, developing their resume to apply for these positions, and connecting/supporting students already involved in research. A productive and enjoyable undergraduate research experience at Berkeley requires a significant activation energy that deters many beginning students. This stems from a tendency for many programs to favor already experienced students and difficulty for new students in navigating a complex myriad of resources. Additionally, students who assist graduate mentors often do not get the chance to generate ideas themselves or interact with other undergraduate researchers in diverse fields. ULAB proposes to create an undergraduate ‚Äúresearch lab‚Äù to gently introduce new students to research at Berkeley as well as provide a social/mentoring experience for already advanced undergraduate researchers to learn from each other and develop professionally. ‚ÄúLab members‚Äù will attend workshops on professional communications or reading research papers, go on tours of campus research labs, listen to talks by professors, and present on their own research work. The program is particularly aimed at students who are interested in research but might not be as aggressive or experienced to seek out these opportunities on their own - ULAB will be the catalyst to kickstart their Berkeley research careers.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: We are committed to individually helping new students find research on campus, developing their experience to apply for these positions, and connecting/supporting students already involved in research.

Name: Undergraduate Law Review at Berkeley
Description: The Undergraduate Law Review at Berkeley was established with the purpose of fostering legal scholarship and interest amongst the undergraduate student body. Our commitment lies in promoting well-researched and thoughtful legal discourse.
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Our primary purpose is to create a supportive environment where undergraduates can explore the ever-evolving field of law.

Name: Undergraduate Legal Honors Society (Formerly Law in Practice at Berkeley) üíô
Description: The Undergraduate Legal Honors Society strives to provide access to pre-law resources for all students, regardless of race, gender, socio-economic status, or any other limitation. We educate students on the complexities one may face on the path to law school and provide them with the ability to successfully navigate their professional and intellectual paths in the legal field.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Undergraduate Legal Honors Society aims to inspire and inform Berkeley students about the vast, exciting, and diverse practice of law.

Name: Undergraduate Marketing Association
Description: The Undergraduate Marketing Association at the University of California, Berkeley is an organization dedicated to providing a bridge between students and the marketing and consulting world. We provide various opportunities in the marketing field and help our members reach both academic and professional goals. Our members are immersed in hands-on experience in strategy, design, and event consulting. In addition, our members are able to interact and network with professionals through our external speaker series and internal professional development events, developing their knowledge in marketing and consulting. UMA is unique because our members consult and work with companies and organizations through a variety of semester-long projects. UMA is divided into three committees ‚Äì Strategy Consulting, Design Consulting, and Events Consulting. Each committee consists of six to ten members, led by two experienced Project Managers.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The Undergraduate Marketing Association at UC Berkeley is dedicated to providing a bridge between the students and the marketing world. We provide our members with hands-on experience in strategy, design, and event consulting with real clients.

Name: Undergraduate Moot Court Team
Description: Moot court is a student organization that simulates Supreme Court appellate advocacy, helping undergraduate students prepare for law school and learn valuable legal advocacy and writing skills. Students compete in oral arguments, with an optional brief writing component, in tournaments run by the American Moot Court Association (AMCA), which releases a fictional case problem on the 1st of May each year. In the 2023-2024 season, UC Berkeley's moot court team won the AMCA National Championship in oral advocacy, the first-ever student-run team to take the title. If you would like more information, check out the AMCA website at https://amcamootcourt.org/ Follow us on Instagram: @berkeleymootcourt
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Moot court is an organization that simulates Supreme Court appellate advocacy and brief writing, helping undergraduate students prepare for law school and learn valuable legal advocacy and writing skills. We compete nationally against other schools.

Name: Undergraduate Political Science Association üíô
Description: The Undergraduate Political Science Association seeks to elevate the voice of all political science majors, explore potential career paths beyond graduate/law school, and foster a close-knit community built on a commitment to serve. We are non-partisan.
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Undergraduate Political Science Association seeks to elevate the voice of all political science majors, explore potential career paths beyond graduate/law school, and foster a close-knit community built on a commitment to serve. We are non-partisan.

Name: Undergraduate Real Estate Club
Description: The purposes of this organization are: to increase awareness of the real estate industry; to provide a network for students interested in the real estate industry; to function as a representative organization of the undergraduate student body interested in real estate at the University of California at Berkeley campus.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: The purposes of this organization are: to increase awareness of the real estate industry; to provide a network for students interested in the real estate industry; to function as a representative of the real estate-focused undergraduate student body.

Name: Undergraduate Street Medicine Outreach
Description: We are a UCB student organization dedicated to reducing the barriers local unhoused members of society face with regards to basic necessities and resources. All are welcome and no qualifications needed to apply. Create valuable interpersonal relationships and go on meaningful weekly volunteering with us.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: USMO‚Äôs mission and goal is to overcome or mitigate the biggest barriers houseless communities/encampments face in relation to accessing healthcare and other services provided in the Berkeley area.

Name: Undergraduate Student Council of the College of Environmental Design
Description: The Undergraduate Student Council at the College of Environmental Design (UgSC CED) is the official governing entity of undergraduate students of the College of Environmental Design. They address & communicate the needs & desires of the student body with administration & campus officials with the goal to unite students. UgSC Staff Council Chair: Lily Weisenfeld (Landscape Architecture Rep) Council Vice Chair: Yesenia Casillas Rios (Landscape Architecture Rep) Council Treasurer: Katie Xiao (SED Rep) Council Secretary: Lauren Velasco (Urban Studies Rep) Events Coordinator: Hitiksha Bansal (Architecture Rep) Executive Committee Representative: Connor Dunbar (Architecture Rep ) Alexandra Bunik (Landscape Architecture Representative) Eleonore Aries-Praud (SED Represenatative) Contact us at cedugsc@berkeley.edu
Categories: Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: UgSC CED is the official governing entity of undergraduate students of the College of Environmental Design. They address & communicate the needs & desires of the student body with administration & campus officials with the goal to unite students.

Name: Undergraduate Women in Economics at Berkeley üíô
Description: UWEB is an esteemed organization dedicated to fostering the integration of academic resources in economics with professional development. Our mission centers on providing exceptional opportunities for enthusiastic students to engage in practical learning experiences. By participating in UWEB, students are empowered to cultivate their knowledge and pursue their economic interests actively, thus propelling their career prospects forward. Beyond academic growth, UWEB takes pride in fostering a close-knit and supportive community. UWEB stands as a testament to our commitment to excellence, learning, and the advancement of women in economics, fostering an environment that nurtures academic and professional growth alike. Check us out here: https://uweb.studentorg.berkeley.edu/
Categories: Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Women Interest Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: UWEB is dedicated to bridging students with academic resources and professional development. Offering extensive hands-on learning opportunities for passionate economics students, we empower them to pursue their career aspirations and build community!

Name: Undergraduate Women in Law at Berkeley
Description: Undergraduate Women in Law at Berkeley embodies a spirit of empowerment and advocacy for pre-law women. U.W.I.L.B. will serve as a pivotal platform for fostering a supportive network, but more so a community, where aspiring female legal professionals can connect, collaborate, and cultivate their interests. Our organization will offer valuable resources, including mentorship programs - these mentors will be female identifying law students and professionals - networking events with female identifying professionals, and workshops designed to enhance skills and knowledge regarding the legal profession and journey towards law school. Our philanthropic efforts will focus on supporting women around the globe and may include writing letters, volunteering at shelters, etc. By creating an inclusive environment where women can share experiences and navigate the complexities of the pre-law world (a world very much male dominated), U.W.I.L.B. will promote gender equity and intends to inspire the next generation of women leaders in law.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Women in Law at Berkeley intends to inspire the next generation of women in law by fostering a supportive community where aspiring female/queer legal professionals can grow and give back to the community through philanthropic endeavors.

Name: Underwater Robotics at Berkeley üíô
Description: Underwater Robotics at Berkeley is a student led, engineering team on campus that participates in intercollegiate underwater robotics competitions, RoboSub and MATE. Members will have the ability to improve their technical skills in designing, building, programming, and testing an underwater robotic submarine. Team collaboration, presentation of ideas, and obtaining sponsor support are also key aspects of the team. Students from ALL majors, years, and experience levels are welcome to join the club's hardware, software, or operations/finance sub-teams. To learn more check out our website: https://urobotics.berkeley.edu
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Underwater Robotics at Berkeley designs, builds, and tests autonomous and teleoperated underwater vehicles to compete at the annual RoboSub and MATE ROV competitions.

Name: Undocumented Student Affairs Committee
Description: The Undocumented Student Affairs Committee is an ad-hoc committee under the ASUC dedicated to advocating for undocumented students and their families. USAC works to ensure that undocumented, immigrant, and mixed-status students have access to equitable resources, representation, and opportunities at UC Berkeley. Our committee leads initiatives that range from campus-wide awareness campaigns and faculty training to direct policy advocacy and resource creation. Rooted in personal experiences and community care, USAC strives to build a campus where undocumented students can thrive, feel supported, and have a voice in shaping institutional change.
Categories: ASUC Government Programs
Summary: Earth Week Committee

Name: UndocuStudents at Berkeley Law
Description: UndocuStudents at Berkeley Law seeks to empower undocumented law students pursuing their legal education. UndocuStudents offers resources to assist students with professional opportunities, academics, financial aid, and legal services.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: UndocuStudents at Berkeley Law seeks to empower undocumented law students pursuing their legal education. UndocuStudents offers resources to assist students with professional opportunities, academics, financial aid, and legal services.

Name: Unidad en Educaci√≥n üíô
Description: Unidad aims to demystify professional development and aid marginalized Latine students in overcoming barriers they face at an institution like UC Berkeley. Reaching higher education is only the beginning of a lot of student's careers or academic ambitions, and our organizational mission is to guide students in clarifying their professional paths and acquire the necessary skills to succeed, through workshops and community-building. We are here to foster a sense of belonging for all Latine students, particularly those that identify as LGBTQ+, first-generation, undocumented, or are marginalized in any other sense.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: To demystify professional development and aid Latine students in overcoming barriers they face while attending University and in professional sectors by providing resources.

Name: United For Health at Berkeley
Description: By serving as an interface between the UC Berkeley campus and UFH clinicians, we will continue to provide services of acupuncture and nutritional counseling and education. This treatment model reduces stress, anxiety, depression, and chemical issues for UC Berkeley students and the campus community. The Hope on the Go Clinics have successfully operated at the UC Berkeley Student CoOps, the Tang Health Center, and the Moffitt Library benefiting hundreds of students on a drop-in basis. Please join our RSO so we may continue to offer our services to you and your fellow students on a regular basis to combat your daily stress! Email us at hope.unitedforhealth@gmail.com to volunteer or with questions.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: United for Health at Berkeley‚Äôs mission is to provide healthcare services and education that is accessible to students, faculty members, and staff on the UC Berkeley campus by partnering with United for Health (UFH), a local nonprofit organization.

Name: United Nations Association of Berkeley üíô
Description: United Nations at Berkeley (UNAB) is the official UC Berkeley campus chapter of the United Nations Association. We are an advocacy-based organization dedicated to educating the students and citizens of Berkeley about pressing global issues and empowering them to take action on them for lasting impact. As part of this mission, we host events and speakers, hold advocacy campaigns, and interact with the local community, including collaborations with other student organizations. We also work closely with our parent chapter, the United Nations Association, East Bay, and the broader Northern California region! We invite and encourage all Berkeley students to join our community and help making a lasting impact on the world! Students in UNAB are organized into project groups designed to help further UN goals. This semester (Fall 2025) the project groups will be creating a DeCal for the Spring 2026 semester, volunteering at a local organization to further SDG #4, and endorsing California legislation on behalf of the UNA. For more information, please see our linktree https://linktr.ee/unaberkeley, contact us at unaberkeley@gmail.com or message our Instagram page @unaberkeley.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The United Nations Association of Berkeley is dedicated to raising awareness about pressing global issues and empowering students to take action on them for lasting impact. UNAB is the UC Berkeley campus chapter of UNA-USA.

Name: Unity in Christ
Description: Unity in Christ meets monthly with representatives from various fellowships on campus in order to plan community events, pray and discuss topics relating to Christian unity. We also support each other in coordinating prayer, teaching and evangelism efforts in the community. We do this all in the name of loving one another as Christ has first loved us.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Spiritual Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Unity in Christ is a community at UC Berkeley designed to promote unity of Christians on campus, empower one another in prayer, service, and evangelism, and provide support for students seeking churches and Christian fellowships.

Name: UNITY Resource Center
Description: The UNITY Theme Program is a living-learning community designed to promote identity exploration and community engagement for students (primarily new UC Berkeley students) through a lens of gender and sexual diversity. UNITY hopes to foster strong community and leadership development, activism, and education. UNITY additionally intends to provide students with resources and support in a queer and trans community space. UNITY aims to achieve its objectives primarily through an academic seminar, residency, and resource center available to UNITY members.
Categories: Undergraduate Organizations, LGBTQ+ Student Organizations
Summary: The UNITY Resource Center‚Äôs primary objectives are to serve students enrolled in the UNITY Theme Program as well as provide resources and a safe space for all UC Berkeley students of the LGBTQ+ community.

Name: University Housing Rights Organization üíô
Description: The University Housing Rights Organization (UHRO) provides a resource for students living in on-campus housing, to ensure that living conditions are up to adequate standards. Students should have a comfortable and secure place to live in order to achieve their full academic potential.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The University Housing Rights Organization (UHRO) works to provide comprehensive resources for students living in on-campus housing, to ensure that living conditions are up to adequate standards so they can achieve their full academic potential.

Name: Unmanned Aerial Vehicles at Berkeley üíô
Description: We are a student organization dedicated to experimenting with and demonstrating the newest technologies available to aeronautics. Founded in 2015, we have designed, built, and tested drones over a large range of sizes and applications. These engineering challenges have strengthened our understanding of autonomous flight software, novel composite materials, mechatronics, and electric aircraft propulsion. Those who have a deep passion for tackling tough design challenges and experiencing the thrill of their efforts contributing to a drone flight are welcome to join us.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Unmanned Aerial Vehicle at Berkeley is a student organization exploring forefront autonomous aerospace technologies.

Name: Untitled Theater Company
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Focusing on site-specific theater, we aim to break traditional boundaries in the structure and design of theatrical productions by using unorthodox locations, diverse play selections, and creative rehearsal schedules.

Name: Unwind üíô
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our club serves as a space for fiber artists of all disciplines to make art together and find community through their shared interests. We aim to promote a welcoming environment that allows our members to de-stress with other fiber artists.

Name: Upsilon Pi Epsilon
Description: Upsilon Pi Epsilon (UPE) is the international computer science honor society backed by both ACM and IEEE. The Nu Chapter is the premier computer science society at Berkeley and provides professional development services, workshops, and events to the student community
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Upsilon Pi Epsilon (UPE) is the international computer science honor society backed by ACM and IEEE. The Nu Chapter is the premier computer science society at Berkeley and provides professional development services and events to the student community.

Name: UpSync
Description: UpSync is a student-run, non-profit management consulting organization. We work with technology companies to help students reach success in non-technical career development. We partner with these corporations to form interdisciplinary consulting teams and develop strategic recommendations to provide answers to the tech industry‚Äôs most pressing problems. ‚ÄãThough our projects always focus on technology in some way, they have spanned a variety of disciplines including but not limited to: product management, marketing, data analysis, SEO/SEM, web and app development, design and prototyping, strategy, and implementation. See UpSync in Action
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: UpSync is a student-led, non-profit, consulting organization at UC Berkeley. We work with companies to solve their most pressing problems, including everything from SEO & General Business Operations to Software Engineering & Data Science.

Name: UX @ Berkeley
Description: If you want to design technology, join UX @ Berkeley! This is a space dedicated to teaching the principles of user-centered design: using research to guide the creation of products. Here, we will teach you how to design you own apps and websites using emerging design principles. With client-led projects, you will form a high-level portfolio meant to help you get User Experience Designer/Researcher internships and entry-level positions. You will also receive design and career advice from tech industry professionals. We encourage students from all academic backgrounds to join, as understanding your audience as a tech designer requires knowledge from many different fields. The application process requires no additional work, so no prior experience is needed.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Teach the disciplines of UI/UX, which include design thinking, prototyping, and user testing. Work on client-led projects to create and prepare a portfolio for internships using professional tools with advice from industry experts.

Name: Vagabond Multilingual Journal
Description: We seek to showcase multilingual creative works in order to foster interests in multilingualism, promote diversity, and support multiculturalism in the UC Berkeley community.Vagabond publishes original poetry and prose, written in various languages and accompanied by English translations. Works are written by undergraduates from all around the world. Our past issues have published works written in languages like Chinese, Finnish, Hindi, Italian, Russian, and many more.
Categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations
Summary: Vagabond is a UC Berkeley student-run, multilingual literary magazine that showcases creative works written in various languages.

Name: Valley Consulting Group
Description: Valley Consulting Group (VCG) is a UC Berkeley student-run, not-for-profit strategy consulting organization that has served leading technology and Fortune 500 companies for over eight years. We provide strategic solutions to vital business and technical challenges for our clients. VCG is composed of personable, intelligent, and motivated UC Berkeley undergraduates looking to make an impact. Each project cycle, our teams take on a new slate of consulting engagements with companies in tech, entertainment, fashion, and more. Some of our recent clients include Spotify, Costco, AMD, Coca Cola, Starbucks, and LinkedIn.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated BNorth Space
Summary: Valley Consulting Group provides students interested in the intersection of business and technology opportunities to engage in real-world consulting projects with leading technology and Fortune 500 companies. Visit: https://vcg.studentorg.berkeley.edu

Name: Valorant at Berkeley üíô
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of Valorant at Berkeley is to create a community of like-minded Valorant gamers who share a passion for the game and to provide opportunities for its members to compete, collaborate, and grow within the e-sports space.

Name: Venture Capital at Berkeley
Description: We are a student-run organization that aims to develop students' interest in venture capital and startup activity on campus. Our professional work includes partnering with the on-campus fund Courtyard Ventures, working with VCs in a VC Fellowship, running a Venture Capital Decal and organizing and maintaining connections across the Bay Area startup ecosystem.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Venture Capital at Berkeley is an undergraduate community that will be empowered to learn about the components of Venture Capital, work with leading venture capitalists and entrepreneurs, and develop relationships with likeminded students.

Name: Venture Strategy Solutions Consulting
Description: Venture Strategy Solutions (Venture) at Berkeley is a strategy consulting group that works with high-growth startups. Past clients include Life360, Handshake, Niantic (creators of Pok√©mon Go), and more! We focus on creating actionable and impactful recommendations for the clients we work with. We also prepare our members for careers in a variety of fields including consulting, tech, start-ups, and finance. Website
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Venture Strategy Solutions at Berkeley is a student-run strategy consulting group that serves start-ups and high growth clients.

Name: Veritas Graduate Christian Fellowship üíô
Description: We are a community of graduate students, post-docs, professional students, and friends--of diverse cultures, disciplines, and denominations--seeking to know Christ and seeking to thrive in our faith together. Through regular gatherings of community, study, and service, we endeavor to support and love each other as we continue to grow in our academics, careers, and faith. Check out our website for more information!
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Veritas Graduate Christian Fellowship is an interdenominational campus ministry, primarily consisting of graduate students and professionals, and is affiliated with InterVarsity, First Presbyterian Church of Berkeley, and UC Berkeley.

Name: Vertical Farming at Berkeley
Description: The Vertical Farming Club at UC Berkeley is a student-led organization dedicated to developing sustainable and innovative solutions to address global food insecurity and environmental challenges. The club's mission is to create a technology that can revolutionize the way food is grown, produced, and distributed, with a focus on vertical farming. Vertical farming is a technique of growing crops in vertically stacked layers, using artificial lighting and a controlled environment to optimize growth and yield. The club believes that vertical farming can be a solution to many of the world's biggest problems, including climate change, water scarcity, and food insecurity. The club's primary goal is to design and implement a scalable vertical farming system that can provide fresh and nutritious produce to UC Berkeley's dining halls. By growing food on campus, the club hopes to reduce the university's carbon footprint and promote sustainable practices. To achieve this goal, the club brings together students from various disciplines, including engineering, agriculture, and environmental science. Members work together to develop and test prototypes, collect data, and optimize the system's efficiency and productivity. Members are also encouraged to develop and execute their own research projects, as well as collaborate with other members to create a community involved in the expansive field of research within UC Berkeley. The club also collaborates with industry partners and academic institutions to stay up-to-date on the latest technologies and research in vertical farming. By sharing knowledge and resources, the club hopes to accelerate the development of sustainable agriculture practices and make a positive impact on the world. Overall, the Vertical Farming Club at UC Berkeley is a passionate and innovative community of students dedicated to using technology and science to solve some of the world's biggest problems.
Categories: Environmental & Sustainability Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: UC Berkeley's Vertical Farming Club develops scalable systems for dining halls, focusing on sustainable practices to solve global food insecurity.

Name: Vertical Takeoff and Landing at Berkeley
Description: VTOL at Berkeley fosters engineering and business skills among students through hands-on eVTOL aircraft development and business management.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: VTOL at Berkeley fosters engineering and business skills among students through hands-on eVTOL aircraft development and business management.

Name: Vietnamese Student Association üíô
Description: Our Founding Longing for their homeland, a group of immigrant Vietnamese students at UC Berkeley joined forces and created the Vietnamese Student Association in 1979. Their goal was to create a space in which they could connect through their similar backgrounds and share their culture with each other. To further their purpose, they looked to educate others about Vietnamese culture, history, and heritage. Through their efforts they built a family away from home for Vietnamese and Vietnamese American students, a community that continues to grow. Cal VSA Today Today, Cal VSA is still a student organization that embraces our Vietnamese and Vietnamese American roots and culture. Though our members are a part of a new generation, we recognize and commemorate the experiences that our parents and relatives have had while also striving to identify and to understand the emerging narratives and current issues in our community. Cal VSA, alongside our goals, has evolved as an organization but we are still driven by the same principles that our founders embraced. These principles can be summed up by our three pillars: Academics | We recognize and embrace the opportunities that we have been given and we endeavor to extend the same opportunities to others in our community. Community | We recognize the diverse contemporary issues facing our community and we attempt to understand them, to promote awareness about them, and to address them. Culture | We recognize that we have a unique Vietnamese heritage and tradition and we aim to preserve and to learn more about our culture. Though we are an organization that focuses on the Vietnamese American experience, we are honored to be able to count many members of non-Vietnamese heritage as part of our family. We welcome any and all students to come see what Cal VSA has to offer!
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, ABSA - Budgeted over $7500 Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Cal Vietnamese Student Association (Cal VSA) strives to empower its members to become leaders of their communities and preserve the history and heritage of the Vietnamese culture for future generations. We welcome any and all to come join our family!

Name: Vision Development Club of Berkeley
Description: A professional student organization at the UCB Optometry that aims to promote awareness of all aspects of vision therapy early in the optometric education, including perceptual training, accommodative and vergence training, sports vision, traumatic brain injury and stroke rehabilitation. Other aspects involve guest speakers and advice into creating a vision therapy practice and incorporating vision therapy to various optometric settings. Guest speakers experienced in the field will be brought to UCBSO for presentations to provide information about COVD, OEP, and other related educational meetings and conferences.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: A professional student organization at UCB Optometry.

Name: Vision Science Club üíô
Description: The purpose of the Vision Science Club is to encourage collaborations between Vision Science graduate students across various labs, promote awareness of current issues in Vision Science, and foster social relationships through community and club events.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose of the Vision Science Club is to encourage collaborations between Vision Science graduate students across various labs, promote awareness of current issues in Vision Science, and foster social relationships through community and club events.

Name: VISION üíô
Description: VISION, a mentorship program under Vietnamese Student Association at the University of California, Berkeley, recognizes and understands the significance of the historical, cultural and contemporary issues the Vietnamese and Vietnamese American communities face. VISION aims to foster and encourage high school students to take away what they learn and gain from our program to become leaders of their own communities. Fundamentally, VISION empowers students to embrace their individual identities as well as the heritage of the Vietnamese culture.
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: VISION is a 4-day, 3-night mentorship program aimed at bringing awareness to historical, cultural and contemporary Vietnamese and Vietnamese American issues.

Name: Visiting Scholars Ministry üíô
Description: VSM (Visiting Scholars Ministry) (https://www.visitingscholarsministry.org/) is a registered student organization that welcomes all visiting scholars, visiting students and post-docs. We strive to provide enriching experiences through English programs, fun outings and American cultural experiences. Each week, we host English classes and VSM Forum, where we discuss and explore various topics on Christianity.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Introducing visiting scholars to American culture, life, and faith

Name: Volunteer Health Interpreters Organization
Description: **FOR MORE INFO: <www.calvhio.org> Our application for 2025-2026 is now closed. Please fill out our interest form for the next upcoming cycle! https://youtu.be/hsomGwJ6jvM VHIO strives to eliminate language barriers in healthcare settings by providing trained volunteer interpreters from UC Berkeley to healthcare organizations and facilities for underserved, limited English proficient (LEP) communities in the Bay Area. VHIO is a University of California, Berkeley undergraduate student-led organization whose roots trace back to 2007, when it was established as the San Francisco Hepatitis B Collaborative (SFHBC) in partnership with University of California, San Francisco health professional students. SFHBC at Berkeley provided trained bilingual students as Asian language interpreters for two monthly UCSF hepatitis B student-run clinics, which we continue to volunteer at. Dedicated to helping stop the spread of Hepatitis B, SFHBC partnered with organizations such as the San Francisco Hepatitis B Free Campaign and helped at various screening, vaccination, and education events. Four hundred million people worldwide suffer from chronic hepatitis B infection, which tragically can lead to liver cancer early in adult life. It is the 10th leading etiologic cause of death in the world. Fortunately, the spread of the hepatitis B virus is preventable with a simple, safe, and effective vaccine. Due to an increase in demand for interpretation services, we have been expanding to provide interpretation and volunteering services for a broader range of issues beyond hepatitis B. In August 2010, SFHBC at Berkeley was renamed the Volunteer Health Interpreters Organization (VHIO) to reflect its expanded scope of language capacities and its service base across the San Francisco Bay Area. We provide trained volunteer interpreters in several languages - Mandarin, Cantonese, Japanese, Hindi-Urdu, Korean, Spanish, Tagalog, and Vietnamese - from UC Berkeley to healthcare organizations and facilities for underserved LEP communities. We work closely with UCSF medical and pharmacy students, UOP dental students, health workers, and medical providers to serve patients and help them overcome the language barrier in healthcare. VHIO plays an integral role in our community by outreaching to the underserved immigrant neighborhoods and assisting them at individual medical appointments and health fairs. Passionate about community empowerment, our volunteers also interpret for educational presentations on topics ranging from cancer prevention to disaster preparedness. VHIO provides the following valuable experiences for pre-health students. Interpretation: Clinical exposure and opportunities to work with underserved communities Outreach: Make connections with medical students and local healthcare organizations Training: Professional training in healthcare interpretation Members Expectations -meet volunteer requirements set by department coordinators (typically 5-10 hours over the semester) -attend 3 General Events per semester -attend training and meet shadowing requirements (if new member) Proud Partners with: Affordable Housing Associates ‚Ä¢ Alameda Hep B Free ‚Ä¢ American Liver Foundation ‚Ä¢ Asian and Pacific Islander Wellness Center ‚Ä¢ Asian Community Mental Health Services ‚Ä¢ Asian Health Services ‚Ä¢ Asian Liver Center ‚Ä¢ AsianWeek ‚Ä¢ Berkeley Food Institute ‚Ä¢ Bone Health Initiative ‚Ä¢ Breathmobile ‚Ä¢ Cal Pre-dental Society ‚Ä¢ California Pacific Medical Center ‚Ä¢ Center for Early Intervention on Deafness ‚Ä¢ Center for Empowering Refugees and Immigrants ‚Ä¢ Center for Elderly Independence ‚Ä¢ Central American Resource Center ‚Ä¢ Chinese American Coalition for Compassionate Care ‚Ä¢ Chinese Community Health Plan ‚Ä¢ Chinese Hospital in San Francisco ‚Ä¢ Chinatown Public Health Center ‚Ä¢ Clinic by the Bay ‚Ä¢ Family Bridges ‚Ä¢ Fresh Approach ‚Ä¢ Korean Community Health Center ‚Ä¢ Street Level Health Project - School of Optometry ‚Ä¢ Kimochi-Kai ‚Ä¢ Labor Coach ‚Ä¢ Lifelong Medical Care ‚Ä¢ Mabuhay Health Center ‚Ä¢ Montclair Physical Therapy ‚Ä¢ Oakland Senior Center ‚Ä¢ Prevent Blindness Northern California ‚Ä¢ Project Open Hand ‚Ä¢ Rotacare Richmond Free Clinic ‚Ä¢ San Francisco Free Clinic ‚Ä¢ San Francisco Hep B Free ‚Ä¢ Satellite Affordable Housing Associates ‚Ä¢ Street Level Health Clinic ‚Ä¢ Team HBV at Berkeley ‚Ä¢ The Hep B Project ‚Ä¢ The Second Opinion ‚Ä¢ UCSF Memory and Aging Center ‚Ä¢ UCSF Partners in D ‚Ä¢ UCSF Operation Diabetes ‚Ä¢ UCSF San Francisco Hepatitis B Collaborative ‚Ä¢ UOP Hearing and Balance Center ‚Ä¢ UOP School of Pharmacy ‚Ä¢ Vietnamese American Community Center of the East Bay ‚Ä¢ Women's Cancer Research at Berkeley **VHIO is a nonpartisan student organization and will not endorse any candidates running for state, federal, or student government. Please do not contact us to inquire about hosting speeches or contacting our members in any way on a candidate's behalf.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Volunteer Health Interpreters Organization, better known as VHIO, provides verbal interpretation and document translation for healthcare related services in the San Francisco Bay Area.

Name: Volunteer Income Tax Assistance Program
Description: Berkeley VITA is a student-led UC Berkeley Public Service Center program that trains and connects student volunteers with tax sites geared towards low-income communities throughout the Bay Area. FOR INDIVIDUALS INTERESTED IN RECEIVING TAX-FILING SERVICES: Berkeley VITA itself does not host tax filing services, but rather trains volunteers to prepare tax returns so that they may serve at local tax sites. Those who are interested in free tax filing services are welcome to check out the following links to locate and schedule an appointment at their nearest site: United Way Bay Area: https://uwba.org/tax-help/IRS tax help website: https://www.irs.gov/individuals/find-a-location-for-free-tax-prepUC Berkeley site @ the ASUC Legal Clinic: https://www.asucslcberkeley.org/appointments.html FOR INDIVIDUALS INTERESTED IN VOLUNTEERING: The VITA program consists of two parts: 1) Fall: Weekly 2-unit DeCal designed to prepare students to take and successfully pass the IRS-sponsored Basic Certification Test in late November. The DeCal incorporates readings and discussions about poverty, income inequality, and the public policies surrounding these issues. Training materials, including official IRS publications and software tutorials, will be provided to students for free. 2) Spring: Students begin volunteer work at one of the local sites with partnering organizations in Berkeley, Oakland, San Francisco, or a virtual site, and continue until the end of the tax season (April). Students can receive 2 additional units for their volunteer work and apply to become a Site Leader. No previous experience or knowledge of taxes is required! Berkeley VITA is a YEAR-LONG commitment! Applications are released shortly after the start of the fall semester! Email us if you have any questions. Learn more about VITA through our Linktree: https://linktr.ee/ucberkeleyvita
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated ESH Storage
Summary: The Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) Program prepares student volunteers to provide free tax-filing services for low-income community members throughout the Bay Area.

Name: Volunteers for Medical Outreach
Description: Every school year, members of Volunteers for Medical Outreach organize various events in order to raise funds for our cause. 100% of the proceeds we make go directly toward funding mobile health clinics, Hepatitis B vaccinations and corrective surgeries for underserved areas in the global community. During the summer, we travel abroad to volunteer amongst doctors, dentists, and pharmacists at the mobile health and vaccination clinics that we fund, teach public health lessons to the communities we visit, visit hospitals to view the disparities of healthcare systems in different countries, and serve the community in non-medically related ways as well. So far, VMO has established a strong presence in Southern and Central Vietnam, but we are hopeful about expanding our services to other countries as our organization continues to grow. Applications for new trip members and general members are closed. Check our website for more detail (https://vmo.berkeley.edu/apply)! Please email or message us if you have any questions.
Categories: Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Members of Volunteers for Medical Outreach seek to provide free medical and health care to people who cannot afford hospital services. The organization will provide students with a way to extend their services internationally to other countries.

Name: Voters Choose at Berkeley üíô
Description: Voters Choose at Berkeley, in affiliation with Voters Choose (a 501c(3) non-profit), is concerned with supporting voters with opportunities to best represent themselves in all elections in a simple, understandable, and cost-effective manner that accurately reflects voters‚Äô preferences. Our work will involve research that assesses the current politics of an area where VCB would like to advocate and possible initiatives that would align with our values. In addition, VCB will strive to educate, research, and advocate for any kind of electoral reform in all levels of government in the US. VCB is comprised of 3 branches: Policy, Advocacy, and Research. We would love to have you join one of our teams! For inquiries about collaborations with your organization, please email: communications@voterschoose.studentorg.berkeley.edu
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We would uniquely serve as an organization to debate and reform democratic institutions through a nonpartisan lens and to experience advocacy from a student led perspective.

Name: Voyager Consulting
Description: Voyager Consulting is a UC Berkeley, student-run, strategy consulting organization that provides services to growth stage and Fortune 500 companies. Voyager strives to provide an environment for members to grow through real world problem solving and create a community that extends beyond Berkeley.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Voyager Consulting is a UC Berkeley based non-profit business organization that provides management consulting and business strategy services to Fortune 500 and growth stage companies.

Name: Water Law Society at Berkeley
Summary: The Water Law Society at Berkeley seeks to engage the student body on increasingly pressing water law issues.

Name: Waterski and Wakeboard Association at Berkeley üíô
Description: We teach beginners how to waterski and provide a place for skiers to train and participate in tournaments against other universities.
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The purpose is to promote the sport in this region as well as provide opportunities for students to compete and socialize with people interested in waterski and wakeboard. We will teach beginners how to ski and skiers how to improve. We want to unite pe

Name: We Kids United at Berkeley
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Undergraduate Organizations, Cultural & Identity/Cultural & Ethnic Student Organizations
Summary: We Kids United at Berkeley is a chapter of national nonprofit dedicated to providing medical humanitarian aid particularly those related to maternal and pediatric health crises in Haiti.

Name: Web Development at Berkeley
Description: Web Development at Berkeley is UC Berkeley's first web development and design-focused organization, bringing full-stack web development education and hands-on industry development and design experience to UC Berkeley students. We have three initiatives, education, training, and industry. In our education initiative, we run a 3-unit DeCal called the Introduction to Full Stack Development Decal designed for students of all experience levels. Our training initiative consists of a semester-long bootcamp where rising developers and designers will build, design, and deliver several web applications to hone their development, design, and teamwork skills. Our industry initiative connects experienced developers and designers with various companies to complete a real-world software project that will end up in the hands of users. WDB unrelentingly upholds an inclusive and friendly culture where everyone can learn, grow, and flourish together.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Web Development at Berkeley is UC Berkeley's first web development and design-focused organization, bringing full-stack web development education and hands-on industry development and design experience to UC Berkeley students.

Name: White Coats for Black Lives - JMP Chapter (formerly known as STRIDE)
Description: UC Berkeley-UCSF Chapter Vision: The White Coats for Black Lives (WC4BL) at the UC Berkeley-UCSF Joint Medical Program chapter is dedicated to providing support, access, and mentorship to local premedical students aiming to address the lack of underrepresented minorities (URM) within the medical field. To provide a space for Joint Medical Program students and other allies to discuss matters related to racial justice, inclusion, diversity, and equity. o To provide a space for members to propose, organize, and implement interventions related to racial justice, inclusion, diversity, and equity. Organization Goals: o To apply the discussions and interventions to various settings, including but not limited to the Joint Medical Program, the School of Public Health, and the larger Bay Area community. This group was formerly named Students for Racial justice, Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity. Name changed 3-28-24 - Millicent
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Providing a space for Joint Medical Program students and other allies to discuss matters and implement actions related to racial justice, inclusion, diversity, and equity.

Name: Women and Youth Supporting Each Other
Description: Once a week, mentors travel to their middle school sites to host a group session for mentees on a specific topic. WYSE mentors use an up-to-date and program-specific curriculum to plan and build weekly sessions that are tailored to the unique needs of our mentees. Using the multi-faceted WYSE curriculum as a guide, mentors engage their mentees in decision-making games, in-depth discussions and community action projects.WYSE mentors and mentees engage in fun, one-on-one outings to spend time together and foster a relationship beyond group sessions. These extra activities are important for building trust and mutual respect between each mentor and mentee and are crucial to WYSE's high retention rate of mentees.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Initiated Service Groups, Service Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: WYSE is committed to inclusivity and belonging for all women: trans women, cis women, femmes, female-identifying, and individuals assigned female at birth. We envision a world in which we are all empowered to determine our futures and effect change.

Name: Women in Computer Science and Electrical Engineering
Description: WICSE was founded in 1977 by CS graduate students Paula Hawthorn, Diane McEntyre, Barbara Simons, Mary Ann Niemat, Susan Eggers, and Deborah Estrin and celebrated its 30th anniversary in January of 2008. This robust networking and advocacy organization has been successful in attracting and sustaining women students through sponsoring pre-college outreach and hosting activities from weekly lunches to national conferences. Sheila Humphreys, academic coordinator for student matters in EECS, credits WICSE's success to its continuity, its ongoing contact with successful alumnae and other prominent women in the field, and to the support it receives from EECS for staff, space, and funding. Using the WICSE model, many Berkeley alumnae‚Äîlike Mor Harchol-Balter at Carnegie Mellon University and Amy Wendt at the University of Wisconsin-Madison‚Äîhave initiated similar advocacy organizations on their campuses across the country. WICSE was recognized with the 2002 award from the Women in Engineering Programs and Advocacy Network for the ‚Äúsustained national impact‚Äù of its efforts.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: WICSE promotes gender diversity in the graduate school of the Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences Department through organized efforts of mentorship, outreach, seminars, conferences, and other community involvements.

Name: Women in Computing and Data Science at Berkeley
Description: Women in Computing and Data Science at Berkeley (WiCDS) helps female and non-binary students at UC Berkeley improve their technical skills and receive mentorship and networking opportunities from industry professionals. We are the first student organization at UC Berkeley for women in data science and have access to a variety of resources, such as technical workshops, networking events, and hackathons, from female organizations. We also offer academic, professional, and social opportunities to our members through committees, events, socials, and more. To find out more information, please visit our website at tinyurl.com/berkeleywicds or send us an email at berkeleywicds@gmail.com.
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Engineering/Computer Science Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Women in Computing and Data Science at Berkeley is for women interested in technological fields to join a supportive community that teaches essential skills and provides mentorship and networking opportunities from professionals in the industry.

Name: Women in Tech Law
Description: Women in Tech Law (WiTL) is a student-led organization that strives to recruit, support, and empower women who are interested in pursuing technology law through providing outreach, mentorship, and educational resources. WiTL aspires to use outreach as a medium to not only encourage women to enter the field, but to also expand the presence of women in the field by providing awareness to the opportunities and potential that tech law can hold for women from both STEM and non-STEM backgrounds. WiTL seeks to use mentorship and other platforms to increase members‚Äô accessibility into tech law, in an attempt to break the glass ceiling of the technology industry. Ultimately, WiTL strives to empower women interested to excel and improve in the realm of law and technology.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations
Summary: Inspire and empower women to enter the field of technology law and establish a mentorship network between prominent women attorneys practicing in the Bay Area and Berkeley Law students.

Name: Women in Weightlifting üíô
Description: Women in Weightlifting (commonly referred to as 2DUB) is a student-led organization at UC Berkeley that focuses its efforts in fostering a supportive, empowering community for women and femme-identifying individuals through the hosting of community building mixers, beginner-focused training workshops, and weekly lifting sessions aimed towards destigmatizing and reinventing the culture that has long existed within the broader weightlifting community.
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Our goal is to uplift and empower women in the weightlifting community by encouraging knowledge, support, and a sense of belonging so that every one of them can walk into the weight section of a gym with confidence.

Name: Women of Color Initiative
Categories: GA Government Projects
Summary: To be entered

Name: Women on Wall Street at Berkeley üíô
Description: Women on Wall Street at Berkeley (WOW) was founded in 2023 by Abigail Copeland as the University of California, Berkeley's first and only independent student organization specifically designed for women and gender nonbinary students. In just two semesters, WOW has become Berkeley's largest finance-focused student organization with 105 members and counting. WOW is committed to providing an inclusive, and supportive network for women and friends on campus to learn more about the financial services industry and ultimately thrive on Wall Street. Through WOW's commitment to inclusivity, diversity, and mentorship, we hope to revolutionize the perception of women in finance on the Berkeley campus and beyond.
Categories: Professional Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: Women on Wall Street at Berkeley (WOW) is Berkeley's first and only independent student organization for women and gender nonbinary students interested in finance

Name: Women's Club Basketball at Berkeley
Categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: We aim to create an inclusive and empowering environment where students can pursue their passion for basketball, foster community, and develop both athletic and personal skills.

Name: Womxn of Color Collective üíô
Description: The Women+ of Color Collective (WOCC+) is dedicated to providing a supportive community space for women and non-binary people of color at Berkeley Law, including and not limited to Asian, Black, Latinx, Middle Eastern/North African, Native American, and Pacific Islander women and non-binary people at Berkeley Law. By providing cultural, social, professional, educational and community service programs, WOCC+ seeks to advance the passions, goals, and needs of women and non-binary people of color and enrich their educational experiences at Berkeley Law. WOCC+ is committed to working in solidarity with other organizations to promote diversity in Berkeley Law, the legal profession, and beyond. WOCC+ rejects the logics and systems of white supremacy, cisheteropatriarchy, settler colonialism, imperialism, capitalism, classism, ableism, and other systems of oppression. WOCC+ affirms and supports movements for Palestinian liberation, Indigenous sovereignty, LGBTQIA+ liberation, racial justice, gender equity, economic justice, disability justice, environmental justice, and other movements for justice and liberation.
Categories: Graduate Student Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: The Women+ of Color Collective (WOCC+) is dedicated to providing a supportive community space for women and non-binary people of color at Berkeley Law.

Name: Yemeni Student Association of Berkeley
Description: The Yemeni Student Association of Berkeleu aims to facilitate interconnectedness within our community to assist Yemeni students achieve success in education. We simultaneously seek to bring awareness to Yemen's culture, history and struggles through our three pillars: recruitment, retention, and education.
Categories: Cultural & Identity/International Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: As the Yemeni Student Association, we aim to motivate, recruit and normalize college for Yemeni students through mentorship especially those who are socioeconomically disadvantaged; and establish and sustain a space for the Yemeni community on campus.

Name: Young Americans for Freedom at Berkeley
Description: Come join us to chat about conservative politics, discuss current events through a conservative lens, listen to the most prominent speakers in the conservative movement, or just socialize and party with conservatives and people from all political backgrounds. We focus on education of conservative values and policies, or just politics in general. YAFB stands for our Constitution, freedom, and America. All are welcome to attend meetings and events!
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
Summary: Young American‚Äôs for Freedom at Berkeley‚Äôs (YAFB) mission is to conduct educational activities to spread conservative values and host prominent conservative speakers in the movement to build awareness about conservatism.

Name: Young Democratic Socialists of America at Berkeley üíô
Description: YDSA is the youth and student section of DSA‚Äì‚Äìthe largest socialist organization in the United States. As Cal YDSA, we fight for the immediate needs of workers and students on campus while building our capacity to push for structural changes at large. Our mission is to educate and organize students and young people and to play a helpful and principled role in the movement for socialism. Within and throughout this struggle, we will articulate and defend the idea that true human liberation is impossible under capitalism. We seek change that extends democracy into all aspects of life -- social, political, and economic. This is the struggle for democratic socialism. Our vision of socialism is profoundly feminist, anti-racist, and anti-imperialist. JOIN OUR SLACK CHANNEL TO GET INVOLVED! Follow us on Instagram for announcements @calydsa.
Categories: Political & Advocacy Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: YDSA is the youth and student section of DSA‚Äì‚Äìthe largest socialist organization in the United States. As Cal YDSA, we fight for the immediate needs of workers and students on campus while building our capacity to push for structural changes at large.

Name: Yu-Gi-Oh Duelists at Berkeley üíô
Description: We Currently Offers: 1. Weekly Duel Event 2. Monthly In School Tournaments 3. Join our group at Regional+ tournaments 4. and enjoy the fantastic Yu-Gi-Oh! world! (Intercollegiate competition awaiting!)
Categories: Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category
Summary: We intend to create an inclusive community of Yu-Gi-Oh players who are a lot but previously disconnected to help with preparing regional/national tournaments, daily trading and exchanging of cards, and introducing card-game and anime fans to Yu-Gi-Oh

Name: Zahanat
Description: Zahanat is a competitive male fusion dance team at UC Berkeley that brings together the dancing techniques of Indian film music and modern day American Music.
Categories: Performing Arts Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage
Summary: Zahanat is a competitive Male fusion dance team at UC Berkeley that brings together the dancing techniques of Hindi film music and modern day American Music.

Name: Zeta Phi Beta
Description: Check out Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Incorporated - https://zphib1920.org/ - for more information about the sorority.
Categories: CalGreeks National Pan-Hellenic Council (NPHC) Fraternities & Sororities

Name: Zeta Tau Alpha
Description: Welcome to Zeta Tau Alpha, Upsilon Chapter at UC Berkeley! We are members of the Panhellenic Community at Cal, which is comprised of 12 national organizations and one local chapter. At ZTA, we are passionate about empowering each and every sister to reach her full potential, both at this university and beyond. One of the lines in our creed is "to realize that within our grasp lies the opportunity to learn those things which will ever enrich and ennoble our lives." Our sisters live this out each and every day; we are passionate about our philanthropy, Breast Cancer Education and Awareness, which our chapter recently received a Founders Award for raising $10,000+ in the last 3 years! Our partnerships with Bright Pink and the American Cancer Society have also led us to pass out thousands of pink ribbons at the Think Pink Cal Football Game, volunteer at the survivor booth for Making Strides, and put on exciting events for the Greek community such as Sugarfest and Cookout for a Cure. Even more, we maintain a sisterhood that lasts a lifetime; Zetas can be found in so many organizations, be it dance, pre-professional organizations, consulting, STEM labs, or even the ASUC! The friendships formed at ZTA will follow you through your entire collegiate experience, from football gamedays with your sisters to weekends in San Fransisco or Lake Tahoe. The mentorship from older members, both in academics and in life, will be invaluable as you navigate a campus of 40,000 students, and will shape the way you see the world around you. ZTA also offers over 30 leadership positions and multiple committees within the chapter, which allow you to develop your strengths and give back! Last but not least, you'll always have a home at 2714 Durant Avenue; from Friday brunches to Bachelor Mondays, our sorority is undoubtedly a home away from home :) Zeta Tau Alpha participates in Fall Formal Recruitment as well as continuous open bidding (COB) at the beginning of each semester, so if you are interested in joining our organization, visit our website or email our vice president of membership at ztacalmembership@gmail.com. For general questions about our chapter, reach out to ztacalpresident@gmail.com. Website: http://berkeley.zetataualpha.org Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ztacal/
Categories: CalGreeks Panhellenic Council (PHC) Sororities
Summary: Zeta Tau Alpha provides well over a hundred women each year with the intensifying of friendship, the fostering of a spirit of love, and the building up of a purer and nobler womanhood in the world -- come join our sisterhood in the Cal Greek Community!
